The food here is tasty, but the wait is just too long. The staff is nice, but the wait for your meal can be pretty annoying. You might want to try a different spot if you're in a hurry.

Body Cycle is definitely the best spin class studio I've ever visited. The studio is spotless and the bikes are top-notch, the instructors are friendly and inspiring, and the online scheduling system makes it simple to plan ahead. Russell, the owner, is extremely enthusiastic and caring about his clients' success. I strongly suggest checking out Body Cycle for an incredible workout experience.

The cozy diner serves up a diverse buffet with a combination of Mexican dishes like a juicy chicken leg, tamale, and stuffed grape leaves. The juicy melon and warm, welcoming staff contribute to the wonderful dining atmosphere. Being able to customize your meal with breakfast items all day long makes it a great spot for a laid-back dining experience with no pressure. Situated beside the Clarion Hotel, it's a fantastic choice for a laid-back meal.

This Indian restaurant provides a scrumptious and one-of-a-kind dining adventure with a diverse selection of dishes to pick from. The lamb curry and korma stood out as our top choices, and the 10 distinct varieties of naan were a delightful complement to the meal. Don't let the outer appearance of the restaurant deter you, as the cuisine on the inside is truly worth checking out. Experiment with something fresh and you'll be pleasantly surprised!

The ambiance in the restaurant is charming, and the proprietor kindly guided us through the soon-to-be patio/roof deck, which will surely shine on splendid days. The cheese curds were scrumptious and quite satiating. I was grateful for the side salad accompanying the sandwiches, especially after relishing in the curds. Opting for the onion, gruyere, and tomato sandwich was satisfying, yet I felt it could use a tad more flavor, perhaps a hint of pepper jelly. I look forward to more additions to the menu, like fresh salads featuring intriguing cheeses. A range of beer and wine choices are available at the establishment, along with a concise cocktail list. I aim to explore the draft wines on my next visit.

As a regular customer for a while now, I was really surprised by the poor service I received when I attempted to order some takeout. Even though the restaurant was only half full, they told me they were too busy. I was really let down and won't be going back. Kanella is a far superior choice at this point.

Fantastic tour! I snagged a groupon for an excellent deal and had a blast exploring New Orleans with a well-informed guide. The tour offered a great balance of French Quarter and cemetery exploration. The meeting spot in front of a grocery store was a little unusual but easy to locate. Make sure to check out this tour if you're in New Orleans!

I definitely suggest trying out this hidden treasure for their incredibly delicious wings and homemade bleu cheese. The ribeye was so tender, expertly cooked, and absolutely scrumptious. The variety of craft beers is also a great addition. All in all, it's a must-visit place for sure.

In general, Los Padres National Forest is a stunning spot to visit during Easter, yet the team should work on enhancing upkeep at White Rock by clearing dead grass and tidying up the water to increase its allure. When compared to Cachuma Lake, the staff at Los Padres could certainly put in more work to maintain the forest's natural splendor.

We dined with a group of 6 at this hibachi restaurant and were let down by the service. The server combined our individual sushi orders on a single plate, causing confusion over whose was whose, and also missed several items from our order. Despite the calm atmosphere at the restaurant, we were taken aback by these errors. The hibachi chef, Francisco, prepared the food nicely but was missing his usual engaging interaction. The service left much to be desired, and although the food was satisfying, the overall experience didn't meet expectations. I don't think I would come back considering the cost.

I had a fantastic time with Shalimar. I had to get my engagement ring resized, and they did it on the same day. Even though I got the sizing wrong, the staff was understanding and fixed it quickly without any extra cost. Their amazing customer service has turned me into a loyal customer. I highly suggest Shalimar for all your jewelry needs.
Milktooth in Indianapolis is a wonderful find that locals highly recommend. I am thankful for the chance to enjoy this culinary delight.

This place is ideal for happy hour or dinner, boasting a wonderful patio with fans to keep you comfortable in the St. Louis heat. The staff is extremely friendly and eager to adjust dishes to your preferences. I especially love the Veal Milanese with mixed greens instead of pasta. All in all, it was a fantastic dining experience.

In general, the food at this restaurant is fantastic. I particularly loved the gnocchi with marinara and the baked eggplant appetizer. Although the service was a bit sluggish, the delectable food definitely justifies coming back.

The bun of the Sonoran Dog is crucial, acting as a warm and comforting wrap for the hot dog. Though the hot dog and bacon could benefit from a touch more flavor to contrast with the mustard and onions, the carne asada caramelo is an exceptional selection with fantastic taste and value. Moreover, the added advantage of a drive-through alternative adds to its allure.
I devoured a scrumptious waffle and crunchy home fries at this spot. The staff was so friendly, and I can't wait to come back for breakfast.

The service at this place, especially from Douglas, was outstanding and the food was scrumptious. Though a bit on the expensive side (averaging $40-50 for a main course), the ambiance competes with top-notch restaurants across the country. An amazing all-around experience.

My husband and I have been to this restaurant many times and every time, we've been blown away by every part of our meal. The staff really knows their stuff when it comes to gluten-free choices, and their suggestions have always been top-notch. The wine and cocktails are fantastic, and the food is just absolutely delicious. The only bummer is that there aren't many gluten-free dessert choices, but that's a small issue when you look at the big picture. We'll definitely be back here again!

I strongly suggest Natalie as a brow expert at Blow Bar - she's fantastic! Victoria also amazed me with her talent, giving my fine, limp hair incredible volume. The salon is lovely and spotless. Victoria will definitely be my regular stylist from now on.

This cafe is a great place for a productive and pleasant visit. The black and white latte is outstanding, the soups are scrumptious even for those who aren't big fans of soup, and the ambiance is just right for getting work done with the perfect level of noise and music. Additionally, the presence of dogs enhances the charm of the place. I wholeheartedly suggest this cafe and will definitely keep coming back as a loyal customer.
The blend of real pumpkin pie in frozen custard is incredible. The bits of pie crust are a pleasant surprise. This dessert absolutely needs to catch on all over the country. It's simply delightful!

Upland Brewery in Bloomington, IN serves up fantastic beers, burgers, and tenderloins, but their pizza didn't quite hit the mark for me. The margherita pizza had a thin, crispy crust and was missing some pizzazz in the topping department. It might do the trick as a starter, but I'll be opting for their other delicious offerings going forward.
I loved the show. It was just what I needed for a chill Friday evening.

This sushi spot is the go-to choice in town, but it really hits the spot when you're craving sushi and need something fast and easy. The salmon is really top notch here, and they also offer delicious choices like zesty edamame, crispy tempura, refreshing ocean salad, and crunchy cabbage salad. Plus, the friendly and quick service just makes it even better.

On the whole, I was a bit unsure if I should rate this restaurant 3 or 4 stars. The vibe is definitely more towards takeaway, but they do have a pretty nice spot to sit down and eat. The sushi bowl was pretty good, but nothing extraordinary, and they were a bit stingy on the veggies and heavy on the rice. The Maui roll just didn't hold up to what I've enjoyed at their other location on 96th street. Nonetheless, I'd come back for those sushi bowls and I'd suggest trying out their bubble tea. The service might be on the slower side, but it's worth the patience for a healthier alternative to fast food in the neighborhood.
The beef brisket sandwich and pulled pork were both absolutely mouthwatering and tender. I highly recommend them for a delicious lunch choice.
This Thai restaurant is undoubtedly the best in the area. Every dish is truly authentic and incredibly delicious. I will definitely keep coming back for more.
All in all, it was a letdown with below-average service and mediocre food. I wish I had chosen differently for my final meal in town.

All in all, our meal at this restaurant was amazing. The dishes were top-notch, served promptly, and had a delightful homemade flavor. The menu offered a wide range of tempting choices. We are eagerly looking forward to coming back for more and exploring the chef's special creations!

The food at this restaurant was okay, deserving of two stars, but the service was really disappointing. Even after spending $100 on entrées and appetizers, I had to call over the sous chef to request more avocado for my tuna dish, and was then informed I had to talk to my server to pay for it separately. It was a very let-down moment.

My first visit to this restaurant was fantastic. The atmosphere is so inviting and cozy, it's like stepping into a friend's house. The staff were warm and funny, making my time there even better. The food came quickly and was absolutely delicious. I can't wait to come back here again.

In general, this place serves excellent burgers, fries, and salad seasoned with a delightful touch of salt and pepper. The charming outdoor seating and welcoming staff create a pleasant dining atmosphere. Easy parking makes it a stress-free option when choosing where to eat.

In conclusion, I wholeheartedly endorse this store for its outstanding staff, impeccable cleanliness, extensive selection, and fantastic customer service. They truly go the extra mile to ensure that all your needs are taken care of.

Brought my car in for a manufacturer recall a couple of years back. Although the initial problem got sorted out, I later noticed a different noise. Kevin and his mechanic identified and resolved the unrelated issue at no cost. Their service was top-notch, and I strongly recommend them.

I recently stopped by my favorite Sweet CeCe's location and, on the whole, I really adore their offerings. The variety of toppings is fantastic, providing a nice balance between nutritious and decadent choices. Though, I've observed that occasionally the employees may not be as attentive or might forget promotions like the $5 Fridays special. Even so, I can't rate them any lower than 4 stars since I truly appreciate my visits there.

Great location in the Funk Zone! Tasty food and wine samples right next to the Santa Barbara Wine Collective. We adored the flavorful croissant - definitely a must-try. Enjoying life to the fullest in this place!

The Center is an excellent place for a soothing massage, offering convenient same-day appointments. I have always had great experiences with the therapists here and have never been let down. I highly suggest it!

The check-in process at the Peppermill was smooth and hassle-free, plus they provided free valet parking. The hotel is quite large, resembling Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, and boasts eight dining options right on the premises. While the casino area is expansive, it's worth noting that some slot machines may require higher minimum bets than advertised. Our room in the Tuscany Tower on the 12th floor offered a lovely view of the pool, a spacious layout, and amenities such as complimentary WiFi, a luxurious bathroom with double sinks and a jetted bathtub, and cozy furnishings. Overall, the staff was friendly and accommodating, making our stay enjoyable.

My partner and I had an amazing first visit to this deli. I devoured a scrumptious turkey, avocado & bacon panini and he savored his buffalo chicken wrap. The meal was served promptly, a nice surprise during the bustling lunch period. The menu featured a diverse selection of dishes such as salads, soups, sandwiches, and hot meals, making us eager to come back and explore more options. There's nothing better than a deli with abundant choices!
The biscuits are phenomenal and the cocktails are fantastic. I highly recommend it, but just be aware it can get pretty crowded.

The dishes at this restaurant were scrumptious and prepared just right. The ambiance and design brought back memories of a fishing lodge, and the menu had a blend of Outback and Bonefish. Thanks to a Groupon, all three of our dishes, along with the calamari starter, were superb. We will absolutely revisit in the future.

In general, this restaurant is affordable and in a convenient location, but the food tastes and seems inexpensive. The dessert choices are enjoyable, and the service was fantastic. However, the breakfast selections were underwhelming, and the decor is outdated. The meat carving station and Mexican food station were also subpar. I visited this restaurant three times and was continuously let down.

All in all, my time at this restaurant was somewhat spoiled by a rather snobbish server, but was completely saved by the exceptional service from the bartender, Ben. Being situated in Hotel Palomar made it quite convenient, and the in-room dining was scrumptious. Even though there was a rough start, Ben's sincere and friendly demeanor more than made up for it. He really went above and beyond, turning the whole outing into a pleasant one.
I swung by after a morning stroll in the park and was blown away by the delicious food, coffee, and excellent customer service. The atmosphere here is amazing. I definitely suggest checking it out.

Honestly, this restaurant is pretty overhyped. The food was super slow to come out, the burger was way too well-done, and the Seafood Jumbalaya was just okay. It's not really worth the cost, especially with all the other great dining options in the French Quarter. I was really hoping for a better experience given all the buzz about this spot.

I absolutely loved my time at this hotel. The bed was super cozy, breakfast was mouthwatering, the internet was quick, and the location was perfect. The affordable rate was a great perk. The only downside was sometimes having to wait up to 15 minutes for the elevator on the upper levels in the morning. Overall, I would definitely suggest checking out this spot.

This restaurant is a bit lacking when it comes to offering a satisfactory dining experience. Customers are required to handle everything on their own, from fetching their own water to settling the bill for their drinks. The general ambiance is subpar, with unkempt outdoor seating. The shining moment was the live music performance. In conclusion, a single visit was sufficient.

If you enjoy choosing your own dishes and don't mind the additional cost of toppings, this restaurant might be a good fit for you. The food was okay but not remarkable. Just be ready for extra fees for items like cheese and salsa. It's a good idea to ask about any additional charges before placing your order.
The cafe was charming with a jazz band playing at 8 am. The breakfast sandwich was scrumptious with rolled egg and bacon pieces inside. It was a fantastic value for a satisfying breakfast.

This place is amazing. The duckfat french fries were so good and the Fois Gras burger was outstanding. Keith, the bartender, was super friendly and really knew his stuff. Can't wait to come back with friends for sure.

The artichoke dip was underwhelming with chilled dip and stale chips. Our server did not acknowledge the problem. The thin-crust pizza ended up being expensive with extra toppings and had a mediocre taste. The server was decent overall. Past visits during Cardinals games were more enjoyable. Next time, I'll seek out a different place.

Jasmine Rice is a great option for a relaxed Thai eatery with mouthwatering dishes such as green curry fried rice and chicken and duck pad thai. The duck specifically stood out as fantastic. The service was generally good, although there were a few complaints from other patrons. Despite a few minor bumps, we'd absolutely come back for more top-notch Thai cuisine.

Courtney is an amazing hairstylist. She instinctively knows what will suit her clients best and consistently produces breathtaking outcomes. Through her expertise and wonderful demeanor, she consistently goes above and beyond. I wholeheartedly endorse her for anyone seeking to enhance their appearance.

For a swift and trustworthy oil change or state inspection, this Pep Boys spot has got you covered. It might not be the fanciest or most thrilling spot, but it gets the job done well. Just time your visit wisely to dodge lengthy waits. All in all, it's a solid and dependable service.
The upgrade of the two outdated Lennox systems from the 70s with newer ones went really well, and the new units have been working perfectly for the past three years. Awesome work all around.

The Brewpub has a fantastic array of tasty dishes like nachos, pizza, and sandwiches, along with a great selection of handcrafted beers brewed on-site. The service might be a bit slow, but it just gives you more time to really soak in the atmosphere and relax on the patio with your pals. It's a family and pet-friendly spot with options for vegetarians and vegans. Definitely try the half order of nachos and the fish & chips – they're top-notch. And make sure to sample their Pumpkin Seasonal Beer; it's up there with the best in its class.

Farmhouse Rustic Chic is a wonderful home store in SB with friendly staff and fair prices. The shop features items from Joanna Gaines and others, making it a great spot to discover home decor ideas. In sum, a terrific discovery for anyone wanting to decorate their home with style and affordability.

My brother and I had a blast at this place. We grabbed a six pack of quality beers for a chill evening but ended up sticking around to play Nintendo 64 and have a few more drinks. The owner told us that the gaming console was given by other guests, which contributed to the welcoming vibe. The food was mouthwatering and the staff were really friendly. This spot should totally be a regular spot in the Northeast.

I loved the coconut soup and pad thai with protein at this restaurant. The coconut soup was rich and not too strong with herbs, which I liked. The pad thai had a great mix of peanuts, noodles, and sweetness, with plenty of juicy chicken. Overall, a really satisfying meal.

I really enjoyed my time at this diner. The service was wonderful, the food was delicious, and they offer breakfast all day. Even though it was crowded, the staff was really nice and helpful. The location right off the 295 freeway made it super convenient to find. All in all, a great place to grab a bite to eat.

This bar has become my new favorite spot on Saturday nights ever since Lucy's shut down. The food, especially the wings and fries, surpassed my expectations. Just watch out for the wtf sauce. It tends to get busy and you might have to wait a bit for the bartender to notice you, but the vibe is totally worth it. Who knows, you might even spot the Always Sunny gang!

The Shellfish Company on the Wharf went above and beyond what we expected with their mouthwatering rock crab special. Although we were a bit skeptical about typical seafood spots catering to tourists, this hidden treasure turned out to be exceptional. The rock crab was prepared flawlessly, boasting tender and succulent meat that was a breeze to enjoy. The shrimp bisque was also a standout. Offering ample servings at a reasonable price, this dining experience quickly became a top choice during our vacation. A must-visit for anyone who adores crab dishes. Be sure to make reservations in advance to steer clear of lengthy wait times.

Weaver's Way is a fantastic spot for individuals who enjoy shopping in smaller quantities and value locally grown produce and preservative-free foods. The community is diverse and inclusive, catering to a wide range of people. Membership requirements and work commitments are reasonable for singles, but may not suit everyone. If you align with the Weaver Way ethos, it's an ideal shopping destination for you. Otherwise, you can stick to chain stores or opt to pay the visitor's fee for occasional trips.

The BBQ at this spot may not be outstanding, but it definitely has a loyal following. For me, I find it decent and lean towards other BBQ joints. It might just come down to personal preferences and particular dishes on the menu.

The TV shows are $4.99 each with commercials, which is quite frustrating considering the hotel's price of over $150 per night. There is no free breakfast provided, just a costly buffet. Overall, not the most elegant or cost-effective experience.

I discovered this pizza joint close to my hotel and was pleasantly impressed by the welcoming staff and fantastic deals they provide, such as the special offer of buy one get one free. I sampled the hot wings and relished the ample amount of sauce on them. I will absolutely be coming back on my next trip for another round of pizza.

Termini Bros' cannolis are absolutely amazing - they're freshly filled to order with just the right amount of sweetness. Whether you're a cannoli enthusiast or a bit hesitant, you've got to taste one from this place!

During our road trip in our RV, we came across this adorable cafe in Granite City. The employees were super nice and the food had a cozy, homemade vibe. We liked our meals so much that we came back for seconds. All in all, a tasty and fulfilling dining experience. Definitely worth checking out.

I've been to several spots in the neighborhood, but I eventually stumbled upon a real treasure on Magazine Street that truly lives up to the buzz. The folks there are super nice, and the Phò is absolutely fantastic. You should totally give it a try!
I absolutely love this place for breakfast. The food and service were outstanding as usual.

The kayaking adventure at Santa Cruz Island surpassed our expectations. Jen, our guide, was so helpful and knowledgeable as we ventured through the caves. All in all, my husband and I had an amazing time and would definitely suggest this tour to others.
I really suggest checking out this spot for a tasty and fulfilling meal that's affordable. The shrimp and goat cheese crepes are a real standout you've got to try.

After checking out this St. Louis classic following more than ten years of being a local, I can definitely say it was well worth the anticipation. The factory tour, shop, bar, and dining spot offer a really cool and special experience. The beer is exceptional, offering a diverse selection to suit all tastes. The food is scrumptious, particularly the pizza and bison burger. The service is outstanding, with a team that truly enhances the unique vibes. Although it may be a bit on the pricey side, the top-notch quality and overall experience totally justify it. I'm absolutely going back and wholeheartedly recommend it to others.
Horrible ordeal, asked for a simple burger and discovered bacon inside (allergic to). Unpleasant service, not even an apology. Won't go back. Going to Freebirds instead.
My first time at this car wash was fantastic. The service was outstanding and I'm really pleased with the results. Thank you so much.

Sushi Nara is an amazing new spot on the eastside. The team is super friendly, the service is quick, and the sushi is always mouthwatering. The prices are fair and the variety is extensive. Definitely worth checking out!
This store is a real find with a savvy owner who really cares about what he does. They have an exceptional range of tires and parts that are tough to come across anywhere else.

I've been to this restaurant countless times and the food always tastes amazing. The Panang curry here is hands down the best I've ever had in Florissant. This hidden gem always draws me back, and I haven't had a chance to visit their sister restaurant yet since I'm always so pleased with my experience here. I highly recommend it.

Even though the food was just okay, I'm gonna bump up this restaurant by a star for its cool menu, ambiance, and vibe. My meal wasn't that great with an underwhelming tomato-basil soup and a strange-tasting tuna melt. I'll come back and check out the Italian meats and pastries next time. The Nutella bruschetta sounds too good to resist.
The vegetable pizza and submarine sandwich we got were underwhelming, with dull tomato sauce, sparse cheese on the pizza, and factory-made dough. Not really eager to give it another shot.

More Than Just Ice Cream features a selection of delicious milkshakes, with the black&white malt being the top pick. While the coffee and chocolate milkshakes could have been denser, they still managed to satisfy the craving for ice cream. The standout flavor was the pumpkin pie ice cream, suggesting that opting for ice cream over a milkshake might be the preferred option in the future.

We had an amazing time celebrating my mother's 100th birthday at this restaurant. The service was outstanding, with a fantastic table, view, scrumptious extra dishes, and a beautifully decorated cake plate. The servers were friendly and attentive, making it a truly unforgettable occasion for us. Highly recommend for special celebrations.

This place is a hidden treasure. The bartender was incredible and the burger was made with fresh, locally sourced ingredients. The food presentations were stunning as well. The beer is icy cold and the drinks are expertly crafted. A beloved local hangout with fantastic staff.

In general, this restaurant is handy for locals due to its long hours and efficient seating for two. The reasonably priced oysters and seafood store nearby are a definite bonus. However, the food quality falls short with improperly prepped raw oysters and unimpressive dishes. The atmosphere lacks coziness and the cleanliness of the restroom is worrisome. I might come back for the sake of convenience, but won't make dining here a top choice.

I would recommend steering clear of this restaurant for dinner. The server appeared confused, and we had to keep requesting simple items like utensils and refills of water. Our order got confused, and to top it off, there was a fish bone in the dish we were served. On a brighter note, the drinks were quite enjoyable.

The food at TDS restaurant was pretty good and reasonably priced, but the absence of decorations, menu boards, and clear staff identification created a cold vibe. It was quite disappointing to be charged extra for salsa, especially after ordering a salsa trio. In the end, the unimpressive atmosphere and strict salsa policy make it a place not worth revisiting.

We have been blown away by Angela Clifton Photography not once, not twice, but three times! The photos are absolutely stunning, the whole experience is a blast, and the prices are very fair. These pictures will be treasured forever. I highly recommend them!

I had a really nice meal at this restaurant with amazing food, although it was somewhat expensive. If you're looking for a calmer outdoor dining spot, I suggest checking out Side street in the French Quarter.

The courthouse is rich with beautiful art and has a unique spiral staircase. From the fifth level, you can enjoy a breathtaking view of the city. The tower clock room is a delightful surprise with its detailed mechanical gears. Don't forget to book an appointment to explore the clock room. A trip to the courthouse is definitely worth spending 2 to 3 hours of your day.

I had a wonderful time meeting with Ann today. She was extremely helpful and positive, going the extra mile to make my first visit outstanding. She has definitely gained a loyal customer in me. Thank you, Ann!

Just tried this place for the first time and it really impressed me. The coconut soup was amazing, and the pad Thai was exactly what I was hoping for. The Thai decorations and music added a nice touch, and the service was excellent. It's a refreshing change from the usual eateries in town. I think I'll be coming back here more often.
This place had such a mellow and laid-back vibe with awesome tunes. The singer was lively and diverse, even putting a country spin on "Let It Go". Looking forward to returning.

If you haven't visited the Smoothie King Center since it was known as the New Orleans Arena, you're in for a pleasant surprise. The venue has been revamped and now boasts a rejuvenated ambiance with enhanced food and beverage selections. The array of food options goes beyond expectations, providing premium choices to suit various tastes. Furthermore, the beverage offerings have been elevated to feature full-service bars, alcoholic lemonades, and an extensive array of drinks like bottled and draft beer, as well as assorted smoothies. The general atmosphere at the location now exudes a more sophisticated vibe, establishing itself as a premier entertainment destination in New Orleans.
Chipotle's steak is the perfect fix for a stomachache. Opting for off-peak lunch times guarantees a calm meal. The warm and quick service is always dependable, making it a trustworthy option.

I was genuinely impressed by this Indian restaurant in Tampa Bay. The atmosphere was lovely with white table linens, and the food was exceptional. The chicken 65 and hot sour soup were outstanding dishes. The server, Angel, was welcoming and attentive. I can envision this place gaining popularity among food enthusiasts looking for authentic Indian cuisine. I highly recommend giving it a try.

After numerous unsuccessful tries, we managed to gain entry to this Jazz club in NOLA by treating ourselves to reserved seats. Definitely worth the additional $20 to avoid the lengthy queue and help preserve Jazz. The cozy ambiance and skilled musicians created a memorable experience - evoking the vibes of concerts half a century ago. Definitely a must-visit in New Orleans!

I had a wonderful time at Keystone Discount Tire! Being a first-time customer without an appointment, they swiftly got my car in for a PA State & Emissions inspection. The team was so nice and very well-informed, plus there were no unexpected fees or extras. The technician even showed me a small problem with my tires. In summary, I totally suggest Keystone Discount Tire and signing up for their coupon newsletter!

I was really impressed by the fast and efficient service at this repair shop. They repaired my son's phone in just under half an hour, and it looks fantastic. I'm so happy with the result. I definitely recommend them!

The service and management at this Cracker Barrel were absolutely terrible. Our orders were completely mixed up, the waiter was rude, and the food arrived cold and inedible. The manager's solution was just to offer us free drinks. This dining experience was a total disaster, and I will definitely never come back here again. Do yourself a favor and steer clear of this Cracker Barrel location.

I've visited a few dog-friendly hotels in the past, but none quite like my experience at Loews in the city. When we arrived, we were genuinely surprised by the warm reception and exceptional care for my Labrador/Golden mix, Bentley. From treats at check-in to a welcome package with dog bowls and more, the level of service went above and beyond what I expected. Other guests even took the time to praise and pet Bentley, making her feel like royalty. The room on the top floor and the helpful valets added to the overall delightful stay. We were so impressed that we ended up staying longer. Thank you, Loews, for proving that a hotel can truly be pet-friendly, even for a big pup like Bentley.

The food at this place is sometimes amazing, but it's inconsistent. I ordered a favorite dish that I've enjoyed for years, but the quality varies depending on who's in the kitchen. About half the time it's great, but the inconsistency is annoying.

I've visited this place twice now and I'm definitely not going back. The first time was just okay, but the second visit was a major letdown. It took three tries to get my ribs cooked the way I wanted. While the manager said sorry, they didn't make up for it in any way. Such a disappointing and annoying ordeal.

Cheu presents a distinct rendition of ramen with hearty noodles and intensely savory broth. While some may appreciate this approach, it failed to captivate a reviewer who favors a more classic ramen encounter. Noteworthy service and a pleasing array of beers are commended, but on the whole, the reviewer was underwhelmed. Individual preferences differ, so it might be worthwhile to sample it firsthand.

You've got to try Federal Doughnuts at the ballpark if you're looking for a yummy and satisfying treat. The mix of doughnuts and fried chicken is a winner. And don't forget about the gluten-free food stand by section 136 - they've got a lot of delicious choices like pizza, cheesesteaks, brownies, and cookies, perfect for folks with dietary needs.

The new spot for Red Kings in Chinatown was absolutely fantastic! The Dan Dan Noodles and shredded Pork in Garlic sauce were so tasty and had just the right amount of spice. They give you a lot of food too, so leftovers are a must. I'm excited to try other items on the menu and go back for a proper meal. Bringing your own drinks and having karaoke rooms upstairs make it even more enjoyable. I definitely suggest checking this place out!
This Chick fil A spot is always bustling but somehow pulls off exceptional service and speed. It's one of my go-to spots because of their consistently fantastic customer service.
My favorite spot for salads in town! I always make sure to swing by for lunch whenever I'm nearby. The service is speedy and the veggies are consistently crisp. I definitely suggest checking it out!

My family and I went on the Oak Alley and Laura Plantation tour and had an amazing time. The driver shared a lot of interesting information and the timing worked out perfectly, leaving us with some free time to explore before and after the tours. The drop off points were convenient and we had a great time wandering around the French Quarter afterwards. I would definitely suggest this tour!

We've been to this spot for brunch twice now and we were really impressed with the tasty food, especially the grits with scallions and sour cream. Just a heads up, the room tends to get pretty chilly, so it's a good idea to bring a sweater.
I adore this spot for their fantastic hot dogs and chili dogs. I visit as much as I can because they're the top choice in the area. So tasty!

Waterline is the perfect spot for catching live music with friends on Saturday nights. Their selection of local beer is top-notch, outshining even Fig Mountain. Personally, I'm a fan of Topa. The cherry on top is having the option to order scrumptious food from Nook Restaurant and drop by Lama Dog, all under the same roof. It's just fantastic!

The tour company delivered outstanding customer service, making sure to cater to our group of 7 despite being a bit outside their usual pick up area. They promptly rectified a billing mistake and refunded the overcharge for an extra ticket. The tour itself was a blast, led by a funny and well-informed guide who introduced us to numerous alligators, turtles, and birds. Getting to hold a baby alligator was definitely a highlight. The return journey was exhilarating, with the guide showing off some boat tricks. I highly suggest this tour for a truly memorable experience!

Westfall did a fantastic job replacing our roof in April. The process was smooth, from start to finish, with excellent communication and follow-up. The quality of our new roof is superb, and we are very pleased with our choice to select this company. I would highly recommend them.

Awesome vegan fast food spot with delicious options at affordable prices. The employees are super friendly and accommodating. Not the best for sit-down meals, but perfect for a quick takeaway meal. Definitely recommend giving the Cheesesteak and sweet potato fries a try instead of the buffalo bella.

The ramen is okay, not amazing though. The service is just average. It's a good go-to for a speedy meal, but there might be better places if you have other choices. I've been there twice and I'll probably go back.

This eatery offers a menu that caters to all tastes. It's neat, stylish, and scrumptious. I suggest arriving early as the line tends to get lengthy after 9 a.m. Nevertheless, the wait is worthwhile as you'll depart feeling extremely content.

The hearty brisket sandwich with two tasty sides and a refreshing drink for just $9.99 was an absolute steal. The BBQ was mouthwatering and the sides, which featured potato casserole, creamed spinach, baked beans, and green beans, were all top-notch. All in all, a fantastic BBQ experience at a wallet-friendly price. Definitely worth trying out.
Amazing food and service! I really wish there were more vegetarian/vegan choices on the menu. Can't wait to come back again soon!

The food is amazing, but the customer service is seriously lacking. The older waitresses are not friendly to deal with, but the owner is delightful. Overall, it's been a mix of experiences at this restaurant.

I discovered this amazing place suggested by a local during my flight to Nashville and I am thrilled that I did. The breakfast at this place is absolutely incredible, especially the corn pancake with bacon, salsa, and sour cream. The service was outstanding and we were fortunate to skip the long line. I will definitely be back on my next trip to the South. I highly recommend it!

I had a really bad experience with this detailing service. I confirmed the appointment several times, but the owner, Michael, was not ready and did not show up at the agreed time. His partner, Alex, tried to contact him but couldn't reach him. I ended up just wasting my time waiting. It was a total disappointment and definitely not worth the trouble.

The office really went above and beyond to assist me during my move, offering exceptional service and additional help. The staff were reliable and made sure I was well taken care of the whole time. I highly recommend this office, they are truly excellent and I would entrust them with my own mother.

The hotel has a gorgeous lobby with a trendy bar and restaurant, setting a seductive mood. The team is welcoming, but our experience was marred by a huge flying roach in the room. Despite being relocated to another room with additional insects and problems, we swiftly decided to depart and check into a different hotel. The personnel expressed regret and proposed a reimbursement, but we have decided not to come back.

The Green Project is the perfect place for cost-effective building materials and environmentally-conscious disposal of extra supplies. For just $35, you can snag a fresh door at The Green Project. They also welcome contributions of building materials to thwart them from being dumped in landfills. An excellent option for eco-friendly living and enhancing your living space.

I would advise against visiting this place. The person checking IDs was so impolite and they hike up the prices just because they're on Broadway. I have no intention of going back and wouldn't encourage others to either.
Just popped in for lunch with my girlfriend and were really impressed by how clean the place was. The food was so yummy and reasonably priced. Excited to revisit for another meal soon!

While the restaurant's ambiance and service are commendable, the food quality has notably decreased. The reheated artichoke, generic-tasting Greek salad, and overcooked, subpar grilled yellowtail were disheartening. This disappointing experience warrants foregoing a visit. Enhancements in the food quality are crucial to prevent the establishment from merely blending in as a tourist destination in Santa Barbara.

Milktooth is a fantastic place to check out for a one-of-a-kind brunch experience, especially if you're a fan of delicious breakfast cocktails. Their menu features creative spins on classic brunch dishes that might be a bit different, but trust me, they're amazing. Even though there's usually a wait, the food is definitely worth it. Some highlights include the Dutch pancakes and raclette grilled cheese. And make sure to try their michelada for a fun boozy breakfast delight. If you can, opt to dine outside to elevate your experience even more.

All in all, the bar and employees at this hotel are fantastic. They surprised us with a room upgrade for our honeymoon, boasting a stunning view. Nevertheless, the room didn't quite live up to our expectations - the tub floor had some rust and peculiar stains marred the tiles. But, the exceptional staff and the prime downtown location in St. Louis definitely make this place worth a trip. The only drawback was the pricey valet parking. It's a great choice for anyone who wants to be right in the middle of all the hustle and bustle with lots of bars and restaurants nearby. I'd give it a solid 4 stars.

I really liked the introductory class at this studio. The pace was just right and the exercises gave me a good stretch. Even though they were easy, I still worked up a sweat and felt fantastic afterward. The studio is tidy and I like that they offer the choice to buy Beyond Organic food items. I definitely suggest giving it a try!

My family and I were overjoyed to stumble upon Lobster Haven after growing weary of chain restaurants. The service was outstanding and the food was genuine and mouthwatering. The variety of choices was remarkable and we were thrilled with the opportunity to buy live lobster and fresh seafood to prepare at home. I highly suggest it for anyone yearning for New England seafood.
This happy hour spot serves the most delicious drinks and offers a delightful menu. If I had more time, I'd definitely become a regular here.

Men's clubs is an excellent barbershop with talented barbers that consistently provide stylish cuts. I've been a dedicated customer for 3 years and have never encountered any problems, except for one minor incident that was promptly addressed by Tim. I value the transparency and professionalism. I highly recommend it.
My husband and I frequent this place often and simply adore it. The dishes are consistently fresh and the service is exceptional. I highly recommend it for sushi and hibachi enthusiasts.

Chickie's and Pete's is a fantastic spot to catch a game and savor delicious seafood offerings such as crab fries and mussels. The vibe is vibrant and exciting, creating a wonderful setting to cheer on your favorite team. Just keep in mind that it can get pretty busy during big games and some customers may get quite lively. In general, it's definitely worth checking out for an authentic Philadelphia experience.

Quick and efficient service on a Saturday for a straightforward mirror repair. The team made the whole process hassle-free for me. I've relied on their services in Charlotte previously and they were fantastic then as well. I would definitely suggest using them.

I savored a tasty meal at Union Station St. Louis, opting for the Ponchartrain dish which reminded me of Tilapia. It was packed with mushrooms and a delightful cream sauce. The shrimp cocktail and lump crab cake starters were decent, although not exceptional. The beverages and service were okay. Eating outside on the patio was enjoyable, although the interior seemed inviting and less laid-back. In general, it was a pleasant dining outing.

I recently checked out this cool spot in St. Pete and was really impressed by the vibe. The meticulous work in the renovation gave off a magical feel, almost like stepping into a scene from a Harry Potter movie. The music playing in the background was just right, not too loud so you could chat without raising your voice. The bartenders, Michael and Peggy, were super nice and fun to chat with. Although I didn't sample the food, the prices for meat and cheese platters seemed quite fair. I'd definitely suggest giving this place a visit for a unique experience.

Maple Street Patisserie is amazing! Their blueberry muffins are the absolute best. It's a delightful spot for breakfast and lunch, and their specialty cakes are fantastic. The owner, Ziggy, is a real gem. This place is unbeatable!

The Bourbon Black and Bleu burger was absolutely scrumptious and cooked just the way I wanted. Nevertheless, the wait for our sizable group of 4 adults and 5 kids stretched on for more than an hour, which was quite disheartening. I rated them 3 stars specifically because of the prolonged wait.

Katie's is the go-to place to take out-of-town visitors, with a range of deliciously made dishes that won't break the bank. Their grilled oysters, shrimp and grits, Cuban sandwich, pizza, and daily specials are all top-notch options. The service is inviting and friendly, ensuring a pleasant dining outing. It's best to come in early on Sundays to skip the wait, but the endless mimosas are definitely a highlight!

Following a day at the Zurich Classic golf tournament, I swung by Creole Creamery for a delightful treat. The inside feels warm and welcoming, and I scored a great spot for parking on the street. They have an extensive range of flavors, and I opted for the cookie monster ice cream on a cone, which was absolutely scrumptious without being overly sugary. A definite hotspot for anyone who adores ice cream in the vicinity.

I'm a regular at this fun and vibrant sushi joint. The vibe is youthful and energetic, with awesome tunes and loads of sake. I usually go for the rolls, sashimi, and heaps of rice for a delicious meal. I'll skip the escargot just to stay safe, but all in all, this spot is a must-try for sushi enthusiasts.

We absolutely love this place! The Backyard Bowl is our go-to, but we're excited to sample other choices too. Whether we go for the kids size or a large to share, it always fills us up. The ingredients are super fresh and the prices are really fair. It does get busy, so brace yourself for a wait, but trust me, it's worth it. I highly suggest checking it out!

The service at this restaurant was decent, with a new server who was somewhat intriguing. The food presentation was nice, but the gumbo could use a bit more rice or potato salad. The Sprite was a bit lacking in fizz, but it wasn't a major issue.

In general, this pancake spot is alright, but things can get pretty crazy when it's busy. The pancakes are yummy but quite sweet, perfect for folks who love sugary treats. The prices are fair and the fact that they serve breakfast all day is a nice touch. Yet, there isn't anything exceptionally special about this place compared to other breakfast joints.
My visit to this store was fantastic! The team was amazing and I discovered some incredible finds. Looking forward to returning!

I've been a loyal customer of this restaurant for a while and the staff has always been friendly and quick with service. Yoli and Frank are fantastic and the food is mouthwatering, especially the shredded beef burro and cheese crisp. I definitely suggest trying it out for some authentic Mexican cuisine.

In general, the dining experience at this restaurant wasn't great due to the unimpressive setting and mediocre service, resulting in a 2-star rating. The lamb kebab and other dishes were decent but could have used more variety in terms of sauces and vegetables. Opting for takeout might lead to a happier mealtime.
This Middle Eastern restaurant really stands out in the area. The food is consistently tasty and satisfying, always leaving me with a content stomach. I highly recommend it!

Potito's has the most delicious cannoli in the city - surpassing Termini's and not as overly popular as Isgro's. I will consistently opt for Potito's when I crave cannoli, it's truly worthwhile to bypass the lengthy queues and head straight to the delectable treats. Believe me, their bambino cannoli is a must-have.

El Limon is a small, genuine, and incredibly tasty restaurant that went above and beyond. The Mexican cuisine here is unparalleled in Pennsylvania, offering a diverse selection of top-notch and affordably priced dishes. The staff is welcoming and helpful, and the handcrafted tamales and complimentary margaritas are definite standouts. Gather your loved ones for a fantastic Mexican meal at El Limon! Hooray!

This new place is promising, I'd give it 4 stars now but it's definitely on track to be a 5-star spot. The food is great, especially The Quaker and the Turkey Greek Burger. They are really nice about fixing any slip-ups and the staff is super friendly. They just need to tweak the pizza and spanakopita a bit, but their fries, onion rings, and baklava are really tasty. The Signature Salad is fresh and yummy. If they keep up the good work, I'll definitely be coming back.

Planet Fitness is a great choice for folks seeking a gym that's open around the clock and provides good bang for the buck. Nonetheless, it might not provide the kind of inspiration serious weightlifters crave since it appears to focus more on folks who are bigger. The perks like tanning beds, massage chairs, and access to the sculpt machine are a sweet deal for just $20 each month. Not allowing friends to join at the $9.99 level could be a bummer for some people. On the whole, the friendly and supportive staff really help make up for any flaws.

I felt really let down by our visit to this restaurant. When we got there at 2:15 on a Saturday, we were told that the kitchen had closed at 2, even though their website said they were open until 5 on weekends. This inconsistency in their hours makes me doubt how dependable and careful they are in running the place. It was a disappointing experience overall and it makes me unsure about wanting to come back.
I really suggest these folks for their punctual and top-notch work. They back up their work with a warranty, which makes them a trustworthy option.

You have to check out this restaurant at least twice a week. The staff is always super friendly and the food is consistently fantastic. I've never been let down and always walk out with a satisfied belly.

Carrow's Restaurant on Plumb and Kietzke is a real gem. The food was amazing - the tri-tip salad and tri-tip/chicken combo were both mouthwatering. The dessert choices were also fantastic. The prices were very fair for the quality of food and overall experience. I highly recommend it!

Rebecca wasn't my official Doula, but she was an exceptional caretaker for our first child. Her insights and advice on pregnancy and childbirth were truly priceless, and I always cherished our chats before and after work. She's a great listener, genuine, and truly devoted to her work as a Doula. I wholeheartedly endorse her as a valuable addition to your support network.

I just got my car tinted at Orange Tint and Tune and the service was amazing. Carlos, my technician, really went out of his way to make sure I was satisfied with my tint. The car pick up service within 4 miles of their shop is super convenient. The receptionist was really nice and Dustin, the owner, even checked in with me to make sure I was happy. All in all, their customer service is exceptional, definitely worth 5 stars.

Spent three nights at TownePlace Suites for work. The hotel is conveniently close to the airport, yet noise wasn't a problem. The rooms are typical, but come with handy amenities. It's located in a serene area with a blend of other hotels and office buildings. A quick ride to downtown and the university spot. Near the Pima Air Museum. Few dining choices around, but Baggins sandwich spot is a short stroll away and comes highly recommended. The staff is welcoming and accommodating. The breakfast is standard with warm choices and they host a reception on weekdays. The food and drinks can go quickly, so best to arrive early. The rooms are cozy, and the location is safe, yet they could enhance the availability of food and drinks during the reception hours.

A secret treasure in Tampa with mouthwatering wood-smoked steaks and affordably priced wines. Warm service and fantastic suggestions from our server. A must-drop-by for an unforgettable dining adventure. Looking forward to going back!

The person running this Saladworks spot is remarkable and genuinely values their customers. The upgraded service and delightful new summer salads make it a spot you shouldn't miss. I definitely suggest patronizing their business.

I absolutely love this deli in the US. There's an abundance of options to pick from, particularly the enormous and mouthwatering Muffalata that is perfect for sharing with a group. The live music on Saturday and Thursday evenings really enhances the fantastic ambiance. The specials are consistently excellent and the side dishes, such as the chili, potato salad, and chips, are truly exceptional. You shouldn't hesitate, make your way there now and indulge!

My dad and I had a fantastic time at Saguaro National Park with Park Ranger Carolyn. Her passion and expertise about the saguaro were truly contagious. I wholeheartedly suggest taking a tour with her.

The eatery has a diverse selection of distinct wing flavors, ranging from classic choices to New Orleans-inspired ones. The watermelon beverage is delightful, and the establishment is making a positive impact on the neighborhood. It is most enjoyable in daylight and definitely worth a taste. Keep an eye out for Skip!

Tom Jones is a nostalgic restaurant offering a wide range of menu choices at an excellent price. Their blue ribbon breakfast is a bargain at $3.79 and comes with all the fixings for a satisfying meal. The decor gives off a retro vibe, complete with orange booths and a vintage payphone that adds to the cozy feel. The staff is welcoming and provides quick service. With recent enhancements like better placement of the ATM and increased cleanliness, it's now an ideal place for a family outing. My daughter adores this place, so I'm rating it 5 stars.

Dr. Ferrel is a real hero to me as an amateur athlete. Following a serious injury on the softball field, he not only treated me promptly but also offered reasonably priced and efficient care at his practice. His skill and commitment have produced remarkable outcomes, resulting in rapid recovery and an earlier return to play than expected. I will forever appreciate and rely on Dr. Ferrel for his outstanding support.
Going to their shows is always a blast. The vibe is chill and entertaining. A fantastic choice for a good time and tasty food at a fair price.
I absolutely adore In-N-Out. The craving can hit like a ton of bricks sometimes and you just have to give in. Four patties, animal style, always does the trick.

Cindy's is superb! Their genuine Mexican food is prepared fresh and delightful. The team is warm and attentive, ensuring a wonderful dining experience. I highly recommend it to anyone craving a taste of Mexico.

I had heard about Trust Me BBQ for some time, so I decided to try it again after a not-so-great first experience. The food was a mix of good and not-so-good - the BBQ sauce and unique macaroni salad stood out, but the chicken was dry and the sides weren't impressive. The service was a bit disappointing, with a staff member who didn't seem very interested in helping us. I think I'll probably just go back to Down to the Bone BBQ next time.

I discovered this hidden treasure while in town for a week and was pleasantly surprised by the delicious pa nang chicken. I requested it with a bit of spice and it arrived promptly. I will definitely be coming back to this charming little spot.

This spot is a real hidden treasure for folks seeking out special and delicious pairings. The blending of various cultures and influences in their dishes is creative and scrumptious. The margaritas on the rocks and the homemade sangria are a must, so definitely give them a shot - they're totally worth it. And the wine bar they've added for extra space and special bottles is a great addition. I highly suggest popping by this place for Cinco de Mayo or any day of the year.

Hidden within Hermitage's historic shopping center, this delightful donut bakery presents a delectable array of freshly baked goodies, featuring distinctive choices such as bacon-adorned donuts and doughssants. Boasting budget-friendly prices and warm hospitality from the proprietor, Yeu, this sweet spot is a definite go-to for donut enthusiasts. And not to forget, they also offer a selection of coffee to complement their sugary delights.
Went to several events like concerts and basketball games, and they were all so much fun. The food options were fantastic, with plenty of tasty local dishes to choose from.
Fantastic food with a diverse range of appetizers and entrees that were all amazing. Affordable prices and great service. I'll definitely be back.
Regrettably, the quality of service at this place has dropped considerably. We used to be regulars but now go elsewhere because of the slow and inattentive service.

The chicken and rice dish was a major letdown, swimming in an excessive amount of oil even though I didn't ask for any sauce. Not only was the meal not what I ordered, but it was also very unhealthy. The restaurant's claim of promoting healthy eating is a total farce. Stay away from this place.

I had an amazing time buying a washer and dryer from Sears. Even though there were some negative reviews, I thought the choices were fantastic, the sales staff were helpful, and the delivery was prompt. The service went beyond what I expected, with the employees putting in effort to provide me with a good deal and stay within my budget. They also gave me extra discounts and made sure to find any ongoing sales. I got truthful advice and had all my queries resolved. I strongly suggest Sears for buying appliances.
The food at this place is amazing, with speedy service and a welcoming staff that always leaves you feeling right at home. I highly recommend it.
I tried out the revamped restaurant recently and was really impressed. The mushroom cheese steak was absolutely delicious.

This café has top-notch espresso and is the best place for an Americano. The folks working here are super friendly, the vibe is chill, and the place is always neat. Though power outlets aren't an option, there's free wifi for days.

Despite good reviews from others, my visit to this restaurant was disappointing. The website didn't provide clear menu information and the prices weren't listed. The food itself was subpar, with the sandwiches being light on meat and drowning in messy gravy. The quality was hit or miss. Choosing the "wet meat" option might save you from the gravy overload. The ambiance felt more like a bar than a restaurant, and overall, I left unimpressed.

I really suggest trying out the Whiskey Burger from Village Whiskey for takeout. While it is a bit expensive at $26, the burger is fantastic with tender meat, crispy bacon, and a generous portion size. You should definitely give the Duck Fat fries a shot, they are so rich and delicious. If you can get past the price, this meal is totally worth it.

We dropped $80 on a meal for the family and it was totally worth it. The dishes were piping hot and the orange chicken was hands down the tastiest I've had in a long time. This place is definitely going to be our new favorite spot for Asian cuisine.

I wholeheartedly suggest this laundromat for anyone seeking a secure, tidy, and effective place to do their laundry. The facility is properly cared for and the staff is welcoming and supportive. I managed to finish a significant amount of laundry quickly due to the fast machines. The added features like security cameras, wi-fi, and vending machines contribute to a cozy and pleasant laundry session. Appreciations to LAUNDROMAT for offering such a fantastic environment for laundry tasks!

The food at this restaurant was decent, but the prices were quite high. The server appeared irritated when both couples opted to share a plate. The garlic bread was truly exceptional, but all in all, it didn't justify the cost. I doubt I'd come back, especially with plenty of other options in St. Louis.

Swung by Haven for a burger during the Seahawks/Saints game and was wowed by how tasty it was. The joint was super busy, but it's no wonder - the grub is top-notch. Definitely planning a return visit, maybe for a more chill Tuesday lunch.

I've only sampled the vermicelli bowls at this restaurant, but I've savored them every time. The portions are ample, and the prices are fair. The spot is conveniently situated for folks in the Alberta Ave area, and my meals are always promptly prepared, even during busy hours.

The Chicken Marsala was skinny, chewy, and parched, whereas the pasta was uncooked and tasteless. The lasagne was also tasteless and unsatisfyingly skinny. The service was not great, as they took away the plates too soon. However, the ambiance was fantastic with live music and the chance to dance. In summary, the expensive prices are not worth the terrible food quality.

This fantastic find provides a wonderful dining experience with a charming atmosphere and a convenient location. The varied menu showcases mouthwatering options like chaats, beef short ribs, lamb vindaloo, beet salad, breads/pickles, and chai. Be sure to save room for the delectable chocolate cake for dessert. The bring-your-own-booze policy is a bonus, and ample street parking is accessible. Being able to pick up some takeout beer from the adjacent bar also adds to the convenience. All in all, I highly recommend this dining spot and will certainly be back.
I absolutely love this restaurant! The ceviche is so tasty, the vibe is lively, and Alex’s service was warm, attentive, and considerate. Definitely a 5-star experience!

This shop is definitely worth a visit for anyone seeking out a variety of fresh and diverse food choices. The salad bar is consistently loaded with delicious ingredients and the assortment of ethnic dishes is truly impressive. I strongly suggest checking it out!

I got a Mediterranean chicken shawarma and it tasted delicious with a good amount of chicken in the pita. The food was ready when I got there and the service was nice. I'll definitely be back when I'm in the area again.
This place is a hidden treasure! The food is mouthwatering, the ambiance is inviting, and the staff is exceptional. A must-visit for both vegetarians and meat-eaters. I highly recommend it!

In general, the service started off a tad slow, but once our turn came, we were delighted with the experience. The gumbo was scrumptious, and the chicken & waffles were a real crowd-pleaser. The staff was welcoming, and the spot on Bourbon St provided fantastic chances for people-watching.

The sandwich options at Earl's grab-and-go restaurant in the airport are flavorful, with choices like roast beef paired with cheddar cheese and horseradish sauce. The portions are ample, and the sandwiches are well-prepared, ensuring a pleasurable dining experience for those on the move. Its strategic placement close to the security checkpoint and Delta SkyClub renders it a convenient option for grabbing a quick bite. It comes highly suggested for a delicious and convenient meal before boarding your flight.

Fantastic time at this restaurant! The cheese curds with red pepper jelly were outstanding, and both the fish tacos and beer brat were mouthwatering. The servings were very generous and reasonably priced. The service was exceptional, with a attentive server and a welcoming manager. Excited to return for game day specials and weekend brunch! Definitely suggest checking out this spot.

I had an amazing time eating at this restaurant. The burger I ordered was incredibly tasty that I'll seriously struggle to choose a different option next time. The variety of beers was impressive, the team was friendly, and the service was quick. The ambiance was pleasant and the place was spotless. I departed feeling extremely content and pleased with my visit. I would definitely suggest dining here.

In general, this hotel is excessively large, pricey, and quite a distance from Downtown. The dining choices are scarce and overpriced, valet service is sluggish, and the location makes it challenging to venture out to nearby eateries. The accommodations are pleasant, but beware of undisclosed fees and extensive checkout waits. It might be advisable to book lodging elsewhere and commute for meetings to circumvent the inconvenience.

I had a great time at Ava. The appetizers were a bit smaller than I thought, but they tasted delicious. The pizzas were really good, although one was missing the rosemary. The grouper with Israeli couscous was amazing. Dessert was the best part, with the zeppoles being out of this world and the cherry tart not really my thing. I can't wait to go back and try more dishes, especially the homemade pastas. Hopefully, next time the appetizer will have more bread to cheese.

This was my first time eating here and I was really impressed. The place was clean, the staff were friendly, and the sushi was delicious. I'll definitely come back. The service was excellent and the sushi tasted really fresh, all at a reasonable price. I highly recommend it.
This place truly lives up to its name - the chicken is absolutely amazing. The fried corn on the cob is a must-have. Overall, a fantastic spot for chicken enthusiasts.

Unfortunately, the food at this restaurant was really disappointing. The pancakes tasted artificial, the "homemade" maple syrup was thin and overly sweet, and the hash browns were greasy and bland. The bacon was burnt and tough, suggesting it had been left out for too long. All in all, the food was lackluster and didn't meet expectations. You can find tastier choices in Nashville.

We thoroughly enjoyed our meal at this restaurant. The prix fixe menu was enticing, and the dishes we selected were exceptional. The decadent prime rib po'boy with gruyere and horseradish sauce offered a delightful upscale variation, and the tomato fennel soup was delicious. The seafood jambalaya and seafood gumbo were arguably the most outstanding I've ever tasted. I wholeheartedly recommend it.

Pure Design really impressed us at our recent event at a nearby hotel. Their team was so professional, well-informed, and managed to stay within our budget while providing gorgeous flower arrangements that our guests absolutely loved. The flowers stayed fresh long after the event, and I even got to bring them home. I wholeheartedly suggest Pure Design for any big event.

My husband and I had an amazing time at this Par-Tee spot. The server was friendly and informative, the beer and liquor selection were excellent, and the pork belly sliders were a delightful surprise. We really suggest checking out this place for a enjoyable and tasty night out. We'll definitely be coming back.

In general, the restaurant is decent or slightly better, but it's definitely overrated and pricey. The portions are meager for the cost, and the extra toppings spoil the bison burger. I wouldn't suggest it given the price.

I'd give this restaurant a low rating because of the unsettling experience of seeing a customer get arrested on the premises. The whole ordeal was poorly managed, and the absence of any explanation or apology from the management amplified the unease. The only highlight of the visit was the fantastic server, LaToya. While the black bean burger was dry, the sweet potato fries were enjoyable. I wouldn't suggest eating here.
The sliders were amazing and just the right size to sample a few. The fried chicken, BLT, monte cristo, and Cuban sliders were all mouthwatering. Looking forward to tasting the donuts next!

We went to the restaurant again after it changed management for the third time. The daily specials are a steal at $7.95 for a plate, iced tea, and soup. We ordered the Carne Asada plate, and it was fantastic. I could swap my rice and beans for a salad. The staff was really on the ball, and we had a positive time. Since the specials switch up every day, there's always something fresh to taste.

I totally adore this charming little store! The delicious aroma of spices always lures me in whenever I walk by. The wide selection of spices on offer can be a bit daunting, but the friendly staff are always ready to help out. The items are great quality and have a long shelf life, giving you good bang for your buck. The unique salts, sugars, and powders are a standout, boasting flavors that are more vibrant than anywhere else. The prices are fair and the items are definitely worth it. I highly suggest checking it out!
Steve and his partner are fantastic - they provide demo racquets and have a wide variety at amazing prices. Absolutely ideal for any tennis player looking for new equipment. I highly recommend them!

I dropped by the new Chick-fil-A in Reno around 6 and was pleasantly surprised by how busy it was. Even though the line was long, I was impressed by how great the staff was. Our food arrived quickly despite the crowd. They handled the madness of opening day really well, with just one minor mistake that they fixed immediately. I really liked how attentive the service was and how smoothly everything ran. I'm happy Chick-fil-A in Reno is keeping up their top-notch standards.
time unwinding and savoring the ambiance. Would definitely suggest for wine enthusiasts seeking a remarkable experience.

Beck's may be a little expensive considering the portion sizes, yet their gator gumbo is definitely worth it. The flavors are deliciously rich and the spices are perfectly balanced. The addition of gator sausage gives the dish a unique touch. Nevertheless, the chicken alfredo pasta was a tad dry and not worth a repeat order. It's best to opt for the gator gumbo for a fantastic meal experience at Beck's.
Even though I was worried at first about getting bad reviews, my visit turned out really well. The wait was minimal and the staff was extremely pleasant and supportive as soon as I stepped in.
I didn't really click with The Taint. The indifferent vibe and Garden District hipsters just didn't do it for me.

If you love Chick-fil-A, you'll be thrilled to know that there's a new spot in Bloomingdale. The drive-thru lines were bustling but efficiently handled by welcoming staff, and the food was as tasty as always. The only drawback was fries that were a bit underdone, but on the whole, a fantastic establishment for the community. Glad to have you here, Chick-fil-A!

This adorable place on Germantown Ave offers a fantastic variety of delectable treats, such as cookies, bars, and cake scrapple. I indulged in the Red Velvet cake with cream cheese frosting and an M&M cookie, and both were absolutely delightful. The cookie was wonderfully soft and chewy with a delightful crunch from the M&M candies, while the cake was so moist and bursting with flavor. A fantastic spot to satisfy your sweet tooth!

The recent upgrades to this place have really upped the comfort level. Still, adding more cushioning to the chairs would really step up the experience, especially for lengthier events like football games. Despite this, the overall renovations have greatly improved the area.
The food at this restaurant is really tasty, but the service is quite slow. It would really help if they had one or two extra staff members at the front to speed up the process of taking orders.

I visited this place when they had just opened, and I was let down. They offered only one flavor that didn't impress, everything seemed too expensive, and we ended up leaving still hungry after dishing out $70-80 for three people. The sauce did not resemble Cajun style; it tasted more like a blend of buffet sauces with a hint of fish sauce. I rate it a solid three since there are superior dining options available.

I really suggest taking the walking tour of Ybor with Raymond as our guide. It was so informative, enjoyable, and mouth-watering with fantastic food stops throughout. Raymond was so welcoming and well-informed, which only added to the already wonderful experience. An absolute must for anyone, whether you're a tourist or a local seeking a thrilling adventure in Tampa!

I really enjoy the delicious spiral plain pies at Franzones. The addition of onions to the white pizza was a nice surprise and a tasty touch. It's just as good as the Bridgeport location I remember from my childhood. You can't go wrong with plain!

The quick clinic at CVS mistakenly diagnosed my daughter's severe sore throat as a fungal infection, giving her medication that exacerbated the issue. The employees seemed mechanical and unwelcoming, pushing us to leave even though we were the sole patients. I suggest relying on a regular doctor rather than these rapid clinics.
The chicken sandwich at this spot is amazing, especially for being situated in an industrial area. Definitely give it a try.

Booking the online appointment was a breeze and the whole meeting and transaction went smoothly with no hassle. I chose a 2-hour side by side ride with guide Matt, who was knowledgeable and fantastic. The four-seater offered stunning views and I had a blast overall during the experience.

This bar has an amazing happy hour from 4-7 every day with awesome deals on wine, drafts, pizza, and appetizers. The staff is super friendly, and the to-go dinners and lunches are fairly priced and quick. Definitely worth checking out.

Terrible experience at this restaurant. The waiter was friendly, but both my appetizer and my friend's noodles had hair in them. We sent back the noodles, but weren't given a new dish. We won't be coming back here.

ITV is a lovely and cozy spot that serves amazing food and cocktails at a fair price. The beef fat biscuit stood out, and having Chef Nick Elmi around made the experience even better. The foie with apricot miso, pork cheeks, and trout pumpernickel soldiers were all scrumptious. The cold smoking methods in their bar menu were a cool addition. In general, ITV is a fantastic place to eat on East Passyunk, offering some of the finest options in the city.
I really love this place! The hours are awesome, it's spotlessly clean, and so peaceful.

Buckingham Pizza serves up the most delicious pizzas in town, with a standout selection of plain and specialty pies like the mouthwatering cool ranch. For the ultimate experience, focus on ordering pizzas and sides instead of entrees such as chicken piccata. You're guaranteed to fall in love with their flavorful pizzas.

Cafe Beignet serves up the most delicious iced latte and beignet we've ever tasted, in a cozy setting jazzed up by live music. When compared to Cafe du Monde, we think Cafe Beignet tops the charts in flavor and customer care. Plus, there's hardly ever a wait, making it a seamless and delightful visit overall.

Captain Bill's provides a lively and laid-back vibe by the waterfront, allowing you to savor delicious food and top-notch service while observing people and dolphins. The menu accommodated all of us, from a finicky 7-year-old to a 72-year-old grandma. The dishes were piping hot, fresh, and spot-on, and the service was prompt and considerate. In sum, it was an outstanding dining outing that we plan to revisit on our next trip to John's Pass. I wholeheartedly suggest it!

Fantastic sushi restaurant in Valrico! Don't miss out on the delicious peanut avocado roll and the truly impressive Volcano roll. The customer service is top-notch and it's definitely worth the trip, even if you're not local. I highly suggest checking it out!
This Cuban restaurant is okay for lunch with daily specials and freshly made meals, but it's just average when compared to other choices.
My husband really liked his 6 oz pepperloin dish, but my shrimp kabob meal was disappointing as it only had 4 overcooked and small shrimp. The service was great and the restaurant wasn't crowded.

Even though the line was long and I was feeling a bit rushed, the speedy service and mouthwatering pastrami sandwich totally justified the wait. The interior had a distinct charm, covered in bottle caps everywhere you looked. The employees were friendly and understanding, creating a welcoming atmosphere ideal for both regulars and first-timers. My pastrami sandwich was deliciously lean and packed with flavor, easily ranking as one of the top ones I've ever tried. The Punk admired the offbeat decorations and relished her sandwich just as much. Definitely a hidden treasure!

Heather's new store on E. Passyunk is a must-stop for anyone who wants a color expert to create a unique style. The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming, ensuring a pleasant visit. Heather and her team are reliable and talented, making it a breeze to suggest to loved ones. Be sure not to overlook Heather's advice on nurturing cactus houseplants or chatting about classic bicycles during your time there.

Sally's offers a fantastic variety of hair supplies and has a team of welcoming employees, making it my top choice for trying out new hairstyles. Nevertheless, I do wish the staff had a better understanding of their products and that the store was tidier and more well-lit. Overall, I'm satisfied with Sally's but I anticipate improvements in the store's appearance.

After sticking with the same barber in Austin for seven years, I finally branched out to give Rodney Mitchell Studio a try upon a friend's suggestion. Rodney himself suggested stylist Allison, who completely nailed the adorable shaggy bob look that I didn't even know I wanted. The salon provides special deals for new clients, students, teachers, and referrals, making it an excellent choice for those mindful of their budgets. I'm eagerly looking forward to my next appointment there. I genuinely recommend it!

Lovely Mercer Building spot, roomy, welcoming baristas, gluten-free treats, delicious Italian sodas. Though, the continuous loud tunes can be a big downside for those wanting to relax, focus, unwind, or chat. Tea comes in messy single filters instead of pots. In general, it's a pleasant place if you can manage the noise and unique tea presentation.

Spice n Grill serves the most fantastic Indian cuisine in St. Louis. The beef nihari, palak paneer, and naan were incredibly flavorful and delightful. The seating inside the place isn't too comfy, so grabbing your food to take away is probably a smarter choice. The owner was super friendly, but it seems like not many people eat in at the restaurant. All in all, I'd definitely suggest giving their scrumptious take-out selections a try.

Having grown up in California with a taste for excellent boba, I felt let down by this establishment's reliance on artificial additives and powders in a few beverages. Still, for those less particular about using natural ingredients, this location might suit you. The ability to adjust sweetness levels and customize add-ons is a pleasant feature. It's an ideal place for socializing with friends, engaging in games, or tackling assignments, especially for University of Arizona students. In general, though it may not satisfy every discerning palate, it's worth a visit for a laid-back hangout.
