I've been ordering from Silver Mine's for the past 4-5 years, and their service has declined over time. They charge for add-ons to soup or chili but fail to include them, and frequently overlook complimentary sides like bread. Delivery consistently takes over an hour. The service is really poor, and the business seems to be in significant trouble. I strongly recommend steering clear of this place.

I got my bike from this store a couple of weeks ago and had a small crash, which messed up the front basket. I took it in today and they repaired the basket and gear shifter at no cost in under 30 minutes. The employees were so nice and made the whole experience great. I definitely suggest checking out this shop!
This shop is like a magical place for grown-ups, with a bit on the pricey side, but totally worth it for the fun it offers. I enjoy popping in just to look around. Definitely a place to check out!

While Pag's menu may not seem too impressive at first glance, the cheeseburger was surprisingly delightful, bringing to mind the taste of a well-made Big Mac. The patty had the perfect juiciness, the bun was spot on, and the sauce was truly delicious. The atmosphere in the wine bar area was wonderful, though it may not be the best for families with young children. The staff was kind and eager to assist. We are certainly looking forward to returning for another round of tasty burgers!

I adore having meals at this eatery with my boyfriend every other week. The dishes and service are excellent, and the prices are fair. Although weekends can get crowded, we never mind waiting. Our favorite dishes include the Indian Pancake and Hainanese/Curry Chicken, but all the choices are scrumptious. We always look forward to returning!

The service was sluggish and the waitstaff were unfriendly. The excessive litter on the outdoor patio was unacceptable and posed a threat to the environment. The food was tasty but the disregard for the ocean and subpar service make it doubtful that I will come back.

In general, digging into the $22 set meal was a delight, offering a nice mix of flavors. The chicken was tender, but the veggies seemed a tad oily. I appreciate the eco-friendly takeout/delivery packaging. Although the food isn't outstanding, it's a dependable choice with a modern vibe, top-notch service, and reliably tasty dishes. The prices might be a bit steep, but the whole experience makes it worthwhile.
Although this Chinese restaurant may not be particularly unique in terms of its menu, it does provide delicious lunch specials and quick service for takeout orders.

I am so glad I got to eat at this unique restaurant yesterday. The onion tart and veal meatballs with polenta were so tasty. The citrus short ribs special was full of flavor and the servings were quite big. Even though the place was small and crowded, the vibe was really welcoming. Can't wait to go back and sample more intriguing dishes on the menu.

We were rejected by the oldest Italian Restaurant in South Philly, but luckily we found Angelina's and had a fantastic dining experience. The warm atmosphere, tasty Eggplant and roasted pepper appetizer, and delectable entrees like Veal Osso Bocca, Carbonara, and lasagna captured our hearts. Angelina and her husband gave us top-notch service, making us feel so comfortable. Looking forward to returning for another delightful meal!
You've got to try the lobster mac and cheese at this place. The food is amazing and the view is truly stunning. It's a perfect mix for a meal you won't forget.
This ice cream shop serves incredibly delicious and huge portions with special flavors. Overall, it's an outstanding experience that others should definitely try.

The food is okay and the drink specials are awesome, but the spot doesn't get too packed. When I visited on a Friday night at 10 pm, there were just 3 other groups at the bar. Even so, they called last orders at 10:15 pm. So, we decided to head to another bar nearby for late-night drinks instead of coming back here.
This place is a great spot to satisfy those late-night munchies. The food is so tasty and the service is really fast. I absolutely recommend checking it out!

Value City might seem like a budget-friendly option, but the pricing is closer to that of Rothman with the quality of Ashley Furniture. The choices for entertainment centers and TV stands are scanty and pricey, and the clearance area doesn't offer many savings. The employees appear more inclined to chat than assist customers, and the dining sets are merely satisfactory. Although there are a couple of contemporary pieces that stand out, generally, the costs are steep for merely average quality. It's advisable to explore other stores in the area or hold off until holiday promotions.

I really enjoy Franzone's because of their welcoming owner, who is clearly dedicated to the food. Although I'm not a big fan of the sweet sauce, I think their cheesesteaks and fries are fantastic. The nice ambiance definitely boosts their rating in my book. 4 out of 5 stars.

Bab Cafe is a must-visit for Asian cuisine lovers in Reno. The Jeyuk Top-Bab packs an explosion of flavors, and the staff is super friendly, plus the location is convenient. The sauce bar is a fun addition and the complimentary miso soup is a nice touch. Amazing value for a tasty and fresh meal. We can't wait to come back and sample more of their dishes!

Just had my first meal in New Orleans and it went beyond my expectations. A $15 lunch special treated me to a scrumptious seafood stew brimming with oyster meat, crab claws, shrimp, and redfish, served alongside a well-crafted salad. Despite not being a fan of seafood, I was pleasantly surprised by how much I relished it. The seasoning, texture, and juiciness of the meats were spot on. Definitely recommend giving it a try.

Biscuit Love was absolutely worth the wait, even in the heat. The Vegan grits with a biscuit on the side were scrumptious, and my sisters relished their meals too. The Bloody Mary's are quite spicy, so watch out. The service was superb despite the 45-minute wait. The line moved swiftly, and our food arrived promptly. Biscuit Love really has their process down to a tee - thanks for an amazing breakfast!

Ichicoro Ane dazzles with its atmosphere, variety of delectable dishes, and impressive whisky offerings. Make sure to try the katsu and bao buns, as their servings come in different sizes – just inquire with your server. Their cocktail choices are exceptional, especially the standout Japanese Old Fashioned. It's a fantastic spot for gatherings that evoke the feel of Japanese izakayas. The staff is friendly and accommodating, making dining here a wonderful experience. A definite go-to spot.
This bakery is a go-to spot for my friend and me on weekend mornings. The breakfast sandwiches, coffee, and donuts are absolutely delicious! I definitely suggest checking it out.

Fantastic variety of whiskey and bourbon, absolutely delicious burger topped with a fried egg, definitely try the duck fries. Adorable ambiance, though seating could be a bit more accommodating for a group of 4. Overall, a delightful spot to visit and we'll definitely come back.

The atmosphere at this English pub is fantastic, with a warm and inviting vibe and delicious drinks expertly crafted by experienced bartenders. But, the prices are a bit high - $7 for a mixed drink - and there's not much seating available.

This comfy little place is just right for grabbing a drink with friends, serving up delicious drinks in charming vintage glassware. However, the selection is a bit limited, with all the drinks featuring some mix of ginger, lime, and honey. The bacon-wrapped dates were overly sugary and the noise increased as more folks arrived. The staff was nice, but they didn't ask about a refill once our glasses were empty.
This place always goes above and beyond with a variety of enjoyable autumn activities like hayrides and pumpkin picking. Definitely recommend for a memorable time.

I had a bad experience with customer service when asking about warranty work for my 2015 $110K AMG. They told me I needed to pay for a loaner car because I didn't buy the car from them. I won't go back there.

This grocery store feels like a miniature Whole Foods, offering a wide range of choices such as a salad bar, fresh fruits, and a juice bar. The store is always well-supplied and convenient, with a parking lot and close to other shops within walking distance. Truly a gem in the city, incomparable.

I really adore this outdoor spot. The one-of-a-kind wine selection, fantastic live music, and creative menu create such a satisfying experience. The atmosphere is stunning and the food and drinks are exceptional. I highly suggest stopping by for a laid-back and delightful time.

I really suggest checking out this place for smog checks on cars. The service is fantastic and the staff is extremely friendly. They are more budget-friendly than most places and always in good spirits.
Fantastic restaurant with mouthwatering gluten-free and vegan choices. The salad, pizza, and root beer were all exquisite. I highly suggest trying it out.

There were 6 of us and we really loved our burgers, they were so satisfying. The restaurant was super neat and had a great vibe. The sweet potato tots were absolutely amazing and you have to try them. Definitely a 5-star experience!

In general, this restaurant has wonderful lighting and a calming ambiance with attentive staff. The food is decent, but could benefit from some enhancements. The noise level is just right for a pleasant dining experience. I would definitely suggest checking out this place. Rating: 8.5/10.

This little deli at the convenience store has some tasty custom-made sandwiches to enjoy in a cozy spot inside or outside with a view of the ocean. The atmosphere may not be fancy, but the food is top-notch. I suggest giving their Cuban press and breakfast sandwiches a go. It's a nice change from the crowded breakfast joint nearby. 4 stars.

My second time there was even nicer than my first, with better service and tastier food. Though there were a few hiccups during the big opening, things got much better with multiple bottle openers and larger portions. The atmosphere still had a few issues, but we got a better spot to sit this time around. The meal was fantastic, and I can't wait to go back. We had no problem snagging a table on a Saturday night at 5pm, and we're happy to have this eatery nearby. I'd definitely suggest giving it a try!

I really enjoy Skyline Chili and I was so excited when they opened a spot in Clearwater. Sadly, the service at this particular Skyline is lacking and the food always takes forever to arrive. There are frequently missing items or problems with the equipment. Nonetheless, I can't resist their cheese coney hot dogs. I'm keeping my fingers crossed that this location gets better.

The eyebrow waxing service is great at this place, but the challenge of booking appointments makes it not worth the trouble. The limited availability and delayed response times on the phone make it irritating to schedule a visit. I chose to go somewhere else despite the increased cost just to make sure I could secure an appointment when I needed it.

The tacos, nachos, ambiance, and margaritas at this place are all fantastic. The Wednesday triple special is a steal and definitely worth a try. Overall, I highly recommend it for a tasty and enjoyable dining experience.

Overall, my experience with this car rental location was very disappointing. The shortage of staff resulted in prolonged wait times and my car not being prepared on schedule. The cleanliness of the car was below standard and I was charged a costly underage fee despite nearing my 25th birthday. I would suggest going with another company like Hertz. Also, opting for the fuel package isn't worthwhile as the cost ends up being similar to regular prices and it's a deceptive tactic for rental companies to generate extra income. The wrong return location address added to my annoyance and further wasted my time. I would not opt to rent from this location again.

Todd and Roberta from this cleaning service did a fantastic job at my house. They were really friendly, worked efficiently, and knew what they were doing. My carpets and couch look fantastic, all pet stains are completely gone. The best part is everything dried quickly and there's no chemical smell hanging around. It was definitely money well spent, I strongly recommend them and will definitely hire them again. A big thank you to the Yelp reviewers for suggesting them!

I really adore this place! The staff is consistently warm and their sips mocha is a top pick of mine. The drive-thru is such a big help, especially when I have my kids with me. And let me tell you about their scrumptious cakes!

Chateau La Vin has transformed from a basic wine shop into a lively wine bar with a diverse selection to cater to wine enthusiasts and beer aficionados. They serve cheese and crackers and permit guests to request delivery from nearby eateries. The proprietor is well-informed and hospitable, and live music frequently fills the air. Boasting an extensive array of wines and some outdoor seating, it's a fantastic destination for unwinding and savoring a beverage.

We absolutely loved our wedding weekend at The Hollander Hotel! The place has such a lovely vibe, the rooms are super comfy and spotless, and the Tap Room is perfect for hanging out with friends and family. The brunch was so tasty and reasonably priced, and the team really made sure everyone felt welcomed. Shoutout to Nick and Will from the management - they were like family to us and made sure everything was just right. If you're in the market for a stunning event venue or a chill escape in downtown St. Pete, we can't recommend this beautiful hotel enough!

I opted for the gyro platter for lunch and was really let down. The dish was dry, bland, and lacked flavor. The veggies that came with it were both unappealing and unpalatable. I wouldn't suggest this spot for lunch, as there are tastier and more satisfying choices in Fairmount.

I had an awesome time at this brewery for drinks. The atmosphere was delightful, with the brewery right there. The beer was scrumptious and the waiter was informed and friendly. Overall, a fabulous place to grab a drink.

I had a fantastic dinner at this restaurant in New Orleans. The BBQ shrimp and bread pudding were absolutely delicious signature dishes. The atmosphere and service were exceptional. I highly suggest trying the fried green tomato appetizer. It's a must-visit place in New Orleans!
The shop offers a fantastic range of products and provides exceptional customer service. It's a bummer they don't have a store in Ft. McMurray. :(

Had a terrible time at the Chippewa store, they totally tricked me with bait and switch tactics. The employees there were trying to cheat me by not accepting online coupons and providing me with incorrect details. Stay away from this place no matter what. Head over to the Creve Coeur store instead.

I was really wowed by this place! The food was absolutely fantastic and the fast service chipotle-style line ordering made for a super convenient experience. The staff was extremely helpful in showing me the ropes as an Indian food newbie. I'm so excited to go back and eat there again!

El Sabor Poblano on Federal might not seem like anything special at first glance, but trust me - the fish tacos are a real standout. Featuring a generous filet of fish in each taco, the tender meat is simply scrumptious and devoid of any overpowering fish taste. You should definitely give the chorizo tacos a shot too - they're free of any unpleasant chewy bits. The team there is welcoming and nice, ensuring you have a delightful time while dining. It's absolutely worth popping by for a yummy and reasonably priced meal.

I was so excited to finally check out this place I had been wanting to try, and it definitely lived up to my expectations. Even though there had been a recent break-in, the service was excellent, and the bartender was really friendly. The pint of dark ale was nice and cold, and the wings were delicious. The owners were really nice, and the independent, locally-owned feel of the place was a welcome change. I can't wait to come back and tell others about this gem. It's a perfect spot to relax near home and work.

I discovered this spot through Yelp reviews and they were totally accurate. The sandwiches were amazing and definitely worth the wait in line. The service was quick and super friendly, our sandwiches arrived shortly after we sat down. Overall, it was a fantastic dining experience.

The theater features incredibly cozy recliners, but the downside is having to lower your feet for others to walk past. The bartender at the lounge is charming, and it's a pleasant touch to enjoy drinks in the theater. However, the concession experience was lackluster with chaos and overcooked popcorn. It might be preferable to have a meal beforehand and simply frequent the bar next time.
This hotel is absolutely fantastic - spotless rooms, welcoming staff, stunning pool, and grand entrance. I can't wait to come back next year.
I tried out this restaurant right after it opened and I was really let down by how the food tasted and its overall quality. I haven't been tempted to go back since and I wouldn't suggest eating here.

Stopped by on a peaceful Sunday afternoon with only a handful of customers. The bartender mentioned they had run out of most food items. The beers were okay but nothing exceptional. Noticed the staff seemed agitated and were having a tense conversation behind the bar. The place had a nice vibe, but there are better choices close by. Not sure if I'd come back.
I had a disappointing experience at Tony Luke's in terminal F. The Philly Cheese Steak didn't look like the picture and the meat tasted like dog food. Definitely not worth the $10.
I really adore this spot. It's like a hidden gem in Creve Couer. The 9-hole course is budget-friendly and the staff is super accommodating.
When I first came here, the service was really sluggish, and the employees were not very friendly, but the food was delicious.

I've been to this place a bunch of times and the service has always been subpar. But the food is consistently yummy and definitely makes it worth going back. It's a good choice for a dive bar with some tasty eats.

I was delighted by the beauty and high quality of the artwork at this free museum in Indianapolis. The African Art and Modern Art exhibits were especially remarkable, though taking photos in the Modern Art section is prohibited. The outdoor sculpture garden and gift shop also contributed to my enjoyment. I highly recommend this museum for art lovers.

The eatery is a solid choice for gatherings, but get ready for a lengthy wait to snag a table, especially during busy times. They don't take reservations, and bigger groups might not fit in the main dining section. The boss did provide coffee for the waiting customers, but I hoped they'd top off the pot. The grub was tasty, offering options like 1/2 and 1/2 combos, though I wished my sandwich had more sauerkraut. The sunrise chile rellenos plate seemed scrumptious, and I'd give it a go next time with a smaller crew.
The store is an amazing place with impeccable attention to detail and services. It provides a wide range of options for private meetings and productive work. I highly recommend it.

My husband and I marked our Anniversary at this restaurant and it was a wonderful experience. The dinner was phenomenal and the customer service was outstanding. We will absolutely be back in the future.

The Terrace Lounge disappoints as a top cocktail spot because of its diluted drinks, inconsistent service, and unwelcoming patrons. The bartenders appear disorganized and unfamiliar with the menu, offering a subpar liquor selection that falls short of expectations. The atmosphere is marred by casino-goers who diminish the overall experience. On the other hand, Cin Cin delivers exceptional cocktails and a more pleasant setting, free from the distractions of gambling machines. Terrace Lounge could elevate its reputation by enhancing service, upgrading its liquor offerings, and creating a more inviting ambiance to draw a more discerning crowd.

I totally suggest checking out this spot for amazing service, with staff who are super friendly. Huge shoutout to Amanda, she's a riot. The food was delicious and the beer was icy cold. The overall vibe was just fantastic.

I absolutely adore this nail salon in the city. I've been coming here for years and simply adore the peaceful and calm vibes. The team is consistently welcoming and quick. For just $25.00 for a pedicure down in the South, it's truly a steal. I highly suggest checking them out!

I had an amazing morning at this New Jersey diner. The taylor ham, egg, and cheese sandwich was phenomenal on a hamburger roll, and the home fries were delicious. The blueberry pancakes were fluffy, but the pre-packaged syrup was a bit disappointing. The service was warm and attentive, with great coffee and no side-eye for ordering two breakfasts. I'm already looking forward to my next visit to this awesome diner!

The server was fantastic and the maple wings were mouthwatering, but the whole evening was completely spoiled by the inappropriate and offensive performance by the "piano guys." Their rendition of the song was appalling, offensive, and humiliating, and utterly ruined the birthday celebration. Definitely not worth the $35 paid for the performance.

The recently opened Han Dynasty has replaced the old Mid-Atlantic restaurant, providing a more pleasant experience than the previous location in Olde City. The service is remarkable, with the staff putting in extra effort to cater to allergies and ensure guests feel at home. The dishes may be less spicy compared to other branches, but the ambiance and layout compensate for it. The lunch servings offer great value, making it an ideal spot for a convenient and budget-friendly meal. All in all, a reliable option for dining out.

Carisma Restaurante has quickly become our favorite place for delicious meals and top-notch service. Owner Jose is welcoming and makes sure all guests are happy. The paellas, salmon, and filet mignon were cooked perfectly and served piping hot. Be sure to check out their cafe for equally yummy baked treats and coffee. In general, Carisma serves fantastic, fresh food made and served by friendly folks - a unique experience beyond the usual Mexican options. You should definitely give it a try!

This cozy restaurant on Woodland Avenue dishes up tasty Senegalese and West African cuisine. The Thiboudienne was fantastic, with a unique twist compared to the classics. The Jollof Rice was a real winner too. You can grab a seat at the high tables for a sit-down meal or opt for takeout. The warm service only makes the experience even better.

I was really let down by the falafel wrap I had recently. The falafels and pita were quite bland, and the tzatziki sauce was sadly flavorless, almost like a runny paste rather than a tasty sauce. The only saving grace were the crisp cucumber and juicy tomato, but they got lost under the lacking sauce. All in all, I wouldn't suggest this if you're looking for a delicious and fulfilling meal.

This spot nails the ideal mix of fancy and chill, welcoming all kinds of guests. Whether you're all dressed up or in your coziest activewear, you'll truly feel at ease savoring their amazing cocktails.

Our party of six had an amazing time exploring a new culinary experience at this restaurant. The featured dish offered a satisfying portion size and a fantastic opportunity to taste a variety of their offerings. The chicken, steak, rice and beans, and plantains were all superb. While the egg and Yuca didn't quite suit my taste, they were simple to set aside. All in all, a place worth visiting for anyone interested in trying out something unique.

The pulled pork dish and sides at this restaurant were scrumptious. The red beans and rice had a nice kick, the sweet potato casserole was mouthwatering, and the pulled pork was smoky, juicy, and generous. A dining experience worth trying.
The detailing job was top-notch. My car was incredibly dirty and hadn't been washed in months. I chose the executive detailing package and now my car looks amazing. I definitely recommend it.

While checking out a possible second home in the area, we discovered that the Lifetime club was compact yet well-equipped, with a welcoming and supportive front desk attendant named Jen, who spoke highly of the club. We also had the pleasure of meeting Joe, the fantastic general manager. The club boasts amazing bathrooms stocked with toiletries and is conveniently situated next to the mall. I highly suggest it for those looking for exceptional service.

The barbecue was alright, but there's definitely room for it to be better. The pulled pork was a tad dry, but it did have a nice smoky taste. The BBQ sauce they had was a bit too sweet for me. In general, it was just okay, and I would probably only go back if there wasn't a better spot close by.

Our visit to this restaurant on a Lenten Friday was quite disappointing. The wait was really long and the service wasn't very helpful. The blackened alligator was too greasy and the raw oysters were fresh but not quite as expected. The main dishes weren't anything special either, as the roast beef was overly salty and the tuna and shrimp kabob were bland. Although the seafood boil menu seemed good, we didn't give it a try. Considering the cost, you can probably find better seafood choices at other places.

Terrible customer service experience. I phoned regarding a promotion, was told it would be honored, but upon arrival, was informed otherwise. The owner declined to rectify their error. I do not recommend if good customer service is important to you.

This Chinese restaurant is a must-visit for anyone who wants to enjoy tasty and spicy dishes with a big group. Each dish is bursting with flavor and always satisfies. It's a sure hit that lives up to its reputation.

The Bricks of Ybor is a place you don't want to miss in Tampa. The meat sandwiches are amazing, and the pulled pork on Hawaiian sweet bread was absolutely delicious. Brian, the owner, was incredibly welcoming and even treated us to complimentary drinks and appetizers. The mix of people and the relaxed atmosphere make this spot a perfect hangout. I wholeheartedly suggest checking out this restaurant and I can't wait to go back on my next visit to Tampa.
The anticipation was totally worth it for the delicious crepes and unique grits. The pancakes were also fantastic. I highly recommend it!

When my sister-in-law and I went to this restaurant, our experience turned out to be rather disappointing. The hostess was hard to understand, the TV show playing wasn't enjoyable, and the service was lacking. Our food took quite a while to arrive, and while the blue cheese burger had an overpowering amount of blue cheese, the fries and onion sticks were tasty. We had to wait for a to-go box and observed another table waiting for their food for a considerable amount of time. All in all, I don't envision coming back to this place again.

The food at this restaurant was pretty good, but it was way too expensive. The guacamole and Mojito were fantastic, but the peach pork medallions were bland. The corn cakes with Barbacoa were delicious. The vibe was cool and welcoming, but finding parking was a real hassle. They should really offer valet parking considering how pricey it is and the lack of spaces. Walking three blocks in the summer heat was just not worth it.

The Rusty Pelican got off to a rough start in the evening when the hostess first turned down our ask for a table by the window. However, our server Liz more than made up for it with exceptional service. The drinks, food, and overall experience were fantastic following the initial hiccup.

The winery provides decent wines but showcases a stunning spot on the pier with a fantastic outdoor patio. The staff is very welcoming, but the wine club is pricey and provides minimal perks to its members. Despite the ambiance, it might be more enjoyable to stop by for a tasting rather than committing to the wine club.

I got a budget haircut in New York that made my hair resemble a wild monkey had a go at it. Desperate for a makeover before job interviews, I visited Domenick's and had Robert style my hair. Although $35 was more than I usually spend, the outcome justified the cost. Thanks to the fantastic service at Domenick's, I regained a human look. I'd rate my experience a 4 out of 5.

Had a really awful experience with Monro Muffler. They didn't put enough oil in our engine, causing damage. Bergeys found out that the timing chain needed replacing, something that should never happen. Joe, the guy there, was not helpful at all - he was rude and actually made my wife cry. We're not going back there - they've lost a customer for good. Wouldn't recommend them to anyone.

The shop is spotlessly clean with delightful homemade breakfast tarts and chicken pot pies. The desserts are not only visually appealing but also incredibly flavorful. While a few items may seem a bit expensive given their size, the exceptional quality justifies the cost. The staff members are welcoming and interactive. It's a fantastic place for locals and a must-visit for travelers from the city center. I'll absolutely return and enthusiastically endorse it.

Arrive early if you're interested in giving this place a try. We waited for about 30 minutes and thought the pancakes were average, though slightly dry. The variety was nice, featuring flavors such as raspberry, sweet potato, san antonio, and sugar and spice pancakes. In general, the food was alright but didn't quite meet our expectations. If the wait is excessive, I suggest checking out Fido nearby for exceptional coffee and breakfast dishes.

The service at this dealership has really gone downhill ever since Kelly and her team moved on. Now, it's really only worth going here for quick fixes like oil changes before trying out a different Honda dealer.

This little spot offers the finest soon-dubu in town in a warm and inviting setting. There are plenty of vegetarian choices, and you shouldn't miss the personalized stews. The extra spicy and spicy heat levels cater well to those who enjoy a kick, while the dol-sot rice is wonderfully crispy. For those not keen on tofu, the Korean BBQ meats are a fantastic option. In summary, it's a top pick for delectable Korean dishes!

This motel has tidy, cozy rooms at an affordable price. Nevertheless, the breakfast spread is so-so and the pool is too cramped for doing laps. The roomy and inviting lobby is a nice touch. All in all, a solid choice for a wallet-friendly getaway.

It's frustrating that the management hasn't shown empathy and taken care of the cleanliness and maintenance issues at the columbarium site. The request for improved vases for all niches should have been understood and acted upon promptly. It's disappointing that the management hasn't been cooperative and seems uncaring towards the families of those interred.

The deli offers a warm atmosphere with kind staff and a tasty menu that features vegetarian breakfast sandwiches and a range of other choices. The prices are fair and the service is quick and attentive. Be sure to explore their snack variety, which includes chocolate bars, beverages, chips, and hi-chew candies. All in all, a fantastic spot for a fast and gratifying meal.

Dropped by for brunch and was happily impressed by the scrumptious food. The 3 meat hash, turkey sandwich, and bagel with salmon were all fantastic. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. It was a tad on the expensive side, but totally worth it. I'll definitely come back if I'm in the neighborhood.

This little treasure at the end of Terminal E in Tampa International Airport has a wonderful variety of food and drinks at reasonable prices. The bar has a local atmosphere, complete with TVs for enjoying the game and caring, welcoming staff. Although seating might be limited, it's a fantastic place to unwind before a flight. The drinks are flavorful and reasonably priced, with a 22oz Jai Alai priced at $8.50. I savored a delightful Manhattan for $11. In general, it's a fantastic discovery for Delta passengers seeking a relaxed spot to pass the time before their flight. 5/5 stars.
The Depot Burger and shishito peppers were incredibly tasty. The food, atmosphere, and drinks were all spot on. I highly suggest checking them out!

The Giant store has really gone downhill. The fruits and veggies are no longer fresh and the prices keep going up, especially for organic items compared to places like Whole Foods. The store setup and service have both taken a hit too, with blocked-off aisles and hard-to-reach spots. It's just not a good shopping experience anymore, so I'm switching to Wegmans.

This charming find in a strip mall is a must-visit for a contemporary, romantic dining experience. The food is outstanding, with exceptional dishes like the Fois gras and short ribs. The set menu is a great choice, providing a selection of courses to explore. The desserts, particularly the caramel tart, are also fantastic. Looking forward to returning for another delightful dining adventure!

Our group dining experience at this restaurant was pretty lackluster. Even though we had a reservation, the service was very slow and inattentive. The food was okay at best, with some dishes being enjoyable while others were just average. The atmosphere was trendy, but the service really brought the whole experience down. I wouldn't recommend this place based on our visit.
The food was amazing for the price. The steak was tender and the shrimp were cooked perfectly. I would definitely think about coming back.

Although Tako had great reviews on Yelp, our visit there fell short of expectations. The employees forgot to bring us ice or a cooler for our wine, and the appetizers were both delayed and lacking in quality. While the sushi was decent, it didn't quite impress us. The overall service was sluggish, and we might opt not to get appetizers if we decide to visit again.

The catfish, chicken, gumbo, and mac & cheese at this lunch buffet are absolutely delicious. Everything was piping hot and freshly made, and the flavors were exceptional. A local suggested this spot to us, and it was truly worth the visit.

See's Candies, a California-based bakery, has made its way to sunny Florida. Specifically, you can find it in Tampa at the International Plaza Mall. Renowned for their delectable and velvety chocolates, the temporary store provides a tempting array of treats like lollipops and assorted chocolates. The welcoming staff encourages customers to taste test various flavors before deciding on a purchase, providing a guilt-free indulgence experience. From nutty delights to refreshing mint and rich toffee options, there is something to suit every taste. Strategically positioned near H&M, it's a definite must-stop for those with a sweet tooth. If you're in the vicinity, why not forgo online ordering and treat yourself to some delicious goodies in-store?

R2L provides a chic and enjoyable dining experience with breathtaking views of the city from the 37th floor of Two Liberty Place. The $35 Center City Restaurant Week dinner menu is a fantastic deal with various options for each course. Standouts featured the crispy peas/ham/garlic risotto balls, satisfying Butcher's Filet with braised short rib and Steuben bean chili, and decadent milk chocolate hazelnut pudding for dessert. The attentive service and sophisticated ambiance create a memorable dining experience.

Becca is an amazing bartender who provides excellent service at the bar. She offers fabulous happy hour specials, including land shark, although the food menu is a bit limited. We look forward to seeing her draw in more locals and maintain her success.

My first visit to this place was quite disappointing. I didn't get my change or receipt and when I inquired about it, I was just told that I already had them. Moreover, I couldn't find a spoon for my chili and the cheese on my burger seemed quite old. I don't think I'll be going back there again.

Excellent deals for family-size orders, the pot roast was mouthwatering for takeout, expertly packed and remained hot, ample portions for a family of 4, exceptional green beans, highly suggest for a delightful family dining experience.
I got a Caramel frappe at the drive-thru and had to wait for 30 minutes to get my drink, even though there were only 2 cars ahead of me. It was a letdown.

All in all, this spot is a must-visit for anyone who loves sweets. The pizza cookies are incredibly delicious and the fact that they're open until 3am is a game-changer. The only drawback is the prices, but the top-notch quality of the treats makes it worth it. I strongly suggest checking it out!

This eatery in Philadelphia is a true gem among the city's dining establishments. The tahini and bread were oddly irresistible, and the organic meat selections were exceptional. The beef shishkabob was flawlessly prepared, and the purslane salad was a delight. The intriguing mix of spices in the dishes left us craving more. The pistachio creme brulee dessert was incredibly delightful. The service was outstanding, with attentive staff and great timing. This spot might just be the sole restaurant worth visiting in Philadelphia - definitely worth the splurge. Cheers to the chef for delivering such a wonderful dining experience.
Steer clear of this spot. The frozen pizza and spoiled beer were a huge disappointment. Keep your cash and find another place to visit. That's all there is to it.
Dining at this place made my entire family ill. The frozen yogurt looked nice but was unpleasant in flavor. I won't be coming back or recommending this place for a meal.
This spot is a real hidden gem for genuine Indian street food. I've tried a bunch of dishes, and each one was cooked impeccably. I highly recommend it for a tasty and fulfilling meal.

The Saint offered a one-of-a-kind and unforgettable night out in New Orleans. The vibe was vibrant, with eclectic Uptown personalities dropping by. The outdoor seating was a pleasant surprise, providing a welcome break from the indoor smoke. It might not suit everyone, but if you crave a unique adventure and can handle a touch of disorder, it's worth a shot.

The food at this restaurant is excellent and consistently fresh. I appreciate that they invest the effort to prepare dishes such as Wonton Soup correctly. Ideal for families with children who have their preferred dishes.

The food at this restaurant was superb, but the service was a letdown. Even though we arrived well before closing, we were turned away for dine-in and forced to only order takeout. Even after explaining that we had two pregnant women and a child with us, they still didn't budge. This disregard for customers is not okay, and I won't be coming back here. It's really disappointing, especially for expecting mothers.

This restaurant went above and beyond with their outstanding steak and amazing staff. Mallory, Max, and the whole team worked together flawlessly to give us a fantastic dining experience. We'll definitely be coming back. Absolutely adore this spot!

The team at this office is really friendly and helpful. Dr. Dinh was caring and made sure to listen to all of my worries during the exam. There were lots of great choices for frames, and the receptionist was understanding and guided me through everything. My visit was fantastic, and I'll for sure come back next year for my check-up.

Terrible experience ordering from this place. The pizza was tiny, the delivery took ages, and the delivery girl was impolite and unwilling to provide the correct change. I definitely wouldn't suggest getting food from here.

BK is definitely worth checking out for some Sonoran hot dogs, but it might not be everyone's cup of tea because of all the different toppings involved. The guacamole really stood out, but the taco combo was a bit of a mixed bag with some not-so-great slimy cabeza meat. I appreciated the salsa bar and the service was on point with speedy food service. The place was buzzing with activity during lunch on a weekday.

I was pretty let down by the service at the restaurant. Even though I had made reservations, they claimed all the window tables were booked when I could see several were empty. The food was delicious, especially the filet and salmon dishes. But it was a bummer that they didn't mention the recommended wine would cost $75 until after we ordered.

This was hands down the most delicious Indian cuisine I've ever tasted! The dishes were so flavorful and the staff was super friendly and helpful. The ambiance was very inviting and everything was spotlessly clean. The palak paneer and biryani were out of this world. Definitely a 5-star experience!
The smoothies at this place are absolutely the top-notch in the world. The fresh bread is incredible too. The staff is so knowledgeable and friendly. A spot that smoothie enthusiasts shouldn't miss!

Bell Meade in Nashville surpassed my expectations on my recent visit. Although I didn't locate the exact bourbon I sought, the visit was delightful due to the tasting bar and Max's lively conversation. I even acquired a distinctive bottle of Tennessee whiskey cream. I intend to revisit Bell Meade without fail in the future. Five stars, absolutely.

You absolutely have to check out this seaside eatery at the far end of the pier if you're into top-notch seafood. Their special on the local crab for $26 was a complete steal and the fried platter of shrimp, oysters, calamari, and scallops at $12.95 was hands down one of the best I've ever had. The view is stunning, the service is top-notch, and the food is cooked to perfection. Definitely try to get there early and nab a spot as it fills up fast. Parking might be a bit of a headache, but the whole experience is definitely worth it.

All in all, this place was a major letdown. The manager and wait staff were extremely impolite and didn't seem to care about customer satisfaction. The manager's unfriendly response to a simple ask for brown rice was unprofessional and unpleasant. The waitresses were awkward and kept running into customers during their meals. The food was decent at most, definitely not deserving of the high price. Asking for payment for each refill of soda felt unfair and too much. I won't be coming back here.

Although my first taste of Nola cuisine began with a bump in the road, I was ultimately glad that I gave it a shot. Despite a few hiccups with our orders and a mediocre shrimp po'boy, I get that the restaurant might just have had an off day. Yet, the whole thing ended up leaving me feeling less than impressed and unsure if I'd go back.

This comedy club seriously needs an upgrade. The vibe is pretty sketchy and old-fashioned, which makes it seem not very welcoming, especially for kids. The service is just okay and everything looks kind of worn out. The place is missing that lively and enjoyable atmosphere you'd hope for, and ends up feeling more like a gloomy meeting hall. On a brighter side, there's plenty of parking and the location is handy. To really improve things, the owners should definitely consider sprucing up the place.

I absolutely loved my weekend stay at the Orange St location. The apartment was incredibly spacious and had all the amenities I could ask for, such as a fully stocked kitchen and a cozy king bed. Even though the location wasn't well-marked, the guard at the front desk was super helpful and gave me all the info I needed. The peaceful environment and the absence of constant maid service made my stay so enjoyable and calming. I would definitely book this place again in the future. I highly recommend it!

I've been a regular at this restaurant for 15 years because of its fantastic location and great service. However, the inconsistent quality of the steak and the staff's excuses have been a frequent problem. I'm happy to pay extra for a high-quality steak, but it's frustrating when the blame is put on the server.

My time at this dealership was a total disaster. Buying a car over my budget, the poor communication, and the dishonesty from the sales team made everything worse. They didn't do much to fix the unaffordable purchase problem and haven't been helpful in trying to make things right. Stay away from this dealership.

Desi Village in KOP may not have the most inviting atmosphere, but the food more than makes up for it being absolutely scrumptious. The location in a strip mall might not be anything special and the decor is a bit outdated, but their menu featuring delights like Keema Naan, Samosas, Saag Paneer, and Lamb Biryani is bursting with flavor and expertly crafted. They are also very accommodating of food allergies, making it a safe bet for anyone with dietary restrictions. So, even though the ambiance might not be stellar, the delectable dishes definitely make it a worthwhile dining destination.

LA Smokehouse really blew us away after a disappointing barbecue spot left us wanting more. The pulled pork was absolutely fantastic, the mac and cheese was a total standout, and the owner's personal attention really elevated the whole experience. This place is a must-try for anyone who loves great barbecue!

Iris has become my favorite place to dine in New Orleans. They really pay attention to every detail - the food, drinks, service, atmosphere, and overall experience are outstanding. The restaurant layout creates a cozy dining atmosphere, and the music selection adds to the vibe without being too loud. The menu is full of creative dishes made with fresh, local ingredients. The prix fixe menu offers an excellent deal for such high-quality food. I plan on coming back, regardless of the size of my party. I highly recommend checking them out.

The ambiance and decoration are fantastic with incredibly welcoming staff. The lunch specials, particularly the Pad Thai with chicken, provide generous portions and delicious flavors. Although the dinner was a bit underwhelming with a small serving of chicken satay, the Panang Curry with chicken was thoroughly satisfying. While Pad See Ew is missing from the menu, there are plenty of other enticing choices available. The staff and manager truly shine in providing excellent customer service. I am looking forward to returning soon.

Petra Restaurant truly impressed our family. The rice with lamb special on Friday and Saturday was incredibly flavorful, with hints of Indian fried rice. Despite its location, the ambiance inside the restaurant was inviting and the service was top-notch. All in all, we had a delightful dining experience and highly recommend sampling their delectable Middle Eastern cuisine.

I had a fantastic birthday dinner at The Pearl. The cuisine, wine, and service were all outstanding. The team was friendly and didn't make us feel hurried even after closing time. I highly suggest trying out this restaurant!

I swung by Albertsons to grab some snacks and was really impressed with the tidy and well-stocked store. They had a nice variety of bakery goods, flowers, and groceries, featuring local treats like California Kettle Corn and Taco Works. I managed to locate the slightly uncommon chips I wanted and picked up a Diet Coke on my way out. The spacious aisles and easy parking made my shopping trip a breeze, and the welcoming staff was a great added touch. All in all, I left Albertsons feeling pretty darn pleased.
I used to adore this place, but the new owners have transformed it into a horrible combination of terrible food and awful service. It's truly disappointing.

Dr. Gloudemans is an outstanding and proactive doctor who stays current on the latest research and supports vaccination. She is warm, positive, and offers comforting advice when handling health issues. Despite some billing problems causing irritation, these issues were fixed after a phone call.

The Homebuilders Association of New Orleans meeting was quite enjoyable. The food offerings were tasty, and the staff was attentive. The mimosa was delightful, and the corn and crab soup was outstanding, despite the small portion. The grits and grillades dish was also delicious with a generous serving. At $10, the price was fair. The atmosphere and food quality make it a spot worth a return trip. Although I didn't try the Wi-Fi, judging by my experience, I'd suggest revisiting this place.

The first café is a great choice for those who avoid gluten, offering budget-friendly options and fast snacks. The Cobb salad is a favorite, especially with an additional egg for a protein boost. Plan for crowded periods like Senior Mondays and busy weekend lunches.

Ghini's serves scrumptious French breakfast choices, with the eggs provencale standing out as a delectable and distinctive dish. Both the sweet and savory crepes are a must-have, especially the spinach and swiss crepe which is my top pick. Don't miss adding hashbrowns for just a dollar. I highly suggest giving Ghini's a go for a flavorful and fulfilling breakfast outing.

I totally adored the cool vibe of this place, with street art on the walls and yummy food choices. The hummus variations were a nice addition, and I especially liked the Greek steak pita with guacamole hummus. The prices were fair and the servings were large. Looking forward to visiting again!

Prep & Pastry is a top pick for brunch in town. The food is mouthwatering, especially the breakfast sandwich, and their sweets are amazing. Remember to add your name to the waitlist before you go to cut down on wait time. The iced tea is exceptional and the staff is incredibly welcoming. I truly suggest stopping by.

The Fringe festival in Edmonton showcases a diverse range of performances, street acts, and vendors across two weekends and an additional week. With numerous venues and theatrical productions to select from, along with a bustling street market, it's a fantastic opportunity to immerse yourself in the local arts culture. Be sure to check out the gourmet mini donut truck hidden behind the farmers market for a tasty treat. The setting contributes to the festival's appeal, cementing its status as a beloved yearly tradition in the city.

I used to visit this place often, but I'm quite let down by the recent changes. The service has really gone downhill - our server was rude, unaccommodating, and didn't even suggest taking a tea to go as they used to. The food was just okay, and the decline in the seating area was obvious. This spot used to be a go-to for me, but I won't be coming back.

Even though this plumber gave us a quick and clear estimate, we ended up selecting another plumber because their price was higher than the others we talked to. Nevertheless, their communication was top-notch and we might think about hiring them for upcoming jobs since they seem dependable. It's a fact that good work usually costs more.
The Mexican food here in Florida is the absolute best! I can't get enough of it and keep returning ever since my first experience. I would definitely suggest giving it a try!

Real Thai serves genuine Thai dishes with the chance to personalize spiciness. The soups are exceptional, and although the curries are flavorful, they might be a little thin. The vegetable eggrolls aren't popular, but it's worth considering the meat ones. In general, it's a reliable pick for Thai cuisine.

Jump on the School Bus delivered outstanding service for our winery and brewery tour as well as our wedding transportation. Darin and Sierra were easy to get in touch with, accommodating, and meticulous. Our driver was informative and offered excellent recommendations throughout the day. We highly suggest them for any event transportation needs.

Bailey's Range is a fantastic place to take visitors from out of town, offering amazing burgers and one-of-a-kind boozy shakes. You absolutely have to sample the horchata shake. Its convenient location makes it a breeze to drop by, and the atmosphere is delightful. The burger options are top-notch, with friendly servers who provide genuine recommendations. The burger competition adds an interesting element. The only drawback is occasional variations in burger cooking levels. In conclusion, I'd rate it as a 4 out of 5-star experience.
This breakfast sandwich on a biscuit is seriously amazing - so tasty!

I'm never coming back to this Silver Mine location at the University. The manager didn't care about my order, the sandwich was cold and sloppily wrapped, and the employee was rude. Good riddance, Silver Mine!

I recently visited this salon for the first time and Grace did a fantastic job on my challenging hair, which is extremely long and thick. The ambiance was modern and spotless without any snootiness. The pricing was fair. I would definitely recommend it!

The food at this restaurant was amazing, especially the Sunday Buffet which included crispy fried chicken, flavorful greens, tender smothered steak, savory corn, and tasty cabbage. The atmosphere was really cozy and gave off a vibe similar to eating at your grandmother's house. Although not a fancy dining spot, the prices were reasonable and the locals really spoke highly of it. The overall experience went above and beyond what I expected and was absolutely worth any wait.

The Passion Passport juice was a delightful mix of passion fruit, banana, pineapple mango, papaya, and natural cane sugar. It was delicious and refreshing, truly living up to its name. I would definitely order it again!

I had a fantastic private tour with Carrie today. Despite the rain deterring the crowds, her enthusiasm and expertise about the Civil War were truly captivating. The Battle of Franklin unquestionably merits the memorial it has.

I had an awesome experience with this service. The team was really nice and took care of me from the moment I called. They gave me the best prices in town and managed to schedule me in for a windshield repair on the same day. The waiting area was cozy and had free drinks and snacks. Overall, I felt appreciated as a customer and will for sure come back for any future auto glass needs. I highly recommend them!

According to the review, it appears that the customer is very angry with TD Bank for failing to communicate their updated overdraft policy, which led to unforeseen charges. The customer also encountered poor customer service, enduring a prolonged hold time on the phone. Consequently, the customer intends to change banks due to this situation.

Our experience at the Four Points for 3 nights in November was enjoyable. Checking in was a breeze, and we appreciated the discounted room rate as members with AAA. The complimentary breakfast was a delightful addition. The hotel's proximity to the airport was convenient, and the staff was cordial and accommodating. The room was cozy, parking was a breeze, and it was peaceful at night. Would definitely suggest it for a business trip.

Situated next to the Union Station Metro stop, this hotel is a handy choice for downtown visitors. Weekend prices are reasonable, but weekdays see a rise. The room was tidy and the bed cozy, adorned with an abundance of pillows. The bathroom was roomy, featuring a tub and plenty of towels. Minor downsides included a subpar coffee maker in the room and thin doors that allowed hallway noise. The lobby stands out as a standout feature of the hotel. In general, a solid pick for accommodations in the vicinity.

I've tried some of the most delicious Mexican food ever, particularly the crispy fish taco. The spicy red sauce and birria are absolute must-haves to bring back home. It can get pretty stuffy in the restaurant during the monsoon season without any air conditioning, but the tasty food definitely makes up for it.

As someone who loves running, I count on my shoes to help me perform my best. Endurance House offers a wide range of shoes, and their team gives personalized support to enhance your running form and avoid injuries. The diverse options, supportive team, and tailored service set this store apart. I plan on coming back for exceptional products and service.

HipCity offers a fantastic lunch option for those seeking mouthwatering plant-based alternatives. Just watch out for the tight quarters and yoga mats when searching for a spot to stand. Their flavorful menu choices such as the buffalo bella and crispy hipcity ranch sandwiches will make you forget about missing meat. Welcoming personnel and prompt service make this an excellent choice for a fast and gratifying meal.
The establishment said it closes at 10PM, yet the kitchen had already shut down when I got there at 8:30. It was frustrating and unfair for them to reject customers that early.
This Chinese restaurant is definitely the best in the area with super friendly owners. The wontons offered while waiting for takeout are a tasty bonus.

Rosemary's Grill holds a special place in our hearts as our go-to dining spot. Their menu is broad, featuring a mix of enticing Classic American fare and authentic Turkish dishes. One standout option is the delectable Mixed grill kebab platter. The servings are substantial, and each dish is meticulously prepared, setting it apart from typical franchise eateries. The intimate, family-run setting creates a comforting atmosphere that always leaves us feeling at home. The staff and owners are exceptionally friendly, ensuring each visit is a delightful experience. We eagerly anticipate our next meal, whether it's for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Don't miss out on trying the rice pudding—it's a definite must-try!

The employees are really nice and the vibe is inviting, but there weren't many people there when I went on two occasions. The $3.50 margaritas after 4 on Tuesdays are a fantastic bargain and super delicious.
I wouldn't suggest this place, even if it was the only option open at 2am. The General Tso's dish was mediocre and not worth going back for. I recommend heading to East Cuisine instead.

The food at this restaurant is delicious, especially the standout dishes like the blueberry lasagna and chocolate dessert. However, the dining experience was spoiled by the arrogant and dismissive attitude of the waiter, who lacked basic professionalism and customer service skills. Without the waiter's behavior, this place would have earned a much better rating.

The ice cream shop offers incredibly distinctive and delightful flavors. The Cassis sorbet was exceptional, beginning with a subtle taste and gradually intensifying with every spoonful. It was definitely worth coming back with friends to try more of their frozen treats.

This place serves the most amazing pizza, no doubt about it. The owners, a former hockey player and his feisty yet lovable wife, are a hoot. They craft their own sausage and mozzarella, and be sure not to say Ricotta wrong. Every pizza is superb, even the crusts which we usually leave behind in our household. Give dipping them in olive oil and vinaigrette a shot for an added flavor boost. I can't recommend this spot enough.

The sales team was really nice and accommodating, especially Mike. He let us take a spin in one of the Razors, and it was such a blast! Maybe we’ll treat ourselves to one in the future! Overall, fantastic customer service.

I really suggest checking out this spot for scrumptious meals and warm service. Don't miss out on the zucchini muffins; I always grab some to enjoy later. Their prices are fantastic and they have an amazing fro-yo bar with endless toppings. It's a delightful place to dine with delicious food.

The unlimited dining encounter turned out to be a letdown because of extended wait periods for orders and being neglected by the servers. Some rolls came with unexpected add-ons not mentioned on the menu, like a sweet mustard sauce that didn't sit well. However, on a brighter note, when orders were eventually placed, the food was prepared promptly.

The restaurant had a lovely atmosphere and was spotless, and each of us had a great time with our food. The fried green tomatoes were seasoned to perfection and mouthwatering, although they came out after everyone else had finished eating. The chicken salad, fried bologna sandwich, and cheeseburger were all delectable options. We split the peach cobbler dessert, which we strongly suggest having with a scoop of ice cream.
The food at this cafe is tasty, but the cleanliness of the place is really not up to par. I probably won't come back unless they step up their hygiene game.
We really recommend this place for mouthwatering food with hearty portions. The chicken parm was particularly delicious. Excited to come back and sample more dishes!

All in all, it wasn't a terrible spot for burgers. The bacon cheeseburger had deliciously crispy bacon and a beautifully toasted bun. The fries and chocolate shake were pretty tasty as well. But, the burger could have been more succulent, the serving size seemed a bit small for the cost, and the lasting aroma of burger grease was a bit of a drawback.

I checked out this place after hearing great things on Yelp. But, the food turned out to be just mediocre. So, I headed across the street to Charlie's, and let me tell you, the redtop pizza was absolutely amazing. If you're craving top-notch pizza, definitely go to Charlie's instead.

We've been devoted patrons of this spot from the days of Wild Oats, and it looks like things have only gotten better since joining forces with Whole Foods. The fruits, seafood, cheeses, and personal care aisles are all outstanding. The organic beauty products and artisanal soaps are preferred, alongside the fresh salad bar. The ideal choices for a post-yoga meal during the colder times include the Carrot Ginger, Split Pea, and Corn Chowder soups. Other notable treats encompass the spiced tofu salad, ready-to-eat sushi boxes, loaded cookies, and floral-infused soda. All in all, a superb shopping venture.
The Mediterranean chicken quesadillas are incredible, especially with the amazing sauce. I highly suggest them for anyone who enjoys fresh Greek cuisine!

I'm totally smitten with this spot! It's beautiful, roomy, contemporary, and to top it off, exceptionally clean. The team, including Will, Amanda, and Sal, are amazing and super helpful, especially with fixing my gadgets as a new vaper. Their selection of juices, mods, and atty's is extensive, and I always enjoy exploring new flavors every time I stop by. A definite go-to for anyone into vaping, you'll be more than satisfied!

Fantastic spot for breakfast with mouthwatering choices like Jebbs open face and huevos rancheros. The monte cisto is a bit pricey and not very satisfying, but the rest of the dishes are delightful. The coffee is absolutely addictive, and it's first-come, first-served, so it's best to come early. Highly recommended for a delicious breakfast outing.

This will be my final visit to this restaurant. I phoned in advance to order a boneless duck, but upon arrival, I was handed a whole duck with unwanted stuffing. The service was extremely poor, with no attempt to make amends. It's unfortunate that their lack of skill taints the quality of the food.

I checked out the nature reserve after reading some reviews, and I was really impressed. The trails were awesome, and I saw lots of animals on the well-marked paths. The bird sanctuary was amazing, and I loved the info center for a little break. The folks working there were super nice and willing to assist. I suggest going in the afternoon for a close-up look at the birds with the caretakers.

This little diner in North Wilmington isn't anything extraordinary, but it really shines as one of the nicer choices in the area. The food is your usual diner grub and the whole experience is pretty average. It's great for a fast and easy meal after swim meets.

We had a great time at this restaurant. The food, service, and decor were all amazing. The manager welcomed us warmly and our server, Christina, was lovely. The beer choices were impressive and the chicken rabe sandwich and pepperoni pizza were scrumptious. The pizza had a delicious "well done" flavor. The only downside was that they didn't have a kids' menu for our fussy 7-year-old. We will definitely come back.

I often go to student salons like the Aveda Institute for haircuts and styling. The outcomes vary because I have different stylists each visit, but the overall experience is good. The haircut might take more time than with an experienced stylist, but the cost covers a nice shampoo, cut, and blow-dry. The students are professional, receptive to feedback, and communicate with their instructors to make sure you are happy with the haircut. In general, it's a fantastic choice for getting quality salon services at an affordable price.
Delicious food and welcoming staff create a wonderful dining experience. Fast service and ample portions. Consider sitting outdoors for an added touch.
I really suggest trying out this restaurant for their scrumptious food, top-notch service, and extensive menu options. The Monte Cristo crepes were absolutely phenomenal - I can't wait to go back!

A calm option to Cafe du Monde, Beignet Oasis provides scrumptious beignets without the extended waits. The serene morning atmosphere on Bourbon St. is a refreshing departure from the usual busy scene. Although the breakfast choices were ordinary, the beignets were truly outstanding. Unfortunately, there was no live music while we were there. All in all, a fantastic spot for a peaceable and delightful beignet outing.

Mixx provides an extensive selection of sushi choices at reasonable prices, making it a great option for a fast and wallet-friendly meal. While it might not offer the highest grade sushi in town, it's a convenient choice for a quick sushi craving.

Terrible and extremely rude customer service. Gave me a price estimate last week that matched other shops, but when I tried to book an appointment, the individual who picked up the phone (Mike or Nick) rejected the quoted price and was disrespectful. Would not allow me to talk to anyone else and abruptly ended the call. Stay away from this establishment at all expenses.

This place doesn't have a customer service department, which results in frustrating experiences when seeking answers or resolving issues. The promises made during the purchasing process were not kept, requiring multiple visits to the dealership and communication gaps. The absence of accountability and follow-through from management is disheartening. Based on my negative encounters, I wouldn't recommend this place to others. A customer service department is crucial to enhancing the overall customer journey.

I love this restaurant! The owners are so kind, and the food is absolutely delicious. My favorite is the bacon pizza. It's awesome that there is a play area for kids to have fun while they wait for their food.
The fried rice at this Asian restaurant is mouthwateringly delicious. The prices are reasonable and the food is outstanding. It's without a doubt one of the top Asian restaurants in town.

Harry's Blue Bell is a real hidden gem in the shopping center, boasting a cozy vibe and an impressive beer selection. The menu is a bit on the smaller side, but the bbq pulled pork and chicken wrap were pretty good. The service was average and the portion sizes were a tad small. It's a good spot for a casual dinner if you happen to be nearby, but not something to go out of your way for. I'd rate it a solid 3 stars.

Kajuns has really stepped up their game by adding smoke eaters, which has made the air so much better for those who are sensitive to cigarette smoke. Even though your clothes might still smell like smoke after leaving, the overall atmosphere inside the bar has gotten a lot better. It's really great to see the staff putting in the effort to make customers happy. Thanks a lot, Kajuns!

My friends took me to Brio's and it was amazing. The free bread and chips, bruschetta, pasta, and salads were all so tasty. The service was outstanding and really made the restaurant special. I totally recommend giving it a try.

My visit to this Tucson place was really disappointing. The food was cold, and the service was rude, making it one of the worst spots in town. They seem to have a good idea, but they just can't seem to get it right.

The thin crust, flavorful tomato sauce, and gooey mozzarella create a mouthwatering combination. The meatballs are a real crowd-pleaser too. The retro decor gives a cozy vibe to the entire dining experience. Gennaro's always serves up fantastic food and ambiance, and I highly suggest giving it a try.

Fantastic ambiance, welcoming barkeep, fully-equipped bar. The Pear Gorgonzola Melt was absolutely delicious. Reasonably priced at about $10. Diverse crowd of all ages and backgrounds. Ideal spot for a sandwich and catching sports matches. Definitely a spot worth checking out.

All in all, the eatery had a fantastic vibe and welcoming staff with fair prices. Nevertheless, the cuisine was somewhat tasteless and not particularly delightful. It did fill us up after a lengthy journey, but it's unlikely we'll pay another visit.
I had a wonderful time at this spot for drinks with such pleasant and welcoming staff. Though I didn't sample the food because of cleanliness worries.

This Greek-owned pancake house serves up a mouthwatering breakfast menu with creative takes on beloved favorites such as Freedom Toast and Freedom Fries. The staff is prompt and welcoming, making it ideal for gatherings. The enthusiastic owner contributes a special flair to the dining outing. Providing a delightful change from big-chain pancake houses, the dishes are scrumptious and prepared with passion.

Even though I used to love going to Fresh, my last visit was really disappointing. The service and the quality of the products were not good, and the prices were just too high. The staff didn't even notice me, and the Vienna Latte I ordered was not only terrible but also really pricey. Sadly, this visit at Fresh was one of the worst experiences I've had there.

In general, the service for a large group was okay but not outstanding. One person did have to wait longer for their food. The lamb kebab plate I got had nicely cooked rice and tasty babaghanoush, but the meat was dry and not very flavorful. The dish looked good. I've had better times at this restaurant before, especially during Ramadan when they have an interesting and varied buffet. I suggest giving it a try during that period, but make sure to go early because it gets busy.
A fantastic spot to visit on a Sunday morning to observe the birds. Welcoming staff and an ideal location for bird lovers.

The food at this established club was delicious, but the service left something to be desired on our visit. Despite savoring a delectable sashimi platter and a juicy burger, we found ourselves needing to repeatedly request essentials like plates, dipping sauce bowls, and napkins. It wasn't until we directly asked that the staff remembered to bring a drink for our child. Our enjoyment was marred by the subpar service, even though we used a Groupon. While we might consider revisiting, it would likely depend on having a different server.

Cuenelli's Peruvian Style Rotisserie Chicken presents a one-of-a-kind and scrumptious interpretation of traditional rotisserie chicken. The chicken is undeniably crafted with care, boasting rich seasoning that permeates each bite and a smoky essence from the charcoal grill. The juicy, expertly seasoned poultry is accompanied by a duo of delectable dipping condiments and paired with sides like flavorful cilantro rice, zesty pinto beans, and perfectly caramelized sweet plantains. Complete your meal with a refreshing Inca cola or chicha limeña for a truly gratifying dining experience. Prepare to reconceptualize your notions of rotisserie chicken—this dish is a must-sample for all culinary enthusiasts.

I had an amazing time at this restaurant, indulging in some meat, bourbon drinks, and a salad. The regular burger was cooked and seasoned just right, hitting the spot even without cheese or bacon. The bartender was super friendly and whipped up some tasty sazeracs to go with my meal. The salad was simple but tasty. Can't wait to come back and taste a more elaborate burger choice. A wonderful spot for a solo birthday celebration.

I stopped by this restaurant for lunch on a Monday and grabbed a seat at the bar. The service was quick and attentive. I decided to try the carne asada taco lunch special, and it was even better than I had hoped for. All in all, I left feeling incredibly pleased with my visit to this spot.
I absolutely recommend these folks. Tony is super helpful and repaired my flat tire for even less than I had anticipated. Amazing service!

I had an awesome time with my hairdresser. She really listened to what I wanted and kept checking in to make sure I was happy with how things were going. I was really happy with how my hair turned out.

The sweet and tangy chicken and chicken chow mein were both amazing, with plentiful pieces of chicken in the chow mein. The sushi was also delightful. Prices are a bit steep, but the quality of the food definitely justifies it.

Dealing with Comcast as a loyal customer was really frustrating. I tried many times to get them to lower my bill, but they only came up with a substantial discount when I mentioned switching to Verizon. It was disappointing how quickly their attitude shifted and left me doubting their dedication to satisfying customers. I'm happy with the service from Verizon and relieved not to have to deal with Comcast's apathy towards their customers anymore.

B's Diner is a delightful find that's truly worth discovering. The inviting ambiance, welcoming staff, and charming decor create a spot that's not to be missed. Its involvement in the community and delectable menu choices make it an obvious choice to show your support. Ideal for a relaxed meal with excellent people-watching chances. Be sure to sample the Elk sausage and perogie poutine!

The food at this restaurant has significantly deteriorated in the last year, with a majority of the buffet options being overly salty. The pulled turkey was chewy, the fish had a strange taste, and the vegetables were cooked too much. The only satisfactory dishes were the corn pudding and mashed potatoes. The desserts were average. The service was commendable, and the attentive staff were the only redeeming quality of the dining experience.

My spouse and I were the sole occupants of the dining area, yet the service we received at this eatery was incredibly sluggish. The delay for our meal and our petite pizzas was excessively lengthy, and the ambience was spoiled by employees' grumbling. To make matters worse, the dishes were merely lukewarm upon arrival. This spot has now earned a place on my do-not-return list.

Fellini's Cafe in Newtown Square is a charming BYOB spot with generous portions at reasonable prices. You definitely won't walk out with an empty stomach! The ambiance is cozy and ideal for a night out, just keep in mind it can get a bit loud. The dishes are tasty despite a few small issues like lukewarm salad plates and slightly frozen peas. The service may vary, but all in all, it's a reliable option for a laid-back Italian dinner. I'll absolutely return for another meal.

The experience at the Catbird Seat left much to be desired, with an uncomfortable entrance and a formal atmosphere. The drinks were just okay, the food unmemorable, and the prices seemed steep for what was provided. While the service was pleasant, overall, it was a letdown dining experience.

Stitch-It really impressed me with my dress in June 2013. They were so accommodating with my rush request and the outcome far surpassed what I expected. The team was so professional, the service was exceptional, and the cost was definitely justified. Maggie O'Neill was my tailor, and she was fantastic. I would absolutely recommend Stitch-It for any tailoring needs.

I had a fantastic time at this place. The team was so skilled and really put me at ease during my Brazilian and blow-out appointments. They were really friendly and kept me laughing the whole time. I'm already looking forward to my next visit! Huge thanks to Jenne for her outstanding job.

If you're in Camden or anywhere in New Jersey, be sure to swing by Santana's for breakfast and pastries. Their coffee is top-notch compared to well-known chains like Starbucks and Dunkin' Donuts, and their pastries are absolutely amazing. It's a definite must-visit spot in the area.

The meal was tasty and reasonably priced, but the escargot was just okay. The ambiance is intriguing, offering the chance to have a meal with a ghost for an added cost. It's a spooky experience in a chilly, dungeon-esque setting.

This chill spot in Philly is dishing out some of the tastiest burgers in the city. The menu is innovative and you can tweak it to your liking, offering flawlessly seared and flavorful burgers made on a flattop grill. The fries, hand-cut and crispy, add the perfect touch of saltiness to complete the ideal burger indulgence. And remember, make sure to snag the SPOT app for awesome rewards and coupons. All in all, this spot is a go-to for burger aficionados.

I absolutely recommend this company for car key replacement! My mechanic sent me their way, and they did a fantastic job with my transponder keys. They were meticulous and made sure that the keys worked on all the doors and the trunk before giving them to me. Their service and attitude were top-notch!

The salon is spotlessly clean and orderly with a warm and welcoming staff. Owner Doug's knowledge and training guarantee exceptional service and innovative techniques. I highly recommend this salon to anyone looking for a hair makeover.

Bab Cafe serves up tasty dishes with a wide selection on their menu. The Dak-Galbi Bibim-bab was really flavorful, and the potstickers made for a great side. Despite the busy lunch crowd, the service was prompt. The only drawback is finding parking downtown. All in all, a wonderful new spot in Reno's dining scene.

If you're searching for a fantastic brunch spot in New Orleans, make sure to check out Mr. B's! The Brandy Milk Punch is a must-have, and the shrimp and grits are incredibly tasty. The atmosphere and the service are excellent too. I highly suggest it!

I really suggest this salon for waxing services. The team is skilled and informative, the ambiance is neat and inviting. I had a wonderful time with Despina who did my armpits, and I will absolutely be back for more services in the future. The prices are fair for the high-quality service offered. Thanks for an amazing experience!

Gus, known as the falafel master, completely lives up to his reputation as the top in town. Although I had to stand in line twice before, I finally had the opportunity to try his amazing food, and it was definitely worth the wait. The charcoal-cooked chicken was juicy and cooked to perfection, and the falafel was scrumptious. The grapes and homemade pasta were a delightful addition to the meal, and the portions were generous enough for two. Gus's use of fresh ingredients and meticulous care make his food truck a must-visit.
SRS is a top-notch management company that is incredibly helpful with specific requests. I highly recommend them.
