Fresco in Tucson is a fantastic spot for tasty and fresh pizza. Affordable prices, warm service, and a dedication to using top-notch ingredients make it a place you shouldn't miss. The meat-special pizza was exceptional with a crunchy crust and plentiful toppings. A top-notch dining experience that is definitely worth revisiting. I highly recommend it!

In general, this eatery was a neat and recently spruced-up spot with fantastic and welcoming service. The grub was scrumptious for grown-ups, though a tad fiery for youngsters and elders. The low lighting made it tough for seniors to peruse the menu. The veggie wings and cactus and sweet potato burritos were exceptional. The guacamole was yummy, but the spicy chips packed a punch. Having the option of margarita pitchers was handy for our big party.

Zaxby's isn't your run-of-the-mill fast-food spot, but their top-notch service and delicious food set them apart. The chicken tenders were succulent and full of flavor, although the Texas toast was a bit too oily. The staff really went the extra mile to make sure everything was just right, giving it that special touch reminiscent of Disney staff. The assortment of sauces was a definite bonus, though having a spicy BBQ and blue cheese choice would have been even better. All in all, it was a great experience with reasonable prices, definitely worth a visit for anyone seeking a unique take on chicken tenders with a southern flair.

I absolutely adore Sugar Coated Bakery. Every baked treat that emerges from their kitchen is truly exceptional, packed with rich flavors and a flawless texture. The intricate decorations on each dessert are outstanding, revealing the care and dedication put into every creation. Their unique flavors are mouthwatering, and their cream cheese frosting is a definite highlight. Indulge yourself and your dear ones with Sugar Coated - you'll be thrilled with the experience!

Even though this store is in a special spot and has interesting items, the terrible service, lengthy waits, and absence of help make it a letdown to shop there. The employees fell short of what was hoped for in wrapping gifts, causing customers such as myself irritation and hassle. While I am fond of their products, I won't come back to this store because of the subpar service I experienced.

The employees at this place are a blend of accommodating and assertive. While some ladies are incredibly helpful, there's one who can be a bit forceful if pushed. It's simple to recognize the contrast and adapt as needed.

Hendricks in St. Louis is a must-visit for barbecue enthusiasts. The meats, sauces, and sides excel beyond those of most barbecue joints. The onion rings are huge, and the coleslaw is wonderfully shredded. The staff is welcoming and quick, although there might be a wait for your food, allowing you to enjoy the distinctive decor.

I was really amazed by the range of food choices available for a late night dinner with my young kids. The individual who took our order was super nice and helpful, but what truly stood out was our waiter Eric and the crew at the grill house station. Eric was so attentive, flexible, and made sure all our needs were taken care of. The folks at the grill house station were so considerate and careful about my allergy. All in all, it was an awesome dining experience that I really wish we had something similar near us in upper PA.

This coffee shop doesn't have a menu and is more aimed at coffee enthusiasts. The vibe is artsy and perfect for observing people, but not the best for studying due to the noise levels. The staff is welcoming and diligent in maintaining table cleanliness. In the end, it wasn't a terrible visit, but it doesn't compel me to return.

I gave Milk and Honey a 5-star rating all thanks to Kyle! He was an exceptional waiter who suggested the delicious honey hot sauce and heavenly biscuits. Make sure to request his service and savor a wonderful meal.

Great location close to 30th Street Station and Drexel University with convenient street parking nearby. The service was decent, and the appetizers like mac and cheese and cheesesteak egg rolls were okay. The chicken pot pie had a good amount of veggies, but needed more chicken. The desserts were generous in size, but the bread pudding and brownie were just average in flavor.

I really enjoyed my time at this bar during a bachelorette party one Saturday night in April. Getting there early is crucial to steer clear of lengthy lines. The live band was amazing and the place had a vibrant vibe with numerous parties going on. The specialty drinks were tasty but a bit expensive. I'd definitely come back for another special event, though I might pass for a regular night out because of the crowds.

This BBQ place serves the most tender ribs I've ever eaten. The pulled pork is fantastic with a wonderful smoky taste. The mac and cheese is rich and delightful. The service was quick and welcoming. The walnut brownie and ice cream dessert was just as satisfying. Overall, it was an amazing discovery and I highly recommend it.

Even though the waitress was nice, my visit to Copabanana during university city restaurant week was awful. The meal was ruined by noisy kids playing soccer near the outdoor seating area. Even after moving inside, the food was disappointing - greasy, overcooked steak and tough chicken. I have no plans to go back. Rated 1 star.

This New Orleans eatery dishes out the most amazing shrimp and grits around. The refreshing juices are just as tasty. My fiance, who's been twice in the last couple of years, still insists it's the best he's ever tasted. Definitely worth a visit!

This little tapas place in Nashville is a real find. The folks there are so nice, and getting to see the chefs at work in the open kitchen really adds to the vibe. Plus, the food is just fantastic. I'm already looking forward to going back and sampling more dishes.

Absolutely delicious seafood with no fancy stuff, just amazing flavors. The sourdough bread was exceptional, and the 80s music gave a cool vintage feel to our meal. Highly suggest it for a scrumptious and fun dining experience.

Dr. Dechant is friendly and builds a strong rapport with his patients. The office is cozy and furnished with state-of-the-art equipment, which enhances the appointment experience. The variety of eyeglass frames is fantastic, and the team is welcoming. In general, I highly suggest this eye care experience.

I had a delightful time at this charming little spot with delicious food. The pear cider beer was absolutely tasty and the service was top-notch. The atmosphere was inviting and the prices were quite fair. I definitely suggest checking it out.

Seasons is a charming restaurant that serves a wide range of scrumptious desserts and updated food options. The shaved ice and boba tea are definitely worth a try, especially the hula and koko loco flavors which are my top picks. The place is neat, welcoming to kids, and offers great service. People also highly praise the quail and chicken wings. All in all, Seasons is a fantastic spot for savoring delightful treats with friends and is definitely worth visiting multiple times. Give it a go and treat yourself to some deliciousness!

Even though the idea behind this cafe is cute, I personally feel that the prices are a bit high for what you receive. It's a charming place to hang out with a friend, but I'd rather have my own coffee made at home. It would be great if they could lower their prices and enhance their offerings.
This place is amazing with 75-cent oysters and scrumptious cheesy grits. It's a fantastic spot for a meal, especially during happy hour.

You've got to check out this restaurant! The natural, tasty, and mouthwatering food comes straight from nearby farmers and fishermen, and a lot of the veggies are harvested right here. The menu has a ton to choose from, but I personally can't get enough of the Carly's breakfast - avocado on sourdough toast with a fried egg and sweet potatoes. I really think you should give this spot a try for a flavorful and fresh meal.

The burgers at this place are absolutely scrumptious, especially the El Mariachi. Despite not being huge, they are packed with flavor that more than compensates. The salted caramel ice cream is a real standout, tasting like it's homemade and top-notch. I suggest giving the rooster sauce a try for an added burst of flavor. In summary, a fantastic dining experience with delectable food choices.

Enjoyed a great late dinner on Sunday night at this sushi place. Was amazed by how tasty and reasonably priced the sushi was - got a plate full for just $13.00. The staff was friendly and appeared to be in good spirits. Looking forward to coming back again. Definitely recommend!

The food at this restaurant always seems to be excessively oily and overly spiced, which left me feeling queasy. Their hoagies were underwhelming, and the buffalo chicken sandwich was drenched in an overwhelming amount of blue cheese and sauce. The desserts were tasteless and didn't justify the cost, while the sodas were frequently past their expiration date and uncarbonated. I wouldn't suggest dining here. They should opt for fresher ingredients and dial back on the grease and seasonings.

In general, the non-smoking room we booked had a scent of smoke and had ashtrays. The shower drained sluggishly and the pillows felt uncomfortable, giving me a headache. On the bright side, the room was tidy, the staff was pleasant, and there was complimentary wifi, even though it wouldn't establish a connection.
The employees at this pharmacy were rather unfriendly and failed to meet the expected prescription collection time. I suggest checking out Walmart next door if you're in a rush.

El Camino is a must-try for seitan enthusiasts, boasting delectable seitan wings and nachos. Although the service may lag at times, a single experience led to a free meal because of the extended wait. The fried pickles fell short, as the coating was coarse and the flavor disappointing. Nevertheless, the seitan offerings and margaritas are compelling reasons to give it another go.

B13 is a fantastic place to get a tattoo. I've gotten two tattoos there and I'm really happy with both of them. The owner managed to squeeze our group in at the last minute with a fantastic design. Amanda does particularly outstanding work, but the whole team there is amazing. I would definitely recommend them.

Our visit to this restaurant on a bustling Friday night was just average. The service was inconsistent, with our server making an effort but falling short. The food was satisfactory, but not compelling enough to entice me back.

Twisted Twig is a definite go-to for those looking for floral arrangements - outstanding service, super friendly staff, and breathtaking arrangements. Jen truly goes the extra mile to make sure your vision becomes reality while sticking to your budget. You'll be thrilled you chose to work with them!

In general, the food at this restaurant was scrumptious with special choices like the Banzai roll. Nevertheless, the service fell short as our waiter was unresponsive and unwelcoming. The seaweed salad, shiomay, and sashimi were all flavorful and delightful. The Banzai roll stood out as a fantastic dish, particularly appealing for those seeking a rice-free option. The dressing on the salad resembled more of a carrot puree. I docked one star because of the unsatisfactory service provided.

I found this awesome brunch spot because of a friend's suggestion. The honeybee crepe and almond croissant were incredibly tasty, I couldn't even take any home. The seating is a bit tight, so come early with your crew. It's ideal for intimate gatherings. Can't wait to go back!
This place is fantastic, serving custom-made donuts that are always served hot and remain tasty even the following day. Definitely a must-visit!
What a lovely and eco-friendly spot! I definitely suggest checking it out. The team is wonderful and the food and coffee are top-notch.

The food was terrible and way too expensive, taking more than 2 hours to arrive. In addition, the customer service was really unpleasant and not helpful when we reached out regarding our order. We won't be ordering from this place again.
Evan is such a great guy and one of the most amazing people I know. He's crucial as the door person at OMALLZ, and I wouldn't go if he wasn't there.

The food at this restaurant was practically disgusting and way too expensive. The burger was bland, the bun was mushy, and the fries were overly salty. Drizzling truffle oil over charred, oily fries didn't justify its $16 cost. We won't be coming back.

I was thrilled to discover a Taiwanese restaurant in Reno, conveniently situated near all the hotels. The boba tea hits the spot, and the genuine Taiwanese cuisine is simply scrumptious, as long as you choose wisely.

Steer clear of this excessively priced mediocrity at any expense. Our family encountered two dreadful dining episodes and "the management" had to reimburse our funds on both occasions. Save your money and give this place a miss.

At first, I thought this place was all about meat, but I was so happy to find out they had a mouthwatering veggie burger and an amazing variety of local microbrews. And when I discovered that they whip up their own ice cream too, I was over the moon! Can't wait to stop by again the next time I'm in St. Louis.

Following the loss of my beloved Indian cuisine chef, Mohammad Butt, I stumbled upon Zaika and was truly delighted. The use of fresh, homemade ingredients and meticulous care put into each dish truly set Zaika apart. The menu is wide-ranging and thoroughly explained, making it effortless to order. The naan is an absolute must for savoring every bit of the delectable sauces. The catering choices are gaining popularity, especially with Ramadan orders in the works. Zaika's commitment to using all HALAL meat bodes well for only positive outcomes. Make sure not to miss out on the divine Ras Malai dessert - it's unbelievably tasty.

Bustling restaurant with top-notch customer service. Impressive gesture of serving special coffee during the wait. Server was attentive to dietary needs and gave fantastic recommendations. Enjoyed a salad, main course, and special grits that were all delectable and reasonably priced for a city-center spot. All in all, I wholeheartedly suggest this restaurant.

Had an awesome time with extremely welcoming staff who are wonderful with kids. The food is incredible, especially the hash browns. Make sure to sample the tomatoes and grits as well. Overall, a fantastic bang for your buck.

The gelato at this spot is amazing, no doubt about it, but the way they treat customers could use some work. A buddy who visited from another city had a similar encounter - the staff during the day were okay, but things felt off with the night crew who were giggling and whispering, making them uneasy. And to top it off, even the younger manager didn’t step in to fix things, instead joining in on the unprofessional conduct. It's disappointing to witness such a drop in service quality at a place that used to provide exceptional service less than a year ago.

In general, this place provides excellent hiking, biking, and running options with well-kept trails and stunning views. There are also shaded spots that are ideal for hiking under the hot sun. However, the primary problem is the disregard for the dogs on leash policy. During my visit, I came across several unleashed dogs wandering away from their owners, which can be worrisome. It's crucial for visitors to respect the rules to preserve the dog-friendly environment of this place for future enjoyment.

After walking past several times, I eventually decided to check out this place and I'm really glad I did. The crab cake appetizer was tasty with a touch of dill in the sauce. The chicken tenders were sizeable servings of hearty, satisfying food. The service was decent, just a bit sluggish because they were short-staffed. The prices were very fair for the delicious food offered. All in all, it was a pleasant meal in a cozy atmosphere. Definitely recommend it!

This sushi restaurant always delivers fantastic service with welcoming staff and incredible food. The fish quality is outstanding and the portion sizes are just right for sampling various rolls. They have frequent promotions that definitely entice customers to return. Without a doubt, our top choice for sushi in the town!

My partner and I visited Jesse's for the first time and we had a pretty good time. The crab stuffed mushrooms were a little funny in terms of size but they tasted good. The French onion soup and Caesar salads were delicious and served at the right times. Our steaks were cooked just right, but I wished my filet had more sautéed mushrooms. Our server, Nikki, was really nice, knew her stuff, and was super friendly. Even with a couple of tiny bumps, we're thinking about going back to Jesse's again.
I had a wonderful time at this store. The staff is really friendly, the selection is great, and the prices are reasonable. I would definitely recommend stopping by.

Even though the atmosphere and service were pleasant, I have no plans to revisit The Praline Connection in New Orleans. The BBQ Oysters, garlic bread, and chicken wings all failed to impress in terms of flavor, temperature, and overall quality. I advise against dining at this establishment.

I am never coming back to this McDonald's spot. The food is always cold or wrong, the service is way too slow, and most of the staff do not speak English. I don't suggest this place unless you have extra time and can speak Spanish.

Fantastic breakfast place just a short walk from our hotel. The crepes topped with fresh fruit were incredibly tasty and definitely a must-have for a repeat visit. The tea had a unique touch of fennel seed that might not be for everyone, but all in all, it was a satisfying dining outing.

I had an amazing time at Holy Mole! I went to a Yelp Elite event and was blown away by the variety and delectable dishes. The unique cocktail was a real standout. The staff was super friendly and really knew their stuff. I'm really excited to go back for a full meal!

I wouldn't suggest going to Dinardo's for a meal. The restaurant looked pretty worn out and the food didn't justify the steep prices. The service wasn't great and the vibe just wasn't up to par. There are way better seafood spots in Philadelphia to check out.

I love treating myself to Starbucks once a week, even though I can't stop thinking about it every day. The baristas here are so nice and the service is super fast. And have you tried their Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate? It's amazing! The breakfast pastries and sandwiches are also delicious, especially the Cranberry-Orange Scone. The drive-thru can get busy, but I usually go inside to order. Definitely a must-visit for coffee enthusiasts!

My spouse and I adored this diner. The ambiance was delightful, the cuisine was scrumptious, and the service was exceptional. The cheese steak was particularly impressive - way superior to Geno's. Our server was truly superb.

Never judge a book by its cover here. JB Dawson's went above and beyond with its friendly atmosphere, attentive staff, and delectable food. The shrimp appetizer had a unique twist, outshining similar dishes elsewhere. The Four Cheese Mac & Cheese and fish tacos were fantastic selections, and the asparagus was prepared flawlessly. The only letdown was the small craft beer selection, but our server Kyle made sure we found drinks we enjoyed. In sum, a wonderful dining experience -- we'll absolutely return.

Loved stopping by this cozy spot for a bite to eat and ended up loving the food. The Greek salad was out of this world, packed with fresh ingredients and just the right amount of seasoning. The vegetarian plate was so tasty and satisfying, offering a mix of flavors that really blew me away. I highly suggest trying this place for a delicious and budget-friendly meal that's a bit off the beaten path.

This cozy pho spot has a devoted following for a good reason - serving up delicious food, using fresh ingredients, and staffed with really friendly folks. I totally suggest checking it out, especially if you enjoy top-notch flavors and genuine experiences.
I really enjoyed the food and atmosphere at this place. The carne asada tacos tasted just like homemade and reminded me of my roots. I highly recommend it!

The beer choices at this spot are great, but the unenthusiastic and unwelcoming bartenders consistently leave us feeling let down. We have chosen to spend our money elsewhere for our meal. We suggest visiting Brickside Grill a couple of miles down the road for fantastic beer, delicious food, and always welcoming service.

My friend and I discovered this place one Monday afternoon. It's an alright spot for drinks and Mexican food, nothing too special. The vibe is pretty casual and has a bit of a college feel, even in the daytime. It's a good option for a laid-back meal, without any high expectations.

Delicious Designs and Leigh Anne went above and beyond with a rushed wedding cake order. The elegant two-tier lemon cake was absolutely perfect, and the chocolate vegan cupcakes for my daughter were a lovely gesture. Not only was the cake stunning, but it was also incredibly tasty. I definitely suggest choosing Delicious Designs for all your bakery needs in Reno.

I've been frequenting Grant Nails for years, but my recent visit was a letdown. Since my favorite technician, Amy, departed, I decided to let the owner, Angela, handle my nails. Regrettably, the gel polish she suggested started chipping the very next day on both occasions. Despite reaching out to address my concerns, the problem persists. Now, my nails are in shambles, and I no longer have faith in their ability to rectify the situation. It's disheartening, but I'll have to search for a new nail salon. A truly upsetting and disappointing situation.
Awful dining experience at Sake House, waited for more than 2 hours and still got lousy service. Do not suggest trying it out.

The only decent aspect of this spot is their impressive stage arrangement. Fabulous lighting, quality sound system, and a spacious dance floor. Nonetheless, the dining service is atrocious. Despite being informed that the kitchen was about to close in 10 minutes, the employees seated and served individuals arriving after me while declining to take my request for a serving of fries. A truly dissatisfying encounter.

Jenna Moore is a hair wizard! After battling to achieve my coveted A-line bob for more than a year, Jenna ultimately pulled it off. She genuinely listened to my wishes, explained her approach clearly, and produced fantastic results. While I understand my hair adventure is ongoing, I have faith in Jenna to guide me towards my hair aspirations. I highly recommend her!

All in all, the food at this restaurant was quick and tasty, especially the meat and guacamole. Nonetheless, the limited taco toppings selection and the thick tortilla chips were a bit disappointing. The dulce de leche soft serve ice cream was scrumptious, but finding a seat was a challenge and the staff could be more efficient at cleaning tables.

CURED nail salon in Nashville is a real gem with fantastic style that reminds you of flipping through a fancy French Restoration Hardware magazine. The fancy nail polish choices, like Chanel, along with the spotless new tools really make it stand out. The service was quick, and getting an extra massage was a nice touch. The vibe is classic and cozy, great for a bridal group or just to hang out with friends. The prices are fair, and it's in a good spot. Definitely a spot to check out in Nashville.  Welcome to the neighborhood!

I've been coming to this spot for years, even after relocating to Colorado. The menu has plenty of amazing choices at affordable prices and with large portions. The Indian Mee Goreng is my top pick and I could devour it daily. Hopefully, one day I can snag the recipe and savor it here in Colorado.
Although the service was decent, I found the pizza I ordered to be underwhelming. I had high hopes given my love for other pizzerias, but unfortunately, it fell short. I don't plan on coming back.

I spent a week at this hotel after Christmas and was pretty bummed out by the poor insulation in the connecting doors. It was tough to get a good night's sleep with all the noise from random conversations, coughs, and other sounds. The staff was great, but Starwood really needs to fix this problem with better insulation. All in all, it was a loud and bothersome stay.

The sandwich I got here was underwhelming. The jalapeño cheese bread tasted bland and was dry, probably stale. The tomatoes and cucumbers were mushy from being too ripe. However, the staff was really friendly. Overall, it wasn't a great experience.
This movie theater/bar/restaurant is fantastic! The drinks are amazing, the service is super friendly, and the food is absolutely delicious. I highly recommend giving it a try!

The iced mocha and iced white chocolate mocha were both quite disappointing, as they seemed to be missing any hint of coffee or chocolate flavor and were extremely diluted. Despite trying to improve them with an extra shot, they were still quite bland and ended up being disposed of. Definitely not worth sipping on.

This shop was fantastic in the past, offering excellent prices, a vast selection of items, and friendly employees. I've had good experiences returning defective or unneeded items for a refund without any problems. However, it seems like the quality has dipped a bit in the last few years, but it's still a pretty good spot to make purchases.

Crescent Park in New Orleans is an absolute hidden treasure with breathtaking city views and a peaceful vibe. The 1.25-mile trail features art displays, a dog-friendly area, and a scenic stroll next to the Mississippi River. Be sure to experience a gorgeous sunset for a flawless conclusion to your NOLA day. I highly suggest this location for anyone seeking a distinctive way to discover the city.

I reached out to United Van Lines for a moving estimate and didn't hear back after the first online assessment. Even after trying to follow up several times, including leaving a voicemail, I never got a response. It felt really unprofessional and made me feel neglected. I wouldn't suggest using their services after my experience.
I really suggest giving their specialty sushi menu a try, especially the Snow Mountain and Volcano rolls. The prices are really great for the amazing quality sushi you receive.

This spot has the most awesome gyros with top-notch food. The chicken gyro is my favorite, but they offer a bunch of tasty choices. Their burgers are fantastic. The steak fries are thick, seasoned just right, and always hot and fresh. The only bummer is the baklava with pistachios.
Incredibly tasty Taiwanese cuisine in Reno. Must-try dishes include 三杯鸡, oyster omelet, and scallion pancake. Wish I could sample more. Going to miss this hidden gem when I depart.

The food was mouthwatering and truly genuine, the atmosphere was spotless and inviting, and the service was exceptional. Although the beer choices weren't vast, it was still a fantastic experience overall and we can't wait to return.

My partner and I had an amazing lunch at this snug wine lounge. The wine choices were diverse and the appetizers were scrumptious. The mozzarella with prosciutto bacon bits sandwich was exceptional. The service was quick and courteous. The ambiance is cozy and charming with a moderate level of noise. Just a heads up about the slightly tricky bathroom door lock. I strongly suggest it for a lunch outing!

Fellinis of Media is my favorite choice for dining out. Offering a variety of dishes to satisfy any taste, friendly staff, and a lovely, calming ambiance, it's the ultimate spot for delicious Italian food. Definitely worth checking out!

This spot is a total game changer for our neighborhood! The takeout we tried was seriously delicious, and I'm totally hooked on their southern Latin cuisine now. The lovely family who runs it are so warm and friendly. It's just what this neighborhood was missing.

Stay away from this nail salon. It's a mess with old newspapers and a dusty fake tree in the waiting area. The nail tech, Jenna, did a bad job on my nails and was argumentative when I asked for repairs. Don't waste your time or money here - it's a dead end. It's in Lehigh Acres.

The bar at this restaurant is awesome, serving up delectable drinks and incredible hummus. But, the breakfast was a letdown with extended wait times, cold food, and a hair in our dish. The manager did cover our bill, but honestly, I'd suggest passing on breakfast here.

I love coming to this theater because it's so clean and the staff is super friendly. However, I can't help but notice that it doesn't quite measure up to other theaters that have fancy new seats, wait staff, and extra perks. Even though the prices are about the same, the fact that this theater hasn't been upgraded much is kind of a letdown. It might be a good idea to check out other theaters that offer more for the same price.

In general, I'd rate this restaurant 4 to 5 stars after my initial experience. Definitely recommended for Thai cuisine enthusiasts. The shrimp spring rolls were outstanding, and the tom yum soup was quite tasty, though I have a personal preference for other types of mushrooms. The Pad Thai and Drunken Noodles were really flavorful, even though the serving sizes were a tad smaller compared to other spots in Reno. The owner was really welcoming and attentive, and I found the details about their cooking classes to be interesting. The final check was quite fair, especially with a discount included. I'm looking forward to coming back again.

Kingsway mall features a diverse selection of stores such as lululemon, Jacob, Danier, and many more minus the busy atmosphere of other malls. The dining options are superb with New York Fries, Orange Julius, and other tempting selections. The food court provides ample seating, and the mall includes Zellers, a dollar store, and Sears. While it's an excellent place for shopping and dining, adding a Bay and a movie theatre would enhance its appeal. In conclusion, Kingsway is a convenient and pleasant shopping spot.

The rice at Indias Kitchen was tasty, but the goat curry left much to be desired with an overpowering salt and tomato flavor in the sauce and chewy meat. The naan bread was also not up to par. For a more satisfying Indian dining experience in St. Louis, consider Spice and Grill instead.

In general, the food at this restaurant was definitely worth the slightly higher cost. The service, after receiving your menu, is attentive and the food arrives promptly. The crab cake and chopped salad were both delightful. Yet, being seated in the bar section with limited table space may be a downside. It's important to be aware of possible problems with erroneous charges on your card.

Being a sushi enthusiast, I was truly let down by my visit to this restaurant. Having warm sushi is a dealbreaker for me. On top of that, the side salad, priced at $3, was simply plain iceberg lettuce. I have no intention of going back. This place has lost its chance with me.

My significant other and I enjoyed the vegetarian platter together and we were really content. The food was scrumptious, the staff was incredibly friendly and attentive. They were great in assisting us with our order and we didn't feel like they were trying to deceive us. We will absolutely come back again.

The hotel had a wonderful ambiance and appeared elegant, but the staff fell short. My friend reserved a suite for a bachelorette party, but ended up with two separate rooms. We had to plead for them to be adjacent. They attempted to compensate by providing complimentary valet, however, her car was vandalized the next day. In conclusion, it was a displeasing and unprofessional encounter.
I absolutely suggest this place for a scrumptious and welcoming experience. The staff is incredibly friendly and the tamales are delightful. Exceptional service and strongly recommended.

After our recent visit, I wouldn't suggest trying out this restaurant. The service dragged, and we had to wait 50 minutes for our food, which was just mediocre. The atmosphere was ruined by rowdy and offensive conduct at the bar, making us feel uneasy. All in all, subpar management and uninspiring food quality make me question the future of this place.

I had a great time at this restaurant and will absolutely return. The vegetarian choices were a bonus and the food was fantastic, especially the duck and rice vermicelli soup. The beef pho didn't quite hit the mark for me because of the meat quality, but I'll give another dish a go next visit. The portions were generous and the service was prompt and attentive. The decor was a bit old-fashioned, but the cleanliness of the restaurant balanced it out. A wonderful dining choice for a delicious meal.

Chickie's and Pete's is a bustling sports bar with ample seating and a fantastic ambiance for game-watching. The DJ booth up high enhances the vibe, spinning tunes tailored for Eagles supporters. Nonetheless, the celebrated crab fries disappointed with overly thick cheese and lukewarm fries. But, the towering beer selections and lively crowd create an enjoyable setting to cheer on a game. Giving it a rating of 3.5 stars.

The Pancake Pantry in Nashville is a definite must-visit for its scrumptious pancakes and the opportunity to possibly mingle with country stars. Despite the lengthy wait times, the overall experience is well worth it for a delectable breakfast and engaging discussions. It's truly one of the best things to do in Nashville.

I've been a dedicated patron of Magasin Cafe for years, but I've been frequenting Magasin Kitchen since the Cafe closed for renovations. The food and service at Kitchen were impressive, with even the pho tasting more flavorful. However, the increased prices and less inviting atmosphere do impact my overall assessment. Nonetheless, I intend to remain a loyal customer because of the top-notch food and service.

I absolutely love going to this restaurant whenever I get the chance. The cumin-style lamb is a top pick for me, but honestly, all their dishes are just so tasty. The rabbit appetizer is a real standout. Some folks might argue about how authentic it is, but in my opinion, the food here is totally worth it. I highly suggest giving it a try.

The Kmart visit feels lackluster, with bright lights and not much variety. Movies are too expensive and the vibe they try to create just doesn't quite make it. On the bright side, you can snag some awesome deals on outdoor furniture during clearance events. The pharmacy is quick and easy to use. While Kmart might not be everyone's top choice these days, it does have some good things going for it.

The Tuck Special at this Nashville spot is definitely worth a visit from out of town. The mix of brisket, egg, and pimento cheese is mouthwateringly good. My husband didn't love the BBQ sauce, but the meat was really flavorful. Be prepared for a busy scene, but if you're willing to wait and strategize your order, it's absolutely worth it.

The restaurant had a bad smell, and the service was disappointing. When my daughter and I picked up our meals, they were combined in one container, resulting in a mix-up. The spicy tuna roll I had was just average, but my daughter liked her food. After this experience, we have decided not to visit this sushi place again.

I absolutely adore the food at this restaurant. The servings are really big and the menu always has something new, which keeps it exciting. But the limited space and noisy atmosphere can make it tough to have a good chat. Also, the coffee doesn't quite compare to Sabrina's. However, the latkas and bacon are truly outstanding and definitely worth a return visit.

Yellow Subs in Reno is a definite go-to for anyone who enjoys subs and delicious food. The sprouts on the sub really set it apart and the vibe is inviting and genuine. The service is quick and the team is consistently cheerful. The seating arrangement fosters interaction and the casual tank tops and t-shirts add a nice touch. I will absolutely be back. 5 stars across the board.

I really enjoyed my meal at this restaurant. Tina, our server, was so nice and the food was delicious for my first try. The only bummer was the long wait at the start, but all in all, I had a great time and would definitely come back. 3.5 out of 5 stars.

I absolutely adore this new neighborhood hangout! The vibe is so inviting, the food is absolutely scrumptious, and the drinks are top-notch. The salsa is just incredibly yummy and the salads are so generous. It's the ideal place to chill with pals, especially on the outdoor deck with a margarita. I can't recommend it enough!

All in all, the service was excellent but the food was mediocre. The soups were not served hot enough and my steak was overdone, even though I asked for it medium. The outstanding service did make up for these flaws.

In general, I felt a bit let down by my visit to Nippon Tei despite its good reviews. Getting complimentary edamame was a pleasant surprise, however, the mango sake cocktail didn't quite measure up for the cost. The sushi rolls were flavorful, yet I've had tastier ones that weren't as messy. The costs were standard, but I prefer other places for sushi. I might consider revisiting in the future.

Watching Star Wars Rogue One in 3D at this theater was quite disappointing because the screen was excessively dark. Even though several viewers raised concerns, the manager chose to ignore the problem and didn't make any effort to fix it. It was a letdown, and I won't be coming back for 3D viewings at this place.

The restaurant served mediocre food that was lukewarm instead of hot, and the prices were overpriced. The servers appeared rushed and struggled to pronounce the dishes. The overall atmosphere didn't align with the prices on the menu. The food and service were unsatisfactory, making it not worth the expensive prices.

The setup inside the restaurant was cool, but the expensive and lackluster food left us feeling let down. The Sunday brunch choices didn't really give bang for the buck, only the chicken tenders and fries were passable. The salad was pitifully tiny and skimpy on lettuce, for the high cost it was laughable. The chicken was alright, nothing remarkable, kinda like what you'd get at Raising Canes. The wait staff took their own sweet time, and it wasn't even busy. All in all, we regret not taking heed of other folks' reviews and picking somewhere else to eat.

I'm not someone who typically goes for vegetarian or health-conscious options, but this spot completely won me over. A colleague brought me here, and now I can't get enough. The salads are beyond tasty, and the vibe is so inviting. I definitely suggest giving it a try.

Had a truly awful time at Regis Hair salon. Angie completely ruined my hair, even after I showed her pictures of the style I wanted. Walked out with a haircut that was a total disaster and not at all what I asked for. Would advise against going to this salon. Thanks a lot, Angie, for the awful experience.

This restaurant is the ideal spot for a lovely date night. The sweet potato nachos and "breakfast" dish were incredibly delicious. Every item we tried was exceptional, and I am excited to return soon. I highly recommend it!

We had an amazing meal at Convivio, even though there were a few small hiccups with the service and the wine running out because it's a new restaurant. The owner was super nice, and the food was fantastic, particularly the tortelloni pansotti, which was the most delicious pasta I've ever tasted. We'll definitely be coming back again.

Crabby Bill's was a handy pick for a speedy seafood bite in Clearwater Beach. The $25 bucket of steamed seafood was alright, but not the freshest. It did the job as a fulfilling snack before heading to Bern's Steak House for dinner. A decent choice for a spontaneous meal in the vicinity.

The Grilled Chicken, Spinach, Swiss and Honey Mustard Sub with Jalapeno Chips from State Street Kitchen was absolutely delicious and so satisfying, especially on a chilly fall day. The place always offers amazing dishes with a little touch of Korean influence, thanks to the lovely Micha and her wonderful team. Definitely drop by to enjoy the cozy vibes and mouth-watering homemade flavors - you won't regret it!

This place is incredible! The food is mouthwatering, the staff is welcoming, and they offer changing specials that are all made from scratch. You absolutely have to try the chicken salad if you're making sandwiches at home. What more could you ask for?

The service at this place was really disappointing. The person who took my order was so rude and unprofessional, which made me feel really unwelcome. Even though the food was good, the bad service experience just ruined it all. I don't think I'll be coming back because I did not feel welcomed or respected by the staff member, Neisha.
The employees at this place are always friendly and effective. Appointments go by fast and waiting times are short, resulting in a seamless and pleasant experience.

Although we liked the drinks and vibe, we were really let down by the food at this place. The Brussel sprouts and fries were way too salty, even after we asked for them to be fixed. The burger and flank steak were just average, nothing special. It looks like the chef might have gone overboard with salt that day. All in all, we won't be coming back here.

I really enjoy attending Phillies games at this stadium. The spacious layout and diverse food choices really enhance the overall experience. Even when it's packed, it never feels overcrowded. The amenities are consistently well-maintained and the seating is comfortable, except for the ones situated beneath the scoreboard. Excited for the upcoming baseball season! Let's go, Phillies!

My partner and I popped in for lunch and the time we had varied. The beans, chips and salsa, and guacamole were scrumptious, but the sizes were kinda small. The salsa was zesty and had a hint of cilantro, and the guacamole was lumpy and freshly made. Sadly, you don't get free chips and salsa with your order. My partner wasn't a fan of his steak tacos; he thought the meat wasn't great and lacked flavor. He's up for another shot, but personally, I had a pretty good meal.

Plaza Deli in La Cumbre Plaza is a must-visit for delectable sandwiches crafted with fresh ingredients and fantastic bread rolls. Being a Santa Barbara local, I've been a regular here for years and have always had a delightful experience. The variety of sodas is also impressive. Even though they might not offer upscale or uncommon choices, Plaza Deli is the ideal place for a fulfilling meal. I wholeheartedly suggest paying them a visit for a quick bite!

I was blown away by the fantastic selection of top-notch shoes and superb customer service at Nordstrom's shoe department. Erwin, the salesperson, really went the extra mile to find and match prices for shoes from different stores, even throwing in free shipping. Nordstrom's has definitely won me over with their outstanding service.

The quaint aquarium in Tarpon Springs is designed with children in mind, featuring exciting activities such as a captivating shark feeding display and the opportunity to interact with gentle stingrays. While it may not be the most thrilling option for grown-ups, it's a delightful experience for little ones. In general, it's a decent outing.

If you're in the mood for some basic Chinese takeout, this spot is tops. The dishes aren't anything out of this world, but they're less oily compared to elsewhere, and the crew is super welcoming. Perfect for a fast and fulfilling bite.

I had an amazing time at this charming restaurant. The Shrimp Po Boy was mouthwatering, and the fries and cole slaw were just the right sides. The atmosphere, food, and service were all fantastic. Looking forward to coming back soon!

Broussard's offered a pleasant experience with flavorful dishes and a picturesque courtyard. The nostalgic charm of the entrance is delightful, although the dining area might benefit from some renovations. The staff was attentive and the food was satisfying, yet the overall atmosphere was somewhat lacking. I suggest visiting for a special event or to immerse yourself in the traditional New Orleans atmosphere, but it might not become a go-to dining spot for all. I rate it 3 stars.

Outstanding service, inviting ambiance, and incredible raw bar make this restaurant a must-visit. The Alaskan crab legs are a definite highlight, but some main dishes may be on the expensive side. Opt for drinks, starters, and burgers for a thoroughly enjoyable time. In general, a reliable option for a laid-back yet upscale dining experience.
Doan's is an amazing place where you can always expect reliable and scrumptious meals. The staff is welcoming and quick, making it ideal for a speedy lunch. I highly recommend it!

This brick oven pizza place never fails to amaze each time I go. The Rotolo, a dough wrapped mortadella and ricotta cheese topped with pistachios, is a must-have at $5. The prosciutto pizza is amazingly delicious, and the dough is heavenly. Excellent service and a nice variety of beers make it one of the top pizza spots in Philly.

This pizza is a total game-changer. It's just what I've been looking for since I moved to Indianapolis. The thick, chewy, cheesy, greasy slices are every pizza lover's dream. It was like I was Oprah Winfrey giving away cars after that first bite. This place is definitely my new favorite pizza spot.
Really slow service at this tea shop in Chinatown. Waited almost half an hour for three teas with no other customers in sight. Not worth the wait for any tea.

I was raised on beef sandwiches in Chicago, and this spot serves the tastiest beef I've ever had outside the city. If I could add, maybe having a bigger sandwich size, some sweet peppers, fries on the menu, keeping the main location open year-round, and extending the hours of operation would make it even better.

Buff Nail Salon really went all out for our Mothers Day celebration. They were so kind and made sure to fit in our group of 4 for pedicures by bringing in an extra pro. The place looked super sleek and tidy, making it a chill spot. Plus, they hooked us up with some free mimosas, wine, and champagne which was a nice surprise. The crew was super chill and knew their stuff, and my nails didn't even chip. The only drag was finding street parking, but all in all, I say, check out Buff Nail Salon for yourself—I'm definitely going back.

Pho 51 in Philly is a must-try for pho lovers! The broth is amazing and the portion size is generous. I got the No. 51 (small) and it was really satisfying. I'll definitely be going back next time I'm in town.

This place is a special mix of café and bar, providing a diverse selection of coffees, teas, breakfast items, along with bar snacks, salads, and sandwiches. The assortment of beers offered on tap, bottled, or in cans is also remarkable. The laid-back vibe and pet-welcoming approach make it an excellent spot to chill with friends for hours. It's like a throwback to college days and ideal for a leisurely Sunday Funday.

The experience of upgrading our rental car at Avis Rent A Car went smoothly and the staff were very professional, but the total expense turned out to be rather steep at $800 for a five-day rental. Although satisfied with the vehicle, discovering that a weekly rate would have been more economical, in addition to the pricey upgrade, was disheartening. Moving forward, I plan to explore rental options from other companies like Hertz or Dollar, and reconsider the necessity of extra insurance.

I just bought a pre-owned car from this dealership and it was an amazing experience. The service was exceptional and I am so happy with my new car. I definitely suggest this place to anyone looking for a dependable used car. Talk to Andy - he was really helpful and knew his stuff.

Jungle Prada Tavern turned out to be a delightful find for me since I relocated to the vicinity. The bartender suggested a fantastic beer, and I was thoroughly impressed by the seafood selections. The scallops prosciutto, del mar pizza, and crab stuffed portabella were all mouthwatering. I also relished the roasted portabella appetizer as a scrumptious vegetarian choice. I've revisited numerous times solely for the food and drinks, and even took my sister, who loves seafood, and she, too, was pleased. Don't miss out on this place -- you'll be thrilled with the offerings!
This bead shop in Nashville is a hidden gem with a vast array of seed beads and glass strands. It's ideal for all your beading endeavors and a beloved hangout for bead lovers.

I checked out this restaurant on its opening day and had an amazing time. The vibe was awesome, the team was super friendly, and the food was top-notch. The green tea was so refreshing, the summer rolls with spicy peanut sauce were mouthwatering, and the pho was just outstanding. I'm planning on coming back here regularly as I discover Fairmount. I totally suggest giving it a go!

Don't let the old-fashioned look fool you, this quaint diner serves up tasty, comforting family dishes that'll whisk you away to the past. It might not be the most exquisite cuisine you've experienced, but it's just right for anyone yearning for homely grandma-style cooking. Indulge in their fluffy pancakes and hearty bacon for a breakfast treat. Offering fair prices and welcoming hospitality, this spot is an excellent choice for a satisfying homemade meal.

Based on the suggestions of our friends, we opted to give this place a shot. Sadly, we were let down when we discovered they were offering only a limited menu just an hour before closing time, a detail not clearly communicated on their website. The server had a tough time grasping simple changes to my order, and the service on the whole was lacking. The food seemed too expensive considering its quality. Unless there's a compelling reason to revisit, we don't plan on going back.

This restaurant always manages to amaze us with its delightful and distinct dishes. The butternut squash and goat cheese Rangoons and mushroom yakisoba were both fantastic, with fantastic flavor and a satisfying meaty texture despite being meat-free. The coconut curry ramen was absolutely divine. The only negative aspect was the limited seating availability while waiting, but the speedy service ensured we arrived at our show on time with content and happy stomachs. I highly recommend it!

The beer options at this spot are decent but not exceptional, especially for someone with pals who brew for a living. The setting has an industrial vibe and lacks ambiance, but they do offer discounted beer when a train goes by. The place has a dedicated following, resulting in a rating of 3.5 stars.

My time at the salon was a bit of a mixed bag. The first time I went for a "Mini Manicure," it was amazing - top-notch service, super friendly staff, and my nails lasted a long time. But my next visit, for a gel French manicure, didn't measure up. The technician didn't have the right tools, which led to crooked lines, varying thickness, and weird shaping. The appointment dragged on longer than I thought, making me late for work. While I do appreciate the effort, the final result didn't meet my expectations, especially for the steep price I paid. Now, I'm torn about whether to give this salon another try since my first experience was great. I'm now stuck deciding between keeping subpar nails or shelling out more money to get them redone elsewhere before an early flight on Wednesday.

If you're seeking a hidden gem away from the usual tourist spots, this Marigny restaurant is definitely worth checking out. While it may not be flawless, the affordable and mouthwatering food more than compensates for any shortcomings. The all-day breakfast offering is an added delight, featuring unique dishes such as lox omelets for less than $10. The menu also caters to vegetarians and vegans, although there might be a need for some clarification regarding the presence of cheese in those options. Noteworthy dishes include the french fry poboy, mac 'n cheese sandwiches, and BBQ chicken legs. With each main course priced under $10 and $5 Bloody Mary's on offer, it's difficult to come up with a reason to pass up on the chance to dine at this budget-friendly and flavorful establishment.
The sangria is fantastic and the ever-changing craft beers are a great addition. The pizza and calzones are mouthwatering and always keep me coming back for more.

This bar really centers around alcohol and acts as a casino bar, which results in higher than usual prices. The drinks they offer are great and expertly crafted, but the food choices are scarce and ended up giving me a stomach ache. The service isn't the greatest, making it hard to get servers' attention for orders. All in all, there are superior alternatives in Reno worth considering.

The employees at this place were really impolite and lacking in professionalism when I asked about availability during the Thanksgiving holiday. They were abrupt and basically brushed me off before ending the call. I'll be going somewhere else for my needs because of this unpleasant encounter.

I went to this restaurant with a gift card and was pleasantly surprised by the tasty food. I ordered the sauteed stir-fry over spinach, and my girlfriend devoured the generous serving of nachos. The menu offers a nice selection of dishes, and the bartender during the day was very welcoming. I would suggest this spot to anyone who wants a welcoming vibe with good food in a sports bar. Plus, they show sports on the TVs, which adds to the fun!

I had a really bad experience with this pizza place. The pizza came cold and soggy after a 2-hour wait, and there was no communication about the delay. Even though they said I would get a refund, they still charged me the next day. The employees were rude and unprofessional. I highly recommend not ordering from here. I won't be ordering from here again and I suggest you don't either.

Fantastic service, amazing food, and lovely atmosphere! The black bean ravioli and bone-in steak were both exceptional. The staff truly made us feel welcome and comfortable. I highly suggest it for a group outing or a special night out.

Timeout Pub and Grill shows promise, but misses the mark in crafting a distinctive and captivating vibe. The absence of genuine sports paraphernalia and emphasis on music over live sports games takes away from the overall ambiance. The food and drinks are typical for a sports establishment, yet the absence of extra entertainment choices might disappoint patrons. While the Happy Hour deals could attract some customers, trying to stand out against well-known sports bars nearby might present difficulties.
The onion rings at this place are seriously top-notch. The Reuben was also really delicious. Definitely recommend it to anyone who loves onion rings.

This coffee shop in Boise is so charming and welcoming, and their coffee is absolutely fantastic. The staff is incredibly warm and hospitable, making it a must-visit spot for coffee enthusiasts. I highly recommend it!

Even though our friends highly recommended it, our visit to this place turned out to be a letdown. Despite the sign indicating they were open until 11pm, we were unexpectedly told they couldn't serve us at 8pm. The uncomfortable situation and poor communication really soured our overall experience, making us hesitant about revisiting.

I really suggest checking out this place! The food is so fresh and tasty, especially the papaya salad and curry. The service is fantastic and they have take-out choices too. A definite must-try for anyone who loves good food!

Music City Dental, especially the team led by Dr. Spurlin, went above and beyond for me. They were kind, caring, and ensured I was at ease during my visit. Even though I'm usually scared of injections, I hardly noticed when Dr. Spurlin gave me mine. The availability of a cozy pillow, warm blanket, and various entertainment selections added to the enjoyable visit. I feel assured that Music City Dental is the right fit for me as my long-term dentist.

The food at this Chinese restaurant was quite enjoyable, especially the shrimp spring rolls which were outstanding. However, the beef noodles were too salty and the fried rice was a tad oily. The disorganized seating situation, with the owner seating others before us despite our reminders, led us to rate it three stars. In general, it was a decent dining experience with a few hiccups.

Burger Up exudes a fantastic community feel with amiable staff and an inviting ambiance. The traditional burger is mouthwatering with distinct, homemade components. The bar serves up an array of beverages, including inventive mixes. Criticisms suggesting it's 'too hipster' are baseless, and personal assaults on the owner are unnecessary. In conclusion, it's a wonderful establishment with a diverse and inclusive group of employees.

Even if you're not big on Indian cuisine, this spot is definitely worth checking out. Let Hassan pick a dish for you and be sure to sample the chaat and lassi, they go amazingly well together. Don't stress over the menu choices, just go with the suggestions and you'll be glad you did.

In general, Mr. B serves up amazing food in a fantastic spot. The shrimp and grits and barbecued shrimp were exceptional, while the appetizers were tasty. That said, the bread pudding was somewhat dry. The service could have been more attentive, and it was uncomfortably chilly in the restaurant. It might be a good idea to bring a jacket when you stop by.

My spouse and I had an amazing time aboard the Steamboat Natchez in New Orleans. The journey was educational and fun, and the team was super organized and friendly. Big shoutout to JoJo for securing us a wonderful window spot. Definitely suggest checking out this tour!

The bar in New Orleans seems to have a great concept, but it's struggling because they frequently run out of key ingredients and their bartenders are unpleasant. It's almost funny how often they're out of things and how many customers they have to turn away. With several taps not functioning and only a few drink choices available, it's a missed chance for what could have been a thriving business.

Our time at Mr. B's was a bit of a mixed bag. The bar had a good buzz and was quite pleasant, and the BBQ shrimp really stole the show. However, the service at our table was a bit inconsistent, with some long delays in getting our drinks and feeling like we were overlooked for over 45 minutes. The wood plank grilled fish left something to be desired in both portion size and value. The rabbit dish was tasty, but in the end, the lack of consistency in service really dampened the whole experience.

This charming little place with a cozy and inviting atmosphere serves a variety of Vietnamese and other dishes, like tasty banh mi and boba tea. The employees are welcoming, and the establishment is well-maintained. The loyalty card for a complimentary tenth beverage and convenient operating hours make it an ideal spot to revisit.
Had a bummer of a time at Walgreens because they didn't have the new ELF Villain's collection. Gonna have to check out some other spots to track it down. Major letdown.

I absolutely loved the amazing Italian cuisine at this cozy, upscale eatery. The main dishes were mouthwatering, and the cheesecake was absolutely delightful. The staff was so warm and welcoming. I definitely suggest it for a romantic evening out.

I adore indulging in fish tacos at this spot, they're fantastic and only cost $2.60 each. My buddy sampled the beef taco and chicken fajitas and found them decent, but concurred that the fish tacos were unparalleled. The ambiance indoors and on the patio is delightful, and there's a Ben and Jerry's nearby for a sweet treat. Overall, it's always a joyous experience when I come here!

I had a fantastic time getting my dive watch battery replaced here. The service was quick, welcoming, and the price was very fair. With plenty of staff available and a convenient location, I was in and out in less than 5 minutes. Highly suggest!

I visited the place last week after spotting it on Trip Advisor. The setting was lovely and serene, nestled under the cool shade of ancient trees. A bit unexpected to find just one table available on a Thursday noon. Food was served promptly without any delays. Personally, the buffalo burger was outstanding, probably one of the tastiest I've had. On the other hand, the tri-tip sandwich was somewhat disappointing, a bit dry with plain meat on bread. My husband couldn't help but envy my burger. It's worth a visit for its unique ambiance and tranquil surroundings. I rate the buffalo burger a solid 5++, while the tri-tip sandwich gets a 3 from me and a 4 from my husband.

The Mad Mex University City spot is a great place for Happy Hour with fantastic discounts on margaritas and wings. The food is decent, but my friends really liked their burritos, guacamole, and enchiladas. The staff could be better trained in handling busy times and large crowds, but it's a nice spot overall if the service improves.

I took my boyfriend to Yuengling for a tour and beer sampling on a Saturday and we were pleasantly surprised by how nearby it was. It's essential to check tour times on their website before heading over. Despite the requirement for closed toe shoes, many folks were sporting flip flops. Since there's no production on Saturdays, the brewery was peaceful. The 40-minute tour was educational, kicking off with a video on the history of Yuengling. The guide was well-informed and led us through the brewery, lab, and tasting room. Our complimentary beer tasting featured their Lager, Premium Lager, and Black and Tan. Unfortunately, they had run out of Lord Chesterfield. Overall, it was a fantastic experience that I look forward to repeating with my parents.

All in all, my visit to this Marathon spot was incredibly underwhelming. The server's sense of urgency and eagerness to hurry us along during our meal created an uneasy atmosphere. Moreover, the dishes were quite mediocre. I received far superior food and service at their branch on 18th and Spruce. I wouldn't suggest this location.

We showed up for lunch during a quiet time on a Friday, but the service was very sluggish. We had to keep mentioning to get our drinks and were told 40 minutes later that the beer we wanted was out of stock. The food was tasty, but the extended wait and slow service dimmed the overall experience.

Spontaneous visit to this organic beer and burger joint was a delightful find. The customizable burger choices and ever-changing beer lineup were fantastic. Welcoming staff and warm atmosphere. Vegetarian choices offered. Don't forget to add sides such as fries to your burger.

My time at Earl's new American Kitchen was pretty underwhelming. The food was alright, but the service left a lot to be desired on both occasions. The first time was passable, but the bartender wasn't very attentive. During the second visit, the bartender was downright rude, and I have no intention of returning or suggesting this restaurant to others.

Jake's serves mouthwatering burgers with a diverse selection of complimentary toppings. The atmosphere might not be remarkable, but the delectable burgers make it worthwhile. They are juicy and bursting with flavor, though the fries were somewhat underwhelming. In summary, it's definitely worth stopping by for the burgers, but the original branch might offer a more satisfying overall experience.

Terrible service at this shop on Broad Street. Even though they work on cars, the staff wouldn't give me a jump when my car needed it. They didn't seem to care about the customers and had an unhelpful attitude. Overall, the experience was very disappointing.

The Pulled Pork Nachos were incredibly tasty! Instead of tortilla chips, they come with crunchy potato chips that paired beautifully with the flavorful pulled pork. They make for a great snack to share with a cold beer or Bloody Mary. I would definitely recommend them, a solid 10/10.

In general, this hotel is charming, conveniently situated close to the beach and wharf, and provides tidy rooms with lovely perks like a fireplace and wine and cheese at 5. The staff is welcoming and accommodating, and the cost is fair. Although there might be a bit of noise from the nearby spa, it's not a big problem. The only drawback is that the room can feel a little stuffy, but cracking open the windows can fix that easily. Definitely thinking about coming back here.

I definitely suggest checking out Mirna's for flavorful and generously sized pasta dishes that are worth the price. The complimentary hummus and pita starter is a delightful addition. Make sure to call ahead to secure a table as the restaurant is quite small.

While I usually like supporting local eateries, I was let down by the pricey downtown Philly restaurant. The place was bigger than I thought, but the costs were way above what was listed online. The dishes were decent, but nothing special, except for the intriguing dessert. The service felt a bit chaotic, with the busser possibly pushing us to leave before we were done. Also, the restroom was surprisingly tiny given the restaurant's size.

Platoon is a fantastic gym with an outstanding trainer in Steve C. The personalized workouts really boosted my progress and kept me driven, encouraging me to attend 3-5 days a week. Steve is an incredible listener and motivator who sets achievable goals. The team is welcoming and flexible, and I never encountered any problems with payments or appointments. I strongly recommend Platoon and Steve C as a trainer.

The grub at this spot was alright, with tasty Tater-Tots and a solid burger. It was a swift lunch break and the folks were friendly in giving tips on nearby sights. All in all, nothing too remarkable or unforgettable about the visit.

I've been a customer here for a while, but my last visit made me change my opinion about this place. The person at the cash register wouldn't let us use a $5 discount coupon for our group of three, which included an older person, saying we couldn't use it with the senior discount. This rule doesn't make sense and makes the managers look bad, not the workers. I'm really let down.

Our trip to SuperGyro was amazing! The Chicago dogs were absolutely delicious and they're the only spot within a 28-mile radius where you can snag them. Just wish they had a poppyseed bun and some celery salt to top it off. Those hot dogs were crafted with 100% beef, and loaded up with neon green relish, sport peppers, onions, dill pickle, tomatoes, and mustard. Can't wait to head back and taste more of what they have to offer. In conclusion, it was a fantastic outing and a refreshing departure from typical fast food joints like Sonic.

Wawa is my favorite convenience store for delicious sandwiches and all my snacking essentials. While this specific spot may not be as welcoming as others, it still shines as a guiding light in a chilly, harsh world.

My father and I discovered this bar on Bourbon Street and were pleasantly impressed by the tasty hand grenades. It was a bit pricey at $9, but the souvenir cup made it a worthwhile purchase as we were definitely feeling the impact afterward. The vibe was energetic with a live band performing and lots of fresh air flowing in. We had a blast, soaking up the pleasant weather and singing along with the band. A fantastic spot near Jackson Square for a quality drink and a fun time.

My first time here was just okay because the staff seemed a bit unfriendly, but my return visit completely changed my mind. The lady who helped me was super helpful, knew her stuff, and really went out of her way to make sure I had a good time. The store is tidy and has lots of shipping stuff in stock. Even though the staff isn’t the most talkative, they really do give great service. I'll be coming back here for all my shipping needs for sure. I highly recommend it. 5 stars.

The chicken BBQ burritos were absolutely delicious and loaded with all my favorite ingredients. The restaurant is a fantastic spot to unwind with family over a meal. It'd be awesome if they had a special space for kids to play, that would really enhance the dining experience.

This cafe is great for grabbing a quick Chai or coffee. The service is quick, the Chai is delicious, and there are plenty of coffee options to choose from. A wonderful choice for those who need a caffeine fix on the move. And don't forget to grab some coffee beans to enjoy at home! A day just wouldn't be complete without a visit to Starbucks.

In general, this new startup company looks promising despite some impatience from customers in the gun community. The owner, Jacob, appears to be a trustworthy individual who follows through on his commitments. The Cerakoted billet lower I bought at a gun show in Las Vegas displayed excellent machining and finish. Correspondence with the owner via email was prompt and helpful. Maintaining patience is essential when interacting with this company.

I really loved the menu and food at this place. The fruit bruschetta was a tasty and innovative pick, and the Popeye skillet and Roadhouse sandwich were mouthwatering. A few things that could be better are the temperature (it was so cold inside) and the lack of atmosphere. Adding some music and improving the lighting could really make the dining experience better. The customer service was decent but a bit distant, probably because of the holiday weekend. All in all, a great spot and I'll definitely return!

I had an amazing time getting a fill and gel pedicure at this nail salon. Even though it was nearing closing time, the team really took their time and fulfilled all of my specific requests. The place was spotless, the staff was so welcoming, and the hand and foot massages were pure bliss. I'll definitely be coming back again. I highly recommend it!

I had an amazing time dining at this restaurant. The cashier was super friendly and the Devil's Delight burger was mouthwatering. The burger was cooked just right and the mix of flavors was incredible. The truffle fries were also really good. The quality and service were outstanding, even though the prices were a little steep. Despite that, it was definitely worth it, and I can't wait to go back.

This place is a real find for folks seeking nutritious dining choices. The Be My Bison burger was totally worth the two-mile trip and totally surpassed expectations. The ease of ordering online and speedy service just added to the great experience. A dream spot for those who care about eating well. I totally recommend it!

All in all, my time at this restaurant was terrible. The disregard and subpar service on my initial visit left me feeling ignored and uncomfortable as I waited to be seated. The bartender seemed too busy to help out, and the lack of care resulted in us walking out without getting a table. On the next visit, the service didn't get any better as our waiter appeared uninterested in serving us. The menu choices were uninspiring, and the pricey, average food was very disappointing. I wouldn't suggest this spot to anyone, but perhaps their takeout could be okay for pets.

The service at the restaurant was great, and the mesquite wings were absolutely delicious. It's a good idea to save some for later or to share, instead of being as greedy as I was. Unfortunately, the lemonade was weak - it was the most diluted one I've ever tasted.

Taqueria Guerrero is a real hidden treasure in our area, dishing out the most mouthwatering Mexican food in New Orleans. You can choose from a wide array of scrumptious options on the menu, including al pastor tacos and zesty shrimp dishes. Finding parking near the restaurant was a breeze, making it a convenient option for dining in or grabbing takeout. Definitely a top pick for anyone hankering for genuine and tasty Mexican fare.

Although the dishes at this place were delicious, the whole visit was spoiled by disappointing service and lack of cleanliness. The table felt grimy, with a fork that wasn't properly cleaned lying on it, showing a lack of care. The meals took quite some time to arrive, and a mistake caused confusion among our group. Yet, the pork belly tacos and spicy beef pho were excellent with delightful tastes. Still, the time it took to get the bill was lengthy and inconvenient. In short, come for the food, not the service.

The return trip to that locksmith shop really paid off. The folks there were super nice and got the job done fast and affordably. They managed to copy some funky-shaped keys that the major stores couldn't handle before. It was a pretty great visit overall.

This place provides subpar work with unfriendly attitudes. Their services are average for toes and substandard for fingers. Any suggestions or corrections are met with unfriendliness and gossip in a different language. Stay away from this place at all costs.

My visit to this salon was awful, even though the owner tried to make it right by offering a free service after a previous bad visit. I requested "white blonde" hair without any orange hues, but my hair turned out damaged, brassy, and orange. The owner hurried through the appointment, overcharged for products, and disregarded my requests. Other customers also left displeased, and it seems like the salon cares more about suppressing negative feedback than offering good service. I won't be coming back and I urge others to steer clear of this salon.

The Riviera Mansion was absolutely ideal for our destination wedding. The venue is breathtaking and the pricing was exceptionally transparent, simplifying our cost management. The layout was fantastic for our guests of all ages, providing plenty of room for everyone to have a great time. Breanna and Eli were truly fantastic, meticulously overseeing every aspect and ensuring seamless organization. The bar service was exceptional, featuring a unique signature drink that was a hit with all our guests. Overall, a truly outstanding experience that made our special day truly memorable.

The guy named Dave working at the food cart last night in Santa Barbara was super friendly and knew a lot about the menu. The hot dogs were whipped up fast and tasted absolutely amazing. The Dave's special, the pizza dog, and the custom creation were all fantastic, and the grilled jalapeños added a good extra kick. We definitely need more late-night food carts like this in Santa Barbara.
My initial visit to Wolfgang was a letdown. The place was packed, the floors looked grimy, and the service fell short. The bright spot was the superb, refreshing Chardonnay.

This Wawa store excels when it comes to pricing and convenience. When they opened, gas prices dropped significantly, showcasing their commitment to saving customers money. The automatic start/stop digital air pump is a great feature, ensuring accurate tire pressure with every use. The service is welcoming and quick, and the store layout is optimized for speed, especially during busy times. Overall, this particular Wawa location stands out and is definitely worth checking out.

In general, the restaurant served subpar food with extremely sluggish service. Our orders were brought out individually, with a considerable gap between each. The staff was impolite and it took an extended period to get our checks, which were riddled with errors. This dining experience was simply terrible.

The seaside eatery received a varied rating. The clam chowder was delightful, yet the cioppino fell short in taste and seafood choices. The crab salad sandwich failed to impress, too mayonnaise-heavy without enough crab essence. It's best to opt for outdoor seating near the waves for an improved dining vibe. Service is decent, though you might have to wait for a table. The menu proves inconsistent, so pick wisely. All in all, a visit is recommended, but maintain realistic expectations.
We had a fantastic time at this place! The staff was friendly and helpful, creating a fun and enjoyable afternoon experience for our family.

You've gotta try Chef Kevin Sbraga's lavender honey fried chicken at Juniper Commons. The chicken is so flavorful, crunchy, and cooked just right. The tasty honey glaze gives it that extra touch. Served with a buttermilk biscuit and red bliss potato salad, it's a meal you won't forget. All the dishes at Juniper Commons are top-notch, and Chef Sbraga really knows his stuff when it comes to fried chicken. Definitely don't miss out on trying this one.

I had a bad experience at Casselli's. The server was rude, the food was inconsistent, and the loud opera singer ruined the atmosphere. Although the parking was convenient, the cash-only rule and overall visit make me not want to go back.

I wouldn't suggest this dealership. The salesperson was nice at first, but when we started negotiating, we had to deal with a manager who wasn't honest and appeared uneasy with knowledgeable customers. If we didn't require a particular color right away, we would have chosen a different dealership. Be ready with research and pricing details if you decide to purchase here. Explore alternative choices if you can.

Located just an hour from Orlando, this casino provides all the usual casino vibes, except for the pricey grub at the Hard Rock Cafe. I really enjoyed my time playing the Breakfast at Tiffany's slot machine, a total must-try for fans of the film.

Merrigans is a trustworthy and authentic family-owned shop in Tucson that focuses on repairing older RVs at a reasonable rate. Though they may not always pick up calls right away, their top-notch repairs and vast expertise make it worth the patience. They carry a range of components for classic RVs and provide a complimentary 24-hour dump station with water. They're definitely the best spot for RV repairs without any worries about being overcharged.
Lisa's talent really comes through on TV. She's truly exceptional at what she does. I highly suggest watching her in action.

Wonderful spot for brunch with a cozy and charming design. The team is super friendly and the cocktails are tasty. Excited about having a lesbian bar nearby, can't wait to bring my mom here for Mothers' Day. Thrilled that this place is around!

I won't be going back to that place because the pizza was not good and the manager didn't follow up. I contacted them and even sent a photo, but they never got back to me or fixed the problem. Really disappointed in their customer service.

Fantastic food and wonderful experience every time. The staff is friendly and informative, the wine options are impressive, and the cheese platter is divine. I suggest dining with a group of around 6 individuals to keep costs down. Dining outdoors with live music creates a delightful atmosphere. Don't miss out on the bacon wrapped dates and the delightful goat cheese and mushroom dish. Overall, it's a delightful and pleasurable experience. I highly recommend it!

I had a great time at this place watching my son's band Last Frontier perform. The staff was amazing and the food, especially the pork belly and fish nachos, was delicious. The variety of whiskies was impressive and the band sounded great thanks to the excellent sound system. It was a fantastic night overall.
