I've consistently had great experiences at this paint store. The team is welcoming and knowledgeable, and they stock all the supplies necessary for painting tasks. They store your paint details for convenient reordering. Keep an eye out for discounts, like a 30% markdown, to get good deals on top-notch paint options such as the interior Super Paint. I highly suggest this store for all your painting requirements.
Had an amazing dining experience with scrumptious food and excellent service. The outdoor deck offered a lovely setting, and we were fortunate to spot dolphins. Will definitely be back again.

Whole Foods in Reno offers a blend of contradiction and opulence, portraying itself as a 'value' grocery store despite competitors like Trader Joe's providing superior value. The store dazzles with aesthetically pleasing food items, charming presentations, and an air of self-satisfaction. Although it might not be the most economical choice for everyday groceries, it serves as a fantastic spot for a midday meal or a special indulgence. Its strategic placement by the highway makes it a handy pit stop for travelers.
This restaurant always gives amazing service and scrumptious food. We're frequent patrons and wholeheartedly endorse it. Fantastic experience every single time!

I was not impressed with the Chopped Italian salad from Fresh as it lacked flavor and had limited ingredients. Adding more Italian-inspired elements could have made a difference. You might want to go for a panini next time for a more fulfilling meal.

Tyson delivers superb service with fast turnaround times and dependable follow-through on commitments. I took my RV with a ford front end to him and he fixed it earlier than expected. The parts were ordered and the team finished the bumper replacement in just 3 days. I wholeheartedly endorse Tyson for any vehicle repairs, as he and his team offer excellent service. As a business owner, I rely on Tyson for all my vehicle needs and wouldn't consider going anywhere else. Manny and Tyson are an incredible duo!

My time at Johnny Rockets in the casino was quite busy during lunch, but our server Lyndel was fantastic and very responsive to all of our needs. The food was scrumptious, and I departed feeling quite satisfied.

This spot is a real hidden gem. The grub is outstanding, the service is fantastic, and the vibe is just so chill. The folks who work here are super friendly and kind. I keep finding myself returning almost every weekend for their phenomenal Cuban espresso. I really suggest giving it a try!

Awesome pizza place in Hatboro! The owner Pete is always there and really nice. Their California, Meatlovers, and Veggie pizzas are fantastic. It's a bummer that they're closed because of a fire in the nearby laundromat, but I'm excited for them to open again. The lunch deal of 2 slices and a soda for $3.99 is a great value. Definitely the best pizza spot in the neighborhood.
The buffalo chicken cheese dip at this place is fantastic. The staff is super friendly and the prices are fair. Definitely recommend checking it out!

The pizza was amazing and the customer service was exceptional. Even though there was a small mistake with the online order, the staff member really made it right by delivering an extra pizza and brownies as an apology. I will definitely order from this place again.

Had a blast celebrating my 21st birthday at this restaurant with family. The food and drinks were tasty, although a bit pricey. The lobster mac and cheese was a standout dish. The complimentary desserts were a lovely surprise. All in all, it was a fantastic experience, but a bit too expensive for what you get.

I enthusiastically endorse this spot for drinks and food. The atmosphere is adaptable, perfect for either a lively date night or a relaxed get-together with friends, especially for watching sports. The exposed kitchen enhances the whole experience. The beer choices are top-notch and you absolutely must taste the rosemary fries. My partner really enjoyed the signature burger. We're definitely planning on a comeback visit.

I'd rate this place a decent 3 stars. The beer was a bit disappointing and lacked flavor, but the food was really tasty and portioned well for lunch. Overall, it's a nice spot for a meal, but don't get your hopes up too high for the brewhouse offerings.

The newly opened taco place near Rivers Edge Apartments has a variety of tasty dishes crafted by a chef with a James Beard award nomination. Both the indoor and outdoor spaces, along with a bar, create a cozy vibe. With fresh, locally sourced ingredients in each taco, there's something for everyone, whether you're vegetarian or a meat lover. My go-to picks are the mushroom and short rib tacos, but you can't go wrong with any choice. A perfect spot for a scrumptious meal, I'll be back for sure.

Capofitto is a great find near Franklin Fountain with shorter wait times and more affordably priced sweets. The gelato, particularly the dark chocolate and pear combo, was fantastic. Looking forward to returning for the pizza. I definitely suggest checking it out.

The A.I. DuPont Hospital is a top pick for families on the East Coast. They provide convenient access to multiple doctors in a day, excellent care, and comfortable accommodations for caregivers. The updated section and welcoming staff ensure a pleasant visit. I highly recommend it for families in need of exceptional care.

I definitely suggest trying out Vetri in Philly for the Chef's Tasting experience. The 9 courses were absolutely amazing and so delicious, paired perfectly with phenomenal wine. Make sure you check out this culinary gem in Philly!

This iconic American diner has been dishing up mouthwatering meals crafted completely from scratch for years. The fried chicken is among the most delectable I've ever tasted, and the endless coffee for $1.75 is quite the steal. Courteous and prompt service contributes to the allure of this everlasting spot. Remember to leave space for a piece of their scrumptious pie!

Steer clear of this place no matter what. They gave me a hard time over a Groupon and neglected to replace my oil filter without giving me a heads-up. Their customer service is awful and their attitudes are just plain rude. You'd be better off finding a different place to go.

I recently went to the #wellDoneTBO tweet-up at Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza and had a wonderful time. The service was excellent and we got to try a variety of tasty menu items. The Philly Cheesesteak Pizza was a hit with my 10-year-old, and I personally adored the Cauliflower pizza. The wings smothered in caramelized onions stood out, along with the meatballs, ribs, and salad. We also savored a half and half pizza with pepperoni, sausage, and mushrooms. It was a fantastic evening overall, and I'll definitely be back. If they served alcohol, it would have been a perfect experience for me. Thank you, Anthony's!
I had a fantastic meal with outstanding service and mouthwatering dishes. The dry ice fog created a really cool and unique atmosphere. I definitely suggest giving it a try!

If you're after delicious, genuine New Orleans cuisine, this is the spot to check out. Even though it was bustling, we got seated right away and decided on the a la carte menu instead of the buffet. It turned out to be the best part of our trip - definitely worth a try!

This restaurant is a go-to spot for breakfast/brunch on the weekends, making it ideal for visitors from out of town. Anticipate extended wait times after 9:30 AM, but the scrumptious menu choices and fantastic bakery, coffee, and gelato counter make it worth the while. Although the service may be a tad slow, the food definitely makes up for the delay.

The meal was fantastic, but the service was subpar. I felt hurried, unvalued, and deceived by the server who didn't return my change. It was a letdown. I might consider giving it another shot, but I'll make sure to have the correct amount of money and tip accordingly.

The sushi at this place is delicious, particularly the Mesa rolls. However, it would be a top-notch restaurant if they enhanced their pick up estimations since they frequently fall short and end up with orders ready after customers get there.
This spot has the most amazing burger in Philly - with fresh bread, juicy meat, friendly service, and reasonable prices. Definitely worth trying!

The outdoor vibe is great for enjoying wine and cheese, but the food choices were a bit disappointing. The bacon-wrapped dates and brussel sprouts were underwhelming, and the sardines were obviously not fresh. It's best to just focus on the drinks and the overall ambiance at this spot.
The Po-Boys tasted great, but they needed more catfish. The service was outstanding.

The Mediterranean meal was terrible. The pita bread was burned, the hummus was too oily, and the manager's customer service was lacking. It was not a good experience and made me feel unwell. I won't be coming back.
The bagels at this place are amazing, but it's a bummer they close early. The staff could be more welcoming, but it's totally worth it for the delicious bagels.

All in all, this hotel was excellent for a week-long business trip. The location was ideal for quick access to the office in Wayne. The room was large and spotlessly clean, with a well-equipped kitchenette. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. Choosing not to have housekeeping in exchange for a $5 credit at the restaurant was a nice bonus. The pool and hot tub were enjoyable, although the bar's drink choices were a bit limited. The breakfast selection was solid overall, and having an omelet station was a nice addition. There were some issues with weak or gritty coffee, but the positives of this hotel overshadow the few minor drawbacks.
The falafel wrap was okay but a bit too expensive, and the vibe was kind of chilly and unwelcoming. You can definitely find better choices in Manayunk.

I had an amazing time at this place when my car broke down during my cross-country trip. Brian went above and beyond to assist me and had me back on the road in no time. I would definitely suggest checking them out.

The location of this restaurant is awesome for checking out the Quarter, but the food was a letdown. Out of 8 dishes we tried, only the jambalaya and file gumbo were delicious. The other options like red beans with rice, meatloaf, Mac and cheese, shrimp po boy, and chicken wings were dull and not worth the cash. The staff was friendly, but all in all, the food was just average.

Looking for the best seafood in Santa Barbara? Check out this casual restaurant with a stunning ocean view. The wait might be a bit long, but the selection of impeccably prepared fresh shellfish makes it all worthwhile. Put your name on the list and enjoy a stroll on the pier as you wait. Trust me, you won't be let down.

I've consistently liked my visits to this restaurant. The dishes are inventive and delicious, and the house wines are pretty good. The cocktails are crafted well, even though they're small. The service has never disappointed, and the outdoor terrace is a fantastic place to relax with friends. Generally, a reliable pick for dining out.

Skyway Cafe (previously known as Skyway Jacks) serves generous portions of delectable dishes at affordable rates. The banana pecan pancakes are a definite must-have. The cow-themed decorations contribute to the welcoming ambiance of the diner. The staff is warm and attentive, and the coffee is continuously available. Make sure to take advantage of their morning breakfast special for a fantastic beginning to your day. I wholeheartedly suggest visiting this charming local establishment.
Terrible experience - waited for more than an hour just to be turned away right before I could get my shot. Total lack of respect for customers. Stay away from this place.
The customer service was really frustrating because it was so hard to find someone to help when you needed it. I wish you the best of luck trying to get assistance here.

Fair Grinds in New Orleans is a fantastic place to get your caffeine fix. The vibe there is chill and just right for getting work done or hanging out with pals. The cold brew with a hint of vanilla was really smooth and super tasty, and don't even get me started on the gluten-free zucchini bread – it was a total delight. It was pretty handy to have the choice to tip right on the card reader at the fancy touchscreen register. The only bummer was the minimal selection of gluten-free goodies, but all in all, it was a great time and I'd definitely be a regular if I lived closer.

I had an amazing time at this place, the desserts were varied and delicious. The oozy butter cookies were amazing and the German chocolate cupcake was absolutely fantastic. I highly suggest checking it out!

Pretty solid frozen yogurt place with a variety of topping choices and 8 different froyo flavors to mix and match. Prices can get high fast depending on how much you load up your cup. Not much seating inside, staff is friendly but not super excited. The bubble tea was a bit disappointing.

You should definitely make the trip from Tahoe for the amazing food here, particularly the Chicken Basil. Ignore the negative talk - the genuine Taiwanese dishes are a must-try, as well as their flavorful Boba Tea. I highly suggest it!

CRU is an inviting wine bar with a contemporary vibe. The wine tastings were delightful, especially with standout choices like the Vespucci Primitivo and Il Fauno di Arcanum. The menu offered a range of tasty options, with the Farmers Plate being a standout for its delicious assortment of cheeses and meats. The ambiance is warm and welcoming, making it a perfect place to unwind and savor a glass of wine with friends. I'm eagerly looking forward to my next visit!

This place has been known for serving some of the best steaks in the city for years. Even though they changed the name, the food quality remains the same. For something different, consider trying the chicken cheesesteak.

Pina's in Roxborough is a hidden treasure with fantastic stromboli and the most delicious Sicilian pie I've ever tasted. Their sandwiches and pizza are decent, but the chicken parmesan is outstanding. All in all, a very enjoyable dining experience.

Although a bit pricey, this cafe has some really tasty food and a wide variety of items in the grocery section. The vegan sandwich and tofu melt are incredible, and the assortment of vegan desserts is always impressive. A fantastic choice for anyone seeking plant-based options.

You have to check out this burger joint in New Orleans. The service was fantastic, and they brought out our delicious food right on time. My buddies really loved the Gator and deer burgers, and the buffalo wings were so tasty. We're definitely going back before we head out. And make sure to grab one of their drinks too, they're really top-notch!

Visited this place twice with my boyfriend and we absolutely adored it both times! The classic atmosphere with 3 floors really adds to the charm. The veal, clams casino, mussels, pasta with oil and garlic, and homemade garlic bread were simply fantastic. Recently gave the gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce a go and it instantly became my new go-to dish. A definite must-try! The staff was friendly and attentive. I can't recommend it enough.

Home Wine Kitchen's "No Menu Monday" offers a one-of-a-kind and thrilling dining experience in St. Louis. The three-course meal paired with wine is a fantastic deal at $30, plus $12 for the wine. The customized menu tailored to your tastes results in a captivating and delectable dining experience. The lamb meatballs and swordfish steak were exceptional dishes, and the staff was warm and professional. The ambiance strikes a balance between casual and elegant, drawing in a vibrant crowd of industry professionals. For food lovers seeking a unique experience in the upscale dining scene, this is a definite must-visit. A repeat visit is undoubtedly on the horizon.

All in all, my buddies and I had a great catch-up dinner at this fancy restaurant. The cuisine justified the cost, though a few pals thought it was pricey. The lobster bake was tasty but not mind-blowing, while the Neopolitan Old Fashion was expertly crafted. The server was outstanding - attentive and even surprised my friend with a birthday treat. The total bill tallied up to $170, which caught some of my friends off guard. I'd rate the service a full 5 stars, the food 3 stars, the ambiance 4 stars, and the pricing 2 stars. I left content with the overall experience.

Susanna Foo has a special spot in my heart, being a treasured dining spot for my family from my earliest days. While the food and service are consistently outstanding, as an adult, I do feel the menu could use a bit more pizzazz. The atmosphere and setting are still fantastic, but I crave a revival with bolder flavors or a return to traditional Chinese cuisine. I yearn for a refresh that will rekindle my affection for Susanna Foo.

I left the hotel dining room and came across Spiro's while looking for a change of pace in the area. Despite its modest advertising, the Greek cuisine turned out to be a delightful discovery. The Greek lemon soup was especially impressive, and the Moussaka was tasty, although the Sea Bass was suggested by the thoughtful waiter. All in all, it was a wonderful dining adventure, and I'll certainly come back if I'm in the neighborhood again. Huge shoutout to Neil for the top-notch service.

As someone who judges barbecue competitions, I have to say this place doesn't quite meet the mark for authentic barbecue. The brisket looked more like greasy pot roast without that delicious smoky essence and was disappointingly tender. I mostly got a mouthful of fat in my sandwich, with scarce bits of meat. It appears the owner is either disinterested or has entrusted the business to inexperienced folks. In general, you're better off seeking out superior BBQ elsewhere.

Our second favorite sunset spot north of Tampa is bustling with clapping crowds and vibrant music. While the rocky beach isn't conducive to swimming, the ambiance and scenery perfectly cap off the day. The food and drinks are adequate, yet the experience is always gratifying. Ideal for families, as we've been bringing our boys since they were infants and, at fifteen, they still relish it.

This old-fashioned ice cream parlor has truly honed their skills since 1958. Their soft serve and hand-scooped ice cream cones, sundaes, floats, and boats are all exceptional. With affordable prices, it's clear why this spot has persevered over the years. Definitely a place worth checking out!

I came across this hidden gem when I was really wanting some real Mexican food, and it did not let me down. The pazole was absolutely tasty with a combination of pork, hominy, and toppings, although the sad lettuce was a bit of a letdown. The taco lunch deal was also nice, but the salsa was a tad too sweet for my liking. The pineapple water was a delightful unexpected delight. The service was excellent, and I can't wait to go back and sample the burritos. Definitely worth checking out for anyone in the vicinity!

The vibe at this restaurant is delightful, with white brick walls, cozy furniture, and appealing staff. The lighting sets the mood for a blind date, and the service is prompt and pleasant. Unfortunately, the prices are steep for the portion sizes and the kitchen is inflexible with substitutions. I was let down by the meager portions and the lack of flexibility, which left me feeling unfulfilled. In general, the experience was lackluster and didn't justify the cost.

I might eat here again, mostly because there aren't many other choices in town. The decorations, lively ambiance, and unique vibe create an intriguing dining outing. The servers seem stylish, but the service felt hurried and neglectful. Not the best pick for those on a Gluten Free diet, as the selections are scanty and the GF buns weren't impressive. The ketchup served here isn't Gluten Free. Finding parking can be troublesome for guests with a vehicle.

I definitely suggest checking out this place for its tasty food and drinks. The pulled pork and fried chicken po boy were amazing, and the mac and cheese was absolutely delicious. The prices are quite reasonable, and they offer a fantastic selection of draft beers. And the fact that they serve food until 1am is a huge bonus. Overall, it's a fantastic spot.

Stay away from this place! The service is awful, the restaurant is filthy, and the food is just so-so and too expensive. Better breakfast spots like First Watch and Pinky's are close by. Save your time and money and choose somewhere else.

El Arado offers tasty food, reasonable drink prices, and friendly staff. Despite a few hiccups with the table cleanliness at first, the food arrived fresh, piping hot, and customized just how we liked it. The margaritas were a crowd-pleaser, and the Mexican beers didn't break the bank. Overall, it's a great spot for a fulfilling meal before a night out in Fountain Square. Just know that you might encounter a pretty intense strip club scene post-dinner.

The Loew's hotel is really clean and looks amazing with top-notch service. The breakfast is awesome and my son says it's out of this world. The rooms are roomy and parking is easy. All in all, a top-notch experience that my family and I wish we could extend for a month.

Yay for honeygrow! I can't believe it took me so long to try this place. The Sour Cherry BBQ stir fry with chicken was fantastic and low calorie. The line moved quickly and the employees were friendly and efficient. Will definitely be going back for a healthy meal option.

This eatery serves fantastic cheeseburgers with a juicy, perfectly cooked patty and scrumptious sauce, paired with delectable zucchini bread. The service is top-notch, offering a great variety of gin and tonics, and a laid-back atmosphere. The convenience of being just downstairs from my place is a huge bonus. The only drawback is the steep prices, and there might have been a small hiccup with the waitress's demeanor, though it's not certain. All in all, I can't wait to come back.

In general, the place provides a range of dining choices and entertainment selections, but the smoky setting could be bothersome for non-smokers with allergies. Costs for food and drinks differ, with a small charge for beverages. The hotel is on the expensive side, but parking is complimentary. There is also an ATM on site, although it may carry risks for certain people. Betting is an option, but it's suggested to only partake if you are prepared to incur losses. Have a good time, even if you're just there to watch.

We were let down by this restaurant despite its 4.5-star rating. The burgers were just okay, and the ambiance seemed typical of a chain restaurant. Maybe it's busier on weekends, but after our visit, we don't plan on coming back.

This brewery is absolutely amazing! We just had a blast at the "Beer School" – it was fantastic. I totally suggest checking it out, especially if you're a first-time visitor. Be sure to start with the brewery tour to catch a glimpse of the Clydesdales and soak in the brewery's history. Excited to dive into the "Brew Master" adventure next time! Budweiser, see you soon!

Terribly unprofessional service. Showed up early for our reservation, only to be neglected and informed that our reservation was not on their list. The hostesses attributed it to a new staff member and displayed no regret. They made no attempt to make things right or express any apology, simply dismissed us. Won't be coming back.

The meal was scrumptious, but I had a frustrating encounter with the Yelp promotion. They advertised a 10% discount for checking in and leaving a review, but didn't honor it until my next visit even though I had a 4-hour window to redeem it. The food was fantastic, but their business practices are dubious.

I've only been to this place a couple of times, mostly to drop off packages, and I really like having the self-service machine there. But the best part was when my husband and I went to submit our passport applications. The person who helped us was really good - she was quick, nice, and knew what she was doing. She made everything simple and even gave us extra details we needed. I hope my next visits go just as well. She should be the one teaching the rest of the team.

This store is an awesome spot to kickstart your health journey, offering a diverse selection of vitamins, supplements, beauty products, and homeopathic items. The staff is super helpful and guided me in selecting items to create my own moisturizer. The rewards program and acceptance of digital coupons are huge pluses. I definitely suggest checking this place out!

I really adore this store! The people who work here are amazing and the vibe is so cool. They have a bunch of yummy and wholesome snacks, along with really tasty croissants. Their lunch and breakfast choices are also super good. I haven't had anything here that wasn't absolutely amazing.
The Cranberry Orange Muffin and Caffe Latte were scrumptious, the atmosphere was lovely, and the service was quick. A wonderful beginning to a Saturday morning. Definitely worth trying.

I absolutely love going to this sushi spot with such warm and friendly staff. The menu is fantastic and every time I eat there, it's always an amazing dining experience. I highly suggest this place for any sushi enthusiasts out there.

This coffee shop is a hidden treasure in the city with incredible food and a hip, trendy atmosphere. The amazing and scrumptious menu items, paired with the cozy seating choices both indoors and outdoors, make it a spot you shouldn't miss. Whether it's for a quick coffee break or a satisfying meal, this spot is absolutely worth a visit.

This family-run burrito joint is hands down the best in town, serving mouthwatering burritos, flavorful salsas, and a chill vibe. I absolutely love the chicken and chorizo combo, but the smoked brisket is also top-notch. A medium burrito should satisfy unless you're a bottomless pit. The prices are fair and the customer service is top-notch. Definitely a must-visit for those looking for delicious, wholesome food.

The lunch offerings at this spot are fantastic! The sandwiches are incredibly tasty, albeit a tad small. Prices are a little high but the quality is definitely worth it. Excited to sample their steaks! The service is top-notch too. Overall, 5/5 for the food, 5/5 for the service, and 4/5 for the price.

Fantastic variety in a classy setting. Don't miss out on the What's Up Doc omelet, although sizes may differ. French toasts and Fancy Breakfast Sandwich are also fantastic choices. Mimosas are the perfect companion to round off your meal. Swapping prosciutto for bacon is a delightful suggestion.
This shop is a gem for aficionados of 50's-Midcentury modern decor. Although it might be pricier than other stores in STL, the distinctive and exclusive items definitely justify a visit.

As a valued gold member and a loyal patron of the Hamptons, I was truly let down by my recent experience. The ongoing construction at the hotel was disruptive, and my room was not cleaned to a satisfactory standard. To add to my frustration, I was denied a four-night reservation after being assured of availability for the following night. I advise avoiding this hotel altogether.

The fried rice at this Vietnamese restaurant is absolutely delicious, and the Pho is top-notch, comparable to some of the best I've tried in Seattle. I highly suggest giving it a try, whether you're new to it or a Pho enthusiast. Make sure not to pass up on this hidden treasure in Nashville!

I strolled to this amazing place from my apartment and was pleasantly surprised. The sliders and donuts were mouthwatering and the unique drinks were a fantastic addition. The ambiance was great and the staff was incredibly welcoming. I'll definitely be coming back in the future.

Casa Video stands out as the top-notch video rental spot with a well-informed and pleasant team. Its wide array of options, from the latest releases to special discoveries like VHS tapes of vintage hockey brawls, truly sets it apart. Plus, the affordable prices are an extra perk. Chicago could definitely benefit from a spot similar to Casa Video.

I enjoyed my time picking out dishes one by one at this sushi spot for a leisurely weekend lunch. The bill came out to around $20 after adding a tip, and the sushi rolls were top-notch and flavorful. The highlight of the meal was definitely the chocolate mochi - it was rich and scrumptious. It satisfied my hunger without making me feel uncomfortably full, just right for a sushi craving without breaking the bank or committing to all-you-can-eat for $25.

I had a great experience at this store, easily finding what I needed with friendly employees. The store was neat, tidy, and had a good selection of items. However, I'm worried about how long they'll stay open with other nearby closures happening.

I'd definitely give this place five stars! The pizza here is hands down the best in town. The staff is super friendly and the beer selection is top-notch - always cold and well looked after. Plus, you can't go wrong with a slice and a fresh beer for only 5 bucks. It's a must-try for anyone who loves pizza and beer.

I was thoroughly impressed by Federal Donuts. Being a vegetarian, my experience was limited to the donuts and coffee, but my husband cannot stop praising the chicken, especially the buttermilk ranch flavor. The donuts are absolutely amazing, especially when enjoyed with an iced coffee. The staff is super friendly and goes out of their way to be helpful, even when they are very busy.

Despite its convenient location and friendly staff, as well as great bar, the food at this restaurant never fails to disappoint. Whether it's the dry turkey patties or fish and chips served in a box, this place has struck out with us three times. Our most recent experience confirmed our decision - we won't be coming back.

Sapore brings a touch of Italy to a strip mall, offering a relaxing break from the heat in a chic, dimly lit space. The selection of drinks is impressive, with a standout being the one-of-a-kind martini topped with an anchovy. While the menu may not be groundbreaking, it does offer reliable choices such as Chicken Marsala and a delightful tiramisu to round off the meal. In essence, Sapore is a great option for a laid-back Italian dining experience with a hint of excitement.

This particular Burger Up spot might not be as hip because it's located in a shopping plaza, but it serves up tasty, messy burgers with quality ingredients. The truffle fries are exceptional, and the chocolate milkshake is scrumptious and rich. Ideal for those looking for a fancy burger meal with all the traditional toppings.

I left my car for a check engine light appointment early in the morning and was informed it would be done by the next day. Unfortunately, they didn't get to it until the day after, and I ended up waiting an hour to retrieve it because of disorganization. Although no repairs were necessary, the hassle and inefficiency make me reluctant to come back again.

RH&B used to be the ultimate spot in southern Jersey for BBQ and blues, but ever since it changed hands, they've stopped hosting live music. The food was just okay, and without the tunes, the vibe just isn't the same. The only saving grace is the awesome staff. All in all, I can't really give RH&B a thumbs up anymore.

I used to count on this spot for sandwiches, but the last two were underwhelming. The cheesesteak lacked meat, and the roll was stale - one of the worst I've experienced in Philly. I hope it was just an off night, but I'll hold off a bit before considering another visit.

Being an SPG Gold member, I had a frustrating experience at this hotel. Even though I paid a decent amount for my room, the staff was unresponsive when I asked for a bigger room because of the noise coming from the adjoining doors. I didn't get any help in changing rooms and had to endure the noise all night long. The service and my whole experience were disappointing, and I wouldn't suggest this hotel to anyone.
In general, the food was fresh and delicious. It wasn't mind-blowing, but the price was reasonable and the staff was incredibly friendly and kind.

All in all, it's a pretty good hotel for business travelers, with cozy beds and a decent cafe. The hallway could do with some sprucing up, and room cleaning could be a bit more meticulous. It's great for a brief stopover.

Henry's is your typical neighborhood coffee shop with a dull vibe and overly bitter iced coffee. The absence of charm and subpar quality of the coffee resulted in a somewhat underwhelming first experience. Open to trying it again with a different beverage next time.

This hotel went above and beyond what we expected. We were greeted with the inviting smell of freshly baked cookies when we arrived, and the rooms were spotless and had everything we needed. They also had nice little extras like a book lending service and a smoking area with relaxing benches. The free breakfast was a wonderful surprise, with different options each day. The pool and hot tub were clean and well-maintained, and we appreciated the late check-out time of 12:00 PM. The staff genuinely cared about our experience and made us feel welcome. I highly recommend this hotel for a cozy and delightful stay.

Purchasing a car might seem scary, but after doing some homework and getting ready, I managed to bargain for what I think is a decent deal at Toyota of Santa Barbara. The sales guy, Sam Ladd, was really nice and let me try out a few cars before choosing. Frank Flores, the sales manager, was honest and tackled my worries while we hashed out the deal. If the car runs smoothly in the long run, I'll be satisfied with my buy. Stay ready and stand firm in your stance all the way for a smooth ride.
Incredible bar with a warm atmosphere and cheerful staff. The diverse crowd creates a welcoming environment. Be sure to check out the BBQ truck parked outside.

The folks working at this Italian eatery were welcoming and attentive, but the dishes were just average and arrived lukewarm. Despite a range of starters like fried gnocchi and calamari, they were nothing special. The main courses were uninspired and flavorless, with lackluster sauces. The mediocre food overshadowed the pleasant service, making a future visit doubtful.
All in all, this Chinese restaurant is one of the greatest and most welcoming spots to enjoy a delicious meal. The double treasure dish is definitely a must-have choice on the menu.

I've been a devoted customer of Reno Vulcanizing for many years and wouldn't go anywhere else for my vehicles. Ken, Bruce, and the whole team are consistently upfront, friendly, and accommodating. I highly suggest their services.

The city tour didn't go well with just 1 star due to complaints about poor communication, uncomfortable seating, and limited sights. On the flip side, the plantation tour scored a perfect 5 stars for its well-informed guides and rich historical anecdotes. Even though the emphasis was mainly on landowners at Oak Alley Plantation, the tour managed to offer a well-rounded view. The swamp tour snagged 4 stars, missing out on alligators, but the guide's expertise was highly praised. The spacious buses ensured a comfy journey back to the hotel after every tour.

Steer clear of that pizza joint. The pizza was seriously bad, with soggy crust, cheap toppings, and a disappointing salad. The knots were okay, but not worth the price. You're better off getting good pizza from spots like Grimaldi's, BJs, or Mellow Mushroom. Dealing with them was a reminder that quality beats convenience. I won't be ordering from them again.

I felt let down by the limited selection of dark beer in February, but the place looked nice and the staff were really friendly. Having summer beer in the middle of winter didn't quite hit the spot for me.

Buddy Brew in Tampa is definitely worth a visit, even with the hectic parking situation and crowds. The staff are super friendly and the food choices are delicious. You can really taste the effort put into roasting the coffee, which is why it's one of my top picks.
The restaurant is overhyped and the charred crust on the pizza was a bit of a letdown. Nonetheless, we really liked the cauliflower salad and the fried dough ball dessert was absolutely delightful.

I was given a gift voucher for this place and finally got the chance to visit. The mixed garden salad sandwich was absolutely delightful and is sure to become a future favorite. The house-made ice cream was also incredibly tasty, and we're excited to return soon.

I adore this Italian restaurant! The food quality and quantity went beyond what I expected, and the service from the girls, especially Alexa, is consistently outstanding. Thank you for being fantastic!

The bar in the Quarter is a fancy place to savor delightful drinks crafted by a charismatic bartender. The Manhattans were superb because of the Carpano Antica Formula vermouth. The food was a bit inconsistent; the lamb meatballs were decent, but the spring rolls were fantastic. Even though the drinks came at a high cost, they were worth the splurge for a memorable evening. The manager, Eric, was warm and competent, leaving us excited to come back for more. A wonderful spot for a refined pause in the Quarter.

I used to go to this restaurant often for their lunch special which was a steal. But my husband doesn't really like it so we haven't been going as much in the last year. The prices have gone up, but the food is still reliably tasty.

I just tried the classic burger and fries at this spot and I was really happy with how it all turned out. The burger tasted seasoned just right and the fries were really good. The service was top-notch too and I treated myself to a boozy milkshake, the Bananas Foster, which was absolutely delicious.

I felt very let down by the service at this place. Despite it being mostly full, there were tables that were not being used. But it took way too long for someone to come take our order, and even longer for our food to come out. The server seemed scattered, and it was unclear who was supposed to be helping us. Another customer who came in later than us got their food before we did, which was really annoying. The reason they gave for the delay was not convincing, especially since there weren't a bunch of new customers coming in. Eventually, after waiting for 40 minutes and no apology, we decided to leave without eating. It was a complete waste of our time, and we won't be coming back.

We had a wonderful time at the bakery! The tres leche cake reminded me of my grandma's baking, the cannoli was scrumptious, and the Italian wedding cookies had just the right crunch and subtle Anise taste. Even though I usually don't like coconut, the dark chocolate florentine was surprisingly tasty. We'll definitely be back for more goodies!

Este lugar es genial para pedir pizzas para llevar o disfrutar en el restaurante. El personal es amigable, el ambiente es limpio y acogedor. Las pizzas son realmente deliciosas, con ingredientes frescos y equilibrados. Recomiendo mucho la pizza de prosciutto y la de hongos. Definitivamente, se merecen cinco estrellas.

I had a great time celebrating a friend's birthday at a charming and tranquil location. The service was prompt and the staff were welcoming. The burger was satisfactory, but not prepared as described in terms of cooking method and level of doneness. I also had a good time exploring the nearby river. Paradise road had a really nice atmosphere.

Having gone through many reviews, I opted to give this restaurant a shot. The oysters stood out as the sole savoury item as they were served raw. However, the rest of the dishes were lackluster and bland. The ambiance was cramped, and we had to endure people coughing near us while sitting at the bar. The two half and half baskets we ordered turned out to be disappointing considering the steep price of $60.

Village Whiskey in Philadelphia really lives up to its hype for having the most amazing burger in the city! The bartenders there are fantastic, mixing up unique and tasty whiskey cocktails. You have to try the Village Burger topped with applewood bacon and their delicious homemade thousand island dressing. And those duck fat fries? So crunchy and packed with flavor! Just a heads up, you might have to wait a bit because it's so popular, but trust me, the wait is totally worth it for the awesome drinks, food, and service. I'm already looking forward to my next visit!

Nice local sushi spot with a small selection of rolls but very friendly staff. Service is prompt and efficient, with everyone eager to make sure you're satisfied. Rolls were good but not exceptional, overall decent and satisfactory. A solid choice for convenient sushi in the area, definitely worth visiting again.

Flanagan's Pub in the French Quarter is a delightful find away from the hustle of Bourbon St. We were captivated by the warm ambiance and ended up coming back several times in a single day. The bartenders and patrons were inviting, and the punk rock music contributed to the hip feel of the location. Certainly worth a stop for a laid-back and genuine New Orleans adventure.

Daily Bread is such a letdown compared to St. Louis Bread Co/Panera Bread. The food is just so plain and flavorless, especially the sandwiches and pizza. But the biggest problem has got to be the terrible service - the staff looks like they couldn't care less, the wait times are endless, and the tables are never clean. After a few tries, I've decided to give up on Daily Bread and look for somewhere that knows how to run a restaurant properly.

In general, my experience ordering delivery from this restaurant on Yelp was great. The food arrived in approximately 45 minutes, but the delivery person was nice. The BBQ chicken pizza was amazing, with the toppings evenly distributed over the entire crust. The mozzarella sticks were a bit different than I imagined, being deep-fried rather than breaded, but they were still delicious. The two complimentary cookies that were included with my order were a delightful surprise and definitely the best part of the meal. The cost was reasonable, and I would absolutely think about ordering from this restaurant again, even with the slightly extended delivery time.

This gym is fantastic with a plethora of fitness options for the price. The class timetable is fantastic for individuals with different work schedules, and the instructors are top-notch, especially in spin and row classes. The We-Fit class is incredibly demanding, but worthwhile. The facility is neat with added perks like hair dryers in the women's locker room. Only time will determine if they can uphold this standard of cleanliness. All in all, a fantastic discovery for those seeking a diverse gym experience.

In short, Prestigious is a stellar auto body shop with a tidy and polished setting, skilled team, and exceptional craftsmanship. The paint match for my repair was spot on, and I was completely pleased with the final outcome. I wholeheartedly suggest them for anyone seeking top-notch repairs.

As someone who visited Santa Barbara from Colorado, I was truly amazed by the dining experience at this restaurant. The food was top-notch, the customer service was outstanding, the prices were fair, and the service was quick. It's definitely a spot you shouldn't miss for breakfast in Santa Barbara. I highly recommend it.

After years of being curious, I eventually gave this place a try for lunch and I was really impressed by the setup, they had different options for seating like tables, booths, and a lunch counter where you can watch the cooks. Even though the staff was quite busy, they were not impolite, and my waitress was really pleasant. I ended up choosing the fried shrimp po boy with a side of red beans, although I was really tempted by the mouth-watering burgers being prepared. The food was okay, considering it's a tourist spot in the Quarter, but I might come back for one of their burgers.

These individuals are truly amazing. We have been through it all and consulted with numerous professionals, but these are top-tier. They genuinely care about animals and you can always rely on them. I highly suggest them!

We had a fantastic time at this family restaurant. The po boys were delicious with the perfect bread. The mac 'n cheese had a delightful kick to it. The service was outstanding. I highly recommend it.

Mr. B's offered the finest dining experience in NOLA during my stay. The delightful Sunday Jazz Brunch justified the 40-minute wait. Our server was warm and observant, allowing us ample time to peruse the menu. The seafood gumbo and sea bass were exceptional, paired with delectable sides and sauces. Treats such as chocolate orange ice cream and creme brûlée were a delightful ending. The seating where Ronald Reagan once dined added a special touch to our outing. Despite the bill exceeding $100, the exceptional cuisine and service made it well worth it. I will certainly revisit Mr. B's if I find myself in NOLA again.

I really suggest staying at this hotel in Indianapolis. The AAA discount helped us save money, the parking was easy, the urban art all around the hotel was really cool, and the service was top-notch. The room was so fancy with awesome amenities like a Keurig coffee machine and the comfiest California king bed. Plat 99 had yummy food and drinks, and being close to Bankers Fieldhouse was perfect for our Pacers game. The breakfast buffet at Market Place was super tasty. Checking out was a breeze and the concierge was really nice. The whole hotel feels like a modern art gallery with unique pieces everywhere. All in all, a great pick for a fun trip in Indianapolis, especially if you're catching a game. We will definitely stay here again.

The ambiance of the restaurant is pleasant, complete with TVs, a bar, and a city center patio. However, my recent visit was underwhelming. The staff mistakenly attempted to include a beer in my takeout order, and I was missing the fish taco I had specifically requested. Instead, I received two beef tacos that did not meet my expectations. The Sonoran dog was lackluster and somewhat soggy in comparison to similar offerings elsewhere. The restaurant was bustling and noisy, which detracted from my overall dining experience. If you prefer to avoid the chance of receiving inaccurate orders, it might be best to explore alternative dining options.

Sam's ranks among the best sports bars in Nashville, providing a fantastic outdoor setting in the sunnier seasons. Nevertheless, when measured against sports bars in other places, it lacks somewhat in terms of service and overall vibe. The food is acceptable, but the assortment of beer and cocktails could use enhancement. In general, Sam's is a solid choice for catching sports action in Nashville, but there's definitely space for upgrades.

This eatery boasts an excellent spot with scrumptious dishes and welcoming employees. The cozy seating arrangement frequently leads to a packed venue, particularly during midday hours. Ordering through the internet appears to be a favored choice to sidestep extended waiting periods. It's just the right place to snag a bite to eat and relish it in Rittenhouse Square. Both veggie lovers and carnivores have relished their meals, rendering it an ideal choice for group gatherings.
Horrible experience with this company. They were more than an hour late without any communication, and their customer service is terrible. Avoid at all costs.

I'm so happy that Michael and Lucy decided to open their new family restaurant on Santa Claus Lane after Tony's on Linden closed. The food is delicious and affordably priced, especially their slice and salad special. The Tuscany design is charming and the owners are welcoming. They serve local beer on tap, have several HD sports TVs, and even feature TVs showing surf videos and kids' shows. Though the location may present challenges, I really hope they thrive in this revitalization of Santa Claus Lane. Best of luck to them!

Even though it's in a shopping center, this restaurant is absolutely incredible. The team, especially Curtis, goes out of their way to make sure you have a fantastic dining experience. The scallops small plate is a must-have, but all in all, the whole experience is outstanding. I really suggest checking this place out for a meal.

I really enjoyed this breakfast spot! The bananas foster was amazing and the vibrant decorations truly brought out the essence of New Orleans. I highly suggest it for a tasty breakfast in a great location.

The birthday desserts at this bakery are absolutely amazing. Yet, the cupcakes and cookies in the front can at times be a bit stale. Nevertheless, the customer service is top-notch and they were quick to make amends when I brought it up. I'll certainly be coming back for those fantastic birthday treats.

The service at Loco was somewhat sluggish during Saturday lunch, but it was tolerable. It's reasonable for a recent place getting started. It's best to steer clear of Friday evenings due to lengthy queues and disorder. The margaritas and cilantro chicken enchiladas were delightful. Sitting outside under umbrellas was enjoyable. The prices are fair, and in general, it seems like a good new spot in the area. It's best to allow them to iron out any issues, but I'm excited to go back. Hopefully, Loco succeeds in the long run.

Nary's nail salon is fantastic! The staff are super friendly and the atmosphere is so lively. The nail designs and options are absolutely amazing and worth the wait. Just make sure to set your budget beforehand. I'm really looking forward to my next appointment!

This spot at Treasure Island is a must-visit! The char-grilled oysters are outstanding, the team is awesome, and the spacious outdoor seating area is ideal for enjoying a meal with your furry companion. Being a pet lover, I value the pet-friendly policy and strongly suggest checking out this place.

The restaurant serves a diverse selection of mostly fried seafood at unexpectedly steep prices given its laid-back setting. It captures a New Orleans feel and is ideal for a relaxed family dinner, although the dishes don't quite meet your hopes.

My family suggested this spot, and it lived up to the hype. Even though it was crowded, the staff was quick and welcoming. The meals were delicious, especially the Cajun tasso omelet which was flavorful without being too hot. The hash browns were fluffy and the French toast and eggs were yummy too. Everyone was happy and full, and we're already planning to come back next time.

Our party of four had an amazing time at this restaurant. The appetizers were unique and flavorful - we sampled dumplings, wings, and specials. The noodles were mouthwatering and fresh. The serving sizes were not massive but the taste was fantastic. It's a fantastic value and BYO. Overall, a wonderful new spot on 10th street.

The sandwiches at this St. Louis place are fantastic and I could totally see myself coming here every single day. The welcoming atmosphere created by the crowd really adds to the overall dining pleasure.

This spot in Reno, NV is a fantastic choice for lunch or dinner. The manager, Tyler, really keeps everything in order, and it definitely reflects in the wonderful staff and overall experience. They also have an amazing selection of beer and wine. Definitely a spot worth checking out in the area!

As someone without kids, I was pleasantly surprised by my visit to Chuck E Cheese. The staff really keep things organized, making sure everyone gets served quickly and stays safe. I appreciated the one-token games, they had a good variety to choose from. The food was abundant and the staff were very attentive, especially during the birthday parties. The only downside was how packed the birthday spot was. All in all, it was a nostalgic trip for me and a blast for the kids.

I really loved my time at this restaurant. The farm-to-table dishes and assortment of coffee choices were a delightful surprise. The Sasquatch brew was especially tasty. The atmosphere was laid-back, chill, and cozy. The proprietors were warm and inviting, which added to the fantastic dining experience.
Yummy ice cream crafted from hormone-free and antibiotic-free cows. The top spot for a tasty dessert. Cash is preferred, but totally worth a visit to the ATM.

Even though Rio Mar was closed for Mardi Gras week and we ended up here as our backup plan, we enjoyed a wonderful meal at this restaurant. The service was outstanding, the bread and butter were delightful, and the beet salad was exceptionally good. The main dishes, G's Choucroute and crab ravioli, were both tasty. The bread pudding for dessert was a lovely way to end our meal. It was truly a dining experience to remember that went beyond our expectations, particularly for a hotel restaurant.
Discovered 51st Deli on Uber Eats and it was fantastic! Looking forward to experiencing it in real life.

I absolutely love the Honey Apple grilled cheese sandwich at Meltdown. The team there is super friendly, the atmosphere is awesome, and the food is just so good. I would suggest skipping the Meltdown in Montgomeryville as it falls short on service and vibes. Stick with the original Meltdown for a memorable dining experience.

This eatery provides fantastic bundle offerings for rolls and sushi, which keeps prices reasonable. The rolls are a bit small, so you might want to order extra to satisfy your hunger. It's impressive how fresh the sashimi is, considering the reasonable prices. The cozy space and leisurely service are downsides, but it's convenient that you can bring your own drinks to enjoy while you wait.

The food was decent, but the service at this restaurant was very disappointing. We asked for orange juice for the kids when we sat down, and we didn't get them until we were almost done eating. Plus, they only take cash or checks. It was an alright experience, but they could definitely do better with their service.

I've been a loyal patron at this restaurant for quite some time, but my recent experience left me disheartened. The food's standard has noticeably dropped. The salsas were runny and sloppily cut, and the main course lacked taste, drowned in an overpowering amount of cheese. I trust that they will focus more on food quality rather than cost-cutting in the days ahead.

I recently got 2 tattoos at Stigma and I'm thrilled! I selected them after reading positive reviews on their website. My tattoo artist, Eddie, was personable, engaging, and incredibly skilled. He understood my vision and brought it to life flawlessly. The entire team was friendly and helpful, especially considering my back problems. Plus, I received a $10 discount for checking in on Yelp! The owner, Chino, has created his own tattoo balm that is soothing and all-natural. I highly recommend Stigma to anyone thinking of getting inked. You'll find exceptional artists and a welcoming environment there.

This place is so much fun! The outdoor patio with hip hop music and indoor dance area with salsa create a great mix of music and vibes. And being able to effortlessly move between the two is a cool feature. All in all, a lively and exciting spot.

While the ambiance and service were excellent, the meal at this restaurant was disappointing. My friend liked the fish special but felt the serving was small. The fattoush salad was bland and lacking in crunch, with wilted lettuce and no olives. The cost for lunch was steep, deterring us from revisiting in the near future.

The veterinarians at The Animal Clinic really care for our pets like they're part of the family and give top-notch treatment. The only drawback is the tough spot for parking. Overall, would definitely suggest. 4 out of 5 stars.
This Taco Bell is the worst I've ever visited. The restaurant is dirty, the service is awful, and they always mess up your order. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else to eat.
The food at this Latin fusion restaurant is amazing and the new, bigger location is a bonus. The chips & salsa are always freshly made and flavorful. All in all, it was a fantastic dining experience.

Discovered Player's as I walked by and was welcomed by warm staff. The service was exemplary and the vibe was chill. Enjoyed a fantastic shave and haircut at a fair price. Overall, a wonderful experience.

The meal at this restaurant was dreadful, and the manager's rude conduct when I attempted to return it was outrageous. The frog's legs were chewy and had a terrible taste. The manager ought to feel ashamed for mistreating customers in such a manner. I have never experienced such awful treatment before.
The place and structure seem old and run-down, with dirty and worn-out elements, but the bed was cozy. Overall, it was a letdown compared to my previous experiences at Doubletree.

All in all, my time at this hotel was amazing. The cozy vibe gave a nice twist to my birthday celebration at the restaurant. The staff was outstanding and the rooms were stunning. The only drawback was the noisy air conditioner in my room. Being close to Printers Alley was a huge bonus. I would absolutely book a stay at this hotel again next time.

Awesome hangout in a prime spot with super chill bartenders and top-notch drinks. Beat the rush by arriving early. The Rye Manhattan was truly outstanding and the burger was hands down the best I've ever tasted. Can't wait to come back for sure.

I really suggest checking out this breakfast spot. The food was amazing with standout dishes like biscuits and gravy, extra crispy bacon, sausage links, and challah French toast. The service was also excellent. It's officially my new go-to place for breakfast.

We were happy with Terra's work as our wedding florist. She really took the time to grasp our needs and budget, and the florals for both the ceremony and reception were stunning. While there were a few issues with wilting flowers in the bouquets, which were likely due to the heat, we were overall delighted with Terra for our wedding.
This restaurant has some fantastic healthy menu choices, with lots of options for takeout. I really liked the turkey meatballs and spaghetti for lunch, making it a delightful place to eat.

This takeout place in Northern Liberties is a gem. The food is fresh, delicious, and satisfyingly healthy. It's a convenient option for busy nights when you want a quick meal on-the-go. I highly recommend it!

I went to an alumni gathering at this snug, softly illuminated spot that had the ambiance of an old library. It was a fantastic peaceful, relaxed place with delicious drinks. The happy hour cocktails such as moscow mules and old fashioneds were a favorite with everyone. I definitely suggest it for a chill evening out.
The burgers are absolutely delicious and worth checking out. The French fries are decent, but definitely go for the onion rings instead.

I had a really disappointing time eating at this restaurant twice. The steak was way too salty, the fish was dry, and my salad was frozen. The service was also not great. I don't understand all the good reviews this place gets.

Modesto in St. Louis is a fantastic Spanish restaurant, standing out even when compared to those in NYC. The food is absolutely delicious, and I really miss it since I moved away. Definitely recommend checking it out.

Awful spa experience. Cramped, grimy, and staff was so unprofessional. The technician seemed ill, nicked my cuticle, and the massage was just awful. The receptionist was not helpful at all and they unexpectedly charged extra fees for the room. Definitely steer clear of Spa Aria at the Monteleone.

I totally suggest trying out the hot shave at this place. You get six towels and a soothing facial massage with oils as part of the service, making it a truly satisfying and calming experience. The shave itself was fantastic, and the overall atmosphere was really impressive.

Taco del Mar has been my favorite spot since it opened. It's consistently good and really quick. Although this place is owned by Subway, I find it to be of much better quality. The make-your-own burrito and taco choices are always fresh and well-filled. They offer plenty of vegetarian options which I appreciate, especially when I can load up my veggie burrito with extra veggies. I also like their chips and "medium" salsa. Give it a try if you're in the Delgado area!

This shop is only really worth checking out for things you can't find at Trader Joe's. But honestly, it's too expensive and they never seem to have enough people working. I wouldn't bother going there.
Authentic BBQ spots serve smoked ribs that are designed to be a bit chewy, not overly soft. If you prefer succulent meat, try another place.

This place is a must-visit for mouthwatering lassi and beautifully plated Karachi style chaat. The lassi is rich and perfectly sweet, while the chaat offers a glimpse of tradition. However, the chaat falls a bit short compared to the fabulous lassi. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in the area.
We had a beautiful wedding reception at Hendel's Cafe. The atmosphere was absolutely lovely, setting the stage for a night we'll always remember with our closest family and friends.

I was really let down by this hotel. Finding a cockroach in my room was a huge letdown, and the sluggish wifi reminded me of the internet back in the 90s. And on top of that, being asked to cough up $10 for a chair at the private beach was just irritating. I won't be coming back.

El Sol was a fantastic choice for my daughter's birthday party. The attentive staff, mouth-watering drinks and food, and lively atmosphere completely impressed us. The surprise cake, sombreros, and fireworks added just the right touch. I'm excited to come back for more delicious fajitas. Well done, El Sol!

Taco Son is a true gem of a restaurant with scrumptious, homemade food and hearty portions. Forget the lengthy waits at Taco Bus and drop by here for a fantastic meal. You simply can't miss their breakfast burritos, especially after a night of fun.

I just bought a pre-owned vehicle for my son from Conicelli, believing it was safe with a fresh state inspection. To my dismay, the front left tire burst a day later, setting us back $450 for replacements. The tire was visibly deteriorated and disintegrated, jeopardizing our safety. Following this incident, I cannot in good faith recommend Conicelli.

The food at this restaurant is superb, but the state of the bathrooms was quite disappointing when I visited on Friday night. The toilet wouldn't flush, and there was a shortage of toilet paper and paper towels. Overall, the cleanliness left much to be desired. Subtracting one star due to this matter.

Although the food I ordered was yummy, the service at this restaurant was extremely unsatisfactory. Even though I placed an order online and arrived prior to the expected pick-up time, I ended up waiting an extra 20 minutes for my meal to be prepared. The employees did not demonstrate any care for the inconvenience and still invoiced me the entire amount. In general, the absence of customer service left me feeling upset and frustrated.

I absolutely love this charming Japanese eatery in Old City that serves up the freshest sushi and unbelievably delicious ramen. The staff is incredibly attentive and friendly, which has quickly turned it into my top pick for sushi and ramen. Plus, the menu boasts a fantastic variety of mouthwatering dishes.

I loved the atmosphere and felt really spoiled and calm while I was there. But, it was quite annoying trying to order a drink. Even after asking four different people, I was finally told to call room service using the white phone. This problem made it impossible for me to give a flawless rating.

Dr. Jeffers is an exceptional veterinarian who demonstrates empathy for all animals and has a knack for swiftly identifying any health concerns. Her fees are quite fair, particularly when compared to other veterinarians in the vicinity. She welcomes reptiles and possesses a variety of advanced equipment for precise pet diagnoses. In general, an excellent veterinarian akin to Dr. Pol. I highly recommend her.

The Mahi Mahi dish was absolutely delicious, with a substantial portion size perfect for sharing. It's key to savor the smoked fish flavors to truly savor this dish. Plus, the server was super friendly and gave top-notch service.

Melissa is hands down the most talented lash technician I've ever visited. She is precise, quick, and produces results that are head and shoulders above other lash studios I've tried. She's not about going overboard with too many layers, and she'll have you in and out in a jiffy. I wholeheartedly suggest making an appointment with Melissa for exceptional lash services.

The greatest casino in Reno offers exceptional features like 4 deck and 2 deck blackjack, actual glassware for drinks, and exquisite decorations. The dining options are superior to those on the strip, and the accommodations are fantastic considering the cost. Be sure to treat yourself to a soak in the hot tub for complete relaxation.

This eatery serves up mouthwatering fish and chips with a crunchy batter and ample helping of fries. The house-made tartar sauce provides a wonderful taste. The salmon tacos and chicken tortilla soup are also delicious, although the salmon was a tad overdone. The serving sizes are a bit smaller compared to other spots, yet the flavors more than make up for it. All in all, a fantastic spot for a fulfilling meal.

Cake Life's Lemon Cake is a scrumptiously indulgent delight that lives up to the hype. I couldn't resist returning for more after my first taste of their cupcakes. With incredible flavors and top-notch desserts, Cake Life has quickly become a go-to destination for me. Excited for my next visit!

The service at Beef's was terribly slow and let us down. We were seated right away, but it took 40 minutes for our sodas to finally reach us, and our order wasn't even taken. The manager apologized, but the whole situation was disappointing. The boneless wings were alright, but not worth the long wait. We won't be coming back or suggesting it to others. You'd be better off looking for a different place to eat.

Wildflower is a delightful and tasty eatery with a fantastic lunch selection. The Vermonter salad and tuna plate were both superb, crafted with fresh and locally sourced ingredients. The outdoor seating area is lovely and the staff was exceptional. The only drawback is the somewhat limited vegetarian choices. All in all, a wonderful dining experience and I can't wait to return for breakfast.

That roast pork sandwich was terrible. The broccoli rabe was so dull and icy, the cheese didn't even melt because it was icy cold, and the bread was damp and soggy. It was a dreadful experience, wouldn't suggest it -- would have taken it back if not in an airport.

Although the appetizers are scrumptious at this place, the main dishes are disappointing in taste and quality. The Pad Thai was excessively sweet with no spiciness, and the other main courses were average at most. At a cost of about $8 per plate, you receive the quality you pay for. The Indian pancakes and chicken satay were the best parts of the meal, but generally, I felt let down by the underwhelming main dishes. It provided an affordable opportunity for an evening out, yet I do wish I had a more enjoyable experience.

If you're a fan of sandwiches, you absolutely have to check out this spot. Each sandwich is personalized and totally worth the slight wait. Being a self-proclaimed expert on sandwiches from Chicago, I can definitively state that this place truly earns every single one of those 5-star ratings. Great job, everyone!

The devil's food cake with sweet vanilla buttercream was incredibly tasty and luxurious. Even folks who usually steer clear of sugary treats couldn't resist. The staff was so nice and accommodating, which added to the whole experience. Excited to swing by the Old City spot again for another heavenly slice of that fantastic cake!

There may be skilled individuals at Perfect Arch, but sadly that is inconsequential when time is of the essence. Despite being scheduled to open at 11 am, there were no staff members available to assist me during my visit on the 23rd of March, 2018, at 11:28 am. A rather disappointing encounter. Tsk, tsk, Perfect Arch.

Spasso in Media is a must-visit for a tasty dinner experience. The food is distinctive with a twist on classic Italian dishes. The service is top-notch, with server Oana being well-informed and attentive. The bread and eggplant/pepper topping are a refreshing way to start the meal. The Caesar salad and pappardelle porcini are exceptional dishes, both fresh and flavorful. Overall, Spasso comes highly recommended for a fulfilling dining experience in Media.

In general, I've had a good time with this credit union. Despite a few mistakes, the customer service at the branch has been great at sorting things out. I've been with them for 4 years and have accounts for my business, parents, ex-husband, son, and myself, and all of us have been content with the service offered.

After visiting several times, we were let down by the many problems we encountered at this place. The vibe is consistently chaotic, drinks get spilled often, service is sluggish, and the food doesn't quite match the high prices. The employees are impolite and unresponsive, and the management doesn't seem to care about customer happiness. We've decided not to come back, and we wouldn't suggest this spot to anyone else. It's an inconsistent experience that's just not worth the investment in time or money.

If you find yourself in St Pete yearning for genuine Mexican cuisine, you must check out this cozy yet scrumptious eatery. The chorizo taco is a carnivore's delight, and the fish tacos are a must for seafood enthusiasts. To minimize your wait, consider visiting on weekdays or during off-peak hours to avoid the bustling weekend rush. This spot is perfect for a relaxed dining experience accompanied by a refreshing cold beer.

Chatham Tap in Indianapolis is a must-visit for wing enthusiasts! The wings are hearty and flavorful, with a fantastic sauce that you'll be tempted to bring home for later. The onion rings come highly praised as well. The ambiance is inviting, with a mix of sports fans and friendly staff. The service is excellent, and the wide beer selection is an added treat. It's definitely worth checking out for a delicious meal and enjoyable time with friends.

Delicious sushi at an affordable price. Service was prompt and effective. It would be nice to have pictures on the menu to give customers a better idea of what the dishes look like. Overall, an amazing dining experience with genuine flavors and nutritious choices.

I visited this restaurant for the first time, and it was an excellent experience. Alison was an amazing server, very well-informed and observant. We had a lovely time reconnecting with old friends without any sense of hurry. The food was delightful, ranging from steaks to meatloaf, and all cooked to perfection. Excited to return and hoping for another fantastic experience.

Jonny's is a chill bar with awesome drink deals and a relaxed vibe. The food, all homemade, is super tasty, especially the plain wings and Jon's salad with chicken. They host entertaining activities like trivia and bingo with cool rewards, like 1 cent beer pitchers. Keep in mind, it's a smoky spot and can fill up on game nights. In general, it's the perfect place to savor affordable drinks, discounted pizza, and hang out with friends.

This restaurant serves tasty meals and has choices for vegans. The staff is welcoming, and the roomy design with a bar and stage area makes it a fantastic spot for gatherings. The guacamole is particularly delightful. Definitely recommended for an enjoyable dining outing.

West Ave. Grill in Jenkintown has a cozy vibe with regulars enjoying their meals on the outdoor patio alongside their pets and kids. The team is warm, the owner is attentive, and the ambiance is inviting. The food is reliably delicious, especially the airy pancakes and the signature Kansas City breakfast. Although the salads might benefit from extra toppings, the staff is responsive to feedback and strives to make things right. In general, it's a lovely spot for a meal with a comforting atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit.
Just had my first taste of the hot chicken and it was absolutely incredible! Hands down the finest in Nashville. This will definitely be a must-stop spot every time we're in town.

The cafe in the grocery store makes the most delicious tuna melt I've ever tasted. The service was outstanding and very attentive. It's hard to believe it's inside a store - they should think about expanding on its own as it would be amazing.

I'm so excited to have discovered a place in St. Louis where I can savor sautéed seafood in a plastic bag. The sauce was so yummy, adding a wonderful flavor. The service was exceptional too. All in all, it was a fantastic experience.
Avoid visiting this drive-thru spot. Multiple menu items were not available and the service was subpar. It's not worth the chance, better to steer clear of this place.

You've gotta try the incredible gravy fries here, they're a must. The staff is super friendly and fun, really adding to the cool vibe of the bar. It's the best place to catch Philly sports teams, especially the Phillies. And they've got a pretty good variety of beers to choose from too.

My spouse and I had a wonderful time at this bar with a lively vibe. Santa and Mrs. Claus showed up, which added to the festive spirit. The service was a tad sluggish, but we were having a good time so we didn't really care. All in all, a lovely spot for a couple of drinks.

We found this amazing little place in South Tucson with the help of Yelp and were really happy with our meal at this revamped 1960's A & W chain stand. The catfish covered in poblano sauce was exceptional, it had a genuine taste that differed from the usual farm-raised fish. My wife's chile relleno was tasty and fresh. The kids in our group really liked the enchiladas and chimichangas. All in all, it was a fantastic meal at a fair price. Big thanks to Yelp for steering us in the right direction once again!

"The Indian food was amazing, especially the vegetable pakora. The main dishes were fantastic and the sauces were so tasty I almost wanted to drink them. Prices were reasonable and the service was decent. It's a great new option for dining in Media, especially with a tempting lunch buffet."

If you have a VW, Howard is the person to turn to. Although scheduling with him might be a bit challenging, his attention to detail, trustworthiness, expertise, and speediness ensure that the wait is worthwhile. I highly recommend him for any VW requirements.

Rich and indulgent, Dark and Sinister undoubtedly offers the finest dessert I've ever experienced. The velvety chocolate ice cream employed in their concoctions is truly unparalleled. In sum, the desserts presented are exceptional and a definite must for any enthusiast of chocolate.

I had an amazing time at this restaurant's oyster happy hour. The dozen oysters and glass of champagne my boyfriend and I enjoyed were a steal at $24 with tip. The staff were so attentive and welcoming, they really made us feel at ease. I really regret not trying their renowned to-go cups. All in all, I can't wait to come back for another visit.

Prep & Pastry is a must-visit for weekend brunch, but brace yourself for a wait as it tends to get pretty packed. The food is absolutely fantastic, featuring standout dishes like green eggs & ham. Make sure not to skip on trying their delightful cocktails such as bloody marys and mimosas. To top it off, they surprised me with a complimentary pastry on my birthday! The added bonus of serving EXO coffee, a beloved local favorite, just adds to the overall wonderful breakfast experience.

I adore the diverse selection of coffees and teas at this cafe. Currently, my top pick is the iced dirty chai. The staff is so warm and inviting, they never give off a rushed feeling. The tables are just right for everyone and I love the local artists' artwork available for purchase. The overall atmosphere is fantastic.

The employee gave great service, but the total price is too steep. Paying by the hour could encourage quicker work, but a fixed rate choice would be better for customers. Checking on Craigslist might be a cheaper option instead.
The Bacon-Bleu cheeseburger is seriously one of the best fast food burgers I've had lately. Dave Thomas would definitely give this one a nod of approval.

All in all, my time at this cafe was a bit of a mixed bag. The carrot cake was alright but definitely too pricey, and I found the packaging to be excessive. The vibe of the place was nice, but the service was lacking. Although the atmosphere was quirky and charming, waiting for our order was quite annoying. It's a fun spot for hanging out with friends, but I wouldn't suggest it for anyone looking for quick service.

The food at this restaurant is absolutely delicious and the service is exceptional. The burgers and pulled pork are the most incredible we've tasted in the Reno/Sparks area. This place is definitely going to be our new favorite spot.

The Smoked Salmon Frittata at this restaurant was absolutely delightful. The mix of smoked salmon, egg, potato, red bell peppers, goat cheese, and horseradish-dill crema was a delectable blend of flavors. It was served with a side of fresh fruit, adding to the overall satisfaction of the meal. A fantastic option for brunch, dinner, or a more intimate dining experience.

Marking a 70th birthday at this restaurant was an exceptional experience. Despite the steep price, the steaks and entrees were phenomenal, and the service was excellent. The atmosphere contributed to the special occasion, making it a perfect selection for a memorable meal.
The food, especially the fried pickles and smash fries, is scrumptious. However, the customer service was lackluster.

I had high hopes for this place, but it turned out to be a letdown. Finding parking was a hassle and we had to wait 30 minutes for our 5 tacos, which were only lukewarm. The flavors were mediocre, especially the buffalo chicken. All in all, it wasn't worth it, and I have no intention of going back.

The workouts at MBSC in City Fitness South Street are designed to really test your limits with tough, diverse exercises. This could be attractive for folks seeking a challenge, but the one-size-fits-all approach and repetitive schedules might not work for everyone. The vibe is more geared towards a younger crowd and the price is a bit steep. I'd recommend giving their trial program a shot before signing up for a full membership. All in all, I'd give MBSC at City Fitness South Street a rating of 1.5 stars.

Pretty average BBQ spot with a big cheeseburger and juicy pork sandwich, but somewhat lacking in taste. Decent BBQ sauce, alright Mac & Cheese. Prices are fair, but the food quality is more like 2.5 stars.
I really liked the variety of dishes at this Indian buffet, it was a great deal for the price. Although nothing was outstanding, I would certainly think about going back again.
