The employee was really unfriendly and inflexible, making us pay for a day pass instead of using a guest pass. We decided to try Retro Fitness instead, where we had a great experience with top-notch equipment and atmosphere. I wouldn't suggest going to this gym.

Brixx is a go-to spot for selective pizza enthusiasts like myself. The gluten-free and lunch choices are fantastic, and the bar is ideal for unwinding after work. Make sure to come early if you fancy grabbing a table on the bustling patio.

This restaurant is a fantastic choice for people with different dietary preferences, serving both meat dishes and options for vegetarians and vegans. I've been here several times and have always been impressed with how delicious the food is. It's a great pick for those seeking a nutritious dining experience.

The frozen yogurt at this place in Central Bucks was absolutely amazing when I first tried it, with really nice staff and a wide range of delicious flavors. But, I just found another spot that is just as good.

The apartment complex in St. Petersburg, FL is fantastic. Nestled among lakes, it provides a tranquil setting. The team at the leasing office is incredibly helpful and welcoming. All in all, my time here was very enjoyable, and I would highly suggest it to those seeking a serene stay in St. Petersburg.
A must-visit in NOLA for a prohibition-era bar experience with a fantastic Jazz band and a cozy seating area perfect for sipping cocktails. The Vieux Carre was an outstanding drink.

The sushi burritos at this new spot were made with really fresh ingredients, but the mix of flavors was a bit off in the slammin' salmon roll. The Japanese fried chicken was kinda dry and the sauce was way too sweet and sour. The green tea and lemonade were decent, but nothing too special. In general, even though this place could be good with its awesome location, the expensive prices for a trendy meal make it doubtful we'll come back.

Enzo's is a great choice for takeout in the area, offering a delicious meatball sub and garlic knots. Even though I personally favor Nabruzzi's pizza, I still suggest giving Enzo's a shot for their top-notch food.

Grabbed some grub at Bareburger in Philly after catching a Prince tribute show and stumbled upon one of the most phenomenal burger joints in existence. Major shoutout to Alya and the crew for an incredible dining adventure! Definitely worth checking out. -Andrew von Gregor, Professional Session & Touring Guitarist.
I've been to this Cosi spot several times while traveling and always liked their flatbreads and salads. The BBQ chicken flatbread is especially tasty and comes in a generous size.

The standards at this place have really dropped ever since they started growing. The small mom-and-pop shop on Linbergh used to have incredible food and service, but now it feels like it's taken a turn for the worse. I don't think I'll be coming back.
I had a really bad time at this place. The egg roll was awful and the sushi was so chewy. It's no wonder I was the only one there. I definitely wouldn't suggest eating here.

In general, this hotel is a fantastic option if you fancy being right on Bourbon Street. The staff is very welcoming and the room is spacious and lovely. Nevertheless, the sound from the vending and ice machines made it hard to get a good night's sleep due to the thin walls. Would have given it 4 stars otherwise.

I wasn't very pleased with my visit to Ocharleys on a Sunday afternoon. The server appeared flustered and kept forgetting things during our meal. However, the manager did a good job of fixing things with the coupon. I might give Ocharleys another shot, maybe for lunch next time.

Don't bother wasting your money here. The service is awful, the food is meh and too expensive, and they never change things up. It was disappointing the first time and just as bad the second time. Save your cash and find a better place to eat if you want a good meal. I wouldn't suggest going here.
No, there isn't a 12-step program designed specifically for dealing with a Reanimator Coffee addiction at the moment.

What a great new spot in the neighborhood! It's so cool to have 2 meaderies close by. The Goober Vitis, Suzy's Cherry Pie, and coffee meads tasted amazing. The place is super inviting with plenty of seating indoors and outdoors. Definitely worth a visit!

I definitely suggest trying out Pina's for their scrumptious dinner specials, mouthwatering cheesesteaks, tempting calzones, and delightful seafood dishes. Don't forget to sample the delectable shrimp scampi appetizer and the flavorful steamed clams; they are both quite reasonably priced. The service is always top-notch, ensuring a wonderful and relaxed dining experience. In summary, Pina's is a fantastic choice for a delicious meal.

Chatham is an awesome place to watch football while savoring affordable drinks and scrumptious food. The fish and chips were a delightful and flavorful treat. The vibe was buzzing, and I had a blast cheering on my team. Altogether, a fantastic pub to catch a game.

This nail salon is totally worth the drive! After testing out several salons in Tampa, we've finally stumbled upon a place that goes above and beyond. The skilled staff, especially Pamela and Steven, were able to nail exactly the look we had in mind, and the designs were absolutely stunning. We won't be going anywhere else from now on!

Belinda and Jerry over at the storage place in Boise truly went the extra mile to give top-notch customer service. Even though I showed up late on a snowy night, they stuck around to help me out and even gave me a ride to my storage unit. Their friendliness and assistance really turned my storage situation around. I definitely suggest checking them out!

My interaction with Unique was fantastic! The staff was skilled, open, and truthful. The technicians were quick and amiable, and the pricing was reasonable. Both the salesperson and manager were excellent. I wholeheartedly endorse them for any home services you may require.

This takeout joint is our absolute favorite spot to grab a meal. The food is top-notch, and they're incredibly quick with their service. They even deliver straight to my doorstep, a service not many places offer. The employees are so friendly, whip up delicious pizzas, and manage the business with great skill. I highly suggest checking them out.
This place serves amazing street tacos and outstanding service, along with delicious homemade horchata. A must-visit spot for taco enthusiasts.

I recently had a manicure and pedicure at this salon. The student who did my nails was friendly and we had a nice chat, but unfortunately, the manicure took 3 hours and my hands look terrible. Nobody checked in to see if the job was done properly. However, the pedicure turned out fine and feels great. While I don't mind that it took longer because the student was learning, I feel like I shouldn't have been charged for the manicure, or at least should have had someone else redo them. My nails started looking bad after only 15 minutes. On top of that, my pedicure got ruined as soon as I put my shoes back on, even though I was told it was dry. I would give the service 0 stars if I could, but I rated it 2 stars for the friendly student. It definitely wasn't worth the $34 I paid. Take a look at the pictures for yourself.

This restaurant provides a warm and inviting ambiance with a variety of Chinese and sushi options. The Szechuan chicken, hot and sour soup, and prime rib and shrimp hot pot were all tasty with satisfying portion sizes. The service was outstanding. I definitely recommend trying it out.

Frank is an amazing dentist who genuinely cares about his patients. He has a kind demeanor and shows a real interest in delivering excellent care. I have been seeing him for years and wholeheartedly endorse him for anyone seeking a fantastic dentist.

I had an amazing time at this place with sidewalk lounge seating and a DJ outside on Friday night. The walk-up bar was a cool addition and the decor inside was stunning. The appetizers were delicious and being in a trendy waterfront area really added to the vibe. I highly recommend giving it a try.

I enthusiastically suggest checking out the Friday happy hour special at this place. It's a fantastic deal with scrumptious food and drinks, plus a lively vibe. The pork sliders and beignets were particularly amazing. The staff were super friendly, adding to the overall enjoyable experience.

Popped in for a quick bite and was really impressed with the excellent service, delicious food, and lovely ambiance. Lisa was an amazing host who really enhanced our evening with her menu expertise and regular check-ins. Can't wait to come back for another visit.

Lush in New Orleans is definitely my top pick from all the ones I've visited in different places. The store exudes a captivating fragrance that can be noticed from a distance of a block. Going there on Halloween never fails to be an enjoyable time. I highly suggest paying a visit if you happen to be in the area!

I really enjoy coming here for Happy Hour and dinner! The Asian Nachos are a must-try, they are almost like a meal on their own. The creme brulee and other desserts are fantastic. The blueberry mojito and mango sling are so delicious. It's a wonderful spot to celebrate special occasions. The bar area can get quite crowded during Happy Hour. Finding parking around the mall is always a bit tough. Overall, it's a lovely atmosphere for dining. Brunch is alright, not as amazing as anticipated.

I've always had an amazing experience at this bakery. The pastries are scrumptious and made with high-quality ingredients. The negative ratings are unwarranted, in my view. The service is consistently warm and accommodating, even for someone like me who can be particular. I'm delighted to have them creating macarons for my wedding. I strongly suggest trying them out.

Even though the ingredients are fresh and the service is fantastic, the pizza at this place is underwhelming. The thin crust cools down quickly, and the pizza lacks flavor and structure. There are plenty of other pizza joints nearby, so I won't be coming back.

The tap room at bier offers a fantastic opportunity to sample distinctive and ever-evolving beers. Although I had difficulty discovering brews that resonated with my taste buds during my initial experience, I admire the dedication to switching up the selection and fostering innovation. The ambiance is vibrant and entertaining, complete with a cozy lounge section ideal for unwinding and chatting. I am eager to grant them another opportunity to leave a lasting impression on me going forward. I rate them 3 stars presently, with room for advancement.

Sweet Confections topped off our trip to NOLA perfectly. The cupcakes and truffles were absolutely delicious, especially the mocha filling and raspberry truffle. The coffee was a lovely accompaniment, not too overpowering or harsh. The seating was cozy and the service was fantastic, though having one more staff member could have enhanced the experience. All in all, a fantastic place for a sugary delight on Magazine St. I'd rate it 4 out of 5 stars.

The pulled pork sandwich was absolutely delicious, but I was pretty bummed out by the Lucky Bun burger because it just didn't hit the mark with the frozen beef patty. The toppings and sauces were excellent, and the bread was tasty, but the processed patty really took away from all the flavors. If they had used freshly ground meat instead, it could have been a fantastic gourmet burger.

This kid-friendly cafe is ideal for families, offering a range of goodies such as juice, cake, and house-made popsicles. The ambiance is reminiscent of a playful tea party for the youngsters, while grown-ups can delight in offerings like freshly baked donuts, patbingsu, and traditional coffee with cream and sugar. I strongly suggest exploring their wide array of menu selections.

Consistently fantastic! The most delicious crust with fresh ingredients and creative toppings. The team is welcoming and the salads are superb. The outdoor seating is ideal for sipping a beer or glass of wine while relishing the finest pizza in the city.
This gas station is a real lifesaver for me working at a beachfront hotel. I often send guests here, and it's the sole 24/7 option on Clearwater Beach. I highly recommend it!
This spot in St. Petersburg is phenomenal and a must-visit. Every item on the menu is scrumptious and will have you feeling so stuffed. Definitely a top-notch experience!

I had a fantastic time at this Chipotle spot. I'm grateful for the shoutout during Teacher Appreciation Week. The service was speedy and the food was scrumptious and flavorful. My favorite bowl with steak and all the fixings always hits the spot. And don't miss out on the opportunity to snag some crispy tortilla chips to round out your meal!
In general, Jimmy John's serves up the usual options without anything particularly impressive or disappointing. The place was really clean, making dining there quite enjoyable.

While on my family vacation in St. Petersburg, I absolutely loved eating at Dooners. The food was amazing, and the staff was so welcoming and kind. I would definitely suggest this restaurant to anyone visiting the area and I would be more than happy to dine there again.

The bar at the Alexander Hotel should be on your list if you love cocktails. The classic cocktails, like "The Elephant in the Room," served in a decanter filled with cherrywood smoke, are a standout. The cozy seating and lovely deck with views of the street create a fantastic vibe. Watching folks exercising at the CityWay YMCA through the window is an interesting touch. And you can't miss the irresistible truffle oil and sea salt popcorn - it's just as delicious as it sounds. Get a beer, savor the cocktails, and keep those popcorn bags coming - you won't be able to resist.

This hotel smack dab in the heart of Philadelphia is a real jewel. The rooms are roomy, sleek, and gorgeously decorated, giving off a warm and delightful atmosphere. The complimentary breakfast is a nice perk, and the round-the-clock lobby offerings of coffee, tea, water, and fruit add to the comfort of your stay. The staff is friendly, accommodating, and really pays attention to the needs of guests. Despite a few noise issues, the hotel's location and amenities make it a fantastic option for travelers. Just be ready for the narrow street and compact shower, and don't anticipate an outstanding view. All in all, a highly recommended place to stay in Philadelphia.

This little-known spot in Northeast Philadelphia serves up scrumptious and hearty dishes at an affordable cost. The oxtail soup (Sancocho) was bursting with rich flavors from the beefy broth and tender potatoes, and the flat steak (Carne Asada) was devoured in no time. With flavors reminiscent of Nanzhou, this eatery is a must-try for anyone looking for tasty and budget-friendly meals. Make sure not to overlook this hidden gem!

I just went to this spot with my pals and we sampled a bunch of donuts, and they were all so good. But for me, the real winner was the fried chicken sandwich. It was absolutely delicious, and I totally suggest giving it a try.

If you're up for a little indulgence, this spot is definitely worth it. The food is scrumptious, including a must-sample green eggs and ham breakfast biscuit. The Santa Barbara tri-tip sandwich was outstanding, and the cold brew coffee was just what I needed. The place has a charming vibe, but it can be a tad tricky to locate. The grab-and-go options are plentiful, with highlights like the salami and pesto sandwich. All in all, it was a fantastic outing and I will absolutely be back. Just keep in mind that prices tend to be on the higher side, as is customary in Santa Barbara.
The food is super tasty, but the service is always slow, even when it's not busy. This inconsistency is disappointing and should definitely be fixed.

I absolutely love going to this Indian restaurant for its amazing food. The vibe is relaxed but nice, and you can always count on getting seated quickly with a smile from the staff. The real star here is the food, especially the fluffy naan bread and yummy dishes like Masala and Vindaloo. While not super spicy, the flavors are top-notch and leave you feeling satisfied. And be sure to save room for the Rice Pudding and Gulab Jamun desserts - they are the perfect sweet ending to your meal. Overall, it's a fantastic spot for delicious Indian food.
This burger is honestly the best I've ever had. The flavors and quality of the meat are truly outstanding. I strongly suggest giving it a try.

According to the review, it appears that the stadium has numerous issues such as limited food choices, absence of vendors, small televisions, and untidy surroundings. The reviewer also cautions about impolite and intoxicated Philadelphia fans, suggesting that guests should bring their own food and exercise caution. In general, the stadium is depicted as a discouraging and unenjoyable outing.

I was completely thrilled with this place! The nostalgic diner atmosphere was amazing, and the staff were extremely friendly. The gumbo was scrumptious, even for someone who isn't a fan of shrimp. The split pea soup was the most delicious I've ever tasted. The prices are unbelievably budget-friendly - we got a plethora of food and beers for just $25. Such a fantastic bargain!

This jewelry store is absolutely fabulous! Ali and Albisia are fantastic owners who design exquisite and one-of-a-kind pieces that are simply irresistible. The store has a delightful ambiance with music and wine provided as you peruse. I'm eagerly anticipating my next trip to Tampa so I can acquire more of their gorgeous jewelry for my collection!

The menu at this place is great and the ingredients are top-notch, but the sandwiches are badly put together. The Turkey and Brie Wrap and Spinach Florentine Wrap felt more like squishes than wraps. The staff appeared unsure and in a hurry, with no clear guidance for customers. It would be beneficial to have signs to guide traffic.

This bakery is incredible! The staff is incredibly attentive and the desserts are crafted to perfection. The banana puddings are a must-try, with multiple layers of deliciousness. The upside pineapple cake is also amazing, with a dense and flavorful cake. I highly recommend this place for scrumptious desserts, just remember to bring cash for tipping as they only accept payment through an iPad.

I recently checked out the new Paoli spot and was blown away by the extensive variety of mouthwatering donuts. These donuts are a refreshing departure from what Dunkin' has, featuring flavors such as Salted Caramel, Bacon Maple, and Lemon. The breakfast sandwiches, muffins, and bagels were also delightful choices on the menu. In general, it's a fantastic spot to grab a tasty morning snack.

Following a disappointing encounter, Chris, the manager at Hermitage O'Charley's, made an effort to extend a gesture of goodwill. Despite initially turning down the offer for special treatment, the return visit turned out to be delightful with exceptional service, delectable cuisine, and an overall fantastic experience. Further trips to the establishment have continued to be consistently pleasant. I strongly suggest revisiting this particular location for another opportunity.

I absolutely adore my haircut! The prices are really fair, and this is my second visit. The first time, the cut and style were fantastic but the color was just a bit off. Still, I felt great and I plan to keep coming back. I highly recommend this place!

This Thai restaurant really stands out with their meticulous care in the food and how it's all presented. They focus on providing both tasty and nutritious choices, with special ingredients such as Japanese squash and white and black sticky rice in their dishes. The sauces are exceptional and there's a great range of dishes to pick from. They're excellent at catering to dietary preferences and even add nice touches like welcome snacks and straw wrappers shaped like roses. We've found our new favorite Thai spot.

This grocery store in Mid-city is a real treasure with an amazing deli, soup selection, hot bar, and salad bar. It's like a budget-friendly alternative to Whole Foods and they even have weekend crawfish or lobster boils. You've got to taste their fried chicken! I'd totally pick this store as my regular spot if I was a local. And you can't go wrong with supporting a local business.

I really enjoyed my time at this quaint cafe/coffee shop in the French quarter of New Orleans. The food and coffee were amazing, the atmosphere was welcoming and laid-back, and the Victorian architecture really added to the charm. The service was a tad sluggish, but the barista was friendly. The assortment of seating choices, from indoor and outdoor tables to a booth and a counter, made it ideal for unwinding. The pet-friendly policy was a nice touch, although it might not suit everyone. My one gripe is that I only had the chance to stop by once during my trip.
The teas they have are really good, but with the pushy sales tactics and crazy high prices, it's tough to see the value. I suggest checking out cheaper alternatives like Republic of Tea or Twinings.

Although Millers offers a convenient location, plenty of parking, and spacious tables complete with a cozy fireplace, my visit was ultimately unsatisfactory. Despite the extended waiting periods, the cuisine failed to impress. While the portions were sizable, they lacked taste, and both the presentation and flavors were disappointing. The service provided was commendable, as our server was courteous and attentive, yet the dining experience as a whole fell short. The plastic tableware and steep prices did not align with the food quality. I don't anticipate revisiting Millers, and my husband may only opt for takeout specifically for the wings.

The facilities are decent, but the lack of thoroughness in cleanliness and mediocre cleaning services are significant downsides. It's disappointing for a regular member of six months. Additionally, struggling to communicate with staff who don't speak English adds to the frustration. There is room for improvement, but the letdown remains.

The Libertine provides a distinctive and invigorating experience, utilizing fresh ingredients in their beverages, right down to the crushed ice. The ambiance is inviting, although the restroom indicators might be perplexing because of the low lighting and resemblance of faces in the pictures. In general, it's a great option for someone visiting a bar for the first time.

I was told to check this place out and I was definitely impressed. The pizza was amazing and the staff were really nice. They were quick and I had a great time. I'll be back for sure and I'll tell my friends about it.

The cheddar curds from the Collingswood Art Festival may be a tad expensive, but they're totally worth it. They're just the right amount of flavorful, not too oily, and absolutely mouthwatering. The cheese pulls and melts like a dream, and the sauces pair with it flawlessly. Once you have a taste, you'll definitely crave more. Investing in these cheese curds is money well spent - a definite must for any cheese enthusiast!

Yats serves mouthwatering Cajun dishes at a reasonable price. The diverse selection displayed on a blackboard in sidewalk chalk, which includes vegetarian dishes, ensures you'll discover something delightful. The option to split plates and the incredible garlic bread truly stand out. Moreover, proprietor Joe Vuskovich is a well-known local figure celebrated for his special seasoning and dedication to the community. I strongly suggest trying it out for a distinct and flavorful meal.

Pi is always a go-to spot with top-notch service and mouthwatering deep dish and thin crust pizzas. The hostess truly saved the day following our last dining mishap, promptly seating us and even treating us to complimentary garlic bread. I definitely suggest giving it a try.
Overall, I had a good experience having my wisdom teeth removed at this dental office. Nevertheless, the inconsistency of seeing various dentists over the last 5 years has been a downside for me.

This spot was suggested by a fellow Yelp Elite member. When we got there on a Saturday morning, there was already a line starting to form. The takoyaki was really tasty and the fried octopus was enjoyable, however, a little more mayo would've made it even better. The ramen noodles were overdone and didn't quite match the dish well. Even though the broth was rich in flavor, the red chili broth turned out to be a tad too spicy to my taste. The prices were fair and the ambiance was pleasant, but the disruptive kids running around made the dining experience somewhat less enjoyable.

Having tried many breakfast places in Philly, this cozy cafe truly shines as the ultimate spot. The dishes are fresh, tasty, and straightforward. Even though the space is small, the menu can measure up to bigger places like Parc. I highly suggest it for breakfast lovers.

I was pleasantly surprised by this diner. Even though it may not look fancy, the food was really amazing. The biscuits and gravy were outstanding and the servings were quite big. I definitely suggest giving this place a try.

Luke is a popular and stylish place, but might be a little noisy and relaxed for some. The food is absolutely worth a try, from crunchy Brussels sprouts to tasty pork schnitzel. The team is helpful and welcoming. It's advisable to book ahead as it can get crowded. All in all, a fantastic 4-star outing.

Fantastic beers, particularly the porter, double IPA, and table gutt. The food is outstanding, especially if Russian cuisine is your jam. The special with sausage and sauerkraut was delicious, and opting for the pickled everything appetizer was a fantastic decision. This place is absolutely amazing.

Rickshaw is without a doubt the ultimate sushi spot in Reno for those who prioritize fresh fish over elaborate rolls and sauces. Their Nigiri and sashimi choices are exceptional and unparalleled in terms of quality. If you're a genuine sushi enthusiast, Rickshaw is definitely a place worth exploring.

I was not impressed with my first time at this restaurant. Finding parking was a hassle, but they had a good selection of beers. The fried olives were a highlight, but the other starters were average. The blue cheese chips, calamari, and meat and cheese platter didn't excite me. I could consider giving this place another try, but my overall experience was underwhelming.

The eatery boasts a pleasant atmosphere and prime location, but the restricted menu and mediocre dishes don't quite meet the expectations. It's alright for a meal, but nothing outstanding to rave about.

I loved this place! The ice cream was awesome, especially the pumpkin cake and nutter butter flavors. The brownie sundae was a total hit, and the staff were so friendly and helpful. I'm really looking forward to coming back to try the hot chocolate next time!

The eatery, situated in the spot where an old O'Henry's used to be, wasn't very busy for a Friday lunch. We were seated upstairs, which didn't have much atmosphere but we chose to stay. The Catfish Acadian was tasty, with a mysterious sauce that went really well with the fish. The veggies were also nicely cooked. However, the pork chop didn't quite hit the mark. Our server, Bria, was friendly and kept a close eye on our needs. The food was decent, but the overall vibe was somewhat lacking. We might come back for dinner and take a shot at sitting on the balcony, a recommendation given to us.

My first visit to this place was really disappointing. The appetizers were undercooked, no jumbo wings as promised, and I even found a feather in my food. The overall quality was definitely lacking. The waitress treated us differently from other customers, which made me feel unwelcome. Although the manager did end up covering the cost of our meal, it doesn't make up for the bad experience. I won't be coming back and wouldn't suggest this place, especially for same-sex couples. 1 out of 5 stars.

This review articulates annoyance with the ongoing presence of a K-Mart store that stubbornly remains open despite being outdated and badly run. The reviewer yearns for a better retailer like Target to take over and supplant the obsolete store. They point out several cases of deceitful advertising and price manipulation as grounds for their discontent with the store.

Don't be fooled by the outside appearance, this spot is actually very delightful indoors. The food is delicious and reasonably priced. The papaya salad was a tad strong on the fish sauce, but the triple flavor duck and king tofu soup were both excellent choices. Also, it's bring your own which is always a nice perk!

The Mazzoni Center offers a welcoming and inclusive space for people seeking caring healthcare services. Though the clinic's layout might seem open, the team values honoring your identity and requirements. Walk-in visits might lead to extended waits, yet reaching out in advance for scheduling guidance can be beneficial. Sometimes, there might be communication hiccups, but on the whole, the care given is thoughtful and empathetic. If the physician you wish to consult with is unavailable, leaving a message at the front desk will prompt prompt support.

This BBQ joint just doesn't stack up to Texan expectations. The sampler plate was a letdown - the chicken tasted like it came straight from the freezer, the ribs were all bones, the sausage had no flavor, and the sauce was way too sugary. The prices were steep for portions that seemed more fitting for a kid's meal. I wouldn't suggest this place to anyone.

In general, this is an excellent spot for wine enthusiasts. The happy hour specials are amazing, offering $5 glasses and $5 off bottles. The food, particularly the cheese platters and sandwiches, is delightful. The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, particularly in the enclosed patio section. The service is also exceptional. I highly suggest it for an evening with friends or a romantic date.

The employees were really impolite and couldn't even manage to bring our salad right. The costs for slices were way too expensive. Even though we were the only ones there, the wait for food took forever. Don't bother spending your money here.

Genuine and mouthwatering Mexican dishes that are just like homemade meals. Noteworthy options are the enchiladas smothered in mole sauce and carne asada tacos. Definitely a must-eat for anyone wanting true Mexican flavors.

The cinnamon rolls from the bake house are a definite must-try for anyone looking for sheer happiness and enjoyment. Enjoy it with a cup of coffee and a crisp salad for an ideal Saturday morning breakfast delight.

I felt really let down by the carrot cake from this bakery. It had a weird flavor of licorice and baking soda, and the chocolate chips just didn't seem to fit well. It's a pity because all the other treats at the bakery seemed so tempting.

The prices for endless food are amazing, but the quality can be hit or miss. The sushi is delicious, the salad is just okay, and the crab Rangoon is quite disappointing. I might return, but I've had better dining experiences elsewhere.
The chicken at this Bourbon St. spot is absolutely amazing. Both the chicken itself and the sauce are outstanding. Overall, a great pick for a tasty meal.

The burger at this restaurant isn't cheap at $16, but it's seriously tasty and totally worth it. The patty is big and the special ingredients, like gruyere in a pepper, really amp up the flavor. The fries are crunchy and seasoned just right, and the bun is top-notch. The vibe is cozy and they've got a good selection of craft beers. It might get crowded on weekends, but the food is so good, it's worth a little wait.

I had a disappointing breakfast on 12/2/17. The service was slow, the coffee was cold, the grits were warm, and there were long waits for food and payment. There are better breakfast options in the area -- I should have chosen another place.

Termini Brothers is absolutely amazing! Their dessert trays are always a big hit at our family gatherings. Coming from an Italian family, we always make sure to have their cannolis available and they are always fantastic. I highly recommend trying their delicious treats!
This hotel is amazing with superb service and fantastic dining choices. The rooms are spotless and cozy. I highly recommend it for a delightful stay.

Coming back to Reno after our time in New Orleans really made me grateful for this place! You've got to try the shrimp po boy here, it's so good, and the corn bread is just amazing. I highly suggest it!

The individuals at this establishment are typically cordial, but it's advisable to steer clear of Katie. During my visit for a hair appointment, she hurried through the process, applying color and trimming rapidly. It seemed as though she was eager to finish quickly, leaving me disheartened given the significant expense of the service. I departed feeling unsettled from the encounter.

The spot close to Vanderbilt University is a must-visit for breakfast in Nashville. The banana pancakes are a must-try - they're like banana bread but in the form of pancakes. Remember to park in the rear lot and pick up a parking ticket from the machine for complimentary parking. It's consistently crowded but the wait is worthwhile. A fantastic spot for breakfast that I always make sure to visit before leaving Nashville.

MexiCali in University City has a great selection of tasty vegan choices that can be customized simply by skipping the cheese. One must-try option is the marinated tofu burrito, known for its chewy texture and protein-rich filling. Other delicious picks for vegans include the sweet potato and plantain burrito, veggie tacos, and guacamole burrito. This spot has a devoted fan base and quick service, making it a go-to spot for a fulfilling plant-based meal.

The breakfast options at this place were pretty good with standout items such as the eggs provençale and pastries. But the unevenly cooked eggs and really bad coffee were big downsides. And seeing misspellings on the menu made me worry about their attention to detail.

This restaurant has a vibrant ambiance with large screen TVs, but it's not your average sports bar. The place is hip and there's a nice variety of beer. The food is tasty, but might not meet traditional pub food standards. Perfect for a lively and dynamic time, but not the best choice for a laid-back burger and beer night to catch a game.

I had an amazing, speedy, and hassle-free windshield repair experience with this company. The greatest part was that it didn't cost me anything out of pocket. I would absolutely use their services again and highly recommend them to others.

This meal was absolutely amazing from beginning to end. The service was top-notch, and the food was among the best I've ever had in New Orleans. The oysters were a definite must-try starter, and the scallops and swine with butternut squash purée was a standout main course. For dessert, the cafe au lait panna cotta with mini glazed donuts was a perfect way to wrap up the meal. The house made 'cellos added a special and tasty touch. Overall, it was an incredible dining experience that I would enthusiastically suggest.

BARRA surpassed all of our expectations during Restaurant Week. From bold and delightful blood orange margaritas to tasty veal and beef meatballs, each dish was a winner. The fisherman stew was a delightful surprise and the steak with cauliflower puree was cooked and seasoned to perfection. The service was exceptional, with a server who expertly navigated us through the menu and checked in regularly. BARRA is a must-visit for anyone looking for fantastic food, outstanding service, and a warm atmosphere at a fair price. I highly recommend it!

Even though the wait was long and the seating was cramped, the breakfast at this busy restaurant was worth it. The cornmeal pancakes were filling and light, while the banana pancakes were quite tasty too. The only drawback was the small portion of bacon in the side dish. The service was decent given the rush. A suggested place for a scrumptious breakfast, just don't anticipate exceptional coffee.

Had a letdown at this bar on a Monday. Requested the bartender to switch on the NBA game but got informed that she was busy watching Netflix. Customer service was definitely lacking. Decided that I won't be coming back.

The Pearl truly deserves all the stars in the sky. The food, service, and ambiance are absolutely outstanding. I always have a fantastic time everytime I visit and it's not just a meal - it's a whole dining adventure. You deserve to indulge in a meal here and spoil yourself rotten.

The bagels at this spot are really tasty, but remember to request more cream cheese if you prefer a generous amount. The employees are consistently friendly, which sets this place apart in Dunedin. However, I was let down to find out that the man preparing the food doesn't wash his hands or wear gloves. He touched money, answered the phone, and wiped his nose before making my bagel. This unsanitary conduct has convinced me not to come back. If cleanliness isn't a big deal for you, the bagels are still worth sampling.
My husband's haircut looked fantastic, but sadly, my son's didn't turn out as expected. It might be best to stay with our usual stylist for future appointments to keep things consistent.
All in all, the steak was delicious but a bit on the expensive side. The guacamole was pretty ordinary, even though it was prepared right in front of us.

I really enjoy visiting New Day Meadery in Fountain Square! They have a great selection of meads and ciders, and the staff is consistently welcoming. My usual picks are the South Cider or Shelby Blue Ribbon, but I ventured out with the seasonal Paulding Light and savored its distinct blend of flavors. While it's not as sugary as my typical choices, that's precisely why I value New Day - catering to different preferences. Undoubtedly, one of my preferred places to frequent!
I think this spot is better than the one in Philadelphia, but I still prefer Szechuan House in Hamilton, NJ.
The food and service at this restaurant are amazing - everything is so delicious and full of flavor. I'll definitely come back for more.

Had a pretty disappointing time at the Make Up For Ever store in King of Prussia. I splurged $75 on products but ended up not liking them after using them for 5 days. Couldn't get a refund since I'd already opened the items, so had to exchange them instead and fork out more cash. Wasn't too thrilled with the products, so I probably won't shop there again. On a brighter note, the Sephora in King of Prussia has a more customer-friendly return policy for the same products.

My top pick for happy hour in Center City! Found it during center city sips in 2011 and haven't looked back. The starters are fantastic, especially the mac & cheese. They have a great variety of beers and a snug basement area ideal for private gatherings. Every now and then, a few unexpected visitors pop up looking to use the ATM and restroom, but that shouldn't spoil your experience. Just head over and have a good time!

Getting the incorrect drink (peach tea lemonade instead of green tea lemonade) every time on three different occasions is really annoying and inconvenient. Having to go back inside to get the drink fixed is a hassle that could be easily avoided with more attention to detail.

The pizza was okay and the experience was there was nothing special about it. The people making the pizza were nice, but the person at the register seemed a bit uninterested. It was quick and got the job done, but didn't leave a lasting impression. I wouldn't make a special trip back, but might stop by if I'm in the area.

The restaurant had a welcoming hostess and a remarkable remodel, but was plagued by a strong odor of dirty mop water. The lack of menu variety was unexpected, but the "Knuckle Sandwich" was delightful. On the other hand, the mushroom swiss burger was underwhelming and the chicken strips were flavorless. The service was disrupted by the noisy atmosphere and the tepid beer. All in all, there is potential for improvement, but still a chance for success. 2 stars.

I enjoyed a scrumptious breakfast at Tuttini a while back, but my most recent lunch visit was quite underwhelming. Even though their sign clearly mentioned serving lunch until 2:30 PM, I was unexpectedly turned away at 1:45 PM. The kitchen had shut down earlier than usual, forcing me to find another spot for my meal. The erratic service really didn't sit well with me.

I absolutely loved my time at this restaurant. The service was fast and so welcoming, the portion sizes were really good for the price, and the pancakes were cooked just right. I would definitely suggest trying it out.

I always return to this restaurant because the food is amazing, the vibe is relaxing, and the people working there are super nice. The crepes are absolutely scrumptious, the best I've ever tasted. I always suggest this spot to my friends, and they've had nothing but good things to say about it too.

The folks at Tires Plus in Flourtown have always been quick and efficient whenever I've gotten tires from them. When I stopped by recently for new Michelins to be put on, my car was taken care of right away and given back to me in just an hour. I definitely suggest them for fast and dependable tire services.

Wildflower Cafe is an amazing place for brunch. The Wildflower Triple selection really impressed us, offering a range of tasty options to choose from. The food was exceptional and the service was incredibly friendly. We are definitely thinking about coming back while we're still in town.

My significant other and I had a fantastic time at happy hour thanks to the outstanding service from Vaughn and Mark. The complimentary appetizer was delightful, and the slot machines brought an extra dose of entertainment. We can't wait to come back for another wonderful evening. I absolutely suggest checking it out!
This place serves mouth-watering yogurt and crepes. You should definitely give it a try!

The event was super packed and low on wine choices. Most vendors were promoting or selling beer and snacks. By 3 o'clock, many tables had run out of items. Not a good value for the money and probably won't come back next year.

All in all, I've had a fantastic time at this restaurant. The serving staff are really attentive and go above and beyond to ensure you enjoy your meal. The seafood was pretty good, especially given the limited fresh choices around here. The sauces were delicious, with an interesting Asian touch. The prices are fair compared to other seafood places, and you definitely get your money's worth for the tasty food and top-notch service. I'd suggest checking this place out, and I'm definitely coming back.

The meal at this restaurant was delicious and freshly made, especially the homemade oso bucco ravioli which was exceptional. However, the ravioli lacked enough filling, impacting the taste. The service was excellent, but the noisy setting made it hard to chat. The tables were cramped, not ideal for a romantic evening. Bringing your own drinks was a bonus, but in general, there are better choices nearby with quieter ambiance, more room, and tastier dishes.

Relocating to Philadelphia from the Midwest at the age of 19, Yuengling Lager swiftly secured a spot as one of my top five favorite brews. Its smooth, sweet, and affordable nature resonated with me on a personal level. I admire the quaint bottle caps and the distinct flavor in each batch. The relatively modest alcohol content is an added bonus. The brewery tour was a delightful experience, particularly due to the witty British guide who developed a fondness for my grandpa. The establishment exuded a charming 1950s ambiance reminiscent of my high school days. The sampling session was exceptional, offering ample opportunities to savor the lager. The fact that Dick Yuengling made a point to prioritize rehiring laid-off employees post-closure only elevated my regard for this family-run enterprise. For beer aficionados seeking to champion a local brewery in the midst of industry giants, this place is a must-visit.

During Mardi Gras weekend, this spot is handy due to its location near the parade route and outdoor seating area. Yet, the service was subpar with bartenders who struggled with drink orders and lacked basic beer knowledge. The pizza was also underwhelming. The only silver lining was the presence of Port-O-Potties.

I definitely suggest checking out this spot for a soothing and welcoming pedicure experience. The atmosphere is spotless, and the team is extremely friendly. It's the perfect spot to indulge in a lovely treatment for your feet.

The new burger joint downtown, part of the Harry & Izzy's franchise, serves up delicious burgers, but just a heads up, you'll need to order sides a la carte. They do take reservations and their service is top-notch. However, if you're not in the mood for a burger, this might not be the place for you. Offering a weekday lunch special could draw in more folks during the workday. All in all, it's definitely a worthwhile experience to give a try.

I felt let down by my time at this restaurant. The salad was decent, however, the pizza was bland, unappealing, and left me unsatisfied. The atmosphere felt chilly on that cool evening, which only added to my sense of letdown. This was my third time here, but I won't be coming back.

The whole thing was a letdown since the sandwich counter was shut, and the reheated burrito from the microwave was not tasty and cost too much at $8. The mix of cream of chicken and stale cheese on top wasn't appetizing. My suggestion would be to head over to Taco Bell for a more satisfying meal.

The pub has a cozy vintage vibe with lots of activities for kids. The beer choices are decent, but it would be nice to see some more unique options. The food can be inconsistent, with delicious burgers and sweets, but a few dishes are overly salty. It's a pleasant spot for unwinding over a hearty meal and a pint.

Zen Yai has great deals on their curry dishes, most are under $12. The cozy setting has its perks and downsides, nice without a wait but packed during peak times. The decor is lively and colorful, adding to the vibe. Service was prompt and effective. The Pineapple curry was delightful, while the green curry didn't quite hit the mark for someone who loves green curry. All in all, a dependable choice for tasty and budget-friendly Thai food.

After multiple visits, I've come to love this hotel. The team is amazing, from the cleaning staff to the valets. The rooms are spotless, cozy, and the Sucre chocolates left during turndown service add a personal touch. Special K was fantastic and the valet service was quick. The Gold Status reception was a great addition. The only hiccup was a mini-bar fee, but it was sorted out promptly. Can't wait to come back.
The sushi rolls and sake were amazing. The cozy bamboo room definitely elevated the whole experience, though it might be challenging for some to access.

I'm really loving that they provide food delivery, and the gyro I ordered was incredibly delicious and generous in size. The tzaziki was just right, and the meat was so tender. Honestly, I didn't even end up needing the fries that were included. I'm totally going to be coming back for more!

I swung by for some takeout and a drink at happy hour. I gave the dragonberry iced tea a go, and it was so refreshing, not too much like a fancy cocktail. The lemongrass chicken and rice was amazing, but I thought the crab rangoon could've used more filling. In all my visits, the food and service have always been top-notch.
I really suggest trying out the #1 Deluxe at this place. The quality and service are always top-notch. Amanda gave outstanding customer service, really going the extra mile.

I was really looking forward to staying at this lovely hotel in a fantastic location, with rooms that perfectly fit my taste. Sadly, my stay was spoiled by the discovery of bed bugs. The staff handled the situation well, but the hassle, cost, and concern about taking the bugs back home made me certain that I won't be returning. I advise others to reconsider booking here until they've replaced all carpets and mattresses to make sure the bugs are completely gone.

I got to the restaurant at 8:30am on a Saturday and got seated right away without waiting. I decided on the sweet potato pancakes with cinnamon cream syrup which were delicious, but the hash browns were pretty close to terrible. The bill added up to $24.43 before tips. It was a letdown to find no paper towels in the restroom. All in all, I doubt I'd come back, but I'd opt to purchase the syrup and cook pancakes at home instead.

Even though the store is usually not crowded and simple to get around, the condition of the red baskets is quite unpleasant. It's cool that they've cleared up aisles for better movement, but it feels like they don't have enough cashiers on duty most of the time. Nonetheless, the variety of products at Marsh is consistently great. It would definitely improve the shopping experience if they address the problems with the baskets and staffing.

Innovative cuisine and high-quality ingredients really stand out at this restaurant. The coffee and tea they offer while you wait for a table are outstanding, and their Bloody Marys are a definite must-have. Each visit promises to be a culinary journey with a variety of intriguing dishes to choose from on the menu.
This place has an amazing vibe and a huge selection of beers to pick from. The Asian chicken salads and Cajun pasta were absolutely delicious. We'll definitely be returning.

I've been a huge fan of this spot ever since I stumbled upon it 25 years ago at the University of Delaware. I'm so excited to see it spreading to more places, but I'm really looking forward to it landing in Huntsville, AL. This particular spot had loads of seating, was nice and tidy, and played awesome tunes. The only bummer was the absence of Herr's chips, but that's no biggie. If this spot is anything like the rest I've visited, it's going to be awesome!

The prices appeared fair initially, but turned out to be misleading because of the extra fees for every small item. The food quality was mediocre, with tough and parched rice and unappetizing, droopy burritos. The waitress we encountered during both visits displayed a terrible demeanor. The lone positive aspect was the delectable guacamole and potent margaritas. It seems like the goal is to intoxicate patrons enough to ignore the inadequate food and service.

My partner and I visited a new Italian restaurant in Trolley Square and we were so impressed. The waiter was really nice and knew a lot about the menu, the food was so tasty and fresh, and they were really generous with the portion sizes. The prosciutto wrapped shrimp and Penne Alla Vodka were absolutely delicious, and the cannoli was just incredible. Overall, we had an amazing time dining there, especially with the awesome deal we got that night. I highly recommend giving this place a try for a delicious Italian meal that won't break the bank.

I'd rate the restaurant 3.5 stars because they didn't serve any alcohol, which was a downer after a tough week. Still, the margherita pizza was scrumptious, and the Greek salad was loaded with crisp, flavorful veggies. On the whole, it's a solid pick for a tasty meal.

I really like Mr. Wizard's because they offer healthier frozen yogurt choices and you can create your own mix. It can be a bit of a hassle that they only have outdoor seating when it's cold, but it's still a fantastic place for a delicious snack.

The restaurant has a diverse range of menu choices, spanning from breakfast to dessert, and stays open 24 hours. The food was delicious, the staff was welcoming, but the meaning behind the name and logo is a bit mysterious. In general, it's a fantastic place to check out while in the area.
I had an amazing dining experience at Spasso with my friends. The seafood special over pappardelle was absolutely delicious, and the service was outstanding. Can't wait to visit again soon!

I revisited the salon for a touch-up but decided to skip the pedicure upon learning it would cost more than $85. The owner appeared friendly at first but turned indifferent after I rejected the steep fees. Without any clarification, she promptly switched my nail technician. This action revealed her preference for newcomers, reflecting subpar customer care. Frustrated by the inconsistent treatment, I left without receiving any services. Many individuals aren't keen on shelling out hundreds of dollars at a nail salon, no matter the product quality.

The ice cream at this Belmawr spot wasn't particularly remarkable and seemed a bit pricey, but it did hit the spot for my sweet tooth. The service was warm albeit a tad sluggish, and the inviting decor enhanced the overall appeal. If I resided in the area, I could see myself popping in again, but it's not compelling enough for a dedicated journey.

Devlin's is the top auto body shop in Philadelphia, in my view. Ed Devlin performed wonders on my Honda Fit, which had gathered nicks, dents, scratches, and lime deposit stains. When I received my car back, it appeared like new. The service was reasonably priced and I was pleasantly taken aback by the ultimate bill. Ed Devlin is truly a miracle worker.

45 might not be the fanciest place, but it's a cozy spot like the bar in "Cheers" where everybody knows your name (if you're able to spot through the cigarette smoke). The relaxed atmosphere and tasty bites on game day make it a top spot, particularly for Red Sox enthusiasts. And the food truck parked outside is a delicious extra treat. It's great for grabbing a drink before or after a show at Tipitinas just around the corner.

The coffee is really good, but it can be a bit annoying to have to request cream and sugar separately. It feels a bit snobby and unnecessary for something as basic as personalizing coffee. Just serve it to me how I prefer without the extra step.

Whenever I visit this brunch place, I've only ventured into trying their grits, and they are unbelievably delicious, making it almost impossible not to indulge in them each visit. The serving size is generous, suitable for sharing. Having the choice to customize your bowl with extra toppings is a wonderful feature, and my personal favorites include avocados, red bell peppers, bacon, cheddar, and mushrooms. The grits are luxuriously smooth and bursting with flavor. While I'm confident their other menu items are equally exceptional, I simply can't resist going back for more of their delightful grits.

Lovely staff, scrumptious chili cheese etoufee, and the choice to dine outside when the weather's pleasant. Just remember, they only accept cash. Don't miss out on the garlic sauce! Rating: 4 out of 5 stars.

The outdoor tables provide a lovely view, ideal for savoring a beverage. The food and service are what you'd expect at a beachside eatery, but the setting is fantastic for a laid-back and soothing vibe. Perfect spot for a refreshing drink with a scenic outlook.

I would totally give six or maybe even seven stars if I could. Lou at All About Hair is just amazing. After searching for a great barber for three years, I finally stumbled upon this gem. Lou not only hooked me up with an awesome haircut, but also made the whole experience so enjoyable with his great conversation and friendly vibe. I haven't written a Yelp! review in ages, but I just had to spread the word about my fantastic time at All About Hair. I absolutely recommend it.
The last trip didn't go well because the skin glue didn't work properly and left a scar on the child. Even so, the person is still thinking about going back to the same place with their kids.

This hotel provides breathtaking airport views and the one-of-a-kind opportunity to dine at the only rotating rooftop restaurant. Additionally, it is conveniently linked to the airport, offering diverse dining and shopping choices. The scenic vistas from the restaurant that overlook the runways and control tower are absolutely unforgettable.
I really adore this place! The turkey, beans, and biscuits are amazing. The pecan pie could be improved, but that won't stop me from coming back.

The restaurant offers a diverse menu, well-maintained facilities, and welcoming staff. Even though they were bustling when we dropped by, the service was quick. The sandwich we tried was scrumptious and their array of draft beer, wine, and mixed drinks was quite impressive. The place had a cozy, family-friendly vibe with crayons on every table and big paper sheets for the kids to doodle on, which made our meal even more delightful. All in all, it was a fantastic experience at this family-oriented eatery and bar.
The crab cocktail was fantastic, and my husband absolutely enjoyed his steamers. The only downside was the high humidity in the restaurant; a fan would be a great addition.

Freddy's serves up top-notch fast-food style burgers made with fresh meat and incredible toppings. Their scrumptious fries paired with "fry" sauce are the perfect side dish. The custard is velvety, indulgent, and simply amazing. All in all, Freddy's is a must-visit for fans of burgers and custard.
Tasty and reasonably priced donuts! The blueberry cake and apple fritter were both fantastic. I'll definitely be coming back for more.

I had a great time at the Nashville spot, but the New Orleans location was not as good. We got there at 10pm and waited for 25 minutes with no service or apology because the kitchen was slow. I really hope this isn't how all their places are.

Allegro's has affordable and quick pizza with a wide range of choices, including stuffed crust. But sometimes the service can be impolite, and the atmosphere might be less than perfect with some eccentric individuals having conversations with themselves.

The Peppermill Casino in Reno is a must-visit spot. Guests can expect top-notch service, pristine rooms, and fantastic amenities. The casino touts having the loosest slots around, as well as offering great happy hour specials and distinctive features such as the Fish bar showcasing a 40-foot aquarium. Although the dazzling lights might be a bit overwhelming, the welcoming staff and overall experience ensure that visitors keep coming back for more. Just be sure to have your key sleeve close by to navigate the sprawling casino floor.

I really enjoyed my time at this restaurant! The burger was fantastic and the pulled pork was really tasty. My wife absolutely loved her egg white and goat cheese omelette. The beer selection was impressive and the spicy bloody Mary was absolutely delicious. The service was top-notch and the eclectic playlist added to the fun atmosphere.

Peppermill's management didn't show appreciation to a guest who helped in a troubling situation, instructing them to go back to their room or risk being seen as a trespasser. Despite multiple tries to connect and resolve the issue, the guest didn't get any reply. The unfavorable way the staff handled the situation and their lack of follow-up created a bad experience, leading to the choice of not visiting Peppermill again.

If you're a student on a tight budget, think about staying at hotels across the street from the convention center for more wallet-friendly choices. The conference center is huge and offers fantastic amenities like shuttle service and well-prepared meals. Dining inside the center can be expensive, but there are chain restaurants close by for more economical selections. The hotel might not have the highest quality, but it's a solid option for cutting costs. In general, a great choice for students who are mindful of their budgets attending conferences.

Although the children adored the individual pizzas at this eatery, the inability to customize the pizzas to our liking, specifically with BBQ sauce instead of tomato sauce, left us feeling let down. Despite having ordered it that way previously, the employees were firm in their refusal to make the change. Consequently, we had to depart and find another place for lunch, leading us to opt against returning in the days to come.
This place is adorable and the staff are extremely friendly. The cookie dough is absolutely divine. A spot you must visit, especially if you find yourself wandering in town.
The tacos were alright, but the chips and salsa were underwhelming. It wasn't a very memorable meal.

I'm so excited about my new favorite spot in Reno! The matcha and ube flavors are absolutely delicious and authentic. The staff is incredibly welcoming, and the soft serve, cake, and sauces are just the right amount of sweetness. I can't wait for them to introduce more flavors in the future, building on their already fantastic selection. This place is a must-visit for anyone who loves desserts!

I found this restaurant after a quick search on Yelp and I'm really happy I did. The cozy interior with some hip hop playing really creates a nice atmosphere. The Duck Fries were amazing, topped with smoked gouda, shredded duck, and scallions. The scallop and foie gras tacos were a delightful special and incredibly tasty. The pork roll burger was so juicy and cooked perfectly. I will definitely visit again.

Three Muses in New Orleans serves up tasty tapas style dishes perfect for sharing. The blue cheese stuffed dates, lamb sliders, and steak and cake were exceptional. The pairing of goat cheese with the lamb was spot on, and the crab cake was absolutely delicious. I'd suggest passing on the fish tacos. All in all, it was a fantastic dining experience.

I particularly liked the atmosphere and style of the restaurant. The way the dishes were served was quite striking, but the taste of the food fell short for me. The potatoes weren't cooked properly and the pancakes were too oily. I'm open to giving it another chance, especially to sample the appealing french toast and omelette. The customer service was top-notch and I'm intrigued to explore their lunch options too.

This place is amazing! The food is mouthwatering, the service is incredibly friendly, and the homemade flan is outstanding. The prices are reasonable, but having a liquor license would truly elevate this place.

Enjoyed a fantastic breakfast with the family, all thanks to the delicious food and excellent service from Jonathan. Even though the restaurant was bustling, we were promptly seated on a Saturday morning. Truly a hidden gem that deserves a visit.

The Praline Connection really hit the spot for our family, especially Dad who couldn't stop praising the soul platter. The fried chicken was a definite winner, taking him back to his childhood with its rich flavors. Although the ribs were a bit tricky to eat, we all had a great time thanks to the delicious sides like potato salad and cornbread. Mom was pleased with her meatloaf and sides too. The only letdown was the mac and cheese feeling a little lackluster. In general, we highly recommend this place for some genuine southern cuisine.

Buddy Brew in Hyde Park Village is a hip coffee spot with delicious coffee and stunning latte art. The sleek design and complimentary parking are great, but the cramped seating and chilly temperatures might make it better for quick coffee runs.

V Vegaz is a fabulous find in the East Loop, providing trendy haircuts in a sleek interior with a fantastic atmosphere. Callie is an exceptional stylist who comprehends the dynamics of hair growth and movement, delivering consistently amazing cuts. I highly suggest this comprehensive salon for individuals seeking a distinctive and top-notch hair treatment.

The woman who works here is amazing! I needed multiple adjustments done quickly, and she not only finished all of them in one day but did a fantastic job. The suit fits me perfectly now and is all set for my trip. They take all credit cards and have convenient hours. I will definitely come back. I highly recommend!

The Irish Pol is a fantastic spot with an impressive array of beers on tap and a lively vibe on weekend evenings. Nonetheless, the happy hour fell short in terms of atmosphere, appearing gloomy and having only a few beverage choices. Opt for Saturday nights to make the most of this undisclosed watering hole.
The spaghetti and meatballs at this restaurant are absolutely delicious. The warm atmosphere just makes the dining experience even better. This is now my go-to Italian place.

You've gotta check out Happy Hour at this restaurant. The 50 cent oysters and half price drinks were such a steal. The beet salad was absolutely amazing and the mussels and flammenkuchen were top-notch too. The flammenkuchen, with caramelized onions, cheese, and bacon on top, was a standout dish that totally blew me away. Definitely give it a try.

I've eaten at this restaurant three times and every time has been really good. The place is smoke-free and quiet, perfect for families. The food and service have both been excellent every time. I've tried different dishes on each visit and have always been happy. I will absolutely come back to this restaurant.
The pizza was scrumptious and the ambiance was welcoming. The service was amiable and prompt. It was a fantastic experience all around.

Richard's is an awesome new spot in the downtown area. The Caesar salad and bread were really fresh and flavorful, and the cheese ravioli with pesto cream sauce was incredibly delicious. The pesto sauce was just right and went great with the pasta. Enjoying it with a Dunham cabernet was a truly enjoyable dining moment. Glad to have you here, Richard's.

I enjoyed a scrumptious breakfast at that restaurant last weekend. The French toast and fried egg were delightful, and the vanilla latte was spot on without needing any extra sweeteners. The ambiance on the patio was delightful, with a nice breeze flowing even inside. Though there was a little issue with my egg, the team quickly swapped it out. All in all, it was a fantastic dining experience.

The ambiance at this restaurant was welcoming, and the staff was amicable. The food was enjoyable, though not exceptional - the quiche crust and croque madame bread could have been improved. Nevertheless, the fresh fruit and excellent coffee stood out. In general, it was a pleasant experience, and I would definitely visit again.

Our family had a great time at Salty's. It's for sure a place we'll revisit next time we're in town. The kids' menu had lots of options that kept the little ones happy. Everyone loved the Crabby Dip, though it was a tad expensive at $14. The Salty Burger and macadamia crusted grouper were fantastic main course picks. All in all, it was a top-notch experience with excellent service.

The ingredients didn't seem as fresh this time, and after my boyfriend had the chili beef nachos, he felt really sick. I got stomach cramps after eating the chicken burrito. We used to enjoy the shredded beef here and might come back, but be careful about freshness if you're planning to visit.
This cool old-school joint plays fantastic music, but make sure you're okay with standing because there's only enough seating for the first 15 folks in line. 4 stars.
I highly suggest trying out Blue Fin or Masamoto instead.

All in all, the Best Western Pepper Tree Inn offered a reasonably priced stay in the expensive town of Santa Barbara. The tidy and inviting rooms featured cozy beds and pleasant amenities such as Bath and Body Works products. The outside area and surroundings were delightful, although the interior design seemed a little old-fashioned. There were a few small concerns with the bathroom and door, and we missed having a hair dryer or free breakfast. Nevertheless, the convenient location and affordable rates made it a solid option for a bachelorette celebration.

Johnny Rockets always delivers with their timeless, scrumptious dishes. The recent barbecued pulled pork burger was rich and satisfying, especially alongside bottomless fries. The relocation led to the absence of their lively musical performances, which was a letdown. In general, a reliably fantastic dining outing.

This salon is completely gross. Cobwebs, dust, outdated and faulty equipment, and unprofessional technicians create an unsanitary and unpleasant atmosphere. It's surprising that the health department hasn't stepped in to close them down. I wouldn't suggest this salon to anyone.

I really suggest backing this local business. They have such a great selection of items and also offer complimentary popcorn for customers. Why spend money on snacks at large chain stores when you can enjoy them for free here?

I love this place because of its welcoming staff, ample space ideal for get-togethers, and tasty tea selections. The Awake Fizz Tea is my top pick, but I was pleasantly surprised by the taro bubble tea. The only drawback is the distracting music, easily fixed by bringing headphones. In general, it's a fantastic spot to savor a peaceful cup of tea.

Yah Man is a must-visit spot in Tampa for scrumptious Caribbean cuisine, exceptional service, and a fantastic ambiance. The beef pie, chicken, island sampler plates, and bread pudding are all exceptional. You'll depart satisfied and content after dining here. Do not overlook this treasure if you happen to be in the vicinity! The staff is warm and inviting, creating a truly delightful dining experience.

I love hanging out at this cozy spot in New Orleans that features a laid-back outdoor bar and awesome local music. It can be a bit cozy for big groups, but the front wine and cheese bar connects to the cool live music space in the back. The cheese platters are really good, and there's a nice variety of wines at reasonable prices. It's a great escape from the hustle and bustle of touristy areas, and definitely a popular spot to visit.

I enjoyed a wonderful lunch at this restaurant. The chicken Caesar salad I chose was scrumptious, and my dining companion relished their personalized salad. The server was friendly and didn't hurry us, giving us time to enjoy our meal. The atmosphere was cozy, tucked away from the bustling streets. In general, it was a superb dining experience.

In general, my time at this place was a bit of a letdown because they didn't handle reservations very well. The drinks, food, music, and vibe were all top-notch, but getting seated in the rear by the restroom when I had booked well in advance was a big disappointment. Blaming a new staff member for messing up the reservation isn't a valid excuse. I suggest double-checking reservations over the phone to prevent this sort of thing. Even though I've had good visits before, this one missed the mark.

My husband and I had an amazing time at this top-notch tattoo shop. Bryan absolutely nailed our new tattoos and we can't recommend him enough. The staff were all so friendly, and it's no wonder this place is the talk of the town for tattoos. Don't forget to visit their new spot at 1418 N. Clairborne, Suite 5 upstairs.

My wife and I adore this place. It has the most incredible view in Santa Barbara and the wines are absolutely fantastic. Tom and Gillian are such inviting hosts. The Conway cabs are top-notch in SB. The Conway 13 reserve Syrah is simply divine, all thanks to Tommy. Rolos red is a bottle that would please any wine enthusiast, yet it's also perfect for those just starting to explore wines. Whenever we're at the pier, our 5-year-old son is always eager for us to go wine tasting here. We are never let down. I highly suggest this spot.
The latte I had was amazing and the customer service was exceptional. A solid 10 out of 10.

I love this restaurant! The BBQ shrimp and truffle fries are definitely worth a try, and the truffle butter filet mignon is so tasty. Don't forget to leave space for dessert - both the bread pudding and white chocolate brownie are amazing. I highly suggest this place for anyone who adores good food!

This wine and cheese shop provides a special and delightful experience unlike any other. The vibe is relaxed and welcoming, and choosing your own cheeses and meats adds a fun element. The final product is a meticulously arranged cheese board with nuts, spreads, and artisan bread. I highly suggest it for a memorable night out or a one-of-a-kind dining adventure. For those craving more, there's the option to order from the kitchen, but the cheese board and wine were plenty satisfying for us.

I had such a fantastic time dining at Smiley's. The owner, Smiley, is an absolute delight and the food was incredibly tasty. It was so good that I am already planning to have it for lunch again today. I really suggest this restaurant to anyone in Manayunk - it's a hidden treasure that you shouldn't pass up!

This steakhouse serves superior steaks with outstanding service and a remarkable wine selection. Standing shoulder to shoulder with Ocean Prime and Ruth's Chris, it's a leading choice for a first-class dining experience.

My friend and I grabbed dinner at this cozy restaurant on Sunday. The way they arranged the seating was quite unexpected, with a few tables where we shared space with other guests. Although the place could get a bit noisy, the service we received was top-notch. The food was not bad - the standout was definitely the Kale Caesar topped with a scrumptious soft egg, but unfortunately, they had run out of watermelon for the salad that was supposed to come with the fried chicken. All in all, it was a fairly good dining experience.

I was pretty let down by the service at this brewery. The wait staff completely ignored us once we sat down, and the beer flight we ordered took forever to show up. The beers weren't great either, with one tasting like soap. Overall, it was not a good experience.

This breakfast place has a disorganized layout and inexperienced staff on Saturday mornings. The food is average with some variations in quality. The help-yourself coffee and lack of proper service might not suit everyone. On the whole, it's a budget-friendly choice but not ideal for those looking for a classic breakfast outing.

We really enjoyed the Greek diner with its mouthwatering Greek omelette and excellent service. The golden-brown home fries made for a delicious accompaniment. We definitely intend to pop by again next time we're in the neighborhood.
Service is painfully slow here, it's been over half an hour and all we have are some miso soup and drinks. The rest of our order hasn't even been started yet. It's getting pretty irritating.
This doctor is amazing -- kind, caring, and skilled. Plus, they've got a fantastic sense of humor. I highly recommend them.

The Ramen at this restaurant might not be as good as other places in NY, but the Steven roll is definitely worth a try. It was one of the tastiest rolls I've ever had. I'll definitely come back when I visit Philly again.

The customer service at this restaurant is really disappointing unless you belong to a specific group. The servers obviously preferred older, affluent clientele dressed in suits, overlooking younger guests. Our server neglected us for extended periods and did not bother to check on our food. The higher-ups also did not seem to be attentive. All in all, a mediocre experience despite the expensive cost.

I wholeheartedly suggest Paris Hair Salon for those with thick, unruly hair. The team is well-informed and attentive to your preferences. I have consistently been satisfied with the outcomes, whether it's a new haircut, color, or highlights. The salon has a cozy and welcoming vibe, making every visit enjoyable. Moreover, the prices are fair. In conclusion, Paris Hair Salon is my top choice for all my hair care needs. -Maureen Kerfoot

I was thrilled to have a Chick-Fil-A nearer to me, but the double lane drive-thru is a mess because Nashvillians struggle to use it correctly. The drive-through wrapping around the front of the restaurant is also perplexing. Nevertheless, the complimentary WiFi is a pleasant perk for those extended waits in line. In general, I'll continue going to Chick-Fil-A in Rivergate or Cool Springs for my waffle fry cravings.

I really enjoyed my time at this restaurant. The service was top-notch and the food was so flavorful. I especially loved the chicken taco salad and plantains. The drinks, especially the mojito, were absolutely fantastic. I can't wait to go back and try more dishes next time.

I worked with the Sultans of Schlep for a small move in center city recently and it was a fantastic experience. Tom was attentive, responsive, and a breeze to work with. Their prices were reasonable, the movers were punctual and quick, and they offered wardrobe boxes for free. And to top it off, their name is pretty cool and amusing. I'd absolutely hire them again!

I got a pedicure recently and was really impressed. The salon was clean and fancy, with no wait at all. The employees were very knowledgeable and my pedicure turned out great. I didn't try the massage, but I definitely suggest this place for a wonderful pedicure experience.

Yats serves up the most incredible Cajun dishes we've ever tried at a reasonable price. Their diverse menu switches up every day, adding excitement to each visit. It's a go-to spot for my wife and me. I can't recommend it enough.

I really liked the variety they offered at this pizza spot. The roast beef sandwich I chose was scrumptious, but it did take a while to be served. There aren't many seats indoors, but there's a nice communal outdoor area. Can't wait to taste their pizza after hearing so many positive reviews.

We stopped by this spot on July 4th and had an amazing time. The team was super nice and supportive, especially the nurse and doctor who assisted my daughter with ear discomfort. The nurse was caring and understanding, and though not successful, the doctor managed to get rid of a big chunk of wax. We could fill our prescriptions at the nearby Target for a cheaper cost compared to Med Express. Overall, it was a wonderful spot for quick care during our beach vacation. Thanks a lot!

The vegetarian wings at this spot are absolutely the best I've ever tasted. I can't get them out of my mind. The fried pickles are also fantastic, but the beverages are a little light. I suggest going for a Mexican coke while you're here.
Our time at this cute diner was nice. The pot roast was so-so, but the vegetables were great. My wife loved her omelette. The service was excellent.
Terrible meal without rice in the Chicken Teriyaki Lunch Bento Box. Absolutely horrid.
Brooke's music could use a makeover. Shifting from pop EDM would help her develop a more genuine sound.

On the whole, this hotel offers great bang for your buck with a fantastic location and roomy accommodations. The only drawbacks were the hard bed and scratchy sheets. Nonetheless, I'd definitely think about coming back here.

The food was absolutely scrumptious, with perfectly cooked pasta, delectable chicken parm, and tasty pizza. The service was smooth and remarkable, with one cashier/waitress handling a full house effortlessly. Very impressed.

My first dining experience at this beachside restaurant was absolutely amazing. The food was delicious, but what truly stood out were the breathtaking view and tranquil atmosphere. Relaxing outside while listening to the sound of the waves was truly magical. The fact that they offer beer was an added bonus.
