I highly recommend checking out this restaurant if you're in the area, and even making a special trip if you're not. I can't wait to go back.

I had an amazing time at the party at this venue. The private room with its own bar and bathroom was a fantastic addition. The buffet was delicious and the service was quick. The atmosphere was perfect for chatting. I would definitely consider hosting a party there.

I felt anxious about my initial trip to LF, but Tori was amazing. She transformed my hairstyle vision into reality and offered excellent recommendations for my fine, thin hair. The salon was spotless and contemporary, and parking was convenient on a Saturday. All in all, it was a wonderful experience!

The burger was amazing, cooked to perfection and packed with flavor. The homemade potato chips and sweet potato waffle fries were absolutely delightful. The outdoor patio was pleasant, although it would be even nicer without smoking permitted. Our server, Jesse, delivered top-notch service. This hidden gem tucked away from the hustle and bustle is definitely deserving of a revisit.

I've been seeing Mark at Blades for 2 years and always leave happy with my haircuts. Coming from pricey salons like Dominic Michael where I paid $35 plus tip, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and affordability of Mark's services. His skills and experience really show in his work, and I definitely suggest him for a fantastic haircut that won't break the bank.

The contemporary style of this restaurant is ideal for a younger crowd. I tasted the mahi mahi with pita chips and hummus and it was delightful. The fish was juicy and full of flavor. The service was also excellent. In general, a fantastic dining experience.

This eatery is a standout for dim sum enthusiasts in Reno. Although I do wish their dim sum selection was more extensive, the excellence of the dishes here is truly impressive. CaiE's oriental cafe, by contrast, appears to serve dim sum that is pre-frozen. Reserving ahead of time and enjoying your meal on-site is the recommended approach, especially if you're craving chicken feet and siu mai. The combination meals are also popular, featuring delightful choices such as sesame chicken paired with fried rice, as well as beef and broccoli or shrimp with vegetables. All in all, this is the prime dim sum destination in the area, unless you're willing to journey to Sacramento.

Had a wonderful time at this restaurant for lunch with a group of eight people. We were seated promptly despite some reviews mentioning potential crowds. The parking lot was surprisingly empty, but be cautious of swinging doors. Our server was fantastic and managed our lively group expertly. The cheeseburger and fries were delightful, cooked to perfection with crispy fries. Overall, we all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves with nothing negative to say. Definitely worth a visit!
The bayou burger is absolutely the best I've ever had. The staff is amazing as well. A definite thumbs up from me.

The private dining experience at the corporate event surpassed all expectations with a carefully curated food menu and a refined bar selection. The service was outstanding and the hors d'oeuvres served were innovative and delightful. Particularly noteworthy were the exquisite lobster consommé and perfectly seasoned filet. The breathtaking view from the private room further enhanced the exceptional experience. I would highly recommend this venue for events or special dinners.

Lazos makes the most amazing pizza in the Fairmount/Art Museum/Brewerytown area. The pepperoni was so crispy and tasty, and the wings were scrumptious. It was such a nice surprise that the wings weren't soggy. Even though they got my drink order wrong, everything else about the pizza and wings combo was top-notch. I'll definitely be ordering from Lazos again.

The traditional decorations in this restaurant create the perfect ambiance for an enjoyable and fulfilling meal. The lunch special is a fantastic offer, providing a soup option along with the main dish of the day. Both the gumbo and crab bisque were exceptional, boasting flavorful and well-seasoned tastes. The garganelli paired with roast pork ragu was exceptional, featuring succulent pork and a delicate sauce that harmonized the flavors superbly. In summary, it was a wonderful dining adventure with exceptional food quality.

All in all, the hotel is amazing with a perfect location. The employees went out of their way to help us during our stay. The closeness to popular attractions like Bourbon Street, Harra's, and Jackson Square is unmatched. However, the pricey parking at $38 per night is a small bother.

I stopped by this store recently and was really impressed with their collection, especially the Chloe and Marc Jacobs pieces and the marked-down Chanel pumps. While their prices are a bit high, I think it's worth it for the quality you get. The staff is super friendly and accommodating, so I've decided to make this my new favorite spot for great clothes.

My friends and I snagged some free happy hours here a couple of times, but dealing with the staff was a chore. The lady running the happy hours was totally unresponsive and unhelpful, while the bouncers and bartenders were unwelcoming and not very fast. The vibe from the crowd was not great, and the disorganization with the guest list was just plain annoying. Even though the drinks were on the house, I wouldn't advise checking out this spot for any other reason.
The 7 Eleven looked tidy and nice, with a great variety of food. But, a pricing mix-up uncovered questionable actions from the employees and manager. This incident left a bad taste with the reviewer.

This nail salon offers a dreadful experience from beginning to end. The employees are impolite and unprofessional, with one even making a mean remark to a customer. The service feels rushed and careless, with little attention given to the work performed. In general, it's a very disappointing and unpleasant visit that could certainly be enhanced with improved customer service and attention to detail.

I really enjoyed the gelati from this spot, especially when it's scorching outside. Even with thoughts of calories and diabetes in mind, it was totally worth it for the refreshing chill. I give them five stars for their yummy frozen treats! And make sure to visit their website for other delicious flavors like Vanilla Ice.

I absolutely adore the all-you-can-drink brunch at this spot! $20 for a brunch item and endless bloody marys or mimosas on Saturdays and Sundays is such a great deal. It's just the thing for a lively and spirited Sunday Funday. I really suggest giving it a try!

The restaurant serves delicious Chinese cuisine and has an impressive variety of beers. I haven't sampled the sushi yet, but I can attest to the excellence of the other dishes. While the staff may not be overly friendly, they get the job done for takeout orders. The ambiance is nothing fancy, but the prices are fair.

Stephanie at Andres Richard Salon on Locust St did wonders for my hair with a balayage touch-up. She was so nice, paid great attention to detail, and made sure to get my hair just the way I wanted. I had been let down by other salons for a year, but now, I've found the ideal stylist I can rely on. For top-notch hair care, Andres Richard is the place to go.

I really enjoyed my time at this restaurant. The lively vibe and diverse selection of Spanish tunes made dining there a blast. The staff was super attentive and managed to handle my special requests without any issues. A food critic highly praised the chicken soup, calling it one of the best they've had. The salad could be better by swapping out the lettuce variety. The queso fundido is said to be fantastic, just be sure to order it without chorizo initially to prevent it from being overly oily. I'll be back for that chicken soup for sure, and can't wait to taste the queso next time.

I was really let down by the service and the quality of the drinks at this Starbucks. Even though there were 4 baristas on duty, I ended up waiting for 15 minutes for a tea latte that was basically just water. I tried to have it fixed twice but there was no improvement. It seems like the baristas could benefit from some serious training on how to make drinks properly. I don't think I'll be coming back here again.

After relocating from Brooklyn, we finally discovered the pizza we were craving here. The crispy thin crust was absolutely delightful, and the service was outstanding. I definitely suggest it for pizza enthusiasts who appreciate great customer service. I will definitely be coming back often.

The food and service were exceptional! Even though we arrived close to closing time, Jules was welcoming and accommodating, offering fantastic suggestions and samples. The steak shwarma with rice was delightful and satisfying, with a nutritious twist. We will certainly return for another visit. Highly recommended!

I really enjoyed the vibes at this charming restaurant. The team was so welcoming and on top of things, finding the right mix of chatting and making sure we were happy. Even though it's not big, the place still felt very spacious and cozy. The Crabby Wife and chicken & waffles were both scrumptious and definitely worth trying. Overall, it was a wonderful dining adventure!

Surrey's is a little-known treasure on the outskirts of downtown with the most amazing shrimp n grits in town. Their fresh juices and delightful crab omelette are absolute must-haves. Expect a bit of a wait, but trust me, the food is totally worth it.

I enjoy the store because of its spacious and well-maintained layout and diverse range of products, but I was let down by the customer service on my last visit. Despite being the sole customer in the store, no one offered help as I wrestled with trying to get my French Bulldog into some sweaters. Even when my dog got swatted by a cat for a moment, no one intervened. I departed without buying anything and have reservations about revisiting due to the inattentive service.

I really recommend this shop for any service needs. The staff are fantastic people who are honest, hard-working, and communicate well about the situation at hand. They pay close attention to detail and have been a dependable choice for our older cars since moving to the area.

This place has a lovely, spotless, and cheerful vibe with a wide selection of frozen yogurt and toppings to pick from. The cashier was super friendly and helpful, letting me use my credit card even though I was low on cash. My son really enjoyed his time here, making it an all-around pleasant experience.

Dropped in for Sunday brunch a few weeks back and had an awesome time. The food was scrumptious and fulfilling, drinks were enjoyable, and our server was friendly. The cafe ambiance was really cool and I'd definitely suggest checking it out.

The ambiance was pleasant and the staff were welcoming, however, the food at this restaurant was quite disappointing. The chicken fajitas were dull and average, made with uninspiring ingredients and presented in a lackluster way. Regrettably, I have no intention of visiting again.

The cozy ambiance and spacious outdoor seating at Gelateria provide a calming and delightful experience. The tasty gelato and pastries make it my top spot in St. Louis to satisfy my sweet tooth. I absolutely suggest visiting!

I really enjoyed my time at this cozy sushi spot near Dale Mabry. The sushi chefs are so friendly, and the food is super fresh and delicious. You've got to try the Wahoo! The prices are very reasonable, and I can't wait to go back for more. I definitely recommend it!

Inexpensive food and vast variety, but the subpar customer service spoiled the whole thing. Our order was overlooked, leading to a 15-minute delay without any acknowledgment from the team. Not worth the hassle.

Larry's Steaks has quickly become my favorite spot for the ultimate philly cheesesteak after my cherished Dallesandro's declined in quality. The thinly sliced meat is smothered in gooey cheese, complemented by onions and mushrooms for extra flavor. The sandwich is delightfully greasy, providing a rich and fulfilling dining experience. For an genuine and mouthwatering philly cheesesteak, Larry's is the place to be. Steer clear of the typical tourist stops and experience Larry's for yourself.

I totally agree with what others have said about this place, it's just awful. The service was really bad, and the food showed up cold, making the whole experience super frustrating. It seems like the folks running the show need to step up their game with the service and kitchen staff before I would even think about going back. Honestly, I'd suggest steering clear of this place altogether.

I liked coming here a year back before the e.coli/colliform scare, but I haven't been back because of safety worries. They need to make sure meat is cooked thoroughly, serve meals piping hot, and only use produce from the US to prevent contamination problems.

I'm really disappointed with my order, it was all wrong even though I clearly said what I wanted. The worker seemed unsure when I asked for no ketchup. It shouldn't be so hard to get it right. Overall, a pretty frustrating experience.

I checked out this breakfast spot following a friend's suggestion and it totally lived up to the hype. The service was super speedy and welcoming even on a bustling Saturday morning. I went for the veggie omelette with fruit and rye toast, and it was absolutely scrumptious. They had a nice variety on the menu to cater to everyone's preferences, and the prices were fair for the hearty portions. I'll definitely be going back for more.
Wells Fargo offers a superb atmosphere for everyone. The Flyers regularly put on thrilling games, no matter your seat. I definitely suggest going to a game, even if you don't usually follow hockey.

Perfect place for grabbing a late-night bite with the added convenience of a drive-thru. The new dishes on the menu and range of vegetarian choices are a pleasant surprise. Just a heads up, it's worth giving your order a once-over as they might accidentally leave out dessert, which could be a letdown.

The spinach and feta hummus is fantastic, and the chicken caesar pita was delicious with flavorful dressing and fresh greens. Even though it's found in a converted garage, it's definitely worth checking out.

I really adore this place! It's amazing that nearly every dish can be made vegan. The Pad Thai with tofu, veggies, and cashews is so yummy, and the avocado egg rolls are a definite must-have. It's definitely a top spot for me.

NOM NOMS in Downtown is a trendy spot packed with stylish individuals savoring drinks and appetizers. The dishes are akin to miniature masterpieces of taste, brimming with enjoyable surprises. While the cocktails might vary in quality, the service is excellent. The food is on the expensive side, but the overall experience makes it worthwhile. A hip location to make an impression or enjoy a girls’ night out.

Though there were a few small hiccups with the order, the outstanding customer service at this Asian/Thai restaurant truly distinguishes it from others. The curry and shrimp fried rice were absolutely delightful, even though the wait was a bit longer than anticipated. The staff's commitment to making sure customers are happy is truly impressive. 4 stars.

Mouthwatering, freshly baked pies with flavorful and crispy crusts and abundant toppings. The Cowboy steak pizza really stood out, tempting whether you choose to have it with or without BBQ sauce. Definitely a must-eat in Philly!

In general, this mailbox service is handy and dependable for people who travel often and need to safeguard important mail. The yearly cost is fair and the extra perk of getting calls for big packages is useful. Even though the location might seem a little dubious, the team is welcoming and quick. I prefer using FedEx for shipping instead of the store and Canada Post for packaging supplies. The printing services are decent.

Jenne at Heads and Tails was really comforting and made my bikini wax experience very pleasant. She explained everything step by step, and my delicate skin wasn't a problem at all. The salon is spotless and the team is truly top-notch. I absolutely suggest it to anyone looking for a fantastic waxing session. I'll definitely be going back.
The food was delicious, but the service was awful. I waited 2.5 hours for delivery without any utensils or napkins, so I had to eat with my fingers. I wouldn't suggest ordering from here again.

The sushi at this restaurant is absolutely scrumptious and stunningly presented. We tried the J Sushi and Fire Roll, and they were both amazing. The service was top-notch, and the prices were very reasonable. I highly recommend it.

My husband and I just moved to this neighborhood and were a bit reluctant to say goodbye to our beloved Mexican eatery. But after giving the nearby place a shot, we were absolutely amazed. The authentic atmosphere and top-notch service really added to an unforgettable dining adventure. We especially liked the extra detail of offering soda in glass bottles. The Taco Sombrero and Chimichanga were utterly delicious. This joint definitely earned a solid 6 stars from us.

The service and food at this restaurant were really bad. The server kept ignoring us because she was always on her phone, the shrimp was tiny for the price, and the tostones were way too salty and greasy. I wouldn't suggest coming here, it's not worth it. Both the service and food definitely deserve just one star.

The customer service at this rental service is outstanding and surpasses other car rental companies. I wish I could rent from them more frequently, as my experience was exceptional. I highly recommend renting from them if you can.

Cafe Piazza is a delightful spot that has moved into the original Benton Park Cafe location. The ambiance is so St. Louis, complete with a one-of-a-kind mural on the ceiling that adds to the quirky vibe. The food is fantastic, providing a fun twist on typical breakfast dishes that are both upscale and inviting. I really suggest checking out this restaurant for its charming decor, location, and yummy, reasonably priced menu choices.

I'm a huge fan of this incredible chef whose chicken is the most tender and flavorful I've ever tasted. The side dishes are innovative and delicious as well. I'm disappointed that I only had the chance to enjoy his cooking once, and now I can't locate him because of the construction in the market. I really hope he returns soon.

I had an amazing time at the corporate holiday party at the Tuscany Ballroom, followed by a pleasant overnight stay in the Tuscan Tower. This resort is definitely the top choice in the area, providing a luxurious experience akin to being on a cruise ship. Surprisingly, there wasn't any lingering smoke smell even though we were in a casino. And to top it off, a special treat was having breakfast with the welcoming Peppermill CEO/GM John Hanson. It was truly a memorable and unforgettable experience.

Amazing experience at this little hidden treasure! At first, we were unsure because of the plaza's look, but we were so delighted by the authentic Indian/Thai ambiance and mouthwatering food. The Tamarind Duck and Panang Curry with calamari were incredibly good, and the mussel starter was delicious. The service was quick, and the portion sizes were just right for the prices. We can't wait to come back and sample more dishes, especially the sushi and different duck preparations. Our taste buds are thrilled!

Corropolese is a must-visit for tomato pie enthusiasts in the area. Their tomato pie is renowned for its mouthwatering taste and is a must-have for my family at gatherings. Though they have a variety of options, the tomato pie is the star of the show and truly incomparable to anywhere else. I highly recommend it for a flavorful and fulfilling indulgence.

I visited this restaurant for a birthday celebration and had a satisfying experience. The beef and lobster were cooked perfectly and the side dishes were delicious. However, the crab and cheese balls were flavorless and needed more seasoning. The Creme Brule was excellent. The service was attentive on a calm Tuesday evening. The wobbly table was a small inconvenience. I would definitely return and suggest it to my friends. Rating: 4 out of 5 stars.

Debbie really went above and beyond, delivering outstanding service. The food was delicious, came out quickly, and was cooked to perfection. Everyone loved the Mac n cheese burger, and the drinks were just right, especially the whisky sour. Can't wait to come back for another visit.

This local shop is an awesome place to find gifts for the holidays. The team there is super friendly and always ready to lend a hand, which makes shopping there a really enjoyable experience. Yay for a cool and one-of-a-kind place to shop!

After reading some positive Yelp reviews, I decided to check out this eclectic spot that combines art, coffee, and a fun vibe like something straight out of a movie. I had a good experience - the service was friendly, the drinks were tasty, and the menu definitely caught my eye. The food was alright, not amazing, so I'd rate it a solid three stars. I'm planning to go back and explore more dishes because the atmosphere and staff were top-notch. Can't wait to see what else they have to offer!

Joyce is amazing! The procedure is completely pain-free and definitely worth the trip from Palm Harbor. Her cutting-edge technology makes her stand out from the rest and puts to rest any concerns from hearing scary stories from friends. I wholeheartedly suggest her services!

The Quarter Stitch in NOLA is a fantastic find for knitters. It's conveniently close to my hotel, and I was excited to discover a unique Mardi Gras yarn available. The variety was amazing, encouraging me to come back for a second visit. The staff was so friendly and helpful, which added to my overall enjoyment. I can't wait to go back to this store again!

The ice cream was delicious, but the service was just awful. The employees acted unprofessionally, neglecting us, tossing napkins, and scolding my son without cause. There was no welcome, no smile, and no regard for us as paying customers. The lively vibe was ruined by the staff's disrespectful behavior.

This small seafood place by the pier has a small selection of shellfish dishes, but don't be put off if you're not a fan of seafood. The crispy shrimp was really tasty and not oily, and the onion rings were great. On the other hand, the crab sandwich came on plain white bread and was a bit disappointing. The staff was fantastic, and even though it was noisy, we got seated fast at the bar. If you're a seafood enthusiast, this spot is worth checking out for its awesome setting and fresh shellfish choices.

Stay away from this place! It was the most horrendous dining experience I've had during my 7 years in Tucson. The customer service was awful, they didn't consider allergies, and the behavior of the staff and management was unprofessional. I wouldn't suggest this place to anyone.
I really suggest checking out this place. Their sandwiches are one-of-a-kind and ideal for those seeking healthier or vegan choices.

I had a blast taking on the Brew Bros. Burger challenge, even though I couldn't quite polish off the huge meal. The staff was super helpful and the food was delicious, but you might want to brace yourself for a possible stomachache later on. Unfortunately, I missed out on sampling their beer, but my buddies couldn't stop gushing about it. At $24, it's a steal, especially when split with friends (although that's technically cheating in the challenge). I'd say it's worth a shot, unless you're also planning on indulging in some brews. I'm already looking forward to returning to tackle the challenge again next time I swing by Reno.

Delightful breakfast choices and fantastic service. Enjoyed the Sunny side skillet with a pancake, which was tasty and reasonably priced at under $8. The ambiance and variety of goods available make this spot stand out from the rest. Definitely a top pick for a gratifying meal.

The food truck provides excellent and quick service with succulent meat and fantastic BBQ sauce. Prices are fair, making it a must-visit for a delicious meal. I highly suggest trying it out if you happen to spot the truck.

I had high hopes for this place, but it fell short. The chicken was just okay, the mac & cheese was too salty and messy, and the bananas foster pie was lacking filling. The best part was the birch beer soda. The food didn't justify the price, and I left feeling let down. The idea, ambiance, and menu were all promising, but they need to work on the quality. I would rate it 2 stars.
The service was painfully slow, despite having several servers on hand. The food was mediocre at most. I wouldn't suggest this place for groups bigger than 4 because of the extended wait times.

This eatery is absolutely worth every penny for outstanding service and mouthwatering dishes. The ribeye steak was simply incredible, and the burger was generously portioned and bursting with flavor. Don't miss out on the bread pudding for dessert. I strongly suggest visiting at least once and enjoying some dishes with friends for a wonderful dining experience.
The menu showcases fresh, locally-sourced dishes that are always changing, promising a delightful treat for your taste buds. Make sure to plan in advance as getting reservations can be a challenge.

The veggie burger was fantastic and one-of-a-kind with grilled mozzarella, pickled veggies, arugula, and guacamole. The spicy fries were flavorful and just the right amount of heat. The vibe is like a cozy dive bar and the space is on the smaller side. All in all, a perfect meal.

Finding vegetarian options in New Orleans can be a bit tricky, but Tomasito's is not quite up to par. While the bean and cheese burrito was alright, the absence of vegetarian rice was a letdown. The service was so-so, and the flan was delicious, but it only had a single raspberry. On the whole, it's good to have vegetarian choices in New Orleans, but Tomasito's didn't quite satisfy.
This Mexican restaurant is fantastic! The food and drinks were top-notch, and the prices were very fair. Definitely worth a visit!
The place has an energetic vibe, with loud live music downstairs, while the upstairs bar offers a more relaxed space for chatting.

Steve from Roto-Rooter really came through for us when our new house had a sewer back-up. He fixed the problem fast and did a great job. We're so thankful for his help and would definitely suggest Roto-Rooter for any plumbing issues.

I'm really upset with the poor communication and lack of response from Jay Fatimo at the auto repair shop. I just needed a written estimate for a basic factory navigation unit replacement in my Denali. After sending several emails without any reply, I had to go somewhere else for the service. It was a very frustrating and unprofessional situation.

I've been a loyal customer of this bakery for ages. The hazelnut cake is absolutely awesome, and their other cakes are equally mouthwatering. You can't miss out on the butter cookies; they're essential and perfect for gifting. The prices are fair, and the team is super friendly and accommodating. I highly suggest checking out this spot for all your sugary desires!
Lunch was fantastic for a first time, they had a wide variety of tasty gluten-free options. Delicious food and welcoming service made the meal even more enjoyable.

The service at this restaurant was fantastic when they hosted our event, but regrettably, the food didn't match up. The brisket was just okay and the bread was hard, but the mac and cheese was delicious. The beer glasses were not clean or cold, and they had run out of draft choices. In general, it was a bit of a mixed bag.

Exploring the Mississippi River on a leisurely day offers a delightful choice for a relaxed outing. Priced reasonably at around $28.00, you can opt out of the lunch package. Keep an eye out for common tourist pitfalls like persistent photographers. Delving into the history of the Natchez Native American Tribe can enrich your journey, and savoring a refreshing beverage can contribute to your enjoyment. In conclusion, it's a lovely way to pass a couple of hours on a steamboat excursion.

Just went to The Fat Ham with my girlfriend and had an amazing time. The cozy ambiance, extensive whiskey collection, and welcoming staff created the ideal setting for our night out. Bartender Dan was prompt and personable, and the drinks and food were mouthwatering - especially the shrimp & grits and hot chicken. The raspberry cobbler was a bit disappointing, but all in all, it was a fantastic experience. Excellent service, upscale comfort food, and reasonable prices ensure that I'll be coming back for sure.

At first, we really liked this place because of its yummy Greek salad and gyros, along with its flavorful vibes and charming atmosphere. But our last trip was a letdown – the tables were grimy, the lamps were dusty and had dead bugs, and the food was much lower in quality. My salad only had a tiny bit of potato salad and seemed weird, and my daughter's fajita bowl had unappetizing tomatoes and chewy, overdone chicken. Even the baklava was old. Hopefully, they tidy up and get back to the top-notch standards they had at the beginning.

Carrollton Market in New Orleans is hands down the best brunch spot I've ever visited. The unique local flavors and exceptional service truly make it a must-visit. Their "biscuits and debris" dish is absolutely mind-blowing, and the oyster-filled French omelet is simply everything I could ever ask for in a meal. Huge thanks to Carrollton Market for giving me such a memorable dining experience.
The variety of beers available here is awesome, but the bartender service was a tad sluggish.

This restaurant serves delicious food with standout dishes such as fish tacos and nachos. The atmosphere is ideal for both family gatherings and romantic evenings, featuring music, a beach bar, homemade ice cream, and even a playground. Overall, it's a fantastic spot for an enjoyable and tasty dining experience.

Oh! Wings serves up the most delicious wings and bulgogi wrap! The Hot Momma and Original flavors are absolute must-haves. Even my dad, who's quite finicky, couldn't resist them. The staff is super friendly and really flexible - they handled a sudden change to our order without any hassle. I'm already looking forward to my next visit!

The critic had a bad experience with New York Pizza Grill as their staff were passing out unneeded fliers in hotels, potentially unsettling and alarming guests. They point out the problem of trespassing and advise individuals to carefully consider before joining such an establishment. The critic ultimately suggests avoiding dining at New York Pizza Grill because of these behaviors.

This was my first time trying out this car wash with a coupon and it really exceeded my expectations. Even though it was crowded, everything moved along swiftly with just a 15-minute wait for the car wash and a comfortable, roomy area to hang out in while waiting. The kids had a blast with the "soap gun" and they had a nice selection of drinks, snacks, and extras you could buy. The car came out looking spotless and tidy, although I did have to clean the front window myself. All in all, it was a fantastic visit with welcoming employees and reasonable prices. I'm definitely planning on coming back for more car washes here.

I really enjoy going to this spot in Indiana whenever I visit family. David creates amazing pink and white sets. The store is pristine and the team is courteous and welcoming. Despite being fairly new, the management has been exceptional in my opinion.

I was really let down by my order from this restaurant. Even though it arrived quickly, my order was totally incorrect. When I reached out to sort out the problem, they wouldn't give me the complimentary meal they had mentioned for the error. I ended up feeling annoyed and won't be giving them my business again.

The shopping trip at Blush, sipping beer at Hops and Crafts, and enjoying lunch at Turnip Truck in the gulch create a perfect afternoon. The diverse range of products at Blush and Turnip Truck elevate the experience, but it would be wonderful to have a rewards program back in place. Make sure to sample the chipotle chicken salad wrap at Turnip Truck—it's truly a delight. All in all, it's a fantastic way to pass the time in the area.

The happy hour and brunch at this spot are fantastic. I've only dined there for dinner once and it was just alright, but I believe it was because I tried something new. I'll definitely give it another shot.

My colleagues and I popped in for a bite at this charming and roomy place upon arriving in Reno. Even though it wasn't packed, we managed to hold out for happy hour specials. The drinks varied in quality (Mint Julep wasn't great, but the gin concoction was top-notch), and the dishes (mac and cheese, fries, pretzel) were scrumptious. Happy hour deals were a steal. I'll definitely come back on my next visit to town!

Muriel's Jackson Square is a fantastic choice for vegetarians looking for Southern/Cajun comfort food in New Orleans. It's best to book a table in advance since it tends to fill up quickly. The cocktails are outstanding, and there are more and more vegetarian dishes on offer. I highly recommend trying the Goat Cheese Crepe, but watch out for any seafood sauces. The Veggie Soiree has a wide range of flavors, though a few dishes might need some tweaking. In general, it's a delightful dining option for vegetarians in the city.

Puckett's serves up a mouthwatering and fulfilling meat-and-three meal with delectable dishes such as squash casserole and meatloaf. Just a heads up, their cornbread is closer to a corn fritter or hoe cake rather than the usual slice of cornbread. In general, it's a fantastic place to enjoy authentic Southern comfort cuisine.

I usually stay at The Grand Sierra, but this time I thought I'd give the Peppermill a try since my usual hotel was under construction. David Fuller, the Operations Manager, really made my stay incredible by giving me a double upgrade to a Tuscany Balcony Suite. The whole staff went out of their way to make sure my experience was top-notch. I will definitely be returning to the Peppermill in the future. I highly recommend it!

The Hilton hotels I visited had really old and tired facilities, and the service was always pretty bad. Even though I had reserved a nice 1 bedroom suite, it wasn't ready when I arrived, and they gave me a lower-quality room with a promise of an upgrade later. But when I returned, they said my original room was already taken. The shady way they handled things and their refusal to make it right just left me feeling let down and frustrated. I won't be going back there for sure.

The burger was just okay and way too expensive. The place felt small and unwelcoming. The service was okay. You can find better burger joints in St. Louis that give more bang for your buck and better flavor. I wouldn't recommend this place.

Pete and Ron shared the top quote from a few I got and showed they were trustworthy. Arbour Bay promised I'd be well taken care of by them and they followed through. They skillfully took out two big oaks using a crane while I was out, causing very little damage in my yard. I definitely suggest them to others.

The sushi rolls were tasty, but way too expensive at nearly $20 for just 2 basic rolls. The portions were decent in size, but didn't satisfy enough to make the cost worth it. I won't be coming back at those prices.

The ambiance and service at this place were excellent. The live music really enhanced the experience and was quite enjoyable. The food was tasty in general, although the burger didn't quite hit the mark for me. Nevertheless, I had a great time and will definitely come back.

I went to a corporate conference that lasted 2 1/2 days in June and was really impressed by the fantastic service, lovely facilities, and outstanding catering at this venue. It's a fantastic place for conferences or small conventions, conveniently situated near the airport, offering free shuttle service and parking. I highly recommend it for business occasions.

Cheese enthusiasts should definitely check out this cozy spot for a wide range of delectable cheeses and drinks to enjoy with friends. The friendly staff and vast drink selection enhance the overall experience. Though not the most budget-friendly option for drinks, the exceptional quality of the cheese justifies the price. Highly recommended with 5 stars.

It was a bit disappointing as the food didn't really capture the essence of authentic Middle Eastern cuisine. The side dishes were lackluster and seemed to be store-bought. It's probably not the best choice for anyone looking for truly authentic Middle Eastern flavors.

I really enjoyed this place, especially the Salmon dish. I've only been for lunch, but it's always been great. The restrooms are super clean and the service is fantastic. I'll definitely be coming back here for lunch more often. I highly recommend it.

This place is a must-visit for exceptional service, delightful ambiance, and amazingly inventive and tasty food. The brunch experience was unparalleled, with standout dishes like the French toast and chicken and waffles. The "Flinstones pushup-pop" drink was a unique addition, and even the deviled eggs were outstanding. Overall, it was a fantastic experience that continues to stay on my mind. Disregard any review that falls short of 4 stars.

We randomly discovered this spot and I'm thrilled we did. Their happy hour runs from 3-8pm every day, providing a 50% discount on all beers, wine glasses for $3-$4, and $8 for hookah. Hookah outside of happy hour time is $13, with various shisha flavors and special choices such as an ice chamber or smoking from a fruit bowl (with extra charge). Although I didn't taste the food, the dishes being served from the kitchen looked delicious. In general, it's a laid-back spot to unwind with pals and soak in a fantastic vibe. A truly delightful experience.

I really adore the Monaco Hotel in Philadelphia. The lobby is super cozy with cozy seating and they offer wine every day from 5 to 6 PM. The employees, like Jasmine, Kayla, and concierge Roshid, are fantastic. The rooms are spotless with amazing bathrooms, especially in the king spa rooms. The decoration is lovely and everything is in great shape. The hotel is a must-visit for anyone traveling to Philadelphia. Just a short walk from the Liberty Bell and historical museums, the Monaco really makes you feel at home. I highly suggest staying here for a memorable experience.

I really love this store! The discounts on popular brands like Bebe, Banana Republic, and BCBG are unbelievable. I always discover fantastic bargains and can't help but return for more. I highly suggest it!

I'm so excited to have come across a family-friendly place to catch a football game in Carp. The vibe was awesome, the service was speedy, and the pizza was scrumptious. I definitely suggest checking it out!

This Acme store is pretty much like the others, but the aisles are a bit narrower and the selection isn't as big. However, the frozen and refrigerated food sections have definitely been improved. The service was decent overall.

My partner and I recently relocated to the neighborhood and have been checking out nearby dining spots every Saturday and Sunday. The Roost has swiftly won us over as our go-to spot for breakfast. Their homemade breads and pastries are phenomenal, especially the raisin bread and sugar-cinnamon toast. You've got to try the cornbread casserole too. The staff was quick, attentive, and super friendly. I wholeheartedly suggest checking out The Roost!

This cozy and bustling breakfast spot can be busy, but the food is mouthwatering and the portions are generous. The servers are on top of things and manage the busyness well. All in all, a fantastic breakfast spot.

I eventually made up my mind to give this charming eatery a shot after seeing it multiple times. The decor was lovely, featuring wooden accents and walls painted in two shades of gray. The yummy prosciutto fig arugula Parmesan flatbread starter was excellent for sharing. The grass-fed beef burger was both huge and flavorful, paired with delightfully truffle-coated fries. The seafood soup was rich in flavor with just the right kick of spice. I'd definitely recommend this spot, especially for fans of a good variety of wine and craft beer. Just a heads up though, it's best to arrive early as it tends to fill up quickly and doesn't accept reservations.

Although there are positive reviews about the food quality, I personally was not impressed with my visit to Dragon Buffet. The dinner spread was rather ordinary, featuring dry meats and greasy fried dishes. Unlike some similar eateries nearby, they charge an additional fee for crab legs. The staff were pleasant but seemed understaffed, resulting in slow service. I doubt I will revisit, as there are other Chinese buffets in the area that I find more appealing. With increased patronage, perhaps they can better maintain food freshness and overall quality.

This restaurant always delivers great food with warm, attentive service. The pear-filled pasta pockets are a definite must-try, and being able to bring your own wine is a nice bonus. The inviting family vibe makes it a perfect choice for any get-together. I highly recommend it.

This establishment linked to a renowned TV show serves $4 White Rascal's and costly gravy fries. The steak fries with gravy and mozzarella cheese were delicious but steep at $11. The service was amicable but occasionally sluggish. On the whole, it's a decent spot with a trendy theme but overpriced cuisine.

I decided to check out this bike shop on Yelp recommendations and was happy to see that they lived up to the hype. The team there was extremely friendly and eager to assist with any queries I had. I'll definitely be going back for any bike maintenance or repairs in the future.

In general, this hotel provides excellent value for the price, featuring a plush king bed, elegantly decorated room, and entertaining rotating Carousel bar. The rooftop pool is a fantastic spot to relax on sunny days. The only drawback is the noise coming from the street, so it's advisable to ask for a room located away from it when staying on weekends. Additionally, be mindful of additional fees for incidentals.

The handcrafted Orangina is simply exquisite, outshining the bottled version in flavor. The croissant sandwiches are equally incredible, creating a flawless combination with the invigorating drink. I definitely suggest giving both a try!
Delightfully tasty food with fantastic milkshakes, ice cream, Chicago dogs, and cheese fries. Reasonable prices make it a top-notch place to check out.
The food at this restaurant is amazing, but it's a bummer they don't have Bud Light on tap. Shoutout to the awesome and attentive servers, especially Jamie White, the absolute greatest.
The food was scrumptious, prices were reasonable, and I definitely plan to come back. Five stars!

I've been frequenting this hotel and casino for about a year now and my experiences have always been stellar. The rooms are impeccably clean and cozy, offering lovely views of the pool. I particularly appreciate the ease of online check-in and using the express kiosk to skip the lengthy queues. The pool area is serene and never too packed, and accessing the slot machines is a breeze. While the spa services come at a premium, this place is undoubtedly a great choice for accommodation and entertainment. I'm excited to explore more of the amenities in the days to come!

This morning, I enjoyed a tasty pork roll, egg, and cheese bagel sandwich on an everything bagel for a reasonable price of $4.23. The freshly baked bagels were delicious, but it felt like there weren't enough staff to keep up with the busy crowd.

The restaurant serves a fixed tasting menu on Sundays, with dishes meant for sharing. Nevertheless, the serving sizes remain constant regardless of the number of diners. Although the flavors were delightful, I found it off-putting that the restaurant allocated one person's portion to multiple guests. It is recommended to ask for individual servings when dining as a pair. Consequently, I have decided not to revisit this establishment.

I had an amazing time at this delightful place for a pizza making class. The instructor, John from Ornesto, showed us fantastic techniques, and I connected with some incredible people. It feels like a magical land for bakers, chefs, and enthusiastic cooks. I've already enrolled in another class and purchased some of their products. Just keep in mind that the lighting is a little dim, but it's definitely a place worth visiting!

I had an amazing experience at this restaurant. The vegetarian and organic menu was outstanding, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and the coffee was superb. I will definitely be coming back again.
I love this place! The veggie burger is outstanding, made with a homemade patty, and the pretzel buns are mouthwatering. Definitely a must-try!

I recently checked out Ploy Thai for lunch and was really impressed. Having just moved here from Los Angeles, where I was let down by the food scene in Tampa, I'd rate Ploy Thai 4 stars. The dishes were delicious and prepared with fresh ingredients. All in all, a fantastic dining outing.

The pizza crust was really dry and the Delmar didn't have enough bbq sauce, so it ended up pretty dry too. The server was nice, but it took forever for the pizza to come out after we finished our salads.

The food and coffee are excellent, but the wait is always too long because they only have one cashier. They should hire another cashier to make the service faster and keep customers from getting annoyed.

Peppermill keeps impressing everyone with fantastic service and accommodations. The gaming experience is top-notch with lots of winning on slots. The food is scrumptious and reasonably priced. Overall, Peppermill stands out as the top spot in Reno.

The breakfast sandwiches at this place are too expensive and not very good. They are smaller than promised, the sausage was cold, and the bacon was really greasy. I could get better food for a lot less at McDonald's. Overall, I was pretty disappointed with my experience.

My first appointment at Music City Optical went smoothly, but things took a turn for the worse when they changed my contact lenses. The new brand caused me pain, redness, and irritation. It was hard to reach the staff promptly to switch back to my old brand. When I got a second opinion, it turned out the symptoms were from the new contacts, not allergies as Music City Optical had said. Their reaction to my negative feedback was defensive and unprofessional.

The Italian Centre offers a fantastic range of Italian treats, complete with welcoming staff to assist you in navigating the vast array. The Mossimo pizza was truly impressive, boasting fresh toppings, gooey cheese, and a flawlessly crispy thin crust at a reasonable cost. Although the Cream Horn pastries leaned towards the expensive side, they were undeniably scrumptious, luxuriously fresh and creamy. It's an ideal place to savor a coffee and pastry either before or after shopping.

The customer service at this nail salon has really taken a nosedive lately. The front desk staff seem disinterested, the services feel rushed and uncomfortable, and the new staff just don't measure up. On top of all that, the sudden price hike was a letdown. Unfortunately, I'll have to find a new place for my nail care needs.

Our go-to place for amazing pizza is Boulevard Pizza in Sparks/Reno. Even though the decor might be a bit old-fashioned, the flavor is outstanding. The addition of fun arcade games for the children makes the whole visit even more enjoyable. We highly suggest checking it out!

This coffee shop is a definite go-to for coffee enthusiasts in the vicinity. The cold brew and nitro latte are the most exceptional iced coffee beverages I've ever tasted. The pour-over and espresso are also incredibly flavorful and robust. The only drawback is the lengthy queue, but the effective and welcoming staff justify the wait. I strongly suggest popping in for a fantastic coffee adventure.
I absolutely loved my visit to this bakery in Indy. The plain glazed and glazed lemon filling donuts were absolutely scrumptious. I would definitely go back if I find myself in the area again.
The food and drinks at this place are exceptional, especially the $1 jumbo wings on Wednesdays and the Dirty Lemonade. I highly suggest giving them a try if you're in Indianapolis.

Don't let the looks fool you - the food here is amazing. The gyros, fish, and chicken are all mouthwatering and perfectly seasoned. And don't forget to save some space for dessert, you'll definitely enjoy it.

The new place in Reno was so busy but really well put together on its opening day. My family and I were so impressed and we'll definitely be coming back several times a week. Thanks for picking Reno as your spot.

Baguette Deli is a fantastic spot for Vietnamese food, serving up mouthwatering BBQ pork and fresh rolls that can compete with fancy Thai eateries. The employees are super nice and go above and beyond, throwing in more jalapenos for free. You've got to give their bubble tea a shot, and I'm grateful to discover a new go-to spot for it in town. All in all, diving into Vietnamese cuisine here has been amazing - can't wait to sample more dishes! Don't hesitate, head over to Baguette Deli now!

I really enjoy eating at this restaurant every month, and I try to go there even more often if I can. The brisket tacos and brisket quesadillas are incredibly tasty. I suggest coming by for happy hour that starts at 3 for buy-one-get-one-free drinks.

Xtreme Tacos has easily become one of my favorite spots for tasty Mexican cuisine. I've ordered from them multiple times and have always been satisfied. The homemade chips are a definite must-try, and the salsa and queso are perfect for dipping. The team is extremely friendly and welcoming, which enhances the entire dining experience. I wholeheartedly suggest checking out Xtreme Tacos!

As a woman who recently relocated to the downtown area, I was looking for exceptional service in various aspects, including car maintenance. The team at Cabrillo Union 76 went above and beyond to surpass my expectations, and I am truly grateful to them for their outstanding service. Trust is paramount when it comes to vehicle maintenance, and I have complete faith in this establishment for their top-notch repairs and smog services for all my vehicles. Ray, your dependable service is greatly appreciated. With sincere thanks, Cheyenne.

Fantastic location with a blend of trendy and relaxed atmospheres. Well-liked place offering a nice variety of local craft beers. The ahi fish tacos were delicious, although the use of prepackaged taco shells was a letdown. The brunch options seemed quite appealing.
"Incredible breakfast pizza, endless mimosas and bloody marys, and outstanding service. A real gem in today's world. Definitely worth a visit!"

I totally suggest trying out Bing's boba in Tucson! Their Taro snow is absolutely delicious, and it's the ultimate boba spot in town. The place is super clean, they have board games, and the staff is so friendly and accommodating. They really went out of their way to make sure my husband got a drink he truly enjoyed, even adjusting the flavor to his liking. Definitely a fantastic spot for all boba enthusiasts!

I really want to suggest Venus Nail salon. I discovered them through a Google search and have been blown away by their exceptional service and ambiance every time I've gone. Ivy is absolutely amazing - she crafted a gorgeous look for my birthday trip that I totally adored.

What a pleasant surprise in a little town! The Indian cuisine at this place is outstanding - you have to try the Naan with peach chutney. The Lamb Korma is just right with its spices and cooking. The ambiance is charming, and the employees are so warm. They're very quick and efficient with the service. It's absolutely worth making the trip, even if you're in Tampa. I can't say enough good things about it!

Greko is a real hidden treasure with mouthwatering rotisserie chicken pitas and exceptional salads. I just had to go back for both dinner and lunch the very next day after my initial visit. The Horta Greens and Athenian Chicken are absolute must-haves. Greko is an ideal spot for a swift and laid-back meal.

Brother Rabbit's Compere Lapin is a hip and scrumptious spot in New Orleans. The homemade cider and Oban 18 really stood out on the beverage menu. The homemade biscuits were amazing, but the crispy chicken skins could use a bit more zing. The marinated shrimp with jalapeño jus was lively and invigorating. And the dobeger cake with lemon curd and chocolate ice cream was a fantastic way to wrap up the feast. Perfect for a fun night out with friends or a romantic date.

Imo's delivery was quick and the food came steaming. The St. Louis-style pizza with provel cheese fell short and was tough to break apart. Nevertheless, the toasted ravioli stole the show with a delicious meat filling. The sauce was a bit thin but had a nice flavor. Pizza was a letdown, but the toasted ravioli was a winner.

"Mazzaro's is the genuine deal when it comes to authentic Italian cuisine. Their sauce and meatballs are unbeatable, bringing back memories of home-cooked meals. A must-try for any Italian food enthusiast!"

The Mandarin is a popular dance club where you can enjoy premium cocktails and beers, as well as standard well drinks and domestic bottles. Guys may have a standard door fee on some nights. The spacious enclosed patio is a highlight, providing ample room even during cold months. The music selection varies, offering anything from familiar hip-hop and pop tunes to more niche tracks. Inside, the atmosphere is lively, while outside on the patio, it's more relaxed and conducive to conversation. If you feel like dancing in the CWE, consider giving the Mandarin a shot.

A charming spot on Frenchmen with an energetic vibe and skilled piano musician. The tapas selection presents a delightful fusion of Asian and Latin cuisines, featuring favorites such as the flavorful smoked hanger steak and scrumptious lobster eggrolls. The happy hour specials are a steal, offering $4 tapas and $5 wines. Can't wait to come back!

The meal was okay, but the restaurant vibe was hectic and cramped, with tables crammed too close together. We kept getting jostled by other diners and servers, which made it hard to relax and savor our food.

Skip the lousy restaurant with terrible service and impolite waiter, and make your way over to La Baia on 17th and Lombard for an amazing BYO Italian dining experience. The cozy ambiance, welcoming staff, and mouthwatering food will definitely make it a place worth checking out.

I used to go to the Randall's on Jefferson often, but now that there's one in West County, I'm really excited. The employees are super friendly and helpful, and they have a fantastic beer assortment with reasonable prices. Definitely worth checking out.

Deseree has been my favorite hair stylist for more than ten years, and I wouldn't choose anyone else. She has styled my hair in every shade from blonde to brunette, in various lengths, and always gets it right. She'll even be doing my hair for my wedding, as well as for my 6 bridesmaids, and I'm confident it will be flawless. Deseree is flexible, dependable, skilled, and let's not forget, absolutely hilarious. I highly recommend her.

We were quite disappointed with our experience at The Sockeye Grill. The service was awful, the salads were warm and bland with watered-down dressing. While the salmon was delicious, the finger steaks were mushy. The setting felt dull, resembling a barn rather than a restaurant, and the numerous TVs showing gloomy news didn't help. The only positive was the dark lager suggested by our waitress. Overall, we were let down by our visit and don't plan on coming back.

We had an amazing time dining here on St. Patrick's day to celebrate my sister's birthday. The server and bartender were so friendly, treating us to cake and a tasty St. Patty's cocktail. The food was really delicious, with the rotisserie chicken and tri-tip standing out. The veggie burrito was a bit underwhelming, but the rest of the dishes more than made up for it. The prices were fair, portions were generous, and the service was top-notch. We will definitely come back again. It's a fantastic spot, just not ideal for vegetarians!

Anders Osborne's show at this venue was a standout moment of my visit to NOLA. The streetcar conveniently transported me to Bourbon Street post-concert, though I regret not extending my stay to relish the tantalizing scents of the food and the affordably priced drinks. The audience exuded a laid-back vibe, contributing to the delight of the entire affair.

Although folks in the area rave about Ralph's, our time there fell short. The grilled calamari was drowned in a too-salty red sauce and the pasta bolognese with filet mignon tips lacked quality. Even the black lobster ravioli, while okay, was way too salty. In general, we had higher hopes for the oldest Italian restaurant in the nation.

The Catalina Mountains provide a stunning high desert haven that is ideal for running or hiking. The beauty of the canyon is truly captivating and we are absolutely entranced by it. #MCLifeTucson is a must-see for nature enthusiasts looking for a distinctive outdoor adventure.

The beer experience at this burger joint was subpar, with mediocre service and unappealing beer flavors. The bartender didn't address the problem after the first drink was returned, revealing a lack of beer expertise. Additionally, the glassware used was unsatisfactory, with subpar shaker pint glasses and improper choices for various beer types. In general, the staff's beer know-how didn't meet expectations for a place offering a wide range of craft beers.

Orangetheory is an awesome fitness studio with the most incredible full body workout I've ever tried. The range of classes available makes it super easy to squeeze into my hectic schedule. Absolutely love it!
The tour was amazing with a helpful and welcoming guide, Raymond. The food stops were delectable, and the whole experience was truly worthwhile. I highly recommend it.

Ron's pub remains a top choice for me. The variety of craft beers is consistently impressive, and this week is no exception. The food is delicious, just make sure to order the right dishes. It's a place I frequent for good reason.

This place is amazing - the donuts are freshly made to order, so they're always mouthwatering. The wait was definitely worth it to savor them while they're still warm. The spot is neat, not too crowded, and with the added perk of having a parking lot. Without a doubt, the finest donuts in Philly and the Delaware Valley. An absolute essential for any donut enthusiasts!

My stay at Econo Lodge was awful. The rooms were filthy and the staff was rude. The manager, Neil Patel, was snarky and offered no assistance. The rooms were not cleaned well, and it was all just unsanitary. I wouldn't suggest staying at this Econo Lodge or any of their other properties. It's wise to go for a more established hotel brand for a more pleasant stay.

You've got to check out Cafe Soleil, a bakery with amazing French pastries that are truly authentic and mouthwatering. The croissants are so buttery and flaky, they rival those you'd find in France. The imported ingredients and skilled French baker really make a difference in the flavor. The only drawback is that it's a tad distant, but totally worth the trip for anyone who loves sweets. I highly suggest paying a visit.

Enjoy delicious Italian dishes at an affordable price, served with hospitality in a fantastic neighborhood BYOB restaurant. The generous portions and diverse menu choices are perfect for those who adore Italian cuisine. Ideal for a meal before a sporting event, remember to secure your reservation ahead of time.

Todd Cobell always delivers exceptional performances, and his music never fails to win over the crowd. You can't go wrong with any of his songs, which makes him a favorite choice for music enthusiasts.

You definitely need to check out this restaurant for its amazing ambiance, top-notch service, and mouthwatering food. The pizza is absolutely fantastic and the daily specials are so flavorful and come in big portions. The team, particularly Selena, Jayna, and Chris, are super friendly and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Overall, it's a truly exceptional dining adventure.

Despina over at EWC is a waxing angel! She works fast, is super nice, very skilled, and uses top-notch wax. My eyebrows have never looked this good, all thanks to her. I genuinely look forward to my waxing sessions now, all because of Despina. She's hands down the best in the business.
The delivery person was friendly and the pizza delicious, but it came barely warm for the second time. I might explore other options until the problem is fixed.

Outstanding food and service at Sbraga's chef's counter 6-course meal with wine pairings. Pricey, but truly worth every penny for the up-close view of delicious dishes. Highlights include Gruyere popover paired with foie gras soup, saffron spaghetti with blue crab, crispy Arctic char, and chicken liver mousse. The wines complemented the meal perfectly, and a delightful birthday treat added to the unforgettable evening. Looking forward to returning!

GlobalQ is a definite must-try if you're seeking something distinctive in the area. Their quesadillas and wraps are all superb, ranging from good to exceptional. The servings are hearty, especially the quesadillas with their creative fillings. The wraps are massive, guaranteeing leftovers for the next day. I suggest sampling the 'Montreal' or 'New Orleans' wraps for a unique experience. The 'French Dip' quesadilla is a standout choice, even if it's not officially on the menu. And the cherry on top? They offer delivery.

I recently gave Wendy's a shot after a while and was genuinely impressed. The sea salt on their fries was a great move and the food's quality surpassed what I expected from fast food. It's definitely worth giving a shot, even for folks who usually steer clear of fast food.

I used to love eating at this restaurant, but my recent visits have been pretty disappointing. The service was bad and the food just wasn't that great. It's not really worth the money, so I don't think I'll be going back.

I was let down by this specific DSW store. The setup reminded me more of a warehouse and the quality and assortment of shoes didn't stack up to other DSW stores I've been to. The inattentive customer service was also irritating. I suggest trying out other DSW locations for a more enjoyable shopping trip.

Even though That BBQ Place has a cool vibe and welcoming staff, the expensive menu, limited facilities, and average ribs don't really make me want to go back. But hey, judging by how much locals seem to love it, I might not be missed if I skip it next time.

This shop is seriously short on staff, leading to lengthy wait times of up to 25 minutes at the checkout. It's advisable to steer clear of this shop if you can, as the employees know about the problem but it appears to be a deliberate tactic to increase profits. Customer service might take a hit because of the lack of staff.

I had an awesome time at Mel's for a late lunch. The turkey club sandwich was so delicious - packed with juicy turkey on flavorful multi-grain toast. The chef/server was really nice and made me feel right at home. Seeing and smelling the pork roast getting ready for tomorrow's sandwiches got me stoked to come back for more yummy meals, even breakfast. I'm really looking forward to my next visit!

If you're craving tasty tacos and tortas, this spot is a must-visit. They serve up fast service and genuine Mexican dishes that will really hit the spot. Make sure to also sample their delightful baked treats; they're a real hidden treasure!

The Monteleone is an ideal option for a romantic escape in New Orleans. The historic hotel boasts charming decor, friendly staff, and a great location for discovering the city. The rooftop pool provides breathtaking views, and the jacuzzi tub in our room was a nice touch for relaxation. Looking forward to coming back!

The dining area in this restaurant could use a bit of sprucing up. The salad was tasty, but they skimped on the bread. It was a letdown that they didn't serve sweet tea. On top of that, there was a booth where kids were on their own for a good half-hour. It seemed like an employee brought them to work, which was worrying since they were young and unsupervised.
My brother and I ate here to celebrate my college graduation and I left feeling totally satisfied. The restaurant had awesome vibes, our waiter was outstanding, and the food was mouthwatering.

I was really bummed about my first visit to Blaze Pizza. Even though their sign said they closed at 10pm, they actually shut their doors at 9pm without telling me why. It would've been nicer if they had explained the early closure on a regular weeknight.

Dr. Dayley is an amazing dentist! His friendly demeanor and expert work have really helped me feel at ease about dental visits. I have full confidence in him and had a fantastic experience having my wisdom teeth removed. The whole team is warm and caring, creating a wonderful atmosphere at the dental office. I enthusiastically suggest Dr. Dayley to all my friends and family, as he has become our favorite dentist. Thank you for the outstanding care!

P.F. Chang's casual dining spot provides a speedy and tasty meal with delightful flavors at a reasonable cost. While it may not boast the same ambiance as their formal sit-down restaurant, the convenience of ordering at the bar and swiftly getting your food more than compensates for it. A definite must-visit for P.F. Chang's enthusiasts.

I absolutely love this salon for blow outs. The team is really skilled and welcoming, and it's super easy to book online. I usually go to Krissy or Bianca, but all the stylists are fantastic. I also recommend adding a vital shot to your blow out for extra conditioning that really lasts - it works wonders for maintaining healthy blonde hair.

To be honest, I was pretty let down by my order from this place. The way the food was served and quick delivery were the only good parts. But, the sushi was warm and soggy, the calamari wasn't cooked enough and was falling apart, and the lettuce wraps weren't what I expected based on the menu. The one thing that saved the meal was the spicy white tuna roll. I won't be ordering from here again and will just go with Niji's on 5th.
The bartender's service was terrible and exasperating. She only appeared to cater to the regulars, neglecting customers waiting at the bar with money ready. I wouldn't suggest this place.

Normand's Bistro is a great spot for a late-night snack after a show at the Winspear. It's open late on weekends and although the menu can be a bit expensive, the food is delicious and made with fresh ingredients. The smoked salmon Carpaccio is a must-try and they have a diverse selection of beers. It's a solid choice for a late-night bite in the area.
The customer service at this store is amazing, especially Tonya who really went the extra mile to help us with our damaged shirt exchange. I highly recommend it.

My dogs and I just adore this place! The diverse selection of toys and abundance of products make it a favorite for us, especially when they have sales. The employees are kind, welcoming, and super informative whenever we have any questions. Even though it's a chain store, it has the cozy feel of a neighborhood pet shop that we love to visit.

The service and staff were welcoming, but the food was underwhelming. The German takeout item ordered was merely a pretzel and a piece of sausage in a box, lacking diversity and taste. Maybe it was just an off day in the kitchen.

I've been a loyal follower of Charlie's for quite some time and I just revisited in search of well-fitting jeans. The employee who assisted me was so helpful and understanding, bringing out several options for me to test out and walking me through all the specifics. I wound up purchasing two pairs of Sebastian McCalls and I am absolutely delighted with stumbling upon this brand. Adorable and cozy, this shop has won me over!

My visit to this car wash on Senior Discount Day left me feeling dissatisfied. Even after choosing the Super wash, my minivan was left unclean and not adequately vacuumed. The manager's response to my issues was unhelpful and lacking professionalism. In general, I would advise against patronizing this car wash due to the unsatisfactory service and mediocre cleaning standards.

The seafood platter at this restaurant was so tasty, especially the catfish. It was a big portion, and the red beans and rice and coleslaw were really good too. The margarita I got during happy hour wasn't amazing, but with the 2 for 1 deal, it's definitely worth checking out this spot for a nice meal.

I've been going to this massage therapy center regularly for quite some time and I've always had a great experience. The place is always clean, the staff never hurry through the sessions, and they really take the time to focus on any specific concerns you might have. Felicia, in particular, is outstanding and gives an excellent therapeutic massage. I highly suggest this spot for anyone looking for a soothing and beneficial massage.

The Sunrise Family Restaurant provides a cozy, small-town vibe with quick and welcoming service. While the Monte Cristo sandwich fell short of expectations, the fries and salad hit the spot. I'm open to sampling different dishes next time, especially during breakfast. I'm looking forward to coming back and exploring their menu further.

Our initial outing to Butcher & Bee with my partner and colleagues turned out a bit of a mixed bag. The eatery exuded a charming farmhouse ambiance with snug booths for a touch of intimacy. Despite feeling slightly cramped for our group of 7, we were promptly seated. I relished the pork belly gnocchi, yet yearned for some crispy pork belly for added texture. My partner was underwhelmed by his trout sandwich, musing that it resembled more of a tuna salad sandwich. The coconut macaroons for dessert proved to be delightful. One colleague raved about the KFC sandwich. All in all, we are inclined to give this establishment another shot. The utilization of books as bill holders was a charming detail.

All in all, this beer event is a fantastic experience for beer lovers with a diverse range of choices to sample. The beverages are reasonably priced, although the food is somewhat expensive. Opting for VIP may not be justified in every case, but for some, it's a worthwhile investment. There are downsides to the venue, like pricey parking and added onsite expenses, but for beer enthusiasts, it's an enjoyable event.

Kiwi Nail consistently provides disappointing service with careless work and rushed results. The technicians neglect to correct errors properly, resulting in a lack of quality. Furthermore, the requirement to tip in cash exclusively can be irritating for clients. Ultimately, it's not worth the inconvenience to patronize this salon.

Chick-fil-A shines in the fast food realm with its top-notch food that doesn't seem like a bunch of additives. As someone who isn't usually a fan of fast food, I value the elevated experience that Chick-fil-A provides.

Square 1682 stands out as an amazing hotel bar with delicious food, exceptional service, and a luxurious ambiance. The welcoming mix of folks, whether they're staying at the hotel or are from the area, adds to the pleasant vibe. What sets this spot apart is definitely Dan, the bartender who truly goes the extra mile to ensure you have a fantastic time. He not only knows your name but also your favorite drinks, which adds a personal touch to your visit, leaving a lasting impression. I always make it a point to drop by on Mondays specifically when Dan is on duty – he's just that impressive! Overall, Square 1682 is a definite go-to for an outstanding evening out.

This cafe is definitely worth a visit, offering a nice variety of coffees and a compact yet effective menu. The dishes are served promptly and consistently fresh, with the Wilburt Skillet standing out as a particularly delicious choice. It's best to come early to skip the lines and depart feeling pleasantly full and content. All in all, it's a dependable and delightful dining option.

My visits to European Wax Center in Philadelphia had their ups and downs. During my first wax session with Despina, things didn't go smoothly - she hardly talked and missed spots. The second time with Amy Jo was a bit more pleasant, but the results were messy and I had to clean up at home. The front desk staff were also a bit impolite and insistent on tips. I've decided not to go back and will look for a different place for my next wax.

I really adore this brunch spot! The ambiance is fantastic and cozy, and the flavor pairings in the dishes are remarkably distinctive. The Cuban Lamb Frita with an egg is a must-try, and all of the side items are scrumptious. The staff is welcoming and quick, particularly with coffee refills. I will absolutely make this my go-to brunch spot from now on.

All in all, this place is pretty decent despite the small portion size given the price. The drinks are reasonably priced, and the service is excellent. The piano really adds a nice vibe to the atmosphere. Be sure to give the amazing cheesecake a try.

Get ahead of the rush and savor a delightful breakfast at this hidden treasure. The only drawback is its cozy size, but the delicious food more than compensates for it. The menu offers mouthwatering choices, including vegetarian and vegan selections. Don't miss out on the exceptional french toast specials. It's an ideal place to energize yourself before the Mardi Gras festivities. I wholeheartedly endorse it!

I really suggest Butch's tour for a calm and enlightening experience with nice places to eat and visit the cemetery. Taking this tour early in your visit will give you a good sense of direction for the rest of your trip. Butch is also enjoyable and does an excellent job overall.

I really enjoy this food truck! The Captain Crunch tilapia burrito is a one-of-a-kind and delightful treat, with crispy fried fish and fresh toppings like cabbage, tomatoes, avocado, and Sriracha mayo. The katsu and curry chicken are also tasty and fulfilling. The Thai tea is always perfect. The prices are reasonable and the staff is welcoming. It's worth making the trip from Jersey just to savor their fantastic street food.

I had a rough day dealing with a migraine and sinus infection, but luckily, I found solace at Massage Envy. They managed to squeeze me in spontaneously, gave me the exact massage I required, and even accommodated my father as well. Jen was compassionate, pleasant, and shared useful techniques for finding relief at home. The foot massage my father had was also top-notch. Their membership program is budget-friendly and fits well with my hectic schedule. The team is welcoming, the ambiance is fantastic, and the setting is soothing. I already feel much improved and will absolutely be coming back for a 90-minute massage down the line. I highly recommend it!

This spot is a secret treasure for mouthwatering roast chicken. The chicken is juicy, the skin crispy, and the flavor smoky and delightful. The double chicken family meal is sufficient to satisfy a family of four with fries and cole slaw. The dipping sauces are fantastic, particularly the mustard base with a chipotle kick. The serving sizes are generous and definitely worth the cost. The proprietors are welcoming and deliver excellent service. I'd opt for this place over Popeyes or KFC anytime. Looking forward to returning for more delectable chicken.

If you're not a fan of classic Japanese sushi but still crave a bit of Japanese flavors, this spot serves up tasty rice bowls and tempura. The setting is relatively calm, ensuring you won't wait long. They provide excellent catering choices for special occasions. The service is prompt, and the dishes are fulfilling for a quick meal, whether it's lunch or dinner. Ideal for those pressed for time.

I recently relocated to Westchase and was in need of a new dentist. After coming across some glowing reviews, I decided to schedule an appointment with Dr. Creech-Gionis and Dr. Stern, who conveniently have their practice just half a mile away from where I live. The entire team is exceptional, and both dentists are truly remarkable. Their expertise made my visits far more bearable, and I couldn't be more pleased with the results. I highly recommend them.

Even though we had heard good things, our visit to Amigos for our 40th anniversary didn't meet our expectations. The ambience was underwhelming, the dishes were just okay, and the costs seemed too high for the value. The salsa wasn't as amazing as suggested, and the chips were rather ordinary. We find ourselves longing for Gloria's despite its cleanliness concerns. All things considered, the $47 we spent, including drinks and tip, wasn't really justified. It might be more satisfying to explore one of the taco trucks in Boise for tastier options.

Heather was an amazing waitress and bartender at this restaurant. Everything I tasted was fantastic, especially the tenderloin sliders with French fries. I'll definitely be back as much as I can, you won't regret giving this place a try.
The security staff at LEX can be really pushy and rude, which sets the tone for the whole place. I'd suggest looking for alternative options before settling for this spot.

This beachside sandwich shop serves up generous, gourmet sandwiches priced like Subway. The owner is super friendly, and the daily specials, like the shrimp tacos with kiwi sauce, are mouthwatering. The only downside is the small outdoor seating area, but the top-notch food totally makes up for it. Perfect for hotel visitors and will soon even offer delivery. A beloved spot known for its five-star cuisine.

This contemporary spot has a stunning view and is conveniently situated near public transportation. However, residents on the side facing the train might encounter some noise disruptions. All in all, it's a fantastic spot with a delightful cafe nearby.

I asked for a full set with long nails, but they were trimmed too short. When I mentioned a misaligned nail, it was filed incorrectly and kept getting shorter. Despite being a returning customer, this visit will unfortunately be my final one.

I definitely suggest trying it out on a Tuesday for the awesome deal on tapas and $5 Sangria/margaritas. The Fried Manchego, Hot Cauliflower, and Camarones were absolutely delicious and had their own special flavors. It's definitely an experience you won't want to miss, especially for the great value.
