If you enjoy live Jazz music, this spot is a must-visit. While the absence of alcohol and food could be a drawback for some, the concentration solely on the music truly allows the talent to sparkle. The venue excels in displaying the rich culture of New Orleans through their music. Priced at $15 per ticket, it's absolutely worth it for the experience.

If you enjoy shopping without the hustle and bustle, this mall is an ideal choice. The atmosphere is serene and laid-back, creating a pleasant space to explore and shop without any stress. Perfect for those who appreciate a soothing shopping experience.

This restaurant was a fantastic pick after a hectic day. The staff gladly arranged a quiet table for us and the service was superb. The recommended aged ribeye steak was exceptional, living up to expectations. Opting to share the 18-ounce portion turned out to be an excellent choice. Furthermore, the shrimp cocktail and iceberg wedge salad were delightful. The only drawback was the narrow wine choices, but all in all, it was a great dining experience, deserving of a solid 4.5 stars.

I had the worst Italian food ever! The service was terrible, the dishes were bland, and the whole experience was really disappointing. I wouldn't suggest going to Caruso's, you should try Contessa instead for authentic Italian food. It was really disappointing and definitely not worth the money.

Even though I usually don't like strip mall bars, I chose to check this one out because a friend suggested it. The food was actually really good, and I can't wait to try their pizza next time. Having a craft bar there was a nice bonus, and the prices weren't bad. Overall, it was a nice surprise and definitely worth a visit.

I tried the Buffalo chicken salad from this place and it was fantastic! The greens were so fresh and crispy, the chicken was delicious, and the blue cheese dressing was really smooth. Can't wait to go back for another one.

Luke Restaurant in New Orleans is a must-try for those craving French-German cuisine. The old-school vibe and the peek into the bustling kitchen really elevate your dining adventure. While nabbing a table without booking ahead was a bit tough, the tasty dishes and top-notch service totally made up for it. The drinks were delicious, the main courses hit the spot, and the sweets were pure indulgence. Our waiter was super nice and really made our meal unforgettable.

While the dental work was good, the prices at this clinic are quite high and there might be some treatments that aren't really needed. The TVs in the exam rooms seem like a fancy touch but they could be a bit distracting during dental procedures. In general, I was happy with the service, but the cost played a big part in shaping my overall experience.

Yesterday was my initial trip to Paris Parker and it was fantastic. Stacey nailed my full highlight session, eliminating all the undesired tones in my hair and leaving me with a lovely, vibrant blonde. Besides being talented, she was also delightful to talk to throughout the session. Definitely suggest booking with her, but she can be quite popular!

I really enjoy the diverse range of ready-made teas and the option to blend my own brews. While the loose tea can be a bit expensive, the high quality justifies the cost. The staff is super welcoming and consistently remembers my favorite choices. Overall, my visits are always fantastic.

GRI is the perfect spot for a unique engagement ring. Terry and Nirali are extremely knowledgeable and supportive, walking you through the process effortlessly. The personalized design choices are fantastic, and the final product is absolutely beautiful. The entire experience is like chatting with pals, not just a typical business deal. I highly suggest GRI for all of your jewelry desires.

Fantastic spot for cocktails with one-of-a-kind glassware and mouthwatering drink selections such as Dragon's Tear and Blackmail. Though on the pricier side, the whole experience is truly worth it. Relaxed ambiance with appropriate tunes and stylish decor. While the food choices could use some enhancement, I'll certainly come back for the beverages.

Pizzaville really impressed me with their top-notch food, abundant toppings, and stellar service. The pizza crust was just right - crispy yet slightly chewy, loaded with delicious cheese and zesty tomato sauce. Their "breadsticks" were essentially divine garlic bread strips that I kept devouring. The staff members were super nice and the place was spotless. I'm already looking forward to checking out their lunch buffet next time!
The service and staff were friendly, but the food was bland and the drinks were just okay. If you're looking for a fast lunch spot, this could be a choice.

I really liked the contemporary and inviting atmosphere of the restaurant. The decor was stylish, although the lighting was better for dinner than for selfie-taking. Our server seemed a little hurried and impatient, but the food was tasty overall. The Shrimp Breaux Bridge, Balsamic Salmon, and Pesto Crusted Idaho Trout were all prepared and seasoned excellently. The Zangria White sangria was pleasant, although it lacked some of the promised seasonal fruits. Despite the service hiccups, I would definitely come back to sample more items from the menu.

The burgers at this offshoot of Rouge are notably superior to those at the main locations. The variety of toppings is always growing, allowing for personalized burger creations. The Kobe Beef burger justifies the higher price, especially with truffle cheese and grilled onions on a brioche bun. Don't miss out on the truffle oil fries, and the extended weekend hours add to the appeal. A top pick for burger enthusiasts.
The pizza at this place was a letdown. The restaurant before had more delicious, homemade dishes. I wish I could have stayed there instead.
Swung by to grab some lunch and sampled the jalapeno burger, it was amazing. The outdoor seating was a lovely addition. Can't wait to come back.

In general, I would definitely suggest this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Reno. The spa, rooms, and customer service are all excellent. The only drawbacks were the absence of bathroom fans and a minor slip-up with room service.

All in all, this spot was fantastic for those seeking an engaging tour, quality beer, and an upbeat ambiance. The diverse range of offerings including watching sports, playing board games, enjoying live music, and frequent tours added to the excitement. Though it might feel a tad busy occasionally, everything blends smoothly. It’s an ideal choice for a joyful outing with friends or a romantic evening.

This place is a complete mess. The service is awful, the food is horrible, and the cleanliness is just not up to par. I'm really worried about getting sick after eating here. Avoid this place at all costs.

My go-to wine and liquor shop in Nashville. The staff is super friendly and always ready to help, plus they've got a great variety and reasonable prices. Just watch out for the steep curb when you drive in to prevent any scrapes on your car.

The daycare at Circle of Friends has been a perfect match for my family. Linda and her team are so nurturing, and my kids have been making great strides emotionally and academically. I value the consistency and the uplifting atmosphere they create. I wholeheartedly suggest this daycare.
The new place on Central is amazing with a wonderful team and atmosphere. It feels like they've discovered a place where they'll really flourish.

Great location and super friendly service, but the food is a bit bland and lacks the depth of flavor found in other Ethiopian restaurants. The atmosphere really captures the essence of Ethiopian dining, but in the end, it's just okay and doesn't stand out. I'd give it a 6 out of 10.

I tested out this restaurant for the first time and was amazed by the mouthwatering seasoning on the seafood. We got oysters, a $45 combo, and garlic chicken wings for a group of six, which was plenty of food. The only downside was that our order was a bit off.

The chicken was way too salty, and I only got 2 pieces of plantains even though I ordered 1/2 chicken, rice, and plantains. I paid $8 for this and it was not worth it. I might have to think twice before ordering from here again.

At first, my visit to this Chinese take-out spot was just okay, with the food being neither exceptional nor awful. But on my second trip, I was truly impressed by the amazing food and perfect service. I highly encourage you to check this place out! A definite 5-star rating.

The Rib Cook-Off in Sparks is a tradition for us every year. Opting for the bus takes away the stress of finding parking and lets us relax with a few drinks before indulging in the scrumptious food. Using the JA Nugget app makes getting around the event super easy. Remember to bring some cash and check out the other vendors besides ribs. Make sure to take advantage of the discounted offers on Monday night. It's a fantastic event for enjoying delicious food and having a blast!

The food and drink selection at this lively bar were top-notch, but the service was a tad sluggish and inattentive. The crab bisque and Poulet Grand-Mère were absolutely delightful, but the service could use some improvement. In general, it was a decent dining outing, but I might check out other spots in the vicinity before coming back. Rating: 4 out of 5.

The food here is amazing, especially their chocolate chip pancakes. The service is fast and the payment process is efficient. The wait can be a bit long sometimes, so it's better to go early to avoid queues. I highly suggest trying out this place for a delicious breakfast in Nashville.

The Sunday brunch at this restaurant is a fantastic deal for foodies looking to enjoy a sumptuous spread and endless mimosas. The buffet offers a wide array of delectable options like seafood, made-to-order sushi, and decadent desserts. The mimosas are generously poured with plenty of champagne. Additionally, the a la carte menu boasts tasty selections. The cozy ambiance and top-notch service create a pleasant dining experience, even on gloomy days. If you're up for indulging in a feast of food and drinks, you'll walk out content and cheerful!

After our camping adventure, we made a pit stop in Santa Barbara for some amazing fish tacos at a top-notch spot. The flavors were absolutely delightful, and we were pleasantly impressed by the scrumptiousness of our tacos. The chefs were so kind, they even served us a generous plate of crispy battered shrimp to sample. We savored our feast on the terrace, basking in the pleasant December climate. We're absolutely planning to return on our next visit to Santa Barbara. And to top it off, the staff were super friendly.

I've visited On the Border in Mount Laurel more than 50 times, and I've really grown fond of their chips and salsa. The chips have a pleasant saltiness, and the salsa packs a nice little punch. I usually prefer to hang out at the bar, where I can enjoy some beer and snacks, and they often have some good beer deals. Their vegetarian side dishes are a nice choice, and the cheese enchiladas are a personal favorite of mine. The service is generally good when dining in. However, the experience with the bartenders can be quite different. Joann is amazing, whereas Nikki's service is not up to par. Overall, On the Border provides tasty appetizers, cold beer, and reasonable prices.

Hectic but worthwhile. Definitely recommend the peach shake, it was incredible. Prices are fair and they offer a lot of choices. The wait was pretty long under the sun, but all in all, a fantastic place to visit in St Louis. Ordering at the window could get a little confusing with the different lines.

Yummy treats, but the customer service needs work. The cakes were fantastic, but the wait was way too long and the takeout containers weren't very practical. It was a bummer that the barista didn't seem to know how to make a decent cup of joe. Fingers crossed that this place gets better soon.

I was so impressed by the accommodations at the JW. The team really went out of their way to support a working mom like me who needed a private space to pump during a trade show. Nathan was prompt and offered a spotless and secluded boardroom for my use. The facilities were spotless and the team was exceptionally friendly and understanding. Huge thanks to the JW and their staff for making the necessary arrangements to help working moms - it truly brightened my day!

All in all, Joe's serves up scrumptious dishes at an excellent value, especially the beef tacos and satisfying meatloaf paired with creamy mashed potatoes. The salad was crisp and abundantly sprinkled with tangy bleu cheese crumbles. The cozy ambiance offers a diverse selection of dishes. Yet, the service fell short on both occasions, as the servers failed to share any specials or demonstrate a good grasp of the menu offerings. Nevertheless, Joe's is definitely a spot to check out for its delightful comfort food and charming atmosphere.

The food at this place is absolutely fantastic. The friendly atmosphere and wide variety of menu options create a really enjoyable experience. The sandwiches are packed with tasty meat, and the homemade toasted ravioli is one of the top picks in town.

Upon learning about St. Louis BBQ, I figured I'd give this place a shot and was really impressed with the customer service. The house-made BBQ sauce is a delightful blend of sweet, tangy, and spicy flavors, which might be a bit much for some palates. The pulled pork sandwich, beans, and cole slaw were absolutely scrumptious, though they might be a bit overwhelming for those not familiar with this kind of food. All in all, a fantastic outing for BBQ enthusiasts.

I was really let down by the chicken salad sandwich. There were just two tiny pieces of chicken and some mayo in it. The so-called salad was just a bowl of lettuce, which left me feeling hungry and not satisfied at all.

All in all, our brunch at this restaurant was delightful. The food was consistently delicious, featuring delectable omelets and flavorful beverages, including a playful bloody mary bar. The service was prompt and friendly, although we did need to request more bacon. The affordable breakfast choice was satisfying, and the fish tacos were also delicious. We particularly savored the experience of dining outdoors on the patio. A wonderful spot for a enjoyable brunch.
This place is totally worth the wait in line. The simple breakfast I had was amazing and the service was fantastic. I'll definitely be coming back, even with the tough parking situation.

I enjoyed a wonderful winter meal at home thanks to C & B's through Order Up Delivery Service. The Swanky Frank with fries was scrumptious and the spices on the fries were a delightful addition. The beef chili was neatly packed and just right for a midnight treat. The extra sour cream and crackers on the side were a nice touch. I highly recommend using Order Up for a comforting chili experience at home this winter.

In general, the food at this restaurant is scrumptious and full of flavor, though it may come with a hefty price tag. The menu is always evolving, keeping you on your toes, but every dish is consistently outstanding. The donuts are exceptional and definitely worth sampling for their one-of-a-kind appeal.

After a visit filled with indulgence and fantastic company, my next go-to picks at Livery are the Carriage House Margarita for a special touch, all the empanadas for a guilt-free indulgence, The Red Drum for a scrumptious fish entrée with a side of yuca fries, and the heavenly churros (you definitely won't want to share these!). I highly suggest following my lead on your upcoming visit.
Amazing service, scrumptious food, and a cozy atmosphere. The Black and Blue burger was outstanding and the sweet potato fries were absolutely delicious. Can't wait to come back again!
The absolute best donut shop ever, I wish they offered shipping. I recently relocated to Florida and I miss it terribly. Unfortunately, it's a New Orleans exclusive. Such a bummer!

Katie's is a well-established local restaurant offering traditional New Orleans dishes with an Italian-American flare. The meatballs are a highlight, and the ambiance exudes the timeless charm of New Orleans, attracting an older crowd who prefer early dining. Keep your expectations in check, and you'll leave satisfied.
I definitely suggest checking out this place for oil changes. The service was outstanding - quick, welcoming, and expert. It's now my preferred spot for all car maintenance needs.
I wouldn't suggest this place for Latino customers. The woman who cut my hair was impolite and unprofessional.

This restaurant really needs a fresh look. The decor is outdated and shabby, the food was mediocre with a burnt burger and uninspiring dishes, and everything felt grimy and sticky. The only good thing was the welcoming servers. It would certainly benefit from a makeover on a show like Restaurant Impossible to improve its quality.

I strongly suggest trying out this restaurant for its exceptional service and unbelievably delicious food. The huevo rancho and top sandwich were exceptional, and the grits were also quite delightful. The owner, who is a friendly gentleman with a genuine passion for food, adds an extra layer of enjoyment to the dining experience. Be sure to give him a warm greeting if you stop by!

I had a wonderful happy hour experience at this spot. The oysters were mouthwatering, we devoured two dozen along with some delicious cocktails. The Riverbend and champagne au poir were exceptional. The sides of fries and grits were also incredible - the finest grits I've ever tasted. The server was attentive in just the right measure. I will absolutely be back.

Bella Vista Designs is a fantastic group of experts who always bring creative and stunning designs to events. Their positive approach and reasonable prices set them apart. Attendees are consistently impressed by their efforts, expressing awe at the Santa Barbara Historical Museum and Goleta Valley Historical Society gatherings. Many thanks for the countless unforgettable and enchanting experiences!
I recently moved to Tucson and had to find a new dentist. I had a fantastic experience at this office and would definitely suggest it to others!
Way overhyped with mediocre food and awful service. They totally messed up my order without even saying sorry. Plenty of better choices on State Street. Steer clear of this spot.

I totally agree with the previous reviewer. The food, service, and prices at this restaurant are top-notch. The beef gyro, falafel, and hummus were all so fresh and tasty. The owner is really nice, and the portion sizes are huge. I highly suggest checking out this spot in Manayunk, as it's a bit under the radar but totally worth a visit. I'm definitely telling all my friends to come support this hidden gem.
The food was fantastic and the service was top-notch at this restaurant. The only hiccup was that our main dishes arrived a bit too fast after our starters, but it didn't detract from our meal.

The restaurant is situated in an average strip mall with a bland interior. The food is alright but nothing remarkable. It's not filthy but doesn't appear very tidy either. In general, just a moderate dining experience.
"What a fantastic spot to grab a bite, the food is just so yummy, especially the Hickory burger. Can't wait to come back!"

I had a one-of-a-kind and delicious time at this restaurant, with a waiter who really knew their stuff and cared about the food. The dishes were distinct and packed with incredible flavors, definitely a must-visit for food enthusiasts. Yet the servings were a bit small and the decor didn't quite match my taste. The food was too fancy for regular visits, as the menu gets updated yearly. Overall, it's a fascinating spot to check out, run by skilled chefs and accomplished owners. Adding booths would've been a nice extra.

In general, the vibe at this Asian restaurant has definitely leveled up since I was last here. The service stepped up its game a lot, especially with Dillon giving top-notch service. The atmosphere is pretty laid-back, giving you the choice to place your order and then chill while they bring your food. The dishes were flavorful and had a nice variety, even if not super fancy. The prices were super reasonable, with a family of four clocking in at around $30, a steal in today's market. If you're on the hunt for a speedy and relaxed Asian dining experience, this spot is definitely worth giving a shot.

Opting to use the Yelp app to join the waitlist turned out to be a great idea for a bustling Saturday morning. The menu offered a wide array of choices, yet the standout was definitely the delightful cinnamon French toast. While the classic breakfast selections were dependable, the additional menu items were truly intriguing. The strawberry orange juice was exceptionally fresh and delicious. The ambiance of the restaurant could have been improved for a more enjoyable visit. The service was top-notch, and the presence of two payment counters was a thoughtful detail for a quick and convenient departure.

Shaving Grace is a welcoming and cozy barbershop that reminds me of my old spot back in Philly. The free beer option added to the whole experience. The team is super friendly and talented, giving an awesome haircut while having cool chats. I have for sure discovered my new favorite place for haircuts and will be back for more.

The food at this restaurant is outstanding, and the staff is incredibly warm and sincere. The eggs Benedict were tasty, but the toast underneath was outstanding. Our server, Tina, even brought us a cream pancake to try, which was the most delicious pancake I've ever had. Bursting with vanilla flavor and incredibly fluffy, it dissolved in my mouth without requiring any extra syrup. Exceptional experience all around.

The service was outstanding and the food was absolutely delicious. My husband really enjoyed the cheese and bacon burger, while I simply adored the crawfish sausage po'boy. Both dishes were expertly prepared and packed with flavor. I highly recommend giving them a try.
My interaction with JT at Ashley Furniture store was amazing! He was incredibly helpful, especially when I had to make adjustments to my order. I highly recommend him!

I definitely suggest trying out Cucina Zapata food truck at Drexel University for a special and tasty lunch choice. Their graffiti-style truck really catches the eye compared to the other food trucks on campus. The thai short rib tacos and cap'n crunch tilapia burrito looked great and tasted fantastic, especially when paired with hot sauce. The food went beyond what we expected and gave us a top-notch experience. The prices are fair and the food quality is superb. I recommend checking out Cucina Zapata for a delicious meal that's a cut above the usual food truck offerings.

I had an amazing time getting my hair done by Jessie Becker at this salon. She managed to trim off the split ends and really paid attention to what I wanted. Jessie is kind, skilled, and wonderful with kids. I strongly suggest visiting this salon and scheduling a session with her.
I love the ramen here, the service is exceptional. So glad I found this gem, definitely worth checking out!

Though the ambiance is charming and the staff is friendly, the portion sizes at this restaurant are surprisingly meager. I left feeling unsatisfied and think that eateries should be more generous with their servings, especially in a local setting.

I tried out this restaurant for the first time not long ago, and I can confidently say the praise was well-deserved. My girlfriend decided on the Greek Salad, while I opted for the Chickpea Vegetarian Pita with a few modifications. The servings were not only scrumptious but also quite satisfying, and the staff were very amiable. The ambiance was also quite lovely. I definitely plan to come back!

I had a fantastic time at this bar and restaurant, with a roomy layout and plenty of TVs to catch the game. An added bonus is its connection to the O'Fallon brewery. The House Special IPA was really good, just the right amount of bitterness. The only downside was the limited dessert options. Seek out Troy at the bar for top-notch service. Rating: 4 stars.

This local hangout on the east side of Whyte Avenue is a pretty good spot for a night out with a younger crowd. The atmosphere is okay with a few pool tables and a foosball table. Drinks are fairly priced and they offer affordable wings with a side of carrot and celery. The pizzas seemed tasty although I didn't sample them. The team, from the youthful servers to the owner, were friendly. All in all, a dependable choice for a laid-back evening.

We got tired of buffets, so we decided to check out this Chinese restaurant close to the Peppermill. Situated among auto repair shops, the subpar Chinese cuisine was quite disappointing. Our orders kept getting mixed up, and the dish we eventually chose was not appetizing. I wouldn't suggest going there.

I had an awesome time at this restaurant, though there was a minor hiccup with the Yelp coupon. The food was really good, especially the chicken caeser salad which had plenty of chicken. The subs were so fresh and tasty. Having the choice of beer was nice, but I went for a Dr. Brown's cream soda which was amazing. The location is convenient, just a mile from the Wagon Wheel flea market. I would totally recommend this place.

I had a great experience at this optometrist. Dr. Neel and Robin were really nice, knew their stuff, and were super helpful. They took the time to answer all my questions, guided me in selecting trendy frames, and got me set up with contact lenses. They were hands down the best eye doctors I've seen and I definitely suggest checking them out.
I enjoyed a fantastic breakfast at this spot with oversized pancakes and delicious home fries. The owner was incredibly kind and accommodating. This place has definitely become a new favorite for me!

We lodged at this delightful hotel in the Big Easy with my family for six nights. From the doorman to the brunch wait staff, everyone was amiable and accommodating. The Carousel Bar is an absolute must-see. Excellent location, we will definitely come back on our next trip to New Orleans.
The chicken stew was underwhelming and tasted akin to reheated fried chicken tossed together in a pot. It lacked any real flavor and left me feeling queasy. I wouldn't suggest it.

The takeout service and food quality at Wei Hong in St. Louis were underwhelming. The steamed dumplings were overly doughy, while the beef and broccoli dish had a strange texture and unpleasant taste. Similarly, the textures and sauces of the General Tao's chicken and orange beef were unappetizing. In conclusion, our overall experience was disappointing, and we do not plan to go back.
Cecile was extremely helpful in helping us load plywood for Hurricane Irma preparations. We are very thankful for her support and assistance during this tense period. Thank you, Cecile!

I had an amazing dining experience at this restaurant. The chicken tagine was outstanding, with tender meat and flavorful seasoning. The carrot salad was a great addition with its mint and cumin flavors. The service was attentive and the atmosphere was lively and well-lit. The total cost was very fair at around $13. I definitely suggest checking out this spot for a tasty and budget-friendly meal.

Although the ambiance and service at this establishment were enjoyable, the food fell short of expectations. Our dishes were promptly served, but they appeared to lack freshness since they were either lukewarm or not fully cooked. The Caesar salad was excessively dressed, hush puppies lacked flavor, and chicken wings were not properly cooked. The only satisfactory option was the chicken and biscuits, although some parts of the biscuit were cold. In conclusion, we do not plan on returning to dine here due to the subpar food quality.
I felt let down after ordering online 30 minutes before pickup, only to end up skipping the line, and then being told they had no record of my order. What a letdown.

If you find yourself in Philly, you've got to sample the cream-filled donuts from this spot. They're truly amazing and totally worth making the trek back for seconds. Make sure you don't pass up this delightful indulgence!

This place isn't really worth your time or money. The owners and bartenders seem more focused on giving gamblers too much to drink rather than keeping the place clean and inviting. The kitchen has problems with mold and it doesn't smell good. The staff mostly seem interested in getting tips from intoxicated gamblers. It's quite disappointing for a restaurant or sports bar. It might be better to head to a fast-food spot across the street instead.

This was our first time at this restaurant and it turned out to be a fantastic decision. The service was top-notch with a warm and welcoming staff. Our server went the extra mile to assist my family, like helping my wife with her jacket while she held our baby. The Chicken Katsu Curry Ramen, Shrimp Katsu Ramen, and Shoyu Ramen were all incredibly delicious. The pork buns were a delightful surprise – not the usual but very tasty nevertheless. Overall, it was a truly wonderful experience.

Brew D Licious serves the most amazing coffee in town, no doubt about it. Brigitte, the owner, truly knows her stuff and makes sure the coffee is always fresh. I love it so much that I buy in bulk. I'm eagerly awaiting the opening of the new location so I can avoid the weird smell at the Hollander Hotel. I definitely suggest giving this place a try.

If you're craving delicious pizza and garlic knots by the beach, you're in luck! The location is fantastic with a trendy street vibe. It's obvious that these folks are experts at what they do. I definitely suggest checking it out.

If you enjoy oysters, this is the perfect spot to visit. You'll be treated to fresh and delightful oysters that are sure to leave a lasting impression. While the servers might not be able to provide the exact variety, it truly won't make a difference once you savor them. I highly recommend it!
Just had the food and it was amazing, the best I've had in the area. The kung pao beef and basil shrimp with pork fried rice were all really delicious. Quick delivery as well. Definitely recommend!

My partner and I enjoyed a tasty meal at this spot that serves more than just deli fare. We indulged in the Philly and club sandwiches, both of which were delicious and reasonably priced. The bill for four bags of chips and two sandwiches came to a little over $20. Be sure to arrive with an appetite, as the servings are generous.

Although some reviews were not great, my own interactions at this place have been really good. The staff might not be the friendliest, but they really know their stuff when it comes to dry cleaning and alterations. They worked wonders on a jersey with stains that were ten years old and have always been super quick, even when they're really busy. I definitely suggest trying them out and I'll be back for more alterations and dry cleaning services.

This spot is bigger than the Rittenhouse spot, plus there's the perk of having street parking available. Our server was really nice and gave great suggestions on what to order. The Groothie was a bit too sugary for my taste, but the Udon Noodle Salad was really tasty.

First time having dinner with the family, Bailey was amazing - so friendly and attentive. The food was absolutely delicious, with hearty portions and so fresh. I was really impressed with the quality as a newbie. Can't wait to go back for sure.

In general, the main dishes were delicious and the prices were fair at this Fazoli's spot. The breadsticks were a standout, but the subpar service and demeanor of the staff took away from the whole experience. By enhancing customer service and efficiency, this eatery could definitely receive a better rating.

In general, the car wash at Riverside Plaza was pretty convenient and enjoyable, featuring iguanas and parrots in the waiting area and a clear view of the auto wash system. The standard $12 treatment was swift, and I got my car back even before I finished paying. Though, there were a few spots missed on my car, making me wonder if the cost justified the experience compared to my preferred car wash in Los Angeles. I might give a touchless system a shot next time, hoping for comparable results without the added entertainment.
The turtle tank has been swapped out for a vibrant fish aquarium, but it’s unclear what happened to the turtle. Nonetheless, the upgrade comes highly recommended.

This Starbucks spot nails it with their drive-thru service, zipping through orders with a speedy flow and attentive employees. They offer plenty of seating both indoors and outdoors. For sure, a top-notch choice for your next Starbucks visit.

I asked for a scissor cut for my straight hair, but the stylist chose to use clippers against my wishes. This led to 90% of my hair being clipped. If you want a scissor cut, consider looking for another salon to avoid getting a military-style fade.

Just had an amazing lunch at this restaurant in NOLA. The artichoke and crab salad was absolutely delicious and the grilled and roasted vegetable platter was also outstanding. The atmosphere and location really made the dining experience even better. I would definitely recommend giving this place a try!

I was told to try the lunch at this Nashville airport spot and it lived up to the hype. The quirky and diverse atmosphere really set the tone. They had some awesome and nutritious menu selections. My absolute favorite was the sweet potato casserole with coconut and dried cranberry - it was absolutely amazing. I would definitely suggest giving this place a try for a meal.

Whenever we're in town from Orlando, we always make sure to visit this charming venue. The staff here is simply amazing, and the service they provide is truly exceptional. Don't forget to ask for table #4 for an even more memorable experience.

This place excels in every way - mouthwatering food, cozy ambiance, and excellent service. The Belgian Waffle with Nutella is a must-have, but the prices are a tad high. In general, it's a fabulous dining spot that's definitely worth a return visit.

In general, this brunch place is a good option with no wait after 1 pm on weekends. Yet, the absence of a proper seating arrangement can be annoying. The food varies from decent to fantastic, with the waffle being exceptional. Service may vary, but generally, it is attentive. The tidy establishment and reasonable prices make it a place worth checking out.

In general, my visit to this place was a bit of a mixed bag. The reuben sandwich left something to be desired because of the rye bread, however, my partner's sandwich was fantastic. The spicy chicken soup and cornbread were delicious, but the chai latte didn't quite meet expectations. The prices were on the higher side, yet the ambiance was pleasant, and the employees were very welcoming. I'd recommend giving it a go and forming your own opinion.

Target is a fantastic alternative to Walmart, offering a diverse range of products such as makeup, groceries, and household items. The prices are typically more affordable than other stores, and the store is nicely laid out with many checkout lanes available for speedy payment.

I had an amazing time at the Oyster Bar, especially loved the "firecracker" cocktail crafted by Kentrelle. The oysters were absolutely fantastic. I would give it 5 stars, but the range of ratings makes me wonder about the fairness of my own rating.

The biggest HMV store in town has a diverse range of gifts and titles, encompassing both classic and niche selections. The checkout team is prompt and not overly insistent on enrolling customers in their loyalty program. Prices are reasonable, but the ordering procedure might be sluggish. In general, it's a fantastic choice for rare finds.

I am absolutely blown away by this restaurant. You simply have to try the fried oysters, along with the crawfish bisque and shrimp with grits. Every dish we had was just so tasty. But do make sure to book a table ahead of time as it tends to fill up quickly.

After a long search for the perfect coat, I finally found my dream coat at Ross Dress for Less. The manager really stepped up to help me exchange the coat, even though I didn't have a receipt or tags. The customer service was fantastic, and I'll definitely be coming back to Ross again. I highly recommend it!

HipCityVeg is a great spot for a tasty and fulfilling meal. The Udon Noodle Salad and Crispy Hipcity Ranch are especially amazing. The team is welcoming, and the service is quick. Besides, they provide delivery options for extra convenience. I highly suggest giving them a try.

Philadelphia, I adore you. This wood-fired pizza spot perfectly embodies the authentic taste of Italy. The Marinara pizza was straightforward but incredibly tasty, and the Salsiccia pizza with roasted fennel was a burst of genius. The cocktails were skillfully made and presented with a trendy, cool flair. The Rotolo featuring mortadella and pistachio pesto was unbelievably fantastic. The Italian cookies and Affogato dessert provided a flawless conclusion to a superb dining experience. The service was welcoming and outstanding. 5-star rating in every aspect!

This boutique provides top-of-the-line designer attire with outstanding customer care. The employees are welcoming and not overly assertive, creating a laid-back shopping atmosphere. Although they stock casual outfits, their focus is on suits, dress shirts, and elegant apparel. A standout choice in West Edmonton Mall for men's formalwear, but expect to invest. Ultimately, an excellent spot to discover premium wardrobe pieces.

The food from this Mediterranean food truck is delicious but not outstanding. The serving size could be better for the price, however, it's reasonable. This late-night venue has plenty of seats and a neat, peaceful ambiance among the vibrant nightlife. The staff is welcoming and prompt. All in all, a distinctive experience that's worth revisiting.

This bait shop is amazing. The people who work there are super nice and really know their stuff. They always have great advice on the best fishing spots. The bait is top-notch and they have a wide selection of fishing gear at really good prices. I used to buy from those big stores, but now I only come here. My only gripe is that there aren't more shops around! I totally suggest this place for all your fishing gear.
Nigel is such an awesome guy, and his candy is seriously amazing. It's totally worth the drive. All my friends are absolutely obsessed with the Bon bons he sells - they just can't get enough!

Muriel's in the French Quarter has a scrumptious $17 lunch deal that comes with a choice of soup or salad, main course, and the option to add on a $4 Bloody Mary or martini. The Bloody Mary had a kick to it and was a good value. The ambience of the restaurant is delightful, with open windows and a prime location. The waitstaff was a tad forgetful, but the food was fantastic. The turtle soup and pork chop stood out, but the cornbread was a bit dry. The portions were hearty and kept us satisfied until bedtime. In general, Muriel's is a splendid option for a classic New Orleans meal without breaking the bank. Highly recommend for anyone exploring the Quarter.

I decided to check out this spot after the shuttle driver suggested it, and I'm so glad I did. The red velvet ice cream was amazing - decadent and creamy with scrumptious cake chunks mixed in. So tasty!

Although the lady at the counter was very welcoming and helpful, the dishes at this American-Chinese diner were only mediocre. The vegetarian choices were tofu-centric, which was a pleasant surprise. The lunch specials offer great value, but regrettably, I ended up with food poisoning after my meal here and won't be coming back.

All in all, the restaurant was fantastic, especially the deep dish pizza with a distinctive cornmeal crust. The bianco salad was good but didn't quite wow us. The only drawback was the difficulty in getting a reservation and the steep prices. Still, it's definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area.

Indy Reads is a must-see bookstore in downtown, backing adult literacy with its excellent assortment of new and pre-owned books. The inviting ambiance is ideal for exploring, conversing with like-minded book enthusiasts, and participating in book readings. Prices are budget-friendly and all earnings contribute to a charitable cause. The only drawback is the crowded $1 children's book corner, but on the whole, Indy Reads is a marvelous bookstore worth visiting.

The customer had a bad experience at this tire shop because of the unfriendly and uncooperative staff. They couldn't schedule an appointment and had to wait a long time. In the end, they decided to go to a different tire shop, Mr. Tire, where they got fast and effective service. It's advised to check out Yelp reviews before going to this specific tire shop.

Fantastic experience at this flower shop! Gave them the freedom to get creative within a set budget, and they produced a vibrant and cheerful bouquet in a timely manner. Extremely pleased, much appreciated!

In general, this review really emphasizes the underwhelming visit to this specific restaurant. The slow service, peculiar food display, and below-average quality of dishes greatly influenced the one-star rating. The reviewer advises against spending time at this place, implying that even Taco Bell could be a preferable choice.

Karyn's coffee shop is a delightful place with a cozy vibe. The coffee is absolutely delicious and having the option for a quick drive-through is a major bonus. Karyn's friendly nature really enhances the whole experience. I highly suggest swinging by for a scrumptious cup of coffee.

Ed's is a happening spot with loads of fun to be had, offering a range of activity areas, dining options, bars, and chill-out spots all in one place. It has a cruise ship vibe, featuring cool pool rooms, arcade games, bowling, dance floors, and live tunes. The place showcases both famous and up-and-coming bands, giving new artists a chance to shine. Perfect for kids, birthday bashes, and anyone who digs music, Ed's is a lively and fantastic choice for a good time in E-town.

Even though my culinary adventures in Asia Pacific have given me a unique viewpoint, I felt that the enthusiastic reviews of this place were a tad overblown. Nevertheless, the pleasant conversation and great company during the meal really made the experience more enjoyable.

I felt let down when I found out they don't have the salad and pizza bar anymore. I used to go to their other spot often and was looking forward to having the salad there again. But now, they only serve whole pizzas. It's just not the same as it used to be.

Poblano's used to dish up a tasty Amiga bowl with shredded grilled chicken and rice, but switched the ingredients to dry chicken crisps. When I shared my letdown, the manager claimed this was the usual dish. The soft tacos were just as disheartening, with old shells and flavorless filling - it felt like the kitchen was falling behind probably due to a walkout. A letdown of an affair - not recommended, Poblano's gets two thumbs down.

While Dewey's is in a great spot and serves some tasty pies, the issue stems from the pizzas being overly salty. The pepperoni, socrates revenge, and bronx bomber were all so salty that it masked other flavors. The salads, although generous in portion, felt a bit overpriced for what you get. If Dewey's could dial down the saltiness, it would really elevate the dining experience.

My time at PF Changs was a rollercoaster of good and not so good moments. The server was nice and kept checking on us, but the dishes didn't quite hit the spot. The egg drop soup was tasty, but everything else seemed lukewarm and lacked taste. The candied walnut shrimp was too sweet and the brown rice was plain. Despite the delicious chocolate cake, I left feeling a bit let down. On the bright side, they do handle food allergies, like gluten, really well.

The rib dinner and pulled pork on a bun were tasty, but the ribs were chewy. The mac n cheese was scrumptious and lived up to the hype. The baked beans were okay, and the cole slaw had an odd aftertaste. Dining in an abandoned car wash was a one-of-a-kind experience. In general, definitely give it a shot just for the mac n cheese.

The fries are the highlight at this restaurant – incredibly tasty and definitely worth another visit! Nevertheless, the beef kebob sandwich was underwhelming with an excessive amount of onions and insufficient meat. I'm open to giving it another shot because of the excellent service and reasonable prices. The smoothies seemed artificial, but the cozy, family-owned atmosphere of the restaurant contributes to its appeal.

Taqueria Burrito's Grill is a real find in New Orleans East, serving up genuinely authentic Mexican dishes. Their green sauce is a must-have, and the cheese enchiladas are just scrumptious. The Mexican rice is also really fantastic. Under new management and having recently relocated from Houston, you can count on good food and great service. They're open every day, and breakfast is on from 9am-11am, making it a great place for a delicious meal. I'll be coming back often for sure! Delicious!
The serving size of the Mexican Roll and Philadelphia Roll was underwhelming for take-out, and the flavors lacked the distinctive touch I was hoping for.

Being close to Mass Ave shopping is not as abundant, but the choices are strong. Silver in the City is where I usually head to for current home and style pieces, plus they welcome pets in the shop. Yet, the vigilant staff can sometimes feel a bit much. On the whole, it's a wonderful place to discover special presents. Rating: 4 stars.

The food I got from this restaurant was really tasty, especially the puttanesca which had just the right mix of salty spiciness. The menu had a lot of choices, and you could even customize your dish. But it was a letdown that they didn't have any gluten-free dough, knowing I might regret this delicious meal later on.
The food was absolutely amazing, especially the crab cake Benedict which was divine. The service was outstanding and they had incredible smoothies. I highly recommend it!

I recently sampled Grillades for breakfast at this charming diner in New Orleans and it was truly delightful. The tender, slow-roasted beef paired perfectly with peppers and onions in a flavorful brown gravy, served over creamy Gouda cheese grits. The food was simply scrumptious. The service was prompt and our server was fantastic. A definite must-visit for my future trips to New Orleans.

Dealing with this rental company was a total nightmare. The staff never responded, the information they gave was completely wrong, and they didn't seem to care about making customers happy. Stay far away from them.

Sierra and India from JOTSB took excellent care of my family reunion in Santa Barbara. They were well-prepared, considerate, and went the extra mile to make sure our requirements were taken care of. I highly suggest them for any event planning requirements in the region.

I wasn't impressed by this place. Despite the absence of bagels and unattractive signage, the food was just mediocre. The pastrami serving was insufficient and the cheese wasn't melted. Even my wife got spoiled creamer in her coffee. We'll be going back to Einstein's or St. Pete Bagel from now on.
Fantastic Italian restaurant with welcoming staff, affordable prices, and mouthwatering homemade salad dressing. The food is absolutely amazing, so it's a definite go-to for fans of Italian cuisine.

I wholeheartedly suggest trying the breakfast burritos at this spot. The bacon, egg, cheese, and potato combo is mouthwatering and harmonious. The potatoes are seasoned just right and diced small to ensure a tasty blend of flavors in each mouthful. The salsa bar provides a delightful range of options, and the staff is consistently warm and welcoming. The only slight downside is that it could benefit from a touch more cheese. All in all, it's a fantastic place conveniently situated near my place.

Just moved to Tucson and explored different pizza spots near U of A, this one is the absolute favorite. I've never tasted better pizza, it even surpasses NYC. The crust is like magic and the spiciness in the five alarm is spot on. Definitely suggest giving it a try.

Despite the bustling atmosphere, Honey's definitely lived up to the buzz for my birthday brunch. The dishes were delightful, with the French toast and Jewish apple cake standing out in particular. Looking forward to returning soon!

Tria is a popular spot for beer and wine lovers because of their experienced staff and wide variety of options. The outdoor seating in the summer is an added perk, but the main attraction are the drinks. The lively vibe enhances the overall experience. While I haven't sampled the food yet, the drinks alone are reason enough to check it out.

Mae's is a local favorite on the east side, offering a cozy ambiance, delectable and fresh dishes, and top-notch service. The pocket-friendly prices cater to families, and the lunch specials are highly recommended! Don't miss out on experiencing Mae's for yourself.

This spot is a must-visit hidden gem in Tucson! The flavors are absolutely amazing, particularly the strawberries & champagne, toasted marshmallow, and cheesecake. I was so excited when they expanded to the valley after I relocated to Phoenix. I'll definitely be coming back here often!

This place has really gone downhill in recent years. With just 2 employees on duty, the service was painfully slow and the food was hardly fit to eat. The sandwich I ordered was served on tough, charred bread. They really need to step up their game or consider shutting down.

The cemetery is peaceful and beautifully arranged, showcasing impressive gravestones and angels that make for great photographs. But some might be put off by the witches hanging around and the girl's unsettling fascination with the cemetery. On a positive note, you won't find any zombies lurking about.

I decided on the Holiday Inn Express in Port Richey because it offered a room with two beds at a good price, it was close to my family, and they provided a free breakfast. The staff was really nice, the wifi didn't cost extra, and the breakfast had a nice variety of hot and cold choices. But, the beds were way too soft and not comfy, which made it hard for me to get a good night's sleep. Also, the AC control didn't work well. Overall, my stay was just okay compared to what I'm used to at Hyatt Place/House.
The employees at this restaurant were too busy chatting and glued to the TV instead of assisting customers. The food was okay, but nothing special. Overall, I’d give my visit a 2 out of 5.

The food at this place is amazing, but the customer service and portion sizes have really gone downhill. I've been a loyal customer for two years, but recently the portions have shrunk a lot. When I shared my concerns, I was told I was mistaken and scolded for not taking the food I ordered. Because of this experience, I won't be coming back to this spot.

I really enjoyed my time dining at this restaurant. The staff was so nice and gave great recommendations from the menu. The margaritas were amazing and the Happy Hour deals were really good. The chicken poblano dish was fantastic and my friend loved his enchiladas, especially having three different kinds on one plate. I would definitely suggest this spot for delicious food and a wonderful atmosphere.

Wow, that salted caramel chocolate cake was absolutely divine, and the Apple Brown Betty was equally fantastic. The beer selection was pretty solid too. I definitely suggest giving these desserts a try.

This bar is awesome for the college crowd with its chill vibe and budget-friendly drinks. The big screens for watching sports are a cool bonus, but a wider display would be better to avoid the picture spilling off the wall. The open layout in the daytime sets the stage for an amazing nightlife experience.

Awful service. The employees appeared confused and kept messing up my order. I asked for a half sausage half cheese pizza, but got all sausage instead. This is the second time this month that I've had problems with this place. Really let down.

I don't suggest dining at Marmont Steakhouse. The crab bisque soup was icy, the calamari was tasteless and tough, and the lobster ravioli ended up being beef, even after I mentioned my dietary restrictions. The way the staff handled the error was casual and lacking genuine care, resulting in a letdown and an ultimately sickening experience.

Tako is definitely the top-notch sushi spot. They serve up fresh and mouth-watering dishes, provide lively private rooms for a night of celebrations, offer a bring-your-own (BYO) policy, and have reasonable prices. My go-to dishes are the zesty jalapeño yellowtail, refreshing kani salad, unique bird's nest roll, and flavorful naruto. I wholeheartedly suggest giving it a try for an amazing dining adventure.

The nearby ice cream shop serves scrumptious personalized flavors like Expresso Chip, Moose Tracks, and Graham Slam. Each flavor is one-of-a-kind and fulfilling, making it a must for ice cream lovers.

My spouse and I have been getting our vehicles serviced at this location for a while now and have been happy with the service. The discount for ladies on Wednesdays is a nice bonus, and the $5 car wash is awesome for a speedy clean. Even though it's not a hand wash, it's still a good choice for a simple wash. They also provide deals on auto detailing packages, which we always utilize and have been satisfied with the outcomes.
In general, this place is okay. The food is alright but nothing too impressive, and the service is inconsistent. The drunken noodles and Thai green curry were both just average.

Redemption is like finding a treasure in an old church. The service was perfect and the food, such as the paneed smoked soft shell crab and seafood stuffed filet of fish, was outstanding. A must-visit for food lovers seeking a memorable dining adventure.

I adore this place! It's so conveniently close to where I live, and I end up there almost every other week. They switch up their flavors regularly and offer a wide range of toppings, including some hidden gems under the counter. The upbeat EDM tunes they blast really amp up the whole vibe and make it stand out. Definitely suggest giving this spot a visit!

This restaurant serves fantastic dishes like Steak Tartare, Caribbean Seafood Pepper Pot, and Curried Goat. The Tartare might just be the tastiest I've ever tried. The goat dish with sweet curry and gnocchi was both special and scrumptious. The lime cheesecake was absolutely fantastic. The service was outstanding, especially for a town with a reputation for hospitality. All in all, it was a wonderful dining experience.

This eatery presents a distinctive and diverse menu in a chic, masculine ambiance. Despite its somewhat lackluster location, the interior exudes a cozy and welcoming atmosphere. The staff is attentive and well-informed about the menu offerings. The cuisine is inventive and skillfully prepared, with standout dishes and a few that don't quite hit the mark. Prices are fair considering the food quality. An ideal spot for a peaceful and intimate dining experience.

"Great score! This frozen yogurt place is a winner for me. Tasty flavors, even the fat-free ones are so indulgent. Conveniently located on South Street for a sugary treat. Definitely worth checking out."

I was really impressed by the amazing service at this restaurant. The food and decor were just okay, but the servers really went the extra mile to deal with difficult customers in a very professional manner. The server, a young girl with purple hair, handled several tables with ease and did a fantastic job explaining the menu. Huge props to the staff for their exceptional customer service. Five stars all the way.

Hallmark dealership provides a seamless and clear shopping experience with reasonable prices, competitive certifications, and warranties on used vehicles. The team is welcoming and not aggressive, creating a pleasant contrast from other dealerships. Although I didn't buy a vehicle here, I suggest giving them a look for a hassle-free car-buying journey.

My visit to this restaurant was really disappointing. The chicken was slimy and way too salty, and the sides were cold and lacked flavor. The service was odd too, with the server laughing while taking my order, which made me feel uneasy. I definitely won't be coming back here.

The lobster rolls at this restaurant are absolutely delicious, whether you go for the warm or cold ones. The bread is just incredible too. Even though it might be a bit pricey, the food's so good that it's totally worth it.

The Habit Burger is a fantastic burger spot that can go head-to-head with In-N-Out. The double char burger and chocolate shake at the Goleta location were absolutely delicious, and the onion rings were a real standout. Definitely a great pick for satisfying your burger cravings.
My husband and I have been coming to this place for the last 8 years. The food is amazing, served promptly, and they offer fantastic drink specials. I absolutely recommend it.

Delicia in Broad Ripple is a delightful spot with a hip vibe and scrumptious cocktails. Although not taking reservations might be a tad inconvenient, showing up early pays off for seating. The guacamole was delectable, but be mindful of nut allergies. The Harvest salad and dishes such as Veracruz Trigger fish and Serrano Scallops were fantastic. The Tostones were slightly dry but complemented the tasty Stewed Black Beans. The absence of gluten-free, dairy-free dessert choices was a letdown. All in all, it's a fantastic place for a lively meal, just be ready for some possible noise.

Jackson's serves up a tasty panini Reuben with flavorful garlic and perfectly melted cheese. However, be cautious as the sandwich placed directly on a plate might result in mushy bread if left untouched. Having the salad arrive alongside the sandwich was not the best arrangement. Despite these slight hiccups, the premium prices are warranted by the top-notch food and beverages they serve up. The staff is welcoming, yet service may be a tad slow at moments due to the constant rush. All in all, a satisfying visit with an impressive array of wine and beer options, prompting a desire to come back for more.

Although I had a wonderful pedicure experience with Young, I felt let down by the gel manicure done by the owner. She didn't completely take off the old polish and the application was uneven, with noticeable bumps and uncovered sides. I might not come back because of this.
The trio appetizer was fantastic and the pizza was mouthwatering. I highly suggest giving both a try!

This awesome spot over on the Westside of Tucson serves up tasty grub at affordable prices. You've got to try the Indian taco and sweet fry bread – they're absolute game-changers. And make sure to catch their daily deals, like the $1 tacos they have on Tuesdays and Fridays. I try to swing by here at least once a week; it's definitely worth checking out!

This bakery has more than just yummy cookies, cupcakes, and puddings; their salted caramel cake is outstanding. The four layers of moist cake, paired with caramel buttercream, were incredibly elegant and tasty, using real ingredients such as butter and sugar. It's a unique mix of flavors and top-notch ingredients.

Craving something sweet after dinner? Forget the fancy dessert and check out this spot on Broadway instead. The homemade ice cream is absolutely delicious, particularly the Cake Mix flavor. It's the perfect way to end a date and enjoy a leisurely walk. I highly suggest it!

I came across this nearby sushi spot and I'm thrilled. The sushiya roll was amazing with flavorful salmon and excellent miso soup. I'll definitely be a frequent visitor from now on. Highly recommend, 10/10.

The Thai dishes at this place are so tasty. They're the top-notch ones I've had around here. The red curry, pad thai, and chicken satay with peanut sauce stand out. I just wish I resided nearer to relish it frequently. Moreover, the lunch specials are quite a steal. I highly suggest giving it a try!

I took my family and daughter to this place for the first time, and my daughter had a wonderful time with lots of activities to enjoy. However, the cleanliness of the place was not up to par, with dust all around, exposed electrical cords, and no visible staff cleaning during our visit. Management really needs to focus on keeping the place clean, especially considering the admission fee we paid. I hope they listen to this feedback and work on making improvements. Giving it 2 stars.

I had a fantastic time at this salon when I walked in. The place was spotless, the team was so welcoming, and Tammy really nailed my eyebrows. As a newbie, I got a complimentary service. They also have wonderful deals on different waxing options. I can't wait to come back.

I was really let down by the food quality at this restaurant. The sushi was sloppily prepared and flavorless, while the dynamite was excessively salty and loaded with mayonnaise. I couldn't finish most of it. It was the most disappointing meal I've had at a supposedly 4.5 star restaurant. I recommend steering clear of this place.

The service at this restaurant is really bad, with wait staff ignoring tables to chat with friends and even recommending that customers order takeout instead of dining in. Save yourself the frustration and opt for delivery instead. It's not worth the trouble.

You should definitely check out this Caribbean restaurant! The food is amazing - fresh, perfectly cooked dishes that aren't too heavy. The stewed chicken, curried chicken, and plantains were fantastic. The owner is super friendly and made sure we had a great dining experience. The prices are really good and they have hidden gems like oxtails. The BYOB option adds to the charm of the place. This spot is a must-try and deserves all the 5-star reviews. Make sure to stop by and tell your friends about it!

In general, Momo's Ouzaria is a fantastic spot with a lively atmosphere, ideal for a group outing or a first date. We had a delightful experience sampling the tapas dishes, and the pan-seared scallops were a standout. The serving sizes were quite generous, so it's worth considering your ordering pace. The Greek salad dressing was a tad too sweet for our liking, but the gyro meat was tasty. The Spanish granacha wine was a steal at just $6. The belly dancer added to the entertainment, although it felt a bit awkward at times. While I've had superior Greek cuisine at other establishments, Momo's is a solid option for a night on the town. We look forward to coming back again.

The customer service at this store has really gone downhill in the past few years. The staff is snobby and overly judgemental, which makes shopping there really awkward. Even though I used to love this store, the consistently bad service has pushed me to stop going there altogether. It's just not worth the effort to visit again.

The jazz performance at this iconic venue is definitely worth the hassle of waiting in line and sitting on a wooden bench beside unfamiliar faces. The absence of heating or air conditioning only contributes to the distinctive ambiance of the place. It's an experience that you shouldn't miss out on at least once, and you'll probably find yourself coming back for more.

The whole thing is pretty underwhelming and not really worth the five bucks each. The setup is all over the place, the DIY tour is dull, and you're better off pocketing your money and checking out the courthouse instead.
If you find yourself in St. Louis, Missouri, be sure not to pass up on the top-notch frozen custard in town. It's truly unparalleled and a definite must-try delicacy.

The restaurant may not have the same vibe as a top-rated dining establishment, but the customer service was nice and the food was satisfactory for a quick visit. I may not prioritize going back, but if I find myself nearby with a sushi craving, I'd definitely consider revisiting. Just keep in mind the slightly worn-out surroundings.

The food was amazing! We had a mix of dishes like the crawfish beignet, seafood stuffed mushrooms, crab cakes, crab cake po boy, and seafood flatbread. Every dish was so tasty and we were really full by the end. I suggest tasting a bit of everything!

If you want a Blizzard, this Dairy Queen could be your spot. Just a heads up, the staff here is pretty young and the food quality and service might not be top-notch. You might want to try another location if you're craving something other than a Blizzard.

My spouse and I enjoy backing local businesses when we go on trips. This store has a diverse selection of items made locally, ranging from clothing to artwork to food products. The owner of the store is welcoming and the vibe is unique. We stumbled upon a special dragonfly wall art piece and futuristic pens crafted by a local artist. Definitely worth a visit!

I really love this coffee shop. Being a coffee lover from Sacramento, I can definitely say this place is a gem. The matcha lattes are particularly delightful. It's my favorite spot in Reno now. I highly recommend it!

I just relocated to Idaho and had a fantastic time at Chipotle thanks to Taylor. She treated me to a free meal and provided exceptional customer service. It really made my week. I definitely suggest giving it a try!

Having a wide-ranging martini menu offering about 500 choices and large pitchers of Patrón margaritas, this spot is a must-visit for cocktail enthusiasts. The prices are fair, the service is exceptional, and the staff are always ready to assist in exploring the menu. Make sure to check out this treasure!

Claudio's is a must-visit spot for all Italian food lovers. With their traditional family ambiance and extensive expertise in cheeses and cuisine, they are a standout option. The team provides exceptional service and the overall visit is truly unique. Even if you're not of Italian descent, you will still appreciate the genuine atmosphere at Claudio's. It's not just a place to buy Italian food, it's an immersive experience at Claudio's. I strongly suggest giving it a try.

This hotel is way too expensive, the service sucks, and it's falsely advertised as a resort when it's just a noisy convention hotel. It's so big that you can easily get lost, and finding a fast meal is almost impossible. Don't bother booking here if you're looking for a chill time.

Even though the service and vibe were good, the food at this spot didn't quite cut it for me. The Dan Dan noodles were yummy but needed more protein, the scallion pancakes were just okay compared to other spots, and the Wontons in Chilli oil weren't impressive. The Talapia Medallions were fried nicely but the greens were tough to chew. Overall, I probably won't make a special trip to eat here again because it felt too mainstream and Americanized. I'm more into authentic and tasty Cantonese or hidden gem places.

Even after asking several times for a room without feathers, the Hyatt didn't come through, which is worrying for the guest's health. On top of that, the steep parking charge in St. Louis just added to the letdown. It's troubling how little care and service they've shown.
Yummy pancakes with hearty servings and a fantastic selection of breakfast meats, including turkey choices. Get there early to skip the crowds. Definitely worth checking out!

In general, the food at the restaurant was okay. Being connoisseurs of fried green tomatoes, my family was let down by their version. The meatloaf was tasty, but the accompanying dishes were just average. The entertainment was pretty dull too, with only a few songs played every hour, making us crave more.

Tina delivered fantastic and speedy service during our visit, even though it was early on a Sunday. The wait time was short, about 15 minutes. The huevos bruncheros were exceptional and a definite must-have for breakfast. I highly recommend giving it a try.

I got my new glasses from this shop and they were really blurry. The staff tried fixing them, but it didn't help. They said they measured the placement of my pupils, but I don't remember that. I asked for new lenses right away, but I haven't gotten them yet. I'm really let down by the service and the glasses.

This spot is a fantastic find for computer gear at excellent prices. The folks here might struggle with the language a bit, but they're really understanding and kind. They offer a wide range of items, and I definitely suggest stopping by for all your computer requirements.

In general, my stay at this hotel was wonderful. The Clue game theme is both original and enjoyable. The entire staff, from bellhops to bartenders, were courteous and provided exceptional service. The customer service on the phone was delightful. The location is convenient, even though the streets can get crowded. As someone from California, I was impressed with the outstanding service. However, the prices for food and drinks at the hotel can be a bit steep, so I suggest looking for more affordable options nearby. The only drawback was the absence of an air vent in the bathroom. Despite this, my girlfriend and I are already planning our return next year. A big thank you to the staff for making our stay so enjoyable.

The strawberry taste at this spot in Atlantic City was surprisingly delightful. Not too sugary, with chunks of actual strawberry present. Priced at $2 for a small serving, it was well worth it. Excited to sample more flavors during my next visit to the area.

I had an amazing lunch at this restaurant yesterday. The welcoming staff and ample portions made for a wonderful dining experience. The recipes from Mrs. Doll are tasty, and it's heartwarming to see her son continuing the family legacy. Definitely worth trying!

The food at Bridgeport Rib House is delicious and the prices are reasonable, but the service experience when picking up take-out orders in the bar is subpar. There are superior options for barbecue in the area with more attentive service.

The updated menu and increased prices at this spot just don't cut it. The food is okay at most and seems to go downhill fast. Even as a novice chef, I can see that the quality is lacking. The service wasn't great either, except for the hostess who was decent. It's not worth the cash, even during happy hour. This place isn't as fancy as it thinks it is. I recommend steering clear of it.

My visit to this store for a battery replacement and pin fix for my watch was fantastic. The employees were very friendly and generously waived the fee for the battery replacement. While the service was a tad slow, the exceptional quality and kindness definitely outweighed any wait time. I wholeheartedly suggest this shop to anyone looking for jewelry.

This eatery features an interesting blend of Jewish deli, southern comfort, and Mexican dive fare. The brisket is delightful, with a sauce that strays from the typical tomato base. The latke is unusual in shape but absolutely delicious. The Jewish Apple Cake was a crowd-pleaser, although slightly overdone at the base. Great for taking with you – still tasty hours afterward.

Although the food at this Chinese restaurant might not be great, the real highlight is reserving a karaoke room for a big gang and bringing your own beverages. The place is great at handling lively groups, and the prices are fair with fast service. The karaoke machines have the latest songs in different languages.

It's been a while since I updated my review of Khyber, but it's still a top choice even though I've moved further away. The Southern barbecue is fantastic, especially the brisket. Don't miss out on the mac and cheese. The atmosphere is lively but not too much, and the staff is so welcoming and helpful. Every visit is always wonderful.

The breads at this spot are amazing, especially the German rye. I always go for the poached eggs for breakfast as they are cooked just right. For lunch, I can't get enough of the eggplant panini or Laurie's salad. Definitely would recommend for tasty and fulfilling meals.

Tony's in Chalmette serves up some truly amazing Mexican fare that goes above and beyond. The chiles rellenos are a definite highlight, the top-notch version I've come across in the whole of Louisiana. The entire menu is reliably fantastic, and don't miss out on their Mexican Coca-Cola made with real sugar. A definite must-visit for any fan of Mexican cuisine.
The ordering process at the business is confusing, and the staff is unprofessional. The sandwich was sloppily made with hardly any sausage. Overall, it was a letdown and I wouldn't suggest it.

In general, the dancewear store has welcoming and helpful staff who provide a diverse selection of excellent products at a reasonable price. Nonetheless, their choices for men's dancewear are limited, and they frequently do not carry the items I seek. Its convenient city location makes it a top choice for dancewear essentials.

I went to this salon on a recommendation and I was really happy with how it turned out. The service was fast, with three stylists working on my hair at the same time. I got a medium-sized look done, which included my hair, and it cost $150. The staff was super nice and I would definitely return. All in all, it was a fantastic salon visit.

I really enjoy the lamb gyros plate at this restaurant. The tiramisu is absolutely delicious and the Greek salad is quite enjoyable as well. I occasionally get an extra order to take home since it's a bit of a drive for me. The dolmas are tasty but a tad too vinegary for my liking. All in all, it's a fantastic spot for Greek food.

The Yum Yum Club is a fantastic spot with amazing macaroni salad. While the service could be a bit more welcoming occasionally, the reasonable prices and scrumptious food always bring me back. I highly suggest it for a delicious meal that won't break the bank.

My husband and I checked into this hotel for the first time in Reno, and it turned out to be a wonderful decision. The room was amazing with a spa and steam room feature in the shower. The hotel offered various dining options and cozy spots to unwind. The casino was tidy and fun, catering even to non-gamblers like me. The hassle-free checkout from the room was a breeze. Overall, it's a superb hotel choice if you seek a pleasant, clean, and modern place to stay in Reno.

After reading some great Yelp reviews, we decided to take our kids to a hibachi and sushi restaurant. We were so happy with our experience - the sushi was incredible, the hibachi was fantastic, and the fried banana and ice cream dessert was the perfect way to finish off our meal. The service was excellent, and we'll definitely be going back again.
I really suggest checking out this place. The pizza is amazing and the staff is super friendly. It's a great spot to hang out with friends and family.
I had an amazing time at this place with my friends. The service was top-notch, and the drinks were absolutely delicious. I definitely plan on coming back in the future.

Even with all the hype from the reviews, this spot didn't quite hit the mark for me. The lamb was flavorful but pricey, and the garlic Naan was underwhelming, felt like it was straight from the store. Also, I was given the wrong info about them taking American Express. All in all, I doubt I'll give it another shot.

A little-known treasure in Brentwood! Amazing flavors and creative pairings that will definitely leave an impression. The owner, Michael, is so friendly and is always introducing new treats. A must-visit for those who adore ice cream.
The food and coffee at this place are amazing. The only drawback is that there aren't many choices at the espresso bar. The pastries are particularly tasty.

Holly Grove is an amazing local treasure with a diverse range of produce and locally-sourced meats and bread. The ambiance is welcoming, with individuals caring for the garden outside. The only drawback is the distance, but it's definitely worth the journey to back local growers and crafters. I highly recommend it!

In general, we had a good time at this restaurant. The service was a tad slow on a busy Saturday night, but the free homemade chips were amazing. The food was tasty, especially the burger and seasoned fries. The blackened chicken was a bit too spicy for my liking, but still tasty. The kids enjoyed the macaroni and cheese from the children's menu. The arrangement of tables inside was a little strange, with some close to the bathroom door. However, we were grateful for the 15% military discount. I would suggest trying out this spot, but be aware that the service could be faster.

In general, this hotel in downtown Tampa is a great option. The suite with the fold-out couch was really cozy and the happy hour with complimentary drinks was a nice treat, even though we didn't make it. The free breakfast was amazing, featuring customized omelets, fresh fruit, cereal, bacon, sausage, juice, and more. The room was contemporary and spotless, with two TVs and a powerful shower. Excellent bang for the buck.

I really enjoyed the cozy atmosphere of this downtown St. Petersburg restaurant. The burgers were delicious, and the arugula gave the chicken and potato gratin a nice extra flavor. I wasn't a huge fan of the cheese in the potato gratin, but the burger was absolutely amazing. The wine was a bit pricey for me, so I passed on that, but the overall vibe was fantastic, and the waitress was super friendly. I'd definitely go back for those tasty burgers.

Cd Roma's has been a go-to place for me for more than ten years. The new contemporary atmosphere is a refreshing change that indicates the restaurant's adaptability over time. The dishes are still scrumptious, especially the Chicken Parm and Alfredo. You shouldn't miss trying the Alfredo sauce which complements their breadsticks flawlessly. While certain appetizers could use a bit of enhancement, Cd Roma's remains a top option for Italian food. I do feel nostalgic for the snug ambiance of the previous place, but the quality of the food and service compensate for it.

The Waffle House is famous for its reliable quality and scrumptious breakfast choices. However, the cozy seating and energetic vibe might not suit everyone. Nevertheless, I always relish my visits there for a delightful breakfast treat.

Henry was an amazing rock star when assisting us in securing a storage locker. He was professional, knowledgeable, and polite, which made the whole experience very enjoyable. He was also incredibly friendly and even took the time to be sweet to our dog Marley who was with us. All in all, it was a fantastic experience and we wholeheartedly recommend their services!

This restaurant is incredible with an amazing location, atmosphere, and food. The drinks are top-notch, particularly the cocktails crafted by mixologist Jared. The menu presents a range of delectable choices, and the specials never disappoint. Feel free to grab a seat at the bar and test Jared's skills with your drink requests. In summary, a superb dining outing with reliably fantastic food and drinks.
