All in all, this spot has a fantastic location and offers a range of delicious vegan choices. However, I felt it was just okay. I did like the crispy ranch and curry tofu dishes, especially the chick'n in the crispy ranch. Still, I hoped for more considering it's a vegan restaurant specializing in such dishes. The fries were solid, but the green lemonade was overly sweet for me. I'd suggest giving it a shot for its distinct offerings, but I wouldn't call it outstanding given the cost.
The service was awful, the environment was filthy, and overall it was a horrible experience. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

The reviewer had a fantastic time at this vegan eatery with a New Orleans twist, going so far as to brave the pouring rain on their final day in the city. Jamone, the staff member, was attentive and offered a sampling of everything, leaving the reviewer spoiled for choice with the mouthwatering selection. They enthusiastically advise giving this spot a try as every option on the menu is top-notch. The reviewer was particularly wowed by the scrumptious dishes and ample portions that were affordable. The bread pudding was particularly memorable. To make the most of the varied and delectable choices, the reviewer recommends arriving with a hearty appetite.

Enchanting vegan paradise with scrumptious eats. My non-vegan wife polished off their Philly steak and was left wanting more. The curry tofu wrap was outstanding. Seating is a bit tight, but the kale lemonade is a definite highlight. We'll definitely return on our next trip to Philly.

We really enjoy this place! The staff is so friendly and the service is top-notch. Don't forget to try the Tiger Roll, Pink Lady Roll, and Tornado Roll. Ask for Billy, he's the best. We highly suggest this restaurant to anyone in the area. Have a great time!

I really enjoy grabbing lunch at this spot in New Orleans! The fried chicken is mouthwatering and the red beans and rice are a must-have. It's always a go-to for us whenever we're in town. The staff is so nice and helpful, and the prices are just right.

Mint is a fantastic spot in the neighborhood with absolutely no wrong picks on the menu. The Taro Tapioca Smoothie is a delightful indulgence for anyone craving something sweet. A definite must-try for locals seeking a scrumptious and fulfilling meal.
I really enjoyed the tasty salsa, guacamole, and homemade chips at this restaurant. The shrimp burrito was absolutely delicious and really big. But the wait staff was kind of just okay in my opinion.

Overall, I was let down by this place. The calzones were yummy, but the crust was too doughy for me. The fillings were decent, but lacked a bit of meat. The dessert, an apple pie calzone, had an odd spice taste and was missing apple pieces. Although the spot was conveniently located and had a great atmosphere, I found it to be overrated and disappointing. I might consider giving it another shot, but I wasn't overly excited after my initial visit.

This fantastic spot in Philadelphia provides a stunning view, top-notch service, and delicious food. Our exceptional server Nick suggested a delightful 2010 Bordeaux to go with our meal. Be sure not to overlook this essential spot in the city. Looking forward to returning for the sunsets.

The food at this restaurant is tasty, but the excessive wait times and slow table turnover make it hard to have a good time. Waited for over an hour to get a table and another hour for the food on a busy day. Some customers were upset, and there were empty tables that were not being used. The staff seemed stressed and management should consider adjusting the schedule. I'm bummed out, but I won't be coming back because of the long waits.

The breakfast at Terraza was a delightful option for someone as picky as me. While the hashbrowns could have used a bit more cooking, everything else on the plate was truly satisfying. The servings were generous, prices reasonable, and I really appreciated the cozy patio. Despite the limited staff, the service was quick and welcoming. I can't wait to test out their lunch offerings next time. In conclusion, a great spot for breakfast and I'm excited to discover more on their menu.

This unlimited dining spot provides decent bang for your buck at $27 per adult, but the standard dishes are just so-so. The maki rolls were passable but seemed preprepared and cold. The oyster ponzu was missing the ponzu flavor and had a thick covering. It's a solid choice for folks wanting a mix of rolls and fried tempura, but skip the squid dish.

After receiving poor treatment from a different locksmith, I reached out to this company and was pleasantly surprised. They showed up promptly, finished the work in under an hour, and even provided me with 4 complimentary keys. Their service was exceptional. I would definitely recommend them.

Stay away from this place. It's packed, has a strong odor, and is not well-maintained. The food and service are just okay. Philly offers many superior dining choices. Save yourself the trouble and find another spot to eat.

The beer choices and staff expertise at this establishment are wonderful, but the food was lacking. The fries were undercooked and inedible, one burger was overcooked and the other pink in the middle, both presented on cold, tough buns. The service was mediocre, and we were billed the full amount despite being unable to consume the meal. I suggest avoiding this place for dining without drinks.

Despite a bumpy start, I opted to grant them another opportunity and was pleasantly impressed. The pizza steak was mouthwatering, layered with abundant mozzarella cheese and a hearty serving of meat. Even though my initial order was mistaken, they rectified the error and the meal turned out enjoyable. I might just have discovered a new go-to spot for pizza steak.

As one of the lengthiest bars in the City, IBP is an excellent place to chill after a show or catch sports games. With a calm late-night crowd on Fridays and Saturdays, finding a seat is never an issue. The upstairs bar offers pool tables and a separate jukebox, adding to its versatility as a nightlife choice. Perfect for those in search of a relaxed setting, without the need to venture into Chinatown or a Dive bar. Also, an awesome spot to catch out-of-town sports matches.

I'd rate the Village Pub a solid four stars for their beer, vibe, and customer service. The happy hour specials, pet-friendly patio, and delicious key lime pie really stand out. However, the smoking on the patio might not be everyone's cup of tea. As for the food, I'd go with two stars. The pretzels hit the spot, but the cheese dip disappoints. Their pretzel bun sammies are a bit pricey and lackluster compared to nearby choices. To improve, they could concentrate more on their fantastic brews and cozy setting, maybe even consider allowing customers to bring in food from other spots.

I'm really impressed with Modern Laundry. The place is consistently spotless, the staff genuinely appears to love their job, and the fluff and fold service was top-notch. My clothes were returned neatly folded and fresh, using eco-friendly detergent. Doing laundry is now so easy and hassle-free thanks to Modern Laundry. I highly recommend it.
The food and vibe at this CBD spot are top-notch, especially the raw oysters and burgers. Just a heads up, the back room can get a bit stuffy when it's crowded. Lunch prices are on the pricier side.
This cozy shop is totally worth the drive. The wine cakes are amazing and the whole experience was wonderful. I stopped by because of the Yelp reviews and will absolutely be returning.

I am typically quite picky about restaurants, but The Love truly impressed me with their outstanding Father's Day lunch. The menu was diverse and the ambiance couldn't have been better. The omelet was just right, and the delightful surprises in the dish were a pleasant addition. The cornmeal Belgian waffles were a creative spin, and the La Columbe coffee was a standout. All in all, The Love left me wanting for nothing.

In general, the sushi roll was decent but choices were somewhat limited. The hibachi grill visit was underwhelming with the steak overcooked even though I asked for medium, and the chicken was bland. Furthermore, be cautious of misleading advertising for a late happy hour; the staff stated it was for a different place not mentioned on the website. It's advisable to confirm specifics in advance.

Even though Lee How Fook's small size didn't faze me, I was let down by the lackluster food. The starters were good, but the main dishes were a letdown - the sweet & sour chicken was too sweet, the veggies weren't cooked enough, and the pan-fried noodles were bland. The service was alright, but there were some issues with communication. In the end, I left feeling full but not entirely happy. It's best to book a table in advance as seating is limited.
The spicy chicken is absolutely amazing and definitely one of the best I've ever tasted, even though I'm from the South. Although, the small portion is a bit pricey. The drinks are also excellent.
Lee How Fook's General Tso chicken is seriously one of the tastiest I've ever had. Give it a whirl and taste for yourself, you won't regret it. - Coolie

Chef John Besh really wowed us at Luke in the Hilton hotel on St. Charles with scrumptious New Orleans cuisine. While the classic dishes were skillfully prepared, the true standout was the remarkable burger that took us by surprise. It was succulent, full of flavor, and impressively sized, making it a delightful discovery that we won't soon forget. The bread pudding a la mode was also not to be missed, boasting a delectable, cozy, and irresistible flavor. Even amidst the formal clientele, the top-notch food at Luke ensures we'll be coming back for more.
I was really bummed to find out that this place is closed, since I was really in the mood for their amazing fish tacos. Fingers crossed they open back up or have a spot nearby.

Jacob at Alpine Locksmith delivered exceptional and prompt service when I misplaced my car keys at Squaw. He promptly arrived, offered a reasonable price estimate, and swiftly crafted replacement keys. I enthusiastically endorse Alpine for their trustworthy and speedy assistance.

The customer experience at this restaurant was really bad on New Years Day 2017. Even after being seated at 7:30, we were completely ignored until 8:15. Several waiters came by and said hello, but none of them bothered to help us. After 45 minutes of asking for water, we gave up and headed to Dat Dog across the street, where we were impressed by their delicious hot dogs. Thanks Dat Dog!
My order was mostly incorrect and missing several items, like a burger. I had a really disappointing experience.

Farmhaus was totally worth the wait - the smoked fish dip and escolar with prawns were amazing. The mushroom salad and tapenade were really good, while the meatloaf was a tad dry. The service was great considering how busy they were. Can't wait to try the blue plate special lunches and dine outdoors next time.

The food at Dish is tasty, but the poor customer service really spoils the meal. Despite booking a table for three two weeks ahead, we were squeezed into a two-person table with hardly any space to enjoy our meal. When we asked for a bigger table, we were brusquely informed it couldn't be done. Sadly, this encounter has prompted us to strike Dish off our list of favorite eateries.

All in all, my time at this restaurant was pretty nice. The milkshake was fantastic and both the food and service were enjoyable. Yet, there was this weird feeling lingering around the place that I just couldn't shake off. But maybe that was just my mind playing tricks on me.

This restaurant fails to deliver on its promise of serving authentic Greek cuisine. The dishes are Americanized versions of Mediterranean classics, and many traditional recipes are inaccurately prepared. For a genuine Greek dining experience, consider exploring other options. Simply decline.

The most delicious meal in New Orleans! Fantastic fixed-price menu featuring a fresh strawberry salad, mouthwatering chicken dish with crispy skin and juicy meat, and a decadent chocolate cake. The staff, Travis, Susan & Caroline, are very attentive and offer wonderful vegetarian and pork choices. The location is fantastic and overall, it's the top-notch dining experience in NOLA.

Kris at the front desk went above and beyond by escorting us to the car with an umbrella during heavy rain. Dr. Deutsch has been amazing with my anxious dog Leo, making sure he feels comfortable during visits. I definitely suggest this vet clinic.

The restaurant really embodies the essence of "farm fresh" with creative, flavorful dishes and perfectly portioned meals. The intimate dining area, welcoming vibe, and attentive service set the stage for a great time with friends and family. Make sure to bring along a nice bottle since it's a bring-your-own. And definitely try the scrumptious Bloody Beet Steak!
Bomb's island bowl always delivers - the flavors blend perfectly and never fail to leave me feeling content. Plus, Dr. Steve Bruhle's endorsement just seals the deal - "For your health!"

The burger was mouthwateringly delicious, made with top-notch ingredients that made it standout from other burger spots. But, the bacon was too chunky and greasy. The shared table arrangement was uncomfortable, resulting in awkward run-ins with unfamiliar faces.

I've been going to LA Fitness for a few weeks now and so far, I'm really enjoying it. The gym is in a convenient location, reasonably priced, and has all the basic amenities you need for a solid workout. The staff members are friendly and helpful, and I was grateful for the complimentary personal trainer session when I signed up. It's also a plus that my membership allows me to access any of their locations without any additional charges.

One drawback for me is that they don't open until 8 am on weekends, which is a bit late for my early morning workout routine. Also, the only group fitness class available before work is a 5:45 am spin class, which is a bit too early for me.

If you're after a gym with extra perks like a smoothie bar and cutting-edge equipment, LA Fitness may not meet your expectations. However, if you're seeking a clean, welcoming gym with quality equipment and a variety of classes, then joining LA Fitness is worth considering.

If you're searching for outstanding sushi in Santa Barbara, don't miss out on Hiro San's restaurant. His impressive abilities as a chef and his top-notch ingredients promise an incredible dining adventure. Hiro San isn't just skilled, but also a truly charming individual to engage with. Being served by him will surely create an unforgettable sushi delight.

Though the theater is a bit old-fashioned, the affordable prices and welcoming staff make it worth checking out. It's never too busy and shows both popular blockbusters and interesting indie films. A fantastic option compared to the more conventional movie theaters.

This place has a lively and welcoming vibe with fantastic brunch options and an outstanding beer selection. Unfortunately, our visit was marred by the terrible server who was impolite, unaccommodating, and committed numerous errors. It could have earned 4 stars if not for that.

All in all, the restaurant has a fantastic vibe and an innovative menu. The presence of La Mulita next door is a pleasant surprise. Nonetheless, not being able to make reservations and the rule that everyone in the group must be seated together can be a bit of a hassle, especially on weekends. Make sure to expect a little delay if someone arrives late.
Cool Springs is a fantastic choice for a bustling Thursday evening when Bonefish Grill is super busy. With a manageable 15-minute wait, you can savor delicious food without the crowds.

We had an amazing time in Tarpon Springs! The restaurant had a bunch of staff who were quick and welcoming. The food was really tasty, especially the Gyro and Chicken Slouvaki. The Spanokopita was decent but the crust was a little tough. The cheese was a favorite as well. We'll definitely be coming back here for future visits.

The Gryphon Cafe is a snug, inviting place that gives off a laid-back and peaceful atmosphere. The lattes are exceptional and brewed with robust espresso, drawing coffee enthusiasts from the nearby Starbucks. However, their pastries can vary in quality, with some treats turning out dry and old. The cafe also fosters a vibrant local music scene, hosting shows beginning at 9 p.m. on Fridays and Saturdays. All in all, a wonderful spot for a mellow coffee outing.

Metamorphosis Tattoo stands out in a sea of lackluster experiences at other tattoo shops in Indy. Trevor delivered a skilled, enjoyable, and considerate experience while working on my rib tattoo, and I'm thrilled with the outcome. The artists at this establishment are laid-back, friendly, and genuinely invested in their clients. Pricing is reasonable, and the non-refundable deposit indicates their dedication to their craft. For a top-notch tattoo without the stress, Metamorphosis is the place to be. I wholeheartedly suggest checking them out.
The beef tongue burrito was scrumptious, not greasy, and served beautifully. It's affordable and straightforward. I'm excited to give the flan a taste on my next visit!
The dim lighting in this restaurant makes it hard to see your food, and it was just okay in taste. I was hoping to enjoy it more, but overall, it was rather average.

The banana pudding at this place is so tasty, whether you load it up with extra toppings or enjoy it just as it is. The people working here are really friendly and you can tell they genuinely care about their customers. I enjoy backing this local business and really hope it hangs around for a good while.

Shepard's gives really lousy customer service when it comes to lost items. Even though they first said they hadn't found the organizer, it was eventually found with them, with only a $100 bill missing. The assistant manager wouldn't look into it or help find the missing money. This lack of accountability and disrespect for customer worries is just not okay.

Despite the previous complaints about this restaurant, they continue to ignore their problems. My recent visit here was very unsatisfactory, with expensive prime rib that was full of fat and tough parts. The fries were served cold, and I didn't even get the right side dishes. It appears that the owner of the restaurant, Jeanne, isn't interested in dealing with customer issues.

I tried the vegan general tso's pizza from this restaurant not long ago and I was really impressed. The crust was crispy and fluffy, bursting with flavor, and the "chicken" had a tasty sauce with a little kick. The staff was very accommodating and the delivery was quick. I will absolutely order from them again. I highly suggest trying their delicious vegan options!

The eatery linked to the Drury Plaza hotel is an ideal option for supper, particularly for big gatherings. The overall service was satisfactory, only a couple of missed beverages can be expected with a group of over 20 people. The servings are enormous, and the cuisine was delightful - particularly the substantial Cuban sandwich. The shandy is a top pick, but the margaritas are lacking, particularly the patron variant. The spicy shrimp tacos are flavorful and pack a punch.

Papertini absolutely deserves all of those 5 stars for their incredibly designed wedding flowers. They are not your run-of-the-mill florist, including special elements that really make a statement. The team is welcoming and a fantastic addition to any wedding. If you prefer a more conventional option, you may want to explore other avenues. However, if you desire a distinctive flair, Papertini comes highly praised.

The brunch at Mr. B's in New Orleans was fantastic on New Year's Day. The atmosphere was inviting with jazz tunes in the background, and the staff was friendly and attentive. The gumbo ya-ya had a spicy kick, and the bbq shrimp were so flavorful, albeit a bit messy. The warm loaf of bread they served at the start was a lovely addition. While it was a tad expensive, the whole experience was totally worth it. I definitely suggest checking out their brunch if you get the chance.

Fantastic steakhouse in St. Louis with a view of the arch. Starters were pretty good, but the filet mignon was outstanding. Just the right portion and cooked to perfection. The wine selection was impressive. All in all, it was a wonderful dining experience.

Unpleasant initial encounter with San Antonio Taco. The refried beans and rice were excessively salty and lumpy, while the beef enchiladas had tough, unappetizing meat. Not sure if I'll be willing to return.

Cousin's in North Philly is the perfect spot for budget-friendly necessities. Although there are some concerns with the produce and operating hours, the convenience and prices are unbeatable. It's great for short outings or when Trader Joe's is out of reach or expensive.

In general, my time at this place had its ups and downs. The Sausage and Pepper Pizza and the cream puff pastry were real winners that I can't wait to have again. The other desserts and bagels were decent, but not outstanding. The pepperoni pizza was lacking in toppings and taste. Waiting for my order was a downside too. Despite that, the closeness and range of goodies to sample will probably draw me back for more delightful discoveries.

This speakeasy is a hip and laid-back spot with a sophisticated atmosphere and relaxed feel. I suggest it for great cocktails and drinks accompanied by good music. Just keep in mind they offer only one appetizer that's not very flavorful, so don't anticipate amazing food. In general, it provides a genuine speakeasy experience.
Steer clear of this place at all costs. Placed a big order and received spoiled food. More than half of the order was wrong. Won't be coming back.

All in all, I'd say this place deserves a 3.5-star rating from me. It was a bit of a letdown not finding everything I was craving, like the opportunity to munch on a chicken slider with a biscuit and buttermilk bites. The glazed donuts also missed the mark being dense and dry. Nonetheless, the sliders I did indulge in were quite satisfying, particularly the fried chicken variation. Hands down, the brown buttered cream sundae was a treat and even featured those buttermilk bites I had been eyeing. Not a bad debut experience, but chances are slim that I'll make a repeat visit.

This cute cafe near my place is a hidden gem for breakfast and brunch. The salmon scramble with egg whites and tofu with brown rice breakfast plate were both super tasty. The service is fast and friendly. Definitely suggest giving it a try for a satisfying meal.

I had dinner on a Friday at 6pm and was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't busy. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere had a cozy and inviting vibe. The food and drinks were delicious, but I deducted a star for the slow cocktail service and appetizers arriving with the entrees. It's understandable as they are new and working out some kinks. Overall, it was a great experience!

This cozy restaurant with a 1960's vibe offers a menu featuring dishes like Risotto, linguine with shrimp and lobster, and strip steak. The food was outstanding and everyone at the table relished their meals. The service was attentive and exceptional. I highly suggest it for a wonderful dining experience.

I absolutely love this sushi place for their generous rolls and top-notch service. You mustn't skip the Heat Attack appetizer, and my go-to choices are the Sapporo and Honey rolls. The crispy rolls are a special and mouthwatering selection. The meals are consistently fresh and beautifully prepared. Make sure to give the spicy sashimi bowl a try for a fresh and thrilling dish!

The customer service at the bar was awful on both occasions. The first bartender seemed irritated while serving me, and the second one completely neglected me in favor of a bigger group. I eventually left and went to another place because of the lack of attention and subpar service. Perhaps the experience is more positive at a table, but I wouldn't suggest the bar area.

I'm really enjoying this place. The atmosphere is amazing, there are so many options to choose from, and the bento boxes and boba drinks are absolutely delicious. If anyone's not happy, they should just eat at home. And you have to try the beef braised soup, it's so good!

The restaurant's decor is gorgeous and the atmosphere is fantastic. The food was outstanding, with a higher quality than we had anticipated for the price. My husband opted for the udon noodles while I indulged in a variety of rolls, with the standout being the must-try Spicy Salmon. The flavors were delightful and perfectly balanced. Overall, we had a fantastic experience and would definitely recommend it.

All in all, the hotel is wonderful with very welcoming and accommodating front desk staff. We enjoyed a fantastic stay away from the club, which resulted in a tranquil night's rest. If you desire a serene experience, this may not be the most suitable choice, but if you're after a lively ambiance, this hotel is just right.

The pizza and gnocchi at this charming family restaurant in Middle Tennessee were absolutely fantastic. The fresh ingredients and wide selection on the menu made our dining experience truly delightful. It felt like we were dining in a cozy European spot - this place definitely serves the best pizza in the area.

I was really impressed with the service I got for a $16 haircut. The student stylist went above and beyond, giving me a really professional haircut that made my hair look so much better. The shampoo also smelled fantastic, and the stylist was very careful. The only downside was the long wait, but I liked that they took their time to make sure everything looked great. In general, it was an awesome experience for a wallet-friendly price. Just make sure you've got plenty of time for your appointment.

My daughter's wedding at the Presidio Chapel in May 2015 was truly enchanting. Rain Longo, who organizes special events at the Chapel, was kind, helpful, and excited. The location itself was exceptional and genuine, with a lovely connecting room for the bride and bridesmaids to prepare. The cost was reasonable and covered 6 hours of access. Much appreciation to everyone involved in creating a flawless day. I highly suggest this venue!

The waxing technician, Miriam, was punctual and well-informed, but the whole experience was disappointing. Instead of concentrating on the waxing service, she spent excessive time promoting EWC items and condemning traditional shaving methods. Although she did a good job on my eyebrows and lower legs, my underarms were left with stray hairs and traces of wax. After the appointment, I didn't feel completely ready for my vacation.

In general, the food at this restaurant was excellent. The pad see ew and The King and I stir fry were highly praised. The portion sizes were satisfactory and the service was very attentive. Nevertheless, the noise level was excessive, making it necessary for us to raise our voices to communicate. If the restaurant could address this concern, it would certainly earn a better rating.

Caution: Keep an eye out for possible theft at this rental spot. Despite informing them about a misplaced radar detector along with its case, it was not recovered and the staff dismissed the idea of it being lost. The vehicles are not maintained well, with plastic bottles hidden under seats and sticky residue on the dashboard. The overall untidiness and threat of theft create a rather dissatisfying rental journey.

This spot has a relaxed vibe that's ideal for dining with your furry friend. The charming wrap-around porch is a lovely spot to savor a scrumptious breakfast. The bananas foster French toast is divine but decadent, and the vegetable omelet is a delicious and nutritious choice. The servings are substantial, keeping me satisfied for the drive back. Looking forward to coming back for more menu options, especially their renowned juices.

The food here is scrumptious with sizable portions at an awesome price. The staff, especially the young lady at the counter, is super friendly and constantly smiling. I wish I could visit more frequently.

I really enjoyed the picturesque views along the trail, ideal for running, walking, hiking, and biking. There are numerous spots to rest and soak in the beauty. A wonderful place to rejuvenate and keep moving.

The service was incredibly sluggish because of delays in the kitchen, leading to a 40-minute wait for a pasta and salad. I wouldn't suggest it for anyone seeking a speedy meal, but it could be a good choice for those who want to savor their dining experience.

I really love this Mexican restaurant - the chips, salsa, beans, guacamole, and chimichanga bites are so tasty! The street tacos and enchiladas are outstanding, and the margaritas are strong. The staff is super attentive and the service is top-notch. Overall, it's a fantastic spot, I'd give it 4 out of 5 stars - almost a fave. It's conveniently located downtown, but I wish they had a full bar already.
I urge you to give the sushi at this place a try. The rolls are delightful, the service is excellent, prices are reasonable, and there are numerous healthy options. Absolutely worth it!
Had an amazing lunch with delicious food and excellent service. The Gumbo Ya Ya, BBQ shrimp, and crab cakes were all mouthwatering. Definitely suggest this place for a fulfilling meal.
Amazing 20-minute workout that makes you feel fantastic. I was unsure at first, but now I'm addicted and feeling better than ever. Chelsey is a superb trainer to work with. I definitely recommend!

The vibe is lovely and the spot is top-notch, getting a 5-star score for each, but the overall rating comes out to be 3 because of the food quality. I had the smoked turkey club which was pretty good, and they even threw in 2 sides, but the meat was nothing to write home about. The creamed spinach was nice, but the mac n cheese was dry and flavorless even though it cost extra. I'm open to giving it another shot and ordering a different dish to see if the experience improves.
I enjoyed brunch during NYE weekend and adored the inviting decor. The Eggs Veney were scrumptious and the entire dish was polished off in no time. Excellent food and a wonderful experience!

Ali ba ba's is a must-try for late-night kebab, shawarma, or gyro in NYC. The gyros are larger in size and pricier ($6) compared to other options in the city, but they definitely satisfy. The increased cost may be attributed to the unique tastes and preferences of NOLA. The only drawback is the limited selection of hot sauce flavors and occasional delays in service. In general, Ali ba ba's gyros stand out among neighboring choices, making it a place worth checking out.
I absolutely recommend this place. The food is mouthwatering, the customer service is exceptional, and the location is so convenient. Definitely a hidden gem that's worth a visit!

I had an amazing time at this place. The Turkish coffee was a pleasant surprise and the veggie wrap and cheese steak were both scrumptious. The cafe area really added to the wonderful atmosphere of the restaurant. I will definitely be coming back whenever I'm in West Philly. 5 stars.

Jones is a definite must-visit for anyone who adores comfort food with a gourmet edge. The mac and cheese, sliders, pigs in a blanket, and calamari are all absolutely delightful. The roast beef dinner is exceptional, featuring succulent, expertly cooked meat and creamy mashed potatoes. The Duncan Hines slice of cake is sheer brilliance. I'm eagerly looking forward to returning for more delicious food and cocktails. Yum yum yum.

The Penang chicken paired with chicken-infused white rice is honestly one of the most delicious meals I've ever tasted. It's consistent in quality whether I'm in Boston or Philly, and the speedy service definitely justified the long queue. The succulent chicken was so flavorful, and now I'm kicking myself for not grabbing some to enjoy on the ride back to Virginia. I won't think twice about getting an extra order to take home next time!
The wait time at this place is too long, even when the restaurant isn't full. It can be really annoying for customers who just want to eat without waiting forever.

Screamagedon is definitely the top haunted attraction in the area. The houses are so realistic, and the haunted hayride is amazing with fire torches, machine guns, chainsaws, churches, and even a creepy priest. Strolling through the woods with only a glow stick is both thrilling and scary. Other Halloween events like Bush Gardens Howl O Scream and Halloween Horror Nights don't even come close - Screamagedon is truly the best. I'm already looking forward to going again next year.

The service was excellent with prompt responses and knowledgeable staff. Shanna was on time and meticulous in examining and treating for lice. Although a bit expensive, the treatment was truly effective. The special comb, not found in regular stores, is very effective in eliminating nits. The only drawback is that the comb is not included in the session and needs to be bought separately. I highly suggest this service for anyone dealing with lice issues.

The BBQ Chicken Sandwich is a fantastic deal at $5.75. The chicken was grilled to perfection, and there are various topping and sauce choices available. The selection of bread options, such as sourdough, wheat bun, and white bun, further enhances the charm of this sandwich. All in all, it's a delightful and scrumptious choice at an excellent price.

All in all, the service was really sluggish and underwhelming, making us wait nearly two hours for a weird shrimp scampi meal. The only thing that made up for it was the mouthwatering sweet potato cheesecake, a definite five-star treat. Probably won't be back for anything else besides the cheesecake.
This burger place provides exceptional service with a bit of a wait, but it's totally worth it for the most delicious burger you'll ever have. Definitely a must-try.

I really suggest checking out this lively gym in Tampa. I was able to utilize my membership from Atlanta and participated in an amazing yoga session. The gym is roomy with a diverse selection of equipment. Parking in the garage was complimentary for two hours and I got guest passes for a colleague. All in all, it was a terrific experience.

This eatery consistently offers delectable, fresh dishes and the warm staff create a wonderful dining atmosphere. The Italian dishes are always flavorful and the bread rolls are exceptional. Ignore any unfavorable remarks as the proprietors are dedicated to ensuring customer satisfaction.

The buying experience for a pre-owned 2009 Rav4 from Glanzmann Subaru was marred by the absence of a precise portrayal of the car's condition problems. The transaction itself was uncomplicated, yet as someone purchasing from another state, the imperfections (significant dings, chipped paint, and tears in the leather) were not brought to attention or shown accurately, resulting in disillusionment upon receipt. Though the vehicle runs well enough, the flaws diminish its worth. This petite, family-run dealership could achieve better customer contentment by engaging in more transparent and candid interactions.

I totally agree with the 5-star reviews! The boutique is spotless, and Lori did a fantastic job with the waxing. The blue hard wax is incredible, and I appreciate the choice of a "custom wax". I will definitely be coming back! Thanks to all the Yelp reviewers for leading me to this hidden gem!
This dealership always lets customers down and exploits them. Despite several opportunities to do better, they continue to let people down. I strongly suggest steering clear of them.

We ate at the Creole House for dinner on a rainy night. The bacon garlic oysters were underwhelming, but the buffalo wings hit the spot. The jumbalaya pasta was bland and the sautéed veggies were too salty. The blackened red fish was decent, while the canal street red fish needed more garlic sauce. The paddle boat drinks were light on the booze. Our server, Alexander, was amazing. Overall, it was an okay 3-star meal mostly because of the average food.

BlackFinn failed to meet expectations because they made several mistakes in our order, such as using the wrong ingredients and giving small portions. The ambiance was pleasant and the staff were courteous, however, the whole experience was unsatisfactory. I am open to giving them another opportunity to make up for it. I would rate them two stars.

Even though the food at Bob Evans tastes really good, the service at this place was not so great. When my family and I got seated, we were completely ignored for about 10 minutes until finally two servers came over. It looked like they were unsure about who should be taking care of our table, even though the restaurant wasn't even that busy. The food was yummy, but the service was slow and all over the place, which was a letdown. The folks in charge should definitely focus on making things better for customers at this spot.
I've been using their business mail services for years and have only had positive experiences. The staff is fantastic and the service is top-notch. I highly recommend them.

The Ox Tail pho at this cozy family-owned restaurant in Reno was fantastic! Just the right amount, tasty homemade dipping fish sauce, and reasonable prices made for a wonderful dining experience. We will definitely make it a point to return every time we're in Reno. You should definitely check it out!

This Bosnian restaurant is fantastic! The take-out service is so easy and the gyros taste absolutely delicious. The atmosphere is so vibrant and the restaurant is said to be really clean. I highly recommend giving it a try! Here's to a wonderful dining experience.

Discover a rare find in the hookah bar scene! With its genuine decor, silky shisha, and serene ambiance, this spot is a must-see. Reasonably-priced drinks and a welcoming team contribute to the fantastic vibe. Ideal for a chill and laid-back hangout with pals. I enthusiastically suggest giving this distinctive place a shoutout!

I discovered the perfect salon for a gel manicure nearby with the help of Yelp. The team was welcoming, the salon was gorgeous and tidy, and my nail artist Kim did an excellent job. It was a lovely experience that I will definitely revisit.

The food was amazing, with perfectly cooked dishes like the jambalaya, shrimp etouffe, and seafood gumbo. The shrimp was fresh and delicious. The bread pudding with praline sauce was a fantastic way to end the meal, paired perfectly with Cafe du Monde coffee. This was definitely one of the best dining experiences we had during our time in New Orleans. I highly recommend it.
The cheesesteaks and cheese fries are decent, but not really worth making a special trip for since you can find similar choices all over Philadelphia.

The takoyaki at this place was delicious but too chewy and had a greasy finish. The curry chicken was underwhelming with a heavy sauce that didn't suit my taste. It's a good option for exploring Japanese fast food for the first time, but not the top choice I've experienced.

Wonderful spot with delicious wines. Regrettably, no food is offered, but feel free to bring your own and savor the scenery with your furry companion. The dog-welcoming ambiance amplifies the appeal. A delightful experience all around.

I truly enjoyed my time at this restaurant. The ambiance was wonderful, the service from Connor was top-notch, and my dinner was scrumptious. The desserts, barley soup, and shrimp ravioli were all superb. The Malbec wine paired perfectly with my meal. I was thrilled to discover that they offer breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I highly suggest checking this spot out. I can't wait to come back again.

I’ve had breakfast at this restaurant and the juevos rancheros were fantastic. The chips and salsa were really good, with a spicy salsa that I loved. The homemade tamale was delicious too. I'll for sure be coming back in the future.

Burger Up in Nashville serves gourmet burgers in a stylish setting. The bacon cheeseburger was delicious but the patty itself could have been more flavorful. The truffle fries were exceptional and a must-try side. The beer selection featured distinctive options from the Deep South. In summary, a solid choice for a departure from the typical dive bar burger scene. Rating: 3.50 stars.

Mandala provides a diverse range of massage supplies at excellent prices. Lisa is welcoming and well-informed, assisting me in selecting essential oils from their aroma bar and skillfully blending them. The prices are budget-friendly and competitive, possibly even more affordable than what's available online. By shopping at Mandala locally, you're backing a wonderful small business. The charming new location in a Victorian-style house enhances the overall experience. I highly recommend it!

This place is amazing with scrumptious food and hearty portions. The ciders are the best, although the meads didn't quite hit the spot for me. I enjoyed it so much that I even brought a cider home with me to the east coast.

If you're in the mood for beignets in Metarie, Morning Call is the preferable option to this shop. But if you have your heart set on Cafe Du Monde, it's just a twenty-minute drive to Decatur, with parking included.

I just checked out the lovely new nail salon on West Chester Pike and I was really struck by how nice the staff was, the salon itself was fresh and modern, the prices were great, and the color scheme was really calming. Plus, I was pleasantly surprised to find out that the pedicure chairs come with phone chargers! I wholeheartedly suggest trying this salon out for a truly relaxing and indulgent treat.

Simon's complete body massages are absolutely fantastic. His skilled hands work wonders in easing muscle tension and removing any stiffness expertly. The ambiance is calming and cozy, creating a truly delightful experience. Fully appreciate the magic of personal touch until you've had the pleasure of a pampering massage like this. Whether opting for a foot rub or a full body treatment, this place is a true oasis that I strongly recommend treating yourself to. Competitive prices and exceptional service ensure it's a relaxation hotspot that shouldn't be missed. Book a session for optimal enjoyment in the early evening hours.

Tuna Bar is a fantastic new spot that sushi aficionados should not miss in the city. The atmosphere, service, and food and drinks were all superb during our soft opening visit. The exceptional fish quality and delightful Asian fusion choices left a lasting impression. The owner and executive chef appeared genuinely proud of their achievements, and they have every reason to be. This hidden gem, just a short two-minute stroll away, is definitely worth a visit. I highly recommend it to fellow sushi lovers.
This dive bar really nails the authentic vibe with its weathered wood panel walls, strong odor, and small drinks. Won't be coming back anytime soon.

I really adore this place! The food is scrumptious, the vibe is fantastic, and the hostess is incredibly friendly with such a positive vibe. My friend, who was here for the first time, also had a great time and is already looking forward to returning. The shrimp salad with lime chili dressing was particularly refreshing and delicious.

The food here just isn't what it used to be. The pork steak was so dry and tough, and those BBQ nachos were just plain soggy and bland. Even though the service was great, I don't think we'll be coming back after this letdown.

I received top-notch service at this salon. My visit was delightful and the stylist who worked on my haircut was truly skilled. I didn't catch her name, but she definitely gained my trust. I highly recommend this salon.

Spiro's was an amazing dining experience! The Greek salad was prepared right at the table and absolutely scrumptious. The Dolmades and combo plate were both phenomenal, especially the lamb. The free dessert for new guests was a delightful touch. Our server Ben was exceptional and really made us feel at home. Spiro's is definitely going to be my new favorite place to eat. Thanks for a fantastic evening!

I felt really let down by the lack of empathy at this place. Waited 2 hours just to get a 5-minute appointment and then got sent home without any pain relief. Can't say I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for good care.
Delicious food, cashier named Alessandra was very friendly and kind. The meal box was reasonably priced and tasted amazing. I'll definitely come back if I'm in the area.

I recognize the attempt to lessen straw consumption for environmental purposes. Yet, I felt let down by the quality of ingredients used in the mixers. The vibe from the bar staff on Saturday night fell short, and the Margarita I sampled was below par. It's a basic drink that should have been prepared more meticulously.

The BarreAmped session at the Music Row studio was fantastic, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere with a very attentive instructor. The space was cozy and thankfully not overcrowded when I was there. Nonetheless, the studio being tucked away in a home gym was a bit perplexing without clear signs, making it a challenge to locate. Nevertheless, it was an enjoyable experience overall, and I may revisit in the future.

My experience with this place was awful. The person I talked to was really rude, kept putting me on hold, and even disconnected the call when I tried to sort out the incorrect order they delivered. The service was just not up to par, so I wouldn't suggest visiting them.
Yummy chicken and French toast, with a bit of sun on the patio but overall a nice time. Pet-friendly and will definitely come back.

This place really saved me when I needed a late-night snack in Nashville. Even though I was skeptical at first, the pizza turned out to be incredibly tasty. Being able to pick it up at 2 AM was such a great bonus. My only regret is not getting a bigger size. I definitely suggest stopping by for a late-night bite.

The delivery service was awful with an incorrect food order arriving an hour later than expected. The food was badly cooked, either under or overcooked. I won't be ordering from here again. It was a really disappointing experience.

If you ever happen to be in Nashville, this place is a fantastic option to explore for good drink discounts on Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. The food is decent, but the vibe and drink promotions definitely make it worth dropping by.

I absolutely love this place for their yummy salads, tasty tea, and crunchy french fries. The staff is amazing, and every time I go there, it's always a great experience. Can't wait to come back again!

We had an amazing brunch at this place. The cleanliness, friendly staff, and lovely decor created a great dining ambiance. Even my choosy four-year-old liked the food, which is a big plus for me. I definitely recommend it!

I had a fantastic time at this delightful tea shop. The variety of loose leaf teas and tea accessories was remarkable, and the beverages and desserts were both scrumptious and inventive. The atmosphere was ideal for a calming tea time, and I relished perusing the books about tea offered by the enthusiastic owner. I can't wait to visit again and enthusiastically suggest this spot to fellow tea enthusiasts.

I love eating at this restaurant. The antipasto is absolutely incredible, and the fresh pasta is bursting with flavor. The Fisherman's stew is just mouthwatering, with succulent fish in a delightful saffron sauce.

You definitely won't want to miss out on Muriel's in NOLA for the amazing food and classic French Quarter vibe. The goat cheese and shrimp crepes are absolutely fantastic, and the rest of the menu is just as great. The service is excellent, although you might get a bit sidetracked by the ghost tours passing by outside. Don't let the spooky stories deter you though, because the only thing supernatural at Muriel's is the mouthwatering food. It's a solid choice for sure.

Although there was some confusion and inattentiveness at first, Taco Bell ultimately delivered satisfactory service when the staff member at the window was willing to assist us. Enhancements in timing and communication could elevate the overall customer experience.

The vibe at this restaurant is delightful, but I was underwhelmed by the minimal breakfast options and subpar food. The omelet was so-so and the biscuit was bland. Getting a table was fast on weekdays, but it could get pretty busy on weekends.

While this gym might be a bit more expensive, I find the executive locker rooms totally worth it. The place is kept clean, and there are many classes and equipment to choose from. Even though a couple of machines are acting up, the general vibe is inviting. My only gripes are the restricted weekend times and the lack of variety in class schedules. In the end, joining was a good choice, and the gym has really helped me get back in shape.

Amazing ambiance with a fantastic bar team, especially Ally who truly goes the extra mile for each guest. Chill atmosphere with options for both indoor and outdoor seating, definitely a spot you shouldn't skip in the Funk Zone. Strongly suggest checking it out! Please give my regards to Ally!

In general, I had a pretty good time at this bar. The bartender was awesome, the lunch options were satisfactory, and the beer was nice and chilled. I suggest visiting during quieter times for a more reliable experience. I'll definitely be coming back.

In general, this hotel offers a welcoming atmosphere for adults and families with numerous dining choices and an enjoyable atrium to discover. The only drawback was that not all pools were accessible during Memorial Day weekend. The hotel is situated a bit distant from downtown but serves as a convenient midpoint between music row and the airport. The team members were outstanding, and the hotel retained its classic appeal while also being well-maintained. I would absolutely choose to stay here again when in Nashville.

Fantastic choice to cool off at this do-it-yourself frozen yogurt shop in Manayunk! An array of delicious flavors and toppings to select from, and you can taste before making your final decision. I absolutely loved the toasted coconut yogurt with freshly-cut fruit toppings, while chocoholics have a plethora of choices. The place is spotless and nicely kept, and the staff is super friendly. I highly suggest dropping in for a revitalizing treat.

Although this chain used to be popular, the pricey, fried food with questionable quality persists. The dishes are bland, and the coconut shrimp and hush puppies were burnt. Even though the servings are generous, the taste is lacking. The setting is pleasant, next to the Boise river, but there are superior local establishments to try. You could drop by once, but don't anticipate something exceptional.
This dive bar lets people smoke inside, making my hair stink and disturbing my sleep. The vibe is dark and hazy, but the bartender is nice. I wasn't thrilled with the watery bloody mary.

I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to this welcoming family restaurant situated just north of Gulfport. Despite my late arrival, the staff warmly greeted me and promptly provided me with a steaming cup of coffee along with a comprehensive breakfast selection. The ham omelet accompanied by crispy home fries and toasted bread was truly delightful and left me satisfied for the rest of the day. The cozy ambiance, enhanced by the nostalgic tunes playing softly in the background, contributed to an overall enjoyable dining experience that I cherished.

You definitely need to check out this spot if you want a varied and enjoyable dining experience. The wine selection is excellent, the hookah offerings add some fun, and the Lebanese cuisine is seriously impressive - possibly the best in town. I highly recommend giving it a try!

Red Mess was a fantastic recommendation from a nearby coworker and definitely lived up to the hype. Chris was so helpful and knowledgeable about the menu, and his service was top-notch. Every one of us in our group loved the scrumptious food and drinks all the way through. Absolutely suggest giving it a try!

I always enjoy trying out the diverse menu options and excellent service at Brick House. This specific branch really caught my attention with its exceptional service, and has become a go-to spot whenever I'm in town. I'll definitely return for another visit.
Siam is the trendiest place in town with high-quality sashimi, a fabulous outdoor patio, and awesome deep house music. The crowd is diverse and seeking a top-notch night out. I highly recommend it.

16th Street Seafood might not wow you with its ambiance or seafood variety, but the mussels drenched in butter and garlic sauce were a delightful choice. The takeout-only arrangement was convenient, and the messy dish was skillfully packaged. The deep-fried shrimp was satisfactory, though a tad pricey. All in all, a spot worth checking out for seafood enthusiasts nearby.

We decided to use a Groupon to check out this place and were happy with the lobster, even though they didn't have every size available. Our server, Jessica, was really on the ball and offered some great recommendations. Overall, a solid choice for tasty lobster, without any frills.
This trendy cafe has a wide range of choices at affordable prices. Definitely try the lox bagel sandwich—it's a must-try. It's a lovely place for a laid-back lunch with a loved one.

Animo Juice in Haddonfield is a real hidden gem, serving up a tasty menu of juices, burritos, and breakfast items. Make sure to try the Haight & Ashbury burrito and enjoy the fresh and satisfying juices. Mixing in some quinoa to your order will truly elevate your meal, and the variety here is unparalleled. If you're nearby, definitely swing by for a visit.

I had an amazing birthday celebration with Wine Edventures in Santa Barbara. Sean was an excellent guide, super friendly and very informative. We checked out 3 wineries and 1 brewery, enjoyed a scrumptious lunch, and got some cool souvenir wine glasses. I definitely suggest it for a fantastic day in the SB area.

Tokyo in Delaware is my go-to sushi spot. Their menu is simple yet expertly crafted, offering rolls that are reasonably priced, beautifully prepared, and generously filled with fish. The spicy tuna roll is hands down the best I've ever tasted, thanks to the kewpie mayo, sriracha, and sichimi powder they incorporate. The switch to short-grain brown sushi rice has really enhanced the dining experience. Observing Sushiman YC Park at work is truly mesmerizing - his expertise shines through in the impeccable nigiri and temaki. I'd suggest passing on Kooma and reserving Mikimotos for special occasions - Tokyo is perfect for a casual lunch. I wholeheartedly recommend supporting this hidden gem during these challenging times. I'd give it 4 stars, saving the fifth for establishments that source fresh, local catch.

Even though there were some bad reviews, my experience at this place was really good. The people working there were nice, the service was fast, and the prices were reasonable. The chicken fingers weren't dry, they were actually really tasty, especially with their honey mustard sauce. The salads were crispy and packed with veggies, and the fries were delicious. I liked that they included cole slaw with the chicken finger platter. All in all, it's a convenient place with pretty good food, just right for a quick and affordable meal. And remember, it's a pizza joint, not a fancy restaurant. Don't expect a fancy atmosphere, just good food for a good price.
Lazo's cheesesteak was incredible, the service was super friendly and quick. It truly brightened my day.

Even though the vibe and setting at this place in the mall were pretty ordinary, the folks there were really nice even though they were short-staffed. The wait was a bit long, but totally worth it once we dug into those yummy vegetable samosas and that tasty chicken tikka masala. The chicken was a tad dry, but the chicken tagine was out of this world. They had a great combo of different types of food on the menu, and we were surprised by the BYOB rule, but we'll definitely come back to try more stuff. All in all, it was a cool dining adventure with some top-notch grub once you look past the slow service.

This adorable little ice cream place in Tucson is absolutely delightful and serves up scrumptious top-notch treats. Yet, it does lean towards the expensive side with a standard single scoop priced at $4.50, giving it a solid 4-star rating out of 5.

The brewery/bar boasts a stylish and distinctive decor that perfectly matches its name. Even though the place was bustling, we managed to find seating without any hassle. The variety of beers, especially for fans of imperial stouts, was fantastic. While they don't offer food, you have the option to either bring your own or explore the nearby eateries across the street.
Vibrant and chill vibes with mouthwatering beef brisket and smoked sausage. A must-visit for BBQ enthusiasts!

Incredible breakfast offer for early risers! Tasty food, unlimited coffee, and exceptional service for just $4. A fantastic deal considering transportation expenses. I suggest visiting between 7-9am on weekdays to take advantage of this amazing offer.

This trendy place is consistently packed for a good reason. Despite the long wait times, it's worth it for the opportunity to mingle with celebrities and savor some of the finest sushi in town. Just be ready for a potentially extended wait.
I truly adored my time at this inn! The room was stunning and the location was ideal, with the streetcar right outside to bring you to the canal. I highly recommend staying here!
This restaurant serves scrumptious and nutritious meals with outstanding service and atmosphere. The prices are fair and you can tell that each dish is made with care. I highly recommend it.

I recently found a fantastic pizza place where I could create my perfect pizza with pepperoni, red onions, and roasted garlic. The flavors were in perfect harmony, and the garlic cloves gave it a special twist. The 10" pizza was ideal for sharing with a friend. I can't wait to go back and sample more items from their menu. I highly suggest checking this place out!

This place serves tasty and nutritious breakfast choices in a warm and inviting setting. The service is outstanding, and the food is flavorful and beautifully presented. I highly recommend it for a morning meal!

I had an amazing experience at this body shop. The service was outstanding, the body work was top-notch, and they even vacuumed the inside of my car. Randy provided regular updates through text, keeping me in the loop throughout the process. Highly recommend.

At first, I didn't enjoy it much, but when I went back for the third time, everything turned around. The food was so tasty, especially the Bubble Tea. If you're in the mood for Greek or Mediterranean cuisine, it's definitely worth another shot. The initial visit was a letdown, but the next one totally made up for it. The Gyros were flavorsome and juicy, and the service was way better. You should totally think about giving this place another shot.

I won't be coming back here. The service wasn't what I wanted and ended up being twice the cost I anticipated. The advisor was impolite and unprofessional when I raised my concerns. The job completed wasn't what we had agreed on, making the whole experience disappointing.

We adore M.L. Rose for their beer flights and local hangout vibe, along with fantastic service. Nevertheless, the food can be inconsistent, with certain dishes falling short. The steak and Gouda sandwich was especially underwhelming. Despite that, we remain loyal fans and are optimistic that the kitchen can enhance for a consistently superb experience.
If you're okay with waiting a bit, it's totally worth it for the scrumptious biscuits and chicken. A fantastic option for a speedy and fulfilling meal.

In general, our trip to the water park on an unusual day in the school season was fun. The place was tidy, the employees were nice, and the reduced prices during the off-peak season were fair. But, the water and air were a little cold for us, and the park was smaller than we thought. The big slides being closed sometimes was a small hassle. Even with these problems, I think people could have a good time if they pick the right time to visit. It was a plus to get a discount with AAA, but we couldn't get extra savings for my son's birthday month since we didn't have proof.

The decor is fabulous, the team is welcoming, and the dishes are just right. Don't miss out on the special sauce and toss for a tasty and special treat. I'll surely return to try out more items. Great job!

The food at this restaurant is delicious, but the service is lacking. Our waitress was barely around, and others had to help out. She even brought the check while I was still eating, which was annoying. In general, the food is good, but the service needs improvement.

The squid dish at this place was absolutely delicious, full of flavor. But the service was quite slow and the prices were pretty steep. It could have been so much better with faster service and more reasonable prices.

I had such a great time at this restaurant! The food was so tasty, the waiter was fantastic, and the cheesecake was incredible. I'm so excited to come back for their cinnamon rolls. We'll definitely be back.

Meijer is a handy and fantastic store, but the Starbucks inside can be inconsistent. The staff appear to be lacking in proper training as they often need to verify prices and the quality of beverages can vary. It's disappointing if you spend money only to receive a drink that's mostly milk.

The eggs at Dawn Patrol are absolutely phenomenal, hands down the tastiest eggs I've ever had at a restaurant. The hash is a definite must-try, with really generous portions. My brother really liked his burger, although he thought it could use some cheese. And don't even get me started on the homemade pastries, bread, and jellies – they are just so delicious.

I arrived to grab some food late on a Friday night, and there weren't many choices left. I decided to go with a personal pizza with a thick crust, and it was decent. While I was waiting, I discovered Scharffenberger chocolate, which was a pleasant surprise. The staff appeared to be pretty worn out by 8pm.

I enjoyed a scrumptious cheeseburger topped with avocado and sampled the flavorful ranchero fries. Despite the delectable food, the leisurely service prevented this eatery from receiving a perfect 5-star review.

I absolutely suggest checking out this restaurant. The food is incredible and the service is top-notch, especially from George. The crab cakes were absolutely delicious. All in all, it was a truly fantastic dining experience.

Our wedding at Winters Creek Lodge was absolutely wonderful all thanks to Judit. She was so well-prepared, accommodating, and really helped us make our dreams come true. The scenery was breathtaking, our guests were amazed, and the food was mouthwatering even without any tastings beforehand. The pricing was fair and competitive. I highly suggest choosing to work with Judit at Winters Creek Lodge.

I was delighted by the fantastic brunch choices at Kanella. The welcoming ambiance and attentive staff create a homely vibe. The Cyprus Breakfast is a definite must-try, offering a delightful Mediterranean spin on familiar breakfast items. The menu showcases an array of authentic Greek, Mediterranean, and Middle Eastern dishes that will surely please any taste buds. Booking ahead is strongly advised, but absolutely worth it for an outstanding weekend morning outing. I'm eagerly looking forward to returning for dinner.

The gravy fries at this spot are tasty, but the sandwiches are just terrible. The meat is thick, tough, and dry, which ruins the whole eating vibe. I tried their pork sandwich and couldn't even chew through the rubbery meat. Folks who praise this spot probably haven't had anything tastier. It's a much wiser choice to head over to Wawa for a sandwich that's truly enjoyable.

In my opinion, this place is primarily driven by profit rather than delivering high-quality products or good customer service. They solely take cash and are reluctant to process returns, appearing to favor big contractors over smaller clients. It's important to carefully examine your purchases as some items might be flawed. I strongly advise against endorsing this establishment.

Even with the subpar service and unfriendly staff, the food at this restaurant was outstanding. The pulled pork, brisket tacos, and pulled chicken were all mouthwatering, although the sides were just okay. The prices were fair, but the absence of ribs for lunch and unclean bathrooms were significant downsides. In general, it was a somewhat satisfying experience.

In general, my time at this restaurant was underwhelming. While a few dishes were genuinely flavorful and true to the cuisine, others felt better suited for American-Chinese establishments. The duck was excessively greasy and lacking in meat, and the stir fry dishes featured peculiar vegetable pairings. Furthermore, the service was notably lacking in friendliness and warmth. The varying quality of dishes makes it challenging to endorse this restaurant.

If you're not a fan of going to the hair salon, Andre's salon is the perfect spot for you. The welcoming and friendly vibe, skilled stylists like Christopher, and authentic connections create a cozy and delightful visit. You'll not only walk out with amazing hair but also with the feeling of having gained new buddies. The easy online booking and fair prices make choosing Andre's salon for your upcoming trim or dye a no-brainer. A top-notch choice!
The food at this place is incredibly delicious and one-of-a-kind. I really suggest trying their boba and pork pancake.

Prohibition is a charming, classic spot with a lengthy bar that seems like it belongs out west rather than in the bustling center of Philadelphia. It's not overly noisy, making it a breeze to chat, and features a jukebox that could get lively as the night goes on. The service from the bartender was excellent, and there's a solid variety of beers on tap, including a tasty local IPA. The compact menu boasts delectable options, with the brat plate standing out. Just be aware that the area around the bar might feel a bit unsafe, so it's wise to be cautious when strolling to and from the venue.

On the Run at Lambert-St. Louis International Airport is a great option for those coming back from renting cars. It's a smart choice for grabbing a fast gas refill before going to the airport. Using the gas pump is simple, but remember to push the button first and then swipe your card. In general, it's a handy spot for travelers who require gas before giving back their rental cars.
The old building is in great shape, and we had a private tour with the Park Ranger because we were the only ones there. It's a fantastic place to get National Park Stamps too.

The service and cleanliness at the restaurant were fantastic, but the food didn't quite hit the mark. The linguine with marinara was okay, but the rotini primavera was a letdown. It was evident that the vegetables were frozen, which definitely took away from the dish. Considering how many fresh ingredients are available in Tucson, there's really no reason to settle for subpar choices like frozen veggies.

Fresh Market might have a friendly staff and a tidy store, but their products and variety are lacking. The unevenly sliced cheese, past-due ricotta, and easily spoiled produce left much to be desired. Furthermore, the steep prices and unimpressive desserts were underwhelming. The inconsistent details about the ATM limit were irritating. It might be a better idea to shop at alternative grocery stores like Weaver's Way, Whole Foods, or Wegmann's.
The Dugout is a unique find in Fletcher Place with a cozy vibe and fantastic drink deals. The spicy cheese balls are a definite must-have, and I'm eager to return for another visit.

Big Scoop is a fantastic addition to Warminster's ice cream scene, providing a diverse selection of delicious treats beyond just ice cream. The service is fast and welcoming, and the shop is pristine and attractive. The ice cream was incredibly tasty, with ample servings and a range of flavors to pick from. With minimal competition nearby, Big Scoop is definitely a must-see and deserves a solid four stars.

Saguaro East is a pretty good park with approachable staff and a lovely visitor center. Nevertheless, the hiking paths lacked unique views, similar to those often seen around Phoenix, so it felt rather ordinary by comparison.

The employees at this store are fantastic and are always happy to assist, even near closing time. The discounts on their website provide a 40 percent reduction on regular priced items, guaranteeing you a great bargain. Overall, it's a wonderful store.

This coffee shop is a great place for getting work done, enjoying the local scene, or getting a quick drink. It's situated in a bustling area where locals gather, making it a nice spot to visit before heading to Fenchmen for live music. The food is more health-conscious than your usual fast food joints, but the service can vary based on how busy they are. It's an excellent spot to sit down and focus on work, and their large cookies are definitely worth trying. And let's not forget, where else can you find a shot in your coffee in New Orleans?

The bouncer at the club was incredibly impolite and unprofessional. Even though I was on the guest list, I was turned away and humiliated by the bouncer when I tried to confirm my status. I wouldn't suggest this club because of the disrespectful way I was treated at the entrance.

Nick's is a fantastic place with ample salad portions, especially the Greek salad. The rustic roast beef sandwich is a standout option that I strongly suggest. The pizza is pretty good, especially when ordered in an XL size for sharing with friends. Interestingly, it might be their best dish. Overall, Nick's is a place worth considering for a delicious meal.

I loved hanging out at this somewhat hipster place, giving off vibes similar to Este Sugarhouse in Salt Lake. The pizza and beer choices are amazing, and I can't wait to sample more items from the menu. Each of the various spots has its special appeal, and whoever is managing them is doing a fantastic job. The only drawback is the slightly cumbersome ordering process, but it's worth it for the fantastic food and atmosphere. I absolutely suggest it for a great pizza and a drink.

The New St. Louis Wok is a dependable and prompt Chinese delivery choice in our neighborhood. Ordering on the website is seamless, and the deliveries are always speedy. The dishes are not oily, arrive piping hot with a generous amount of sauces, and they even provide fortune cookies. It's our preferred option for satisfying our Chinese food cravings.
Osaka is my favorite spot for sushi. Reasonable prices and delicious rolls make it a must-visit for sushi enthusiasts. I highly suggest checking it out.

Kelly's has recently changed owners and completely overhauled their menu, which has left some of the usual customers feeling let down. The new staff is highlighting the improved cleanliness of the restaurant as something good. Nevertheless, the traditional hamburger and fries I ordered were quite disappointing and seemed a bit too expensive, especially with the burger being dry and bland. It is now simpler to drop by for dinner, a change that was not possible before. However, it seems that the alterations at Kelly's may not have been a positive step.

I wholeheartedly suggest checking out this place if you want to boost your strength and flexibility. The instructors are exceptional and provide enriching classes. By enrolling in a monthly membership, I experienced significant improvements in my fitness. It's a wonderful spot to visit regularly.

I was a regular at this local restaurant but recently, I've faced persistently long waits for change and orders being mixed up. The final straw was getting the wrong and cold food; it's made me decide to stop dining here altogether. I won't be coming back as a customer.

The pizza and service at this place are generally excellent, but my encounter with their delivery service was quite disheartening. The driver acted disrespectfully and made me uneasy by making unsavory remarks about the car parked across the street, insinuating that I might be linked to something dubious. It was uncalled for and left me feeling unsettled.

Cake Life is a great new spot in Fishtown with talented bakers and a cozy, welcoming vibe. The Bourbon Pecan cookie was a real treat, hitting just the right mix of sweet and nutty flavors. The cupcakes were super moist and tasty, but the icing wasn't my top pick. Everyone couldn't stop talking about the chocolate chip cookie. I'll for sure be back and might even think about ordering something special.

This past Thursday, we enjoyed the $5 domestic pitchers deal during happy hour at this place. The service was a tad sluggish initially, but got better. The wings were tasty, although it's uncertain if it was truly a full pound. The gyro and fries were surprisingly delectable, as were the French onion soup and potato skins. Rock n' roll bingo was a blast, and playing pool and darts was enjoyable as well. We will absolutely return!

Johnny Tucci and his team are amazing videographers. They are talented, efficient, and truly turned our wedding video into a stunning film that moved us to tears. Investing in their services is absolutely worthwhile with Johnny Tucci at the helm. I highly recommend them.

Citizens Bank Park is definitely one of the top spots to catch a game in the whole country. The park boasts a wide range of unique dining and drinking spots, like a rooftop bar. Ticket prices remain reasonable despite the Phillies' recent achievements, especially when compared to venues in New York. The staff is great at suggesting where to sit - for example, the 3rd base field level to escape the harsh sunlight. The fans are lively, and contrary to some perceptions, most are friendly and courteous. The overall vibe is enjoyable, the park itself is stunning, and the team is a joy to watch.

I've been really let down by my recent trips to Cosi. The salads I love always seem to be messed up, with no dressing on them. It's really annoying to see the quality going downhill at a place that's supposed to be known for their awesome salads.

Regrettably, the reopening of Rembrandt's left us all feeling let down. The new proprietors have converted the delightful old church into a sleek, chilly cafe that is devoid of the inviting ambiance we cherished. It's disheartening to witness Eagle losing its allure at such a rapid pace. Here's to hoping that neighboring shop owners take note and strive to maintain the town's charm and loveliness within their own establishments.

The service at this place was not great. The staff didn't seem to know much about the menu and kept forgetting our orders. The food looked nice, but it wasn't very good - the waffles were dry, the biscuits were tough, and the chorizo wasn't authentic. The only good things were the nice atmosphere and the variety of drinks.
All in all, this restaurant is a nice place to have a meal. The burgers are really tasty, but the pizza crust can be a bit hard. The dining area is cozy and welcoming.

We used to go to this restaurant a lot in our neighborhood, but our latest visit was really disappointing. The bathrooms were dirty, one even had toilet paper stuck in the toilet. Our server, Ashley, was really rude and didn't seem to care about giving good customer service. The chicken quesadilla was mostly fatty and not very tasty. We probably won't go back, especially with so many other better restaurants around.
This bar/restaurant serves the usual fare for its kind. The food was alright, but nothing exceptional. The standout aspect was the exceptional service.

We decided to check out this humble spot on a friend's suggestion, and we were absolutely amazed by the delicious comfort food options. The BLT was bursting with flavor and chock-full of fresh bacon and veggies. The fries and coleslaw were absolutely excellent, and the pies we brought home were simply delightful. We'll definitely be coming back for more.
The staff was super friendly, the wait for food was short, and the chicken bacon croissant with chipolte sauce was absolutely delicious and served promptly. I highly recommend it.

The Thai restaurant in Nashville might have some old-fashioned decorations, but the food is truly amazing. Being a huge fan of Thai food and having explored many parts of Southeast Asia, I can definitely vouch for the quality of the dishes here. I highly suggest it for anyone who loves Thai cuisine.

This spot is a hidden treasure for donut enthusiasts and doubters alike. The apple fritter and chocolate long john are exceptional and will surely win you over with their delectable treats. Forget about the other donut joints in STL and give this place a chance. I strongly suggest it.

We absolutely loved this New Orleans restaurant over all the others we tried. We enjoyed both lunch and dinner there, and the service was top-notch. The inviting and lively atmosphere really stood out. It's a good idea to call ahead for a reservation if Opentable appears booked up. Don't miss the delicious lunch special of spicy fried chicken. If you're a group of two or three, ask for the cozy corner booth by the window to make the most of your meal. All in all, it was a truly wonderful dining experience.

Situated close to City Park, this affordable shaved ice spot is a must-try. Offering a plethora of flavors to select from, you'll have a tough time deciding with more than 50 choices available. The shaved ice provides a delightful refreshment after a sweltering day in New Orleans, particularly following a park visit. Even the smallest serving is quite sizable and comes at a mere $1.50, making it a pocket-friendly choice. Toppings can be added for just a few extra dollars, rendering it an excellent option for cooling off during the summer. Highly suggested! 5 out of 5 stars.

Mr. X serves up mouthwatering NY style pizza with hand-tossed crust and amazing flavor. The employees are welcoming and the wait for takeout is just 20 minutes, way quicker than big-name pizza places. In conclusion, a fantastic choice for a fast and scrumptious meal.

In general, my initial visit to this bar was enjoyable. The setting was pleasant albeit quiet, with only a handful of other customers present. The variety of beers was impressive, offering choices such as Magic Hat, Fat Tire, and Blue Moon at affordable prices. The interior design was sleek and appealing, featuring dark woods and a few televisions positioned around the area. The bartender was amiable and prompt, however, the absence of a bustling crowd resulted in a slightly lackluster experience. It functioned as a suitable place to pass the time before moving on to another bar, yet it lacked the vibrancy and allure that would entice me to come back.
