The service in this store has really gone downhill. Out of six visits, only one order was done right. It took nearly 20 minutes to get 2 tall decaf coffees today, making our bagels cold. The staff clearly needs more training and their customer service was lacking. No apology or effort to fix things. It's a letdown and I'll pick a different Starbucks next time.

The night at this restaurant for a double date with a long-lost friend was enjoyable, with a lovely atmosphere and tasty food. Though there were a few hiccups with undercooked potatoes and rice, the scallops and crab stuffed grouper were fantastic. The creve brûlée was outstanding, and Tim's attentive service was a great touch. Definitely worth coming back, but there are some areas that could use improvement for a better rating.

My spouse and I had an amazing time at this little treasure. The store was neat, vibrant, and lively, creating a cozy atmosphere. We had a great time trying out all the flavors and discovering their background stories. The proprietors were extremely friendly and guided us in selecting the ideal popcorn according to our tastes. We departed with several bags of tasty goodies and are definitely planning on coming back soon. I strongly suggest paying a visit!

This adorable coffee spot is perfect for a little pick-me-up. The iced coffee was delightful, offering a range of milk and sweetener choices. The menu is somewhat limited, mostly featuring donuts, although the vegan banana bread was a tad heavy. Despite the absence of outdoor seating, there were tables from nearby restaurants to use. I'll definitely come back to sample more of their fancy coffee selections and am looking forward to an expanded food menu in the near future.

I was told to try this coffee spot in Philly and it absolutely lived up to the hype. The cafe was spotless and welcoming, plus they offered tap and sparkling water to customers. The prices were reasonable and the staff was so nice. I even picked up some fantastic espresso advice from one of the baristas. I'll definitely be going back soon!

The bar in this college town is a Villanova staple, serving up a great variety of draft beers, mixed drinks, and classic pub fare with some special deals thrown in. It's a perfect spot for a laid-back evening, but don't anticipate anything fancy or an exceptional lunch experience. This place is just a straightforward bar that covers the basics well.

I had an amazing time at this store because of Mary's outstanding customer service. She assisted me in selecting frames and was very friendly. The entire team was welcoming and kind. I will absolutely come back again.

This furniture store provides lower prices than well-known brand stores, along with welcoming staff and distinctive accent pieces. Although customer support and furniture quality can vary, the chance for excellent bargains justifies a visit.
I've been to this place several times for brunch, dinner, and lunch take-out, and I can confirm that the staff is always friendly and the food is consistently delicious.

The meal at this restaurant was fantastic. The menu was one-of-a-kind and the service from Adrian was exceptional. The endive and beet salad was delightful and the tongue dish was outstanding. The wine list was impressive and the dessert was delicious. All in all, a fantastic meal and I can't wait to return the next time I'm in town. Well done!
Steer clear of this place! The food is mediocre and doesn't justify the price. Invest your time and money in a more satisfying dining experience elsewhere.

The restaurant felt warm and welcoming, just right for a private engagement party. The unique menus and homemade desserts were a lovely addition, but the limited options were a bit disappointing. The Penne Fellini was overly sauced and unbalanced. The bruschetta and salad were average. The servers were kind, but the food overall fell short. It's not a spot I'd hurry back to, but the distinct event area made for a joyful celebration.

The employees at the dealership are welcoming and make sure to keep you informed while addressing recalls on our 1999 Nissan Pathfinder. We received exceptional assistance and were treated with the same level of attention as if we were buying a brand-new car. I highly recommend their service.

This undiscovered treasure is a must-visit for anyone looking for a special dining adventure. The ambiance might not be extravagant, but the dishes truly shine. Hearty servings at reasonable prices, featuring standout options such as the chicken hot pot and seafood medley. Ideal for individuals who value delicious cuisine without the airs and graces. A fantastic discovery for those ready to embrace something new.

Even though it may not seem like it at first, this festival is a must-visit for a fantastic weekend afternoon. The dance performances were absolutely amazing, and the food was definitely worth waiting in line for. The gyros and spankopitas were mouthwatering, and it's ideal to bring along friends and family to sample a bit of everything. It's an awesome way to enjoy Labor Day weekend, and even the kids will have a blast. I'll definitely be coming back every year without fail.

The food at this restaurant is mouthwatering, especially the brisket and cheese grits. However, our experience with takeout has been consistently disappointing as items were absent on three separate occasions. This is a stain on an otherwise excellent restaurant.
Provi is a hidden gem, and the chipotle chicken avocado sandwich and chicken noodle soup are truly delectable. I give it a perfect 10/10 and highly recommend it.

The Fountain provides fast, budget-friendly, and top-notch meals with a menu showcasing sandwiches, salads, and soups. The Cuban sandwich was fantastic with a creative spin on the classic ingredients. The Royal Grille grilled cheese was delectable and fulfilling. The spicy carrots side dish was exceptional with delightful flavors and the perfect level of spiciness. The service was prompt and welcoming. Can't wait to go back and sample more dishes. Definitely worth checking out.

Burger Up in Nashville is a must-visit place with amazing burgers and a wide variety of choices to suit all diets.  The Woodstock burger paired with truffle fries is exceptional, and the Troyathalon is a fantastic vegetarian pick. Adding the 12 South Lemonade as a refreshing beverage to your meal is a great idea. The staff's attention and expertise make dining here enjoyable. While parking might be a bit tricky, it's worth the effort to enjoy this trendy spot. Make sure not to skip trying Burger Up!

In general, I have conflicting thoughts about this place. The wait without a reservation was lengthier than anticipated, but the cheese fondue was delightful. The main course we sampled was decent, but I wasn't a fan of the oil cooking style. The secluded booth was intimate and ideal for a relaxed dinner, but I might just go for the cheese fondue on my next visit. Suitable for individuals wanting seclusion and a prolonged dining session.

Las Cazuelas is a fantastic spot for bringing your own bottle of tequila to enjoy some delicious Mexican dishes. The food is amazing, with unique creations that look as good as they taste. You'll love the margaritas that you can make with your favorite tequila, and the waitress was really helpful with dietary restrictions. The prices are fair, making it a top choice for a memorable food adventure. I definitely suggest it for anyone wanting to try something different than the usual Mexican options.

This restaurant really shifted my view of Pakistani/Indian cuisine. The lamb was prepared superbly, and the rice had the ideal level of spice. It's a fantastic choice for those who love spicy flavors as well as those with a more subtle taste. The service was exceptional, and I'd suggest this spot to anyone, even those who aren't usual fans of this kind of cuisine. Making a journey to St. Louis just for this dining experience would definitely be worth it.

All in all, the food at this place was amazing. I sampled various dishes and they were all scrumptious. The Bloody Mary was a bit underwhelming, but that's not their specialty. On the other hand, the mojitos were fabulous. I would definitely suggest trying this place just for the food.

Jones has become my favorite spot for any special event or romantic evening. The ambiance, service, and food are always top-notch. From the filet to the deviled eggs, each dish is cooked to perfection. I've never had a negative experience here and I doubt I ever will. Jones has definitely earned my loyalty.

I threw my husband's surprise birthday bash at Black Sheep's underground bar for 35 guests. From the first chat with James to the party night with Adam mixing drinks, everything was amazing. Excellent service and seamless event planning. Definitely suggested.

Quack & Cheese is a must-stop, especially for lunch. The duck fries are outstanding, and the team is friendly and diligent. Even when there was a mix-up with my order, they managed it gracefully and ensured I left happy. I'll certainly be back, especially for a romantic evening out. Strongly suggest!

Casa Garcia is a cozy restaurant with tasty chips, salsa, and bean dip. The tortilla soup was outstanding, but the main dishes were just okay. The quesadillas were a bit bland. In general, not a terrible meal, but there are definitely better choices close by.

Joe's is the ultimate place for mouthwatering seafood. The service is prompt and friendly, creating a delightful dining moment. The clam chowder and crab specialties are especially remarkable. A must-try for seafood enthusiasts!
Not happy with my iced coffee from this Starbucks spot. Discovered a bunch of coffee grounds in the base of my cup. Wasn't the convenient pick-me-up I was expecting. (1 star)
Had a terrible time at Dunkin. Staff seemed more focused on their phones than helping customers. The donuts were inedible and clearly stale. Quality control was lacking. I won't be going back there.

I had a wonderful time at this place. It was spotless, gorgeous, and the food was fantastic. The staff was delightful, incredibly attentive, and accommodating. I took my 11-month-old for lunch with a friend and we both had a fantastic time. This is now my top spot to visit. I highly recommend it!

I had an amazing time dining at this restaurant! The food was so tasty and came out fast. Our server Lyndel was outstanding and really elevated our meal. The only drawback was that the restaurant felt a bit cramped. All in all, it was a fantastic experience.

Moreno Bakery is an amazing family-owned bakery in the heart of Brandon that serves up a wide range of tasty baked goods, like fresh bread, cupcakes, flan, and cookies. You absolutely have to try their Cuban sandwich with that special sauce spread, and my top pick is their almond sticks - a delightful choice for fans of almonds. If you're craving something sweet, Moreno Bakery is definitely the spot to hit up!

I highly recommend avoiding dining at this Chinese restaurant. My husband and child both suffered from intense stomach pains after eating here, and the delivery was incredibly sluggish. While this place used to be a favorite of ours, we have decided to never patronize it again. Rating: 0 out of 5 stars.
I inquired about the cost to repair a flat tire and was told it would be $35.99, a price I deemed too high. It feels unjust in a city where many struggle to make ends meet. #disheartening #smh
The food at this place was fantastic, and the milkshakes were incredible! I will definitely be back the next time I'm in town.

I really appreciate how convenient it is to have a groomer come to my place for my dogs. The prices are reasonable and cover all the grooming basics. The only downsides are the lack of teeth cleaning, charging the same price for all dog sizes, and the possibility of feeling judged. But I would still highly recommend this service for efficient and budget-friendly grooming.

Thursday night at this restaurant is a delightful experience featuring live music in the style of James Taylor. The food is scrumptious, the service is welcoming, and the red Sangria is particularly delicious. A perfect place for a laid-back evening out.

Underwhelming lunch outing. Mediocre, overpriced dishes that lacked flavor and arrived barely warm. Regrettable use of time and money. Suggest opting for a quaint, genuine Mexican eatery nearby. Should have gone to Mi Pueblo.
This place has a fantastic variety of beer, amazing tunes, and super friendly staff. You should totally give it a try!

This bar has become a popular spot in the neighborhood, serving fantastic cocktails and the most delicious burger in town. Their brunch offerings are also top-notch. I would definitely suggest checking it out to anyone, whether you're a local or just passing through.

I've been to this salon a few times and had decent experiences, but today's visit was terrible. They offered multiple nail shapes without asking me, didn't provide any hand lotion or cuticle care. Despite having a lot of polish choices, the unprofessionalism and bad results make me not want to come back. It's a pretty salon, but they might not have very skilled technicians.

The food at this restaurant was scrumptious and the service was outstanding. Even though we had to wait a while for the formal side, we were still able to relish the complete menu at the bar area. The firecracker shrimp arrived promptly, and both the salmon and swordfish were superb. The live band contributed to the wonderful ambiance, and the servers were very attentive. We also savored the view and catching a glimpse of the enormous fish tank from the TV show Tanked. All in all, it was an incredible experience and we definitely plan on returning.

The vibe at this cozy joint is great, but get ready for a bustling brunch with a 30-45 minute wait. The spinach, caramelized onion, and goat cheese omelet is a winner, but go easy on the goat cheese since it's quite strong. The fruit was also just right. Keep in mind that they only accept cash.

Traveling through Tuscon and in the mood for some Native American influenced breakfast dishes? You've got to check out this spot! The pueblo, a green corn waffle with eggs and your pick of side, was absolutely delicious. The server's suggestion of mixing syrup, hot sauce, egg, chorizo, and red sauce resulted in an explosion of flavors with every mouthful. I wish I could enjoy this special and tasty meal on a daily basis! A definite five-star rating!

Amazing Vietnamese restaurant in a strip mall vibe. The pho is a must-have, a small bowl of bliss with personalized toppings. Mouthwatering BBQ pork sandwiches featuring juicy meat and fragrant herbs. Cash accepted only, but reasonably priced. Undoubtedly the top spot for pho in Nashville.

The Cake Bake Shop in Broad Ripple is a delightful and enchanting destination for those craving something sweet. The striking decorations and scrumptious treats create an ideal setting for a delectable snack that's worth sharing on Instagram. The Red Velvet Cake is undoubtedly unparalleled, and the Lavender Latte hit the spot perfectly. Despite the slightly elevated prices, the exceptional quality and generous portion sizes justify the cost. The amiable staff and meticulous attention to detail give you the sensation of stepping into a fairy tale. This undiscovered treasure is bound to become your preferred choice for indulging in sweet treats. Don't forget to browse through my Instagram highlights for more snapshots!

If you love lobster, this is definitely the place to visit. With affordable prices, fantastic service, and mouthwatering food, it's the ideal spot for a relaxed dining outing. You have to try the Lobster special – it gives you a hefty serving of lobster, mussels, and steamers at a great value. Don't miss out on the clam chowder and lobster roll, they come highly praised. In conclusion, a superb option for those who adore lobster.

I stopped by the facility briefly to fetch my father and was welcomed kindly by the receptionist, who effortlessly found him despite his challenging last name. She described him as a wonderful patient and instructed me to take a seat until he was ready. He emerged in roughly 5 minutes, looking content and largely free of discomfort. Even though my interaction was brief, the employees were considerate while I waited.

The mojo chicken sandwich at this cozy eatery is truly scrumptious! The vibe is relaxed with a touch of Caribbean and Spanish influence, and the team is welcoming and offers excellent service. The costs are reasonable, making it a definite go-to for anyone seeking a delectable meal in a comfortable environment.

Overall, I was quite let down by the food and couldn't quite see the charm of this place. It feels geared towards beer enthusiasts, yet lacks any standout features compared to similar bars in the area.

I absolutely recommend this brewery for their fantastic IPA, welcoming staff, and lovely outdoor seating area. The prices are fair compared to other breweries in the area, ranging from $6-$7 per pint. A definite stop for beer enthusiasts!
Our pizza was more than 30 minutes late and arrived barely warm due to delivery problems. Very disappointing, won't order from here again.

This ice cream shop is fantastic. I adore that they serve bananas foster and their freshly crafted waffle cones are exceptional. The ambience is grown-up friendly and the owner is really down to earth even though he graduated from Harvard. My only gripe is that I wish it was nearer to the cinema for an easier outing. All in all, a superb spot for some delicious ice cream.

Western Cycle is your go-to destination for all things biking, serving both kids and dedicated athletes. The team is well-informed and committed to delivering top-notch customer service. A highlight is their discounted selection of returned items, offering excellent deals on premium products. Their dedication to customer loyalty and integrity solidifies their reputation as a preferred choice among cycling enthusiasts.
My husband and I adore this place! We've never had a disappointing meal and always get exceptional service. Every aspect of this restaurant is fantastic - definitely worth checking out!

Five Star pizza is an excellent choice for tasty and affordable pizza. The pepperoni bites are a must-have, but I'd avoid the cinnamon bites. The pizzas are generous in size and frequently come with discounts and promotions from their website. The team might not be top-notch, but the food is worth it. Delivery is speedy, with orders ready in 20-30 minutes.

I found my visit to this place to be decent. They managed to seat our big group at short notice, which was nice. I opted for the black spaghetti, recommended by others, but I personally disliked it. The texture was strange and it tasted almost like plastic. However, my colleagues were happy with their dishes, so maybe my choice was not the best. I might give them another chance if I come back to Nashville. On a positive note, the drinks were excellent as anticipated.
The eatery provides speedy service with top-notch ingredients, a friendly team, and quite possibly the healthiest meal in the whole mall. I'd suggest it for a speedy and wholesome meal choice.

This restaurant has exceptional warm service and a welcoming vibe. The food is mouthwatering, particularly the sweet potatoes and gnocchi with blue cheese. It's almost hard to resist not keeping this gem to myself because it's just so fantastic! I definitely suggest giving it a try.

If you haven't had the homemade ice cream at this spot yet, you're seriously missing out! The variety of flavors that change with the seasons and the warm customer service make it a place you've gotta check out. And the best part is, they let you taste until you find the one you love. I can't recommend it enough!

If you're dining at this restaurant, I suggest requesting Phil. He's quite chatty, but his service is really great. His suggestions are awesome, but the octopus was a bit overdone on my last visit. Ordering a few tapas lets you eat without breaking the bank, but for two people with wine and dessert, I usually shell out around $100. It's a bummer that they don't offer private party areas, but all things considered, it's worth checking out. I'd give it 4 stars.

We totally fell in love with the amazing IPAs at Urban South Brewery in New Orleans, and trust me, we've tried some good ones in Cincinnati. The vibe there is just so chill and relaxed, making it the perfect place to kick back and savor some top-notch craft beer.

The restaurant has a pleasant atmosphere, but the sushi rolls were underwhelming with flavors that missed the mark. The tuna tartare was alright. Even though I got a discount voucher, I'm not sure if I'd come back.

This restaurant was a solid pick for group dining, consistently providing top-notch food and service during my three visits over the weekend. Whether you're craving breakfast or sandwiches, everyone in my group left happy. A fantastic spot to refuel during a bustling weekend in town.

I adore this store - it's my absolute favorite. I enjoy strolling around and feeling at ease with every buy. The prices are fair, and the team is consistently kind and accommodating. One staff member really went the extra mile to assist me in choosing the ideal tree stand, and I truly appreciate his knowledge. I wholeheartedly suggest checking out this place!

I was very let down by my recent stay at this Aloft hotel. The place was unkempt and grimy, with other guests being rowdy and annoying late at night. The staff seemed indifferent and made minimal effort to handle the situation. I suggest looking for a more satisfactory lodging option in the vicinity.

I just moved to Nashville and was concerned about locating a vet that was not only competent but also reasonably priced. Dr. K at Parker's Paws went above and beyond. She was friendly, skilled with my pooch, and transparent about costs. Her approach is always to start with the most budget-friendly options and thoroughly explore all alternatives. I wholeheartedly endorse Parker's Paws!

If you don't have a California license, it's not worth heading to this spot. The bouncer was really impolite and wouldn't recognize my passport ID or other legit forms of ID. He picked me out from the group and denied entry without even trying to verify my identity with any questions. Totally unacceptable and not up to professional standards. Best to steer clear of this place.

I really adore this market! The ground beef and babyback ribs are so fresh! Even though it's a little expensive, it's totally worth it. I definitely recommend it for all your grocery needs, even if it's a bit of a journey to reach.
El Limon is a real hidden treasure with the freshest ingredients and delicious spices. The nearby market offers spices at unbelievably low prices. A dining experience you definitely shouldn't miss!

Contrary to the rumors going around, this restaurant is absolutely open for business. I treated myself to a mouthwatering meal there earlier today, which featured a succulent beef platter alongside some skewered chicken. The flavors were so delightful that I couldn't resist taking some leftovers home, especially the fantastic egg roll. While the spot may be a tad tricky to spot, it's truly a gem nestled beside Burger King at the corner where Keystone meets Raymond.
A sarcastic review implying that individuals meeting specific criteria are probably going to come across as pretentious.
We stopped by a few months back and indulged in a scrumptious appetizer platter showcasing cheese and honey. The prices are reasonable and the ambiance is delightful.

This is one of my top 2 favorite spots in Brandon. The food here is always fresh and bursting with delicious flavors. The pad-thai here is an absolute must-try. The team is so friendly and always on the ball, and the prices are surprisingly affordable for the quality you get. This place is really clean - I mean spotless! If you're in the Tampa/Brandon area, this is a must-stop. I can't recommend it enough - definitely give it a go!

Steer clear of this salon. I encountered insects previously and got a below-par spray tan with obsolete equipment on my last trip. I wasn't offered a better machine and sensed I was exploited. I'll be transitioning to Shine Salon for more reliable service.

The first time I tried Mongolian BBQ was at this place and I absolutely enjoyed it. You're free to load up your bowl with all the ingredients you desire, pass it on to the chef, and witness the culinary marvel at work. The sesame bread is a must-try, I make sure to snag an additional piece every time. In sum, a dining experience that shouldn't be missed.
This awesome place serves incredible Sno-balls with a range of delicious flavors. The staff is really friendly, which creates a delightful experience. Looking forward to returning.

We loved our meal at this restaurant. The General Tsao chicken was amazing and the Curry Chicken was a favorite with my wife. The portion sizes were just right and the prices were fair. The service was friendly and attentive. The cozy seating area didn't bother us at all. All in all, it was a fantastic dining experience, and we'll definitely come back.

The food at this restaurant is truly exceptional. I indulged in the 3 course meal and every dish was incredibly delicious. Our server Jenna was outstanding, elevating our evening to sheer perfection. All in all, a wonderful dining experience - highly recommended for a special occasion.

Mellow Mushroom totally rules as the ultimate pizza joint in the bay. You absolutely have to go for the Maui Wowie, it's a flavor explosion with pesto, chicken, bacon, pineapple, and banana peppers. The crust is always crispy and spot-on. The team is super nice and we've never had to wait for a table. I strongly suggest it for anyone who loves pizza.
The food is amazing and the staff is really good about allergies, but the drinks are a bit stingy and the bourbon seemed watered down, which was a letdown during the meal.
Impeccably made donut with just the right amount of sweetness that perfectly complements the tasty dough. The best one I've ever tried.

You've got to try Taste of Havana. Mouthwatering sandwiches, super nice service, and such a cozy vibe - it's a real find. We're for sure coming back and will totally suggest it to everyone. Awesome food and even better company.

Incredible drinks, mouthwatering food, and a lively Tiki bar ambience. The scorpion bowl, piña colada, fried shrimp taco, and Jell-O-Shots/gummy tiki cocktails were all incredible. The bar mixologist was super friendly and the decor was distinctive and pleasant. Ideal for hanging out with friends or a romantic evening. Absolutely adore Tiki Tolteca in the French Quarter! Highly suggest for locals and tourists in New Orleans. Exceedingly pleasurable and authentic. A must-visit destination for a fantastic night out. Have a great time! :-)

We were really let down by our visit to this restaurant. We had to wait for 40 minutes before being seated, only to receive a lukewarm breakfast. The food wasn't cooked to our specifications, the sausage links were overdone, and the egg whites were undercooked. We had to keep asking for more coffee, and the waitress didn't seem to care much. On top of all that, it took us more than 10 minutes to get our bill. Spending $40 on a basic breakfast for two was definitely not justified.

Sukho Thai might not be the most genuine Thai spot around, but it reliably comes through with its great food and service. I usually opt for the red or green curry, opting for the "native Thai hot" level and always finding it delightful. The owner is friendly and attentive, sometimes even pitching in as a waitress. Its quirky setting beside a go-cart track adds a unique appeal. I just wish they offered Kee Mao on the menu, but I can always find that at other places. All in all, Sukho Thai is a dependable option for a flavorful meal.

Muriel's is a top destination for dining, boasting a haunted history and a splendid view of Jackson Square from its 2nd floor wrap-around balcony. The cozy indoor patio dining space is my go-to for a peaceful meal. Their dinner pre-fix menu is a steal, featuring delectable dishes such as seafood gumbo, dijon mustard encrusted salmon, and bread pudding. At lunch, the wood grilled pork chop was rich and succulent, though the red beans and rice were slightly lacking in flavor. All in all, Muriel's provides a delightful atmosphere and mouthwatering cuisine that will leave you eager for a repeat visit.

I enjoyed a wonderful lunch at this place with fried green tomatoes and vegan soda. The variety of beers was impressive and the atmosphere was really great. The staff was super friendly and attentive, and the music was really enjoyable. I'll definitely be coming back.

All in all, this Walmart in Meadowlark is handy for a fast visit, particularly for food items at reasonable prices. The assortment in the produce section is somewhat limited, but the snack and canned food sections offer good deals. The availability of other items in the store can vary, with some items being limited and potential for higher prices. Assistance from employees is not always reliable, but the checkout lanes usually have sufficient staff to keep waiting times brief.

This yoga studio charges a high price without a good reason. Their two-for-one session deal for new customers has a tight 14-day expiration date. The location is inconveniently situated off the busy highway.
